title: Beautiful campus
text: Walked around Harvard and the campus was beautiful and really neat to see. They have beautiful buildings and statues. Definitely worth exploring the campus!
translated_text: Walked around Harvard and the campus was beautiful and really neat to see. They have beautiful buildings and statues. Definitely worth exploring the campus!

title: College visit
text: Well this bored my 13 year old tears...the senior and junior were ok. As college tours go, it was pretty par for the course. What I left with, out of the info session was, is that if you can make in...good grades, enticing essay...etc....Harvard is attainable for everyone...that was promising and felt good. The student run tour, had a few historical tidbits which I found interesting, and otherwise it was standard college tour fare! I was surprised to learn that Harvard was a liberal arts college...

title: Stunning!
text: What to say about this magnificent place? Cambridge and Harvard University are truly a gem! The atmosphere is fantastic; you can spend all day long walking around the campus and the adjacent streets and dorms. The different architectural's styles are engaging; the solitude of the campus is a real inspiration, you can stay as long as you want and enjoy the silence. I truly recommend Harvard and Cambridge!

The atmosphere is fantastic; you can spend all day long walking around the campus and the adjacent streets and dorms. The different architectural's styles are engaging; the solitude of the campus is a real inspiration, you can stay as long as you want and enjoy the silence. I truly recommend Harvard and Cambridge!

title: A Definitely must visit
text: A Definitely must visit. Very impressive. Nice big, clean university. Did the student tours. The students are very impressive. Definitely was my highlight when we visited Boston.

title: Simply Awesome
text: We finally got the chance to visit this great institution. My daughter said when she was 5 that she wanted to go to Harvard to study meteorology. She's 10 now and I hope she fulfills her dream. We were able to sit on the law just as they did in the movie Legally Blonde. SO much history at this school. It is worth the trip.

title: The history make it worthwhile.
text:
We visited on he advise of our daughter who had visited a year ago. Plus trip advisor gives Harvard a good rating. It wasn't as wow as we were expecting but the tour guide was excellent and the history of the place, the library story and the statue info made for a very interesting hour. 
The buildings were beautiful and the grounds well care for. You wouldn't visit Cambridge without taking the tour.

title: Good but didn't quite meet expectations
text:
I visited the campus and took a 2hr walking tour. It was easy to get to. Take the red line train about 4 stops from downtown. It took about 10-15 mins and the train arrives just under Harvard Square.

As a tourist attraction it didn't meet my expectations but i still enjoyed it. Having been to oxford and cambridge i maybe unrealistically expected something as grand and picturesque, but harvard isnt quite that. Its very functional, most buildings are off limits and the garden areas are just grass. There is a range of shops and cafes around the Harvard Square.

I would recommend visiting but would suggest taking a tour once you get there.

title: Must see, but don't need to spend the day there.

title: Harvard Campus Tour
text:
Took the campus tour (which was led by the students, I forgot the name but I think there's only one. The stall is on the island in Harvard Square) with my friends and we had an excellent experience. 

The tour guide was Justin, he was funny and awesome!! The way he narrated the whole tour was on point, he walked and waited for most of the group (there's always going to be few people who would take their time and took pictures; me, myself, was one of them). His voice was loud and clear. If you want to do the tour, ask for Justin. You won't regret it. He told many interesting stories about the campus. I'm not gonna say it here, you need to take the tour yourself to hear it.

At the end of

title: Do the Havaad Tour
text: So much fun and Melissa, our guide, was awesome!  I loved her and her stories and personality.  I just wish that we could have seen inside some of the buildings, especially the library.

title: Beautiful
text:
What a beautiful campus. It seems never ending. Old buildings and the museum of natural history is right there ( around the corner from Harvard law school ) there were several food trucks in the square and people playing a giant chess board. 
We walked around in awe for about an hour and saw there were several Tours. We learned the tours were free and you can join up any time ( just remember to tip
Your guide ) :) 
Don't miss Harvard square with the boutiques and the famous Harvard book store.

title: Harvard
text: Harvard - anyone here OUGHT to study; even research is study.  And it's costly UNLESS the brilliant in-demand student gets 'a free ride' from the University

title: Expectations
text: We came to check out the campus and man I was really disappointed by the grounds.  So ugly, good luck finding any flowers or anything pretty to look at.  The grass was not even well kept.  You would think they could spend a little money on landscaping.  There were tourist everywhere, we did fine without joining a tour.  If you sit outside the steps of Memorial church you will hear several tours stop by and give the run down.  Don't expect to enter many of the buildings, as most are for students, which is expected. The most interesting thing I saw was a truck full of bread.

title: Take A Tour
text: We took a one hour free tour of Harvard that took us through Harvard Yard. The tour provides interesting facts and historical information, and allows you to go into some of Harvard's many beautiful buildings. To take the free tour, go to the Richard and Susan F Smith Campus Center located at Mount Auburn and Dunster St.

The tour provides interesting facts and historical information, and allows you to go into some of Harvard's many beautiful buildings. To take the free tour, go to the Richard and Susan F Smith Campus Center located at Mount Auburn and Dunster St.

title: Busy place.
text: This was one of the busiest places we visited in the Boston area.  Lots of future student hopefuls and even more hopeful parents.  The campus has a lot of history and many lovely buildings.  It is worth the trip, even for a quick 1/2 hour walk through. You can't go into any buildings as a regular tourist.  Take note of the Henry Moore sculpture.

title: Harvard University / Visiting the World's leading university is a must when visiting Boston
text: Harvard University was founded in 1632 and is the oldest center of learning in the World . It is rated the best university in the world ahead of Yale , Oxford and Cambridge . It is located on both sides of the Charles River and in a beautiful setting and same for the buildings housing 11 faculties , 21.000 students and 2.100 professors . The endowment fund is by far the biggest in the world with USD 37 billion . Students from 201 countries has attended Harvard . The Harvard Square is a great place for meeting up or having a meal while students are passing by . It is really a wonderful university and well worth a visit .

The endowment fund is by far the biggest in the world with USD 37 billion . Students from 201 countries has attended Harvard . The Harvard Square is a great place for meeting up or having a meal while students are passing by . It is really a wonderful university and well worth a visit .

title: Harvard Yard - Always Busy
text: During the past 6 summers I've had the opportunity make my way through Harvard Yard on my way to and from class. I'm always struck by just how early the tours get going, and how many people are on campus.  Early mornings are my favorite, as it's quiet, shady and very few folks are around. The chairs around the Yard are usually empty in the mornings. By afternoon, it is tricky to navigate my way back through as I weave between tours in various languages and every chair is usually taken. The nearby food trucks make this a great stop for lunch, too.

title: A university with its tradition !
text: We visited this university as part of the free walking tour at Cambridge. The college campus is awesome, full of history from renowned politicians to scientist, the old yard is amazing you have to see the memorial church, memorial hall and the library. Touring this university is like travel back in time. Please do visit some of the free exhibits in the library. I was convinced that this US university is indeed an American Treasure and icon.

title: Harvard Tour

text: There is so much interesting history to this ivy league school. Unfortunately it's been long forgotten.

title: Herritage of note
text: Visited in March 2015. What a nice experience. The old buildings is a pretty site. The old gate where first years enter. All the old customs. And to think all of this started in 1634. Buildings are well maintained.  A pleasant visit.
translated_text: Visited in March 2015. What a nice experience. The old buildings is a pretty site. The old gate where first years enter. All the old customs. And to think all of this started in 1634. Buildings are well maintained.  A pleasant visit.

title: Entertaining and Informative Tour
text: Really enjoyed our one hour tour round Harvard. The buildings take on a new life when you know why they were built , who lived in them and the stories that make up Harvard's history over the last 300+ years. Our guide ( Zach - 2nd year Psychology)  was informative entertaining and encouraged us to ask any questions on student life. did a neat backwards walk throughout the tour as well to keep facing us! $10 per person. Easy to walk.

Our guide ( Zach - 2nd year Psychology)  was informative entertaining and encouraged us to ask any questions on student life. did a neat backwards walk throughout the tour as well to keep facing us! $10 per person. title: Free tours by foot
text: Excellent! Even though it was a very warm day, our guide, David P., made the journey very cool and as they say: once in Harvard you be come wiser

title: Prospective students tour and information session is great
text: Our daughter is considering attending Harvard so we came for the information session and tour.  Both were very well done and worth your time if you have a prospective student.
translated_text: Our daughter is considering attending Harvard so we came for the information session and tour.  Both were very well done and worth your time if you have a prospective student.

title: Beautiful campus...historic and modern buildings
text:
In summer, you can sit on the quad in lots of lawn chairs scattered around. Tons of people - most of them tourists - hanging out. LOADS of parents with high school-age children, all of them to marinate in the atmosphere - and hope that somehow a visit pays off come admission time.

Harvard Square is literally outside the gates. It's a little more buffed and polished over the last 25 years, fewer local shops, more chains trying to look ye-old shoppe or hipster modern.

The University has several outstanding museums. Visit their websites to see admission times and rates. Massachusetts residents get into the Harvard Museum free on Saturday mornings.

The town surrounding the campus has so many great shops and eats. Harvard Square had everything anyone would ever need.

title: Good not great
text: I expected more from our visit to Harvard and although the University has some beauty it was simple without the "Wow" effect.  Someone said it is one of the only Universities that is also a tourist attraction.  It was crowded with too many people walking around, even large tour busses.  They would benefit from limited access for their personal interest tours and better grounds upkeep.

title: Great tour and tour guide
text: Our tour guide from Alaska (I say her name was Anna, but my GF says it was Katherine) gave us a complete and very informative tour around campus and introduce ourselves to the Harvard culture. She was very nice and willing to answer all our questions in spite of the amount of people of our huge group. Totally recommended!!!!

title: Harvard Tour by students
text: Easy to access by train. Our guide, Eric, had just finished his first year at Harvard and gave a great tour of the area. He shared lots of info about the history of Harvard and being a student there. It is worth taking this tour.
translated_text: Easy to access by train. Our guide, Eric, had just finished his first year at Harvard and gave a great tour of the area. He shared lots of info about the history of Harvard and being a student there. It is worth taking this tour.

title: Do the official tour given by the students
text: It's worth touring one of the world's best universities with a current student of the university. They may not have all the facts and colourful stories, but they give the tour real meaning and context. Well worthwhile and inspiring for would be students.
translated_text: It's worth touring one of the world's best universities with a current student of the university. They may not have all the facts and colourful stories, but they give the tour real meaning and context. Well worthwhile and inspiring for would be students.

title: Beautiful, Historic Campus
text: We did the Harvard Tour for $10 per person. It was led by a Harvard student and was very informative. You can purchase tickets in Harvard Square. What a beautiful campus with so much history and stories!!
translated_text: We did the Harvard Tour for $10 per person. It was led by a Harvard student and was very informative. You can purchase tickets in Harvard Square. What a beautiful campus with so much history and stories!!

title: DIY walking tour in Cambridge
text:
I stayed at Boston Park Plaza near Public Garden, and form there I walked over to Harvard University. The thing I enjoy most when visiting a new place is just walking around to really see and experience the area. From my hotel to Harvard, it was a   an-hour-and-12-minute walk, according to Google Maps. If you are an urban hiker and are OK walking this kind of distance like me, read on!

From Public Garden, there are many streets running parallel to one another. I walked on all of them and the Esplanade toward Harvard Bridge. They are all charming. Newbury offers high-end shopping and the view of the Charles River walking along the Esplanade is wonderful. 

After crossing Harvard Bridge, you see MIT. I visited on the 4th of July, so unfortunately everything was closed. Otherwise, I would have been interested in visiting MIT Museum. After seeing MIT, stay on Massachusetts Avenue no matter what Google Maps says. I typed in Harvard University as my destination, and really got lost. So try some other destination or just stay on Massachusetts till you see Harvard. 

The area surrounding the University is very charming, with lots of eateries and shops. The red brick campus is, of course, worth a visit. Now, here's one of the highlights of my walking tour:

Whenever I plan a walking tour like this,  especially on Sunday or major holidays, I really worry about whether or not there are any toilets along the way. ( Harvard and MIT are universities, not amusement parks, people! ). I did some search and found a very recent article saying "the very first public bathroom in the Harvard area made a "grand opening" in February, 2016!  The article sounded like the appropriateness of putting a public loo right in front of Harvard was controversial for many reasons. I was so curious I went to find it, and to see if it's really there.

The bathroom was very clean and  spacious, and very good-looking. Only one stall. For those who go to a bathroom twice a day, it might be laughable for me to write this much about one. But for others, it is an important issue. If I hadn't stumbled on the article about this new addition to the area, I probably would have visited Aquarium on the 4th. 

So, to whomever came up to this idea and made it happen, thank you very much. I really enjoyed visiting Cambridge on Independence Day, 2016.

title: OK, So - It's Harvard
text: Harvard's not nearly as architecturally significant as the university its namesake attended [Cambridge University, England, as a student at Emmanuel College]. All the same, it's a nice campus for a walk about [ particularly during the peak of the autumn leaf's color splendor.

text:

It was nice to wonder around the buildings.  There was plenty of shade from the old trees, so it was nice and cool.

Most of the university buildings are closed to the public.

title: Fun way to see the campus

title: Campus Tour a Must
text: We took the free one-hour tour led by a Harvard student, and it was outstanding. He had a great personality and told some great stories about the university, some real and some folklore. It was a nice way to see the campus, and the best part about it was the price! It even came with a 15% off coupon at the Harvard store, so we got a nice t-shirt to take home.

It even came with a 15% off coupon at the Harvard store, so we got a nice t-shirt to take home.

title: Inspiring visit to world's most prestigious university
text: My 11 year-old did a report for school on FDR.  In her research, she learned that he attended Harvard and has been obsessed with the prospect of visiting this university ever since.  We took a "tour" offered by a free app available for our Iphone and even got to eavesdrop on a tour being offered by a Harvard student.  She told us the story of the library's benefactor, a grieving mother who lost her son on the Titanic.  We hung out in Harvard Yard and strolled through Harvard Square.  All in all, a great visit.
translated_text: My 11 year-old did a report for school on FDR.  In her research, she learned that he attended Harvard and has been obsessed with the prospect of visiting this university ever since.  We took a "tour" offered by a free app available for our Iphone and even got to eavesdrop on a tour being offered by a Harvard student.  She told us the story of the library's benefactor, a grieving mother who lost her son on the Titanic.  We hung out in Harvard Yard and strolled through Harvard Square.  All in all, a great visit.

title: No stuffed shirts here!
text:
We were delighted with our Hahvahd tour.   The junior student guide was well trained, informative, and delightful.  And, she is clearly smart and committed to doing great things in life.  

Overview of the history of Harvard, its buildings, and culture.   As I hoped, our 15 yo grandson got a glimpse of what could be in his future.    The discussion of how the university supports its students and conducts campus life was very enlightening.  

We were impressed by the number of student run enterprises on campus; not only giving pay to students but work experience and a lot of business management experience as well.    

We got this tour as an add on to the duck boat tour, but I strongly recommend it even if you have to buy a separate ticket.    

Tour guides are students, we were prepared to make a meaningful tip for at the end of the tour.   That is an important thing for all of us to do.

Overview of the history of Harvard, its buildings, and culture.   As I hoped, our 15 yo grandson got a glimpse of what could be in his future.    The discussion of how the university supports its students and conducts campus life was very enlightening.  

We were impressed by the number of student run enterprises on campus; not only giving pay to students but work experience and a lot of business management experience as well.    

We got this tour as an add on to the duck boat tour, but I strongly recommend it even if you have to buy a separate ticket.    

Tour guides are students, we were prepared to make a meaningful tip for at the end of the tour.   That is an important thing for all of us to do.

title: Work visit
text: What a great place to visit let alone go to school.  Plenty to see and do.  Lots of history.  Very open minded campus.  Obtw, it is an open campus so anyone and visit.
translated_text: What a great place to visit let alone go to school.  Plenty to see and do.  Lots of history.  Very open minded campus.  Obtw, it is an open campus so anyone and visit.

title: Beautiful Anytime of Year
text: Of course you should visit Harvard University. It's the country's oldest--in fact it's older than its country--and one of the most famous and prestigious universities in the world. It also happens to be gorgeous. A stroll through Harvard Yard is lovely in every season, though I do recommend summer or fall, and fall more than summer. It's also a good idea to take the tour. As a local, I generally just eat and drink at Harvard Square and use the spot in transit to and from various places. I've never taken the tour, but many of my ESL students have and have loved it. Harvard and Cambridge are essential parts of a trip to Boston though, so don't think about skipping them. You'd be missing out.

Harvard and Cambridge are essential parts of a trip to Boston though, so don't think about skipping them. You'd be missing out.

title: Great campus
text: Harvard University has a beautiful campus. It was very clean. The students and faculty all seemed very friendly. Overall, it is a great school!

title: University tour by a student
text:
Travelled to Harvard via subway from downtown Boston.  Very quick and easy.
It is free to walk around the university
Tour cost $10 each, tickets from newsstand near to subway exit.  Your guide is a Harvard student.  This is a far better way of understanding Harvard than just looking at some old buildings.
Tour last just over an hour.
Our guide was Jake.  An expert at walking backwards.
We had a fantastic time.
Jake was knowledgable, friendly and interactive with our group of approx 10 people.
We learnt a lot about the university, and it's history, without even realising we were being taught.
We had a laugh, enjoyed every minute, Jake made it fun.
The time went so quickly.
I will unreservedly recommend this tour to anyone.

Tour last just over an hour.
Our guide was Jake.  An expert at walking backwards.
We had a fantastic time.
Jake was knowledgable, friendly and interactive with our group of approx 10 people.
We learnt a lot about the university, and it's history, without even realising we were being taught.
We had a laugh, enjoyed every minute, Jake made it fun.
The time went so quickly.
I will unreservedly recommend this tour to anyone.

title: Beautiful architecture, green campus
text: One cannot complete a Boston/Cambridge tour without visiting one of the most presitgious universities in the world. The architecture of the buildings here is truly world class, and it is a very inspiring sight. We covered most of the buildings (without going into a lot of details) in about 3-4 hours.

title: History of US Elite
text: This place was our final destination during our 3 day trip to Boston and we wanted to visit here because we wanted to show our kids one of the best schools in the United States. We were hoping that this visit will influence our 10 and 7 year old kids. Campus is large, beautiful and full of energy and kids loved this experience. We also visited the museum and I just felt so much of the national support for these students who will lead the nation one day. Definitely, this is the place people should go to study if they are qualified to challenge themselves to be a leader one day.

title: Great Free Family Outing
text:
There are a variety of gates leading in from all sides of Harvard Yard; be sure to look up to read what may be carved above the gate you choose.  The campus is beautiful with mature trees and lots of shaded lawn that the kids can run across.  The kids may also enjoy climbing the many steps to Widener Library - great photo.  Have them look up Widener Library and who Harry Widener was and why all Harvard students must pass a swimming test.
Memorial Church is directly across from the library.  You may be able to respectfully enter and attend a service there and read the wall to your right where those from Harvard who died in WWII are listed.  Note the 3 Roosevelts.  Why are they on the wall?  Should poor Kermit be there?  Talk about FDR's role in this war.
Find the statue of 3 lies.  Rub it's toe - it's just what you do.  Have the kids tell you the 3 lies.
Find the site of the building occupied by General Washington and his staff during the Revolutionary War...your kids will be able to look this up...they basically took over Harvard, eh kids?  There is a plaque describing the fort built as directed by Gen. Washington at 101 Waverly Street in Cambridge; it's embankments are the only remaining Revolutionary War bits in Cambridge.  Where is this in relation to the Charles River and why did the General have it constructed there, kids?
Parents, explain why the Harvard Science Center was referred to as the Polaroid Building.  Point out the ways in which it really looks like a Polaroid camera (consult your own parents, as necessary).  The kids can look up who funded it.  Why aren't Polaroid cameras and film made anymore?  They were fun.  As fun as SnapChat?  Discuss.
The Harvard Natural History Museum is as amazing as walking around the Yard and worth the cost.  Your kids can't run through it as they can outside but they will be entertained well beyond what they'll expect.  Yes, kids, the glass flowers are glass...you could look it up.

title: I'm probably biased
text:
As a former student I'm probably biased...but really do you need me or anyone else to sell you on seeing one of the greatest schools on the planet?

You can get tours, but you don't really need to. Harvard has tons of free apps you can download and it geo locates to tell you what building you're at and the history of it.

It's truly one of the most beautiful campus' you could ever imagine! It's got incredible architecture and beautiful Ivy everywhere! 

If you aren't a student you're not going to get into the buildings either way, tour or no tour but just walking around the campus is breathtaking! 

If you're in the area you're truly missing out if you don't take the time to go see this marvelous piece of history!!!!!

text: The campus is lovely and unexpected.  The beautiful buildings are set off by the "city" all around them.

title: Beautiful campus in a lovely setting
text: After seeing some of Cambridge on the trolley trip I was so surprised  to see how charming the town next to the campus was. The campus is beautiful and the history feels palatable. The green space is lovely and the architecture is beautiful. We didn't have time for a tour but next time we would book it. The  neighborhood surrounding the Harvard Yard is full of shops, restaurants,bars and more. Wonderful selection of souvenirs, lots of choices to grab a bite, great section just to stroll. Great way to spend a couple of hours while in Boston!

title: A beautiful campus
text: Having spent many years of my life at university, I couldn't come to Boston and not walk around the main campus. Spending time in other sections of the university, isn't the same as visiting the statue and enjoying the scale of the library (outside only for tourists) and having a walk around this great university full of history. Take the time to read the plaques and you get a sense of all that has happened on these grounds.

title: Beautiful Historic Campus
text: Walking around Harvard campus is like walking in history.  Beautiful historic buildings, arches with quotes, statues, and of course lots of students. If you are lucky enough to know a student who is willing to take you into the Widener Library as their guest make sure to do it. The Widener Library was built as a memorial to Harry Widener who died on the Titanic.

The Widener Library was built as a memorial to Harry Widener who died on the Titanic.

title: a great campus to walk on
text: i love harvard.  i love the old buildings and the atmosphere.  the main library with the stairs to great to sit and hang out.  i came with a school group but i know that my own kids want to come and visit.    it has so much history and there were/are so many great minds that have attended here.

Of course there are plenty of old, beautifully academic buildings, all with endowments to keep them looking appropriately old.  Others will comment on Harvard itself... I just liked how modern universities haven't really deviated from this initial layout.

title: Worth a visit.
text:
We visited the campus and the area around it and it was a few hours well worth it.
It was after the graduation ceremonies and the university was now closed so ypu could walk around the grounds without too many people.
It's free to visit but keep in mind that you can not enter buildings etc.
It's only 15-20 minutes from downtown Boston and you could go by subway but even a taxi ride across the river is about 20 dollars each way and that way you could see a bit of Cambridge 
Worth a couple of hours visit.

title: Great Tour of Harvard campus!
text: My cousins and I did the Cambridge & Harvard Tour organized by Free Tours By Foot. It was an amazing experience! The tour guide, David P, was very knowledgable and easy to get along with. He gave us in-depth history and background behind all the major spots. It's unbelievable that the tour is FREE! I whole-heartedly recommend this tour and others organized by them. I have enjoyed four tours organized by them in two different cities and have never been disappointed.

title: Beautiful, Best Univeristy!
text: I visited Harvard as a part of my college visit. It is at the very end of the tour and it. Was raining. Still the excitement within me arose. The tour guide was very friendly, and the campus is absolutely stunning. She talks able it her experiences in Harvard, and despite raining, we saw so many scholars doing their work busily under the roof, not wanting to be disturbed. The campus is magnificent, covered in a low key red, with raining it was added with a partial degree of elegance. After the visit, I feel like I actually fall in love with Harvard, wanting to study there, and wanting to belong there.

title: Become part of history - Harvard Commencement Exercises
text:
My daughter is now a graduate of this University. It is an experience that cannot be matched. My daughter is sad a bit to leave her friends (as a senior - an awesome view from her room). 
380 years of academic history lay within this institution. I took a bit in but not enough. There are museums galore and the arts, and public lectures. 
Take your family, find something that appeals to each. It's all there.
Sports, sailing, science, music, plays, performances of various types.

title: Most prestigious
text: Established in1636, Harvard is a private research institute which is the U.S.  oldest institution of higher learning is situated in Cambridge not very far from Charles river. It is named after its first benefactor John Harvard and in terms of prestige, influence , culture and excellence it is the best in the world. It was the founding member of Association of American Universities in1900. It's  dozen campuses are spread out in  the Boston metropolitan area. It's almost 40 billion dollar  financial endowment is the largest in the world enabling it  to offer good aid packages. It operates see verbal museums and large library.

title: great place - wish I went to school there!
text: really lovely area with pretty buildings, lots of energy, cool shops and eateries.  wish I had gone to school here!
translated_text: really lovely area with pretty buildings, lots of energy, cool shops and eateries.  wish I had gone to school here!

title: The grounds are worth a visit
text: In the spring you may find a guide at the exit of the T, and a map of the grounds. In the winter, maybe a map from the guidebook. Take note of the fun stories! The so called Harvard statue, who was the model? Do the students pea on it at night time, or is it a joke? The museums and the Coop are also worth a visit.

title: Great ancient and historical building with many nice people around
text: I finally visit HARVARD !!! Great ancient building. I can feel so much dream, spirit, pray and effort live and nurture this campus
translated_text: I finally visit HARVARD !!! Great ancient building. I can feel so much dream, spirit, pray and effort live and nurture this campus

title: Touring History
text: We all decided to tour one of the most prestigious universities in the United States. Harvard is so beautiful. The library is so majestic and you need your picture taken with the statue of the founder John Harvard. Everyone should have Harvard on your list of sites to see in the Boston area.
translated_text: We all decided to tour one of the most prestigious universities in the United States. Harvard is so beautiful. The library is so majestic and you need your picture taken with the statue of the founder John Harvard. Everyone should have Harvard on your list of sites to see in the Boston area.

title: Buildings are nice...grounds not so much
text:
The buildings were nice.  But the grounds were a let down.  No flowers, bushes, flowering bushes...you get the idea.  The grass wasn't lush...just thin blades and all of the grass was roped off.  I'm not sure what I was expecting but I figured the grounds would be beautiful and in full spring color.
Wander around for a little bit if you'd like...but I think you would probably enjoy it just as much from one of the hop on hop off trolley tours.
translated_text:
The buildings were nice.  But the grounds were a let down.  No flowers, bushes, flowering bushes...you get the idea.  The grass wasn't lush...just thin blades and all of the grass was roped off.  I'm not sure what I was expecting but I figured the grounds would be beautiful and in full spring color.
Wander around for a little bit if you'd like...but I think you would probably enjoy it just as much from one of the hop on hop off trolley tours.

title: Why would you NOT visit?
text:
It's Harvard. If you're in Boston, go visit the campus. DUH. 

My personal guide is a research assistant on campus, and a very good guide indeed. We visited the big library (Widener?) - be sure and check out the room holding this guy's original book collection, including a Gutenberg Bible. 

The history and architecture of this campus is insane. Find a local or someone who works there to give you the tour to be sure you learn all the cool stuff. 

Definitely visit Memorial Hall. Stunning building, inside and out.
translated_text:
It's Harvard. If you're in Boston, go visit the campus. DUH. 

My personal guide is a research assistant on campus, and a very good guide indeed. We visited the big library (Widener?) - be sure and check out the room holding this guy's original book collection, including a Gutenberg Bible. 

The history and architecture of this campus is insane. Find a local or someone who works there to give you the tour to be sure you learn all the cool stuff. 

Definitely visit Memorial Hall. Stunning building, inside and out.

title: It's Harvard
text: You gotta check it out there's only one! Architecture alone makes it worth the visit. Time stood still around here. It's pretty cool to think of everyone from JFK to President's Obama and Bush and so many more went there!
translated_text: You gotta check it out there's only one! Architecture alone makes it worth the visit. Time stood still around here. It's pretty cool to think of everyone from JFK to President's Obama and Bush and so many more went there!

title: Not that great
text: I've been to lots of campuses around this country and this is my first time at this storied place.  It was a bit of a let down.  You can't go in a bunch of the buildings.  The place is a bit run down and there is no longer any ivy.  Seriously?  Go to USNA and see a beautiful campus well-kept and full of courteous students.  Oops - a little giveaway there....
translated_text: I've been to lots of campuses around this country and this is my first time at this storied place.  It was a bit of a let down.  You can't go in a bunch of the buildings.  The place is a bit run down and there is no longer any ivy.  Seriously?  Go to USNA and see a beautiful campus well-kept and full of courteous students.  Oops - a little giveaway there....

title: Remarkable Harvard
text: A tree lined, lovely oasis in the center of the very desirable Cambridge, Mass. Harvard is historic and welcoming with beautiful, predominantly brick, buildings. The library is grand and expansive and the students and employees are incredibly helpful, friendly and warm. In addition to ranking "the best university in the world," Harvard offers dance and theatrical performances open to the public. These performances rival Broadways best! Harvard Yard is a lovely place to sit and people watch and observe the future leaders of the world.
translated_text: A tree lined, lovely oasis in the center of the very desirable Cambridge, Mass. Harvard is historic and welcoming with beautiful, predominantly brick, buildings. The library is grand and expansive and the students and employees are incredibly helpful, friendly and warm. In addition to ranking "the best university in the world," Harvard offers dance and theatrical performances open to the public. These performances rival Broadways best! Harvard Yard is a lovely place to sit and people watch and observe the future leaders of the world.

title: Do the walking tour
text: We took the "Hahvard Walking Tour" led by a student - it was excellent! It included history, an informative walk around the campus. The tour lasts about 80 minutes. We learnt a lot and enjoyed the tour. Recommended.
translated_text: We took the "Hahvard Walking Tour" led by a student - it was excellent! It included history, an informative walk around the campus. The tour lasts about 80 minutes. We learnt a lot and enjoyed the tour. Recommended.

title: Not what I expected
text: To be honest I thought the place looked a bit run down. The grass lawns suffer from the foot traffic and makes the place look a bit tired. Shame for such a great seat of learning that it is not better cared for. Inside is a different matter of course but needs a make over outside.
translated_text: To be honest I thought the place looked a bit run down. The grass lawns suffer from the foot traffic and makes the place look a bit tired. Shame for such a great seat of learning that it is not better cared for. Inside is a different matter of course but needs a make over outside.

title: Beautiful campus, rich in history
text: You can just wander the green spaces of the campus if you wish... tour guides offer info on the history of the statuary and the buildings or you can buy a campus map. Could be the most beautiful campus in the US. Exquisite grounds.
translated_text: You can just wander the green spaces of the campus if you wish... tour guides offer info on the history of the statuary and the buildings or you can buy a campus map. Could be the most beautiful campus in the US. Exquisite grounds.

title: 3.5 stars
text: Lots of historical buildings and a beautiful campus to walk thru.  But, you need a map.  And...biggest disappointment...you can't go in most of the buildings, including the libraries.  The Fogg Museum was excellent and the guided tour was great.
translated_text: Lots of historical buildings and a beautiful campus to walk thru.  But, you need a map.  And...biggest disappointment...you can't go in most of the buildings, including the libraries.  The Fogg Museum was excellent and the guided tour was great.

title: Great Yard
text: It was just impressive to get to look at such a renowned institution up close and personal.  It is quite exquisite.
translated_text: It was just impressive to get to look at such a renowned institution up close and personal.  It is quite exquisite.

title: Lot to see - but requires guidance
text: Everybody has heard about Harvard University, and nearby Cambridge, will want to pay a visit. It is very nice to walk around the Harvard Yard, and take a picture nearby John Harvard's statute. You can walk around and grab something to eat at the food trucks located at the plaza, and kind of have a feeling of how it is to be here for longer. But you will need someone to point you out the details about the buildings and the notorious people that lived and studied in there. You can have a free tour that is provided by Harvard University itself; it will take you about an hour and provide you with the needed information. There are also paid tours, departing from Harvard Square. Be aware that you won't be allowed to enter in many buildings like students residencies and the library. Anyway, it's worthy.

title: Historical and Beautiful to Walk the Campus
text: It is an icon and you should walk the area and the campus if you are in Boston and have the time.  I got dropped off in an uber, bought a little campus map at the informational center and walked the campus.  It is full of history and there are a few little tours that you can take if you want to learn more.  I cannot believe how old that University is and on a cloudy day in the later afternoon there was not one student outside enjoying the Harvard Yard!  Then I remembered...it is Harvard and they are probably all inside studying for finals.....   A beautiful University campus.

title: Great.

text: It's not too crowded on weekend mornings if you start around 8/9a. It's not a huge campus so you can cover the highlights in about an hour.

text: The buldings are beautiful with the New England style. Walk around a little bit and don't miss the foot of Mr. Harvard.

title: Big
text: The campus is expansive but without any maps for visitors to follow.  Suggest doing some research first and identify the sights to see and bring your own map.  For a university campus, it mostly has history going for it but it is not an especially pretty campus.

title: Touring America's oldest (and arguably best) university.
text: Harvard Square is a must see when in Cambridge. The University is our nation's oldest and arguably the best in the world. It's certainly got the largest endowment. It was a treat to tour campus with my son. Any prospective student should visit! Start at the John Harvard statue. Don't miss the library and dining hall.

It was a treat to tour campus with my son. Any prospective student should visit! Start at the John Harvard statue. Don't miss the library and dining hall.

title: Harvard Square in the rain
text: Sense of academia is palatable - as well as typical coed campus. Nice to celebrate education for such a long period as this school has operated. Keep that going!
translated_text: Sense of academia is palatable - as well as typical coed campus. Nice to celebrate education for such a long period as this school has operated. Keep that going!

title: Take your time -- From an Alum
text:
Take your time.

There is so much history on this campus, it's worth the extra time if you can grab a hotel and spend an entire day (Or more) touring the campus.

In my time studying at Harvard I really enjoyed the history, and I know you will too. 

Slow down, take your time.
translated_text:
Take your time.

There is so much history on this campus, it's worth the extra time if you can grab a hotel and spend an entire day (Or more) touring the campus.

In my time studying at Harvard I really enjoyed the history, and I know you will too. 

Slow down, take your time.

title: Definitely a walk to remember
text: While spending the Labor Day holiday weekend touring the New England states, we stopped for a few hours at Harvard University on our way to Newport, Rhode Island.  I have always wanted to visit Harvard and walking the campus on a beautiful summer day, where most of the students are on holiday, was a surreal and refreshing experience. The buildings are lovely and there are quaint cafes around the campus. We, however, chose to grab a bite at Harvard Square. Aside from enjoying the walk and food, we were able to take great pictures.
translated_text: While spending the Labor Day holiday weekend touring the New England states, we stopped for a few hours at Harvard University on our way to Newport, Rhode Island.  I have always wanted to visit Harvard and walking the campus on a beautiful summer day, where most of the students are on holiday, was a surreal and refreshing experience. The buildings are lovely and there are quaint cafes around the campus. We, however, chose to grab a bite at Harvard Square. Aside from enjoying the walk and food, we were able to take great pictures.

title: An inspiring place
text: We picked up a tour of the University in Harvard Square at the newsagent's kiosk . About $10 each and well worth it as our guide ( a student ) was knowledgeable and entertaining . The tour lasted an hour and covered stories about how the University was founded, the various buildings and alumni. After that we went to have a look at some of the other buildings as there's an interesting variety of architecture .( you get given a useful map so you can see what's where ) . Lovely place,lovely atmosphere .
translated_text: We picked up a tour of the University in Harvard Square at the newsagent's kiosk . About $10 each and well worth it as our guide ( a student ) was knowledgeable and entertaining . After that we went to have a look at some of the other buildings as there's an interesting variety of architecture .( you get given a useful map so you can see what's where ) . title: A class act
text: Stepping into the Harvard university feels amazing. The age, the knowledge and the impact each of those gigantic structures have is eminent in the air. An absolute must go for academics.

title: A Great Walk and A Great Space to People Watch
text: Harvard is one of the most prestigious universities in the world. The campus is befitting of a university of such caliber. It is a very well integrated and beautiful campus. It is great to walk around and take pictures. If you are hungry you can stop by Harvard Square for a bite.
translated_text: Harvard is one of the most prestigious universities in the world. The campus is befitting of a university of such caliber. It is a very well integrated and beautiful campus. It is great to walk around and take pictures. If you are hungry you can stop by Harvard Square for a bite.

text: If your tour begins with the "recruiting" auditorium presentation, you should plan a few hours. If you just want to stroll thru and see the buildings, you can do that in an hour. It's a fairly tight campus and you'll quickly recognize places from various movies.

title: About what you'd expect
text: A nice walk around campus. Buildings are lovely and about what you would expect. Plenty of cute eateries and coffee shops around campus.

text: Who can't enjoy visiting the greatest institution of higher learning the world has to offer? So much to see and do with so much history everywhere you look.

title: Yearly morning stroll
text: Went, saw, no concor....was a great site seen.the weather was cold. With snow and ice. But was really nice to see the buildings, statues and parks.
translated_text: Went, saw, no concor....was a great site seen.the weather was cold. With snow and ice. But was really nice to see the buildings, statues and parks.

title: Ancient buildings, beautiful interiors
text: Home to some of the smartest students on this planet, the architecture doesn't disappoint. It has some really old buildings complemented with beautiful interiors and furnishing. Scholarly landmarks and a Harvard friend who brought me around campus on a tour completed the package for me.
translated_text: Home to some of the smartest students on this planet, the architecture doesn't disappoint. It has some really old buildings complemented with beautiful interiors and furnishing. title: For the academe
text:
I took three courses at Harvard through the Extension School.

The quad is teeming with tourists all year round, specially around Harvard Square.
translated_text:
I took three courses at Harvard through the Extension School.

The quad is teeming with tourists all year round, specially around Harvard Square.

title: Quintessentially New England
text:
We skipped the tour, having done it before on a previous visit, but still enjoyed wandering around the campus in the spring sunshine.  Harvard Yard is beautiful; the elegant Georgian style red brick halls quintessentially New England and has a very 'old money' feel about it, in complete contrast to MIT down the road which is more cutting edge. Do try to fit in a visit to both to see the contrast.

And of course we stopped at the statue of the John Harvard, the 'Statue of the 3 lies', so called because it doesn't depict John Harvard at all, he was the benefactor rather than the founder of the university and the date is incorrect.

Definitely worth a visit.
translated_text:
We skipped the tour, having done it before on a previous visit, but still enjoyed wandering around the campus in the spring sunshine.  Harvard Yard is beautiful; the elegant Georgian style red brick halls quintessentially New England and has a very 'old money' feel about it, in complete contrast to MIT down the road which is more cutting edge. Do try to fit in a visit to both to see the contrast.

And of course we stopped at the statue of the John Harvard, the 'Statue of the 3 lies', so called because it doesn't depict John Harvard at all, he was the benefactor rather than the founder of the university and the date is incorrect.

Definitely worth a visit.

title: Underprepared
text: We were visiting Boston and took the subway over to Harvard to walk around and check it out.  it was easy to get there and the walk around campus was very nice.  However, I really think we needed a guide or someone from the area to show us the ropes because we were pretty clueless as far as what was located where.   I'd certainly recommend everyone to go see this Institution but I believe you'd get a lot more out of it paying for a tour once there.

However, I really think we needed a guide or someone from the area to show us the ropes because we were pretty clueless as far as what was located where. title: Great visit
text: Take the tour run by students. They have great stories. The price is ok for a one hour tour. The tour guide was a junior student. She knew a lot about the university. I recommend the tour during warm weather for all of it is outside. No indoor access to buildings.
translated_text: Take the tour run by students. They have great stories. The price is ok for a one hour tour. The tour guide was a junior student. She knew a lot about the university. I recommend the tour during warm weather for all of it is outside. No indoor access to buildings.

title: Great tour
text: We took the official historical tour--our tour guide was a current Harvard senior. Great knowledge of the University's history and very friendly and fun.
translated_text: We took the official historical tour--our tour guide was a current Harvard senior. Great knowledge of the University's history and very friendly and fun.

title: Harvard Yard: Prettiest Campus in Boston area
text:
Although not all of the Harvard campus is pretty, Harvard Yard itself is quintessential Ivy League and New England. 

Go to Smith Center (formerly Holyoke Center) and sign up for a campus tour by an underclassmen, filled with funny anecdotes and history.

Finish by walking around the shops, eateries, and bar of Harvard Square.
translated_text:
Although not all of the Harvard campus is pretty, Harvard Yard itself is quintessential Ivy League and New England. 

Go to Smith Center (formerly Holyoke Center) and sign up for a campus tour by an underclassmen, filled with funny anecdotes and history.

Finish by walking around the shops, eateries, and bar of Harvard Square.

title: Amazing

title: Spoiled of that university, Love it

title: The second best university on Mass Ave in Cambridge
text:
So a few famous people people might have gone here. And it's been around for a while. And the campus is nice. But really, with MIT right down the road, who really wants to go here? :-)

OK, seriously, Harvard has a lot of great stuff for even non-students to do. The Harvard museums are terrific; the Sackler (art) and the Museum of Natural History are exceptional.

So a few famous people people might have gone here. And it's been around for a while. And the campus is nice. But really, with MIT right down the road, who really wants to go here? :-)

title: Don't Miss Harvard Coop
text: If you are a lover of books like me, then you should not miss the Harvard massive bookshop (Harvard Coop) located in the heart of Harvard Square. Also has lots of souvenirs for colleagues, friends and family. Loads of fine and casual dining shops and coffee shops to choose from.

text:
harvard yard is a great place to sit.  the freshman dorms line Harvard Yard and worth a visit.  Beautiful campus in the center, but the rest of the college line the streets of Cambridge.
 Top college in the country.

title: Learn a lot at Harvard
text: whether you attend Harvard or simply visit, you'll learn a lot AND learn to appreciated the history, the architecture that is America at its best.  The university itself a microcosm of our world which hopefully will teach us all to be tolerant of each others beliefs, culture, etc.

title: This is one of the best universities ever!
text: We toured Harvard University and it was totally awesome!  There were so many nice places to walk around to.  It was incredible to see the number of students touching Harvard's foot for luck.  It was neat to see some of the dorms where students lived i.e. Mark Zuckerberg.   The Harvard library has a Titanic connection.  Finally, a university police officer offered us a toy Harvard police car.  It was the coolest thing!
translated_text: We toured Harvard University and it was totally awesome!  There were so many nice places to walk around to.  It was incredible to see the number of students touching Harvard's foot for luck.  It was neat to see some of the dorms where students lived i.e. Mark Zuckerberg.   The Harvard library has a Titanic connection.  Finally, a university police officer offered us a toy Harvard police car.  It was the coolest thing!

title: Must Visit
text: If you are in Boston, you cannot miss visiting Harvard University. During the summers, it's good to walk around the campus.
translated_text: If you are in Boston, you cannot miss visiting Harvard University. During the summers, it's good to walk around the campus.

title: Terrific Tour!
text: My high school freshman daughter requested a visit and tour. Campus tour excellent and highly recommend it for the history lesson. Tours are very popular so be sure to check-in about an hour before tour time to get a ticket (free). Lunch at Mr. Bartley's Burgers after the tour was a hit too!
translated_text: My high school freshman daughter requested a visit and tour. Campus tour excellent and highly recommend it for the history lesson. Tours are very popular so be sure to check-in about an hour before tour time to get a ticket (free). Lunch at Mr. Bartley's Burgers after the tour was a hit too!

title: One of the Best!
text: This is an old University with nice brick buildings. Nice places to walk around. Also has Cafes everywhere especially around Harvard Square. Get a Map first, so that you know how to get back to where you parked By the way , parking spots are scarce.
translated_text: This is an old University with nice brick buildings. Nice places to walk around. Also has Cafes everywhere especially around Harvard Square. Get a Map first, so that you know how to get back to where you parked By the way , parking spots are scarce.

title: Greatest university ever
text: I visited there as a member of delegate from Tokyo to participate in the student-organized conference. So many students there were friendly and warm that I really enjoyed staying there. Buildings are nicely built and I wish I could study there as well.
translated_text: I visited there as a member of delegate from Tokyo to participate in the student-organized conference. So many students there were friendly and warm that I really enjoyed staying there. Buildings are nicely built and I wish I could study there as well.

title: Harvard Campus Tour for Dummies
text: Highly recommend the Harvard Tour for visitors - those of us who will probably not gain admission in this lifetime! We took our three children on this tour when they were in middle school and starting high school. Why not start at the top?  The tour guide was great, the stories were factual and relatable. Who knew about the library? So much to do in Cambridge before or after your tour and of course there is the Harvard book store!

text: Steeped in history, art, and architecture, the oldest extant university is worth the trip. Do not miss the recently revamped art museums.

title: Good and historical campus.
text: Harvard university has very attractive camus, just near to metro station and welcomes you  "Enter to grow in wisdom'. You are so lucky if you attend a programme there, if you are a tourist you should visit the historical campus which is on the Cmbridge side of Boston.

title: Bucket list.... Checked!
text:
I have always wanted to come here and I wasn't disappointed.  Very easy to get to by train and covered in lovely snow when we did arrive to make it all the more romantic.  If you appreciate history and architecture this should be on your list of things to do in Boston.    

Child and stroller friendly, even our toddler enjoyed the walk.

title: Harvard trip
text: Don't forget to hit the bookstores!  Awesome old building, row house (the water freezing over), the football stadium across the river and the amazing old gates everywhere on campus.  Great athletic facilities and the public transportation was so easy!!  We took. The bus from the airport with our luggage to the subway.  No problem!

title: Very cool
text: It was really cool to walk around this iconic university, learn about the history and imagine being able to study there.
translated_text: It was really cool to walk around this iconic university, learn about the history and imagine being able to study there.

title: An insider view of Harvard Business School
text: I was fortunate to visit Harvard Business School when my wife was a speaker there at a conference. So I had the opportunity to sit in one of their larger classrooms [both as a back bencher and later an eager beaver in the front row]. It was an experience I will never forget. And the walk through the campus on a crisp February Sunday morning was truly memorable.
translated_text: I was fortunate to visit Harvard Business School when my wife was a speaker there at a conference. So I had the opportunity to sit in one of their larger classrooms [both as a back bencher and later an eager beaver in the front row]. It was an experience I will never forget. And the walk through the campus on a crisp February Sunday morning was truly memorable.

title: Great architecture and atmosphere
text: We spent 90 minutes walking around the campus, rubbed the foot of Mr Harvard's statue, sucked up the atmosphere of learning and enjoyed looking at the buildings.
translated_text: We spent 90 minutes walking around the campus, rubbed the foot of Mr Harvard's statue, sucked up the atmosphere of learning and enjoyed looking at the buildings.

title: Regional Manager

title: Getting Smart at Harvard
text:
Being in Boston invites for sure for paying a visit to Harvard. Being in a place having hosted more than 40 Nobel price winners is for sure exciting. You can approach such a visit in many different ways.

The hanging out version:

Breath the culture, mingle with the students, start conversations, ask what people like, sit just down and enjoy the atmosphere, stroll around not missing out the library building offering you the exposer to a lot of very individual persons, who for instance just occupy the benches, hang out in the internet, stretch out and sleep or talk with you cause you seem to have time. Like that you'll spend a jolly day and remember for ever Harvard was a place feeling you good.

Making a museums tour version:

You can of course also book or make a tour for instance and you gonna meet the 
Harvard Museum of Natural History, Harvard University Herbaria, the Museum of Comparative Zoology, the Harvard Universitria and the Mineralogical and Geological Museum and if you've swallowed it all, you may remember Harvard is a place making you smart. Such tours can be booked in local tourist agencies and will cost you about 20 dollars (Jan 2016)

Exploring the surroundings version:

Of course even in times of Netflix and Spotify the students love to meet somewhere and getting entertained. Meaning after looking around and enjoying little caf√©s and bars offering healthy stuff (naturally raised chicken making the premium price of your Caesar Salad for instance) you will find a number of local clubs, to hang out and listen to some good music, playing chess or back gammon in public or dare to sit down and show off playing master mind - just because you may feel so much inspired.

Should you be around in winter times like me don't miss ice skates, because there is mostly an ice scating parcour built up.

Whatever version you choose , have fun !

title: Photos
text: Dropped by the college to see where so many of histories leaders learned and walked. I wanted to "feel" the history, touch it and see why it resonates with so many. Beautiful buildings, nice campus and yes, I felt it.
translated_text: Dropped by the college to see where so many of histories leaders learned and walked. I wanted to "feel" the history, touch it and see why it resonates with so many. Beautiful buildings, nice campus and yes, I felt it.

title: Oozing History
text: Wander through Harvard Yard and feel the spirit of the generations who have attended.  It has a world class History Museum and Art a Museum.  There's are many cafes, bistros and restaurants outside the bricks walls to discuss your big thoughts.
translated_text: Wander through Harvard Yard and feel the spirit of the generations who have attended.  It has a world class History Museum and Art a Museum.  There's are many cafes, bistros and restaurants outside the bricks walls to discuss your big thoughts.

title: A place of importance
text: It's an impressive place, all right! The buildings all have seen greatness, the stories that you feel in every quad and hallway. It's all there. I felt honored just to walk among those hallowed halls.
translated_text: It's an impressive place, all right! The buildings all have seen greatness, the stories that you feel in every quad and hallway. It's all there. I felt honored just to walk among those hallowed halls.

title: As other reviews have said, It's Harvard!
text: It was amazing to see such a prestigious school but unless you pay for the tours there is only so much you can see as everything is restricted to members. The area around Harvard was really cool though. A lot of little different kinds of shops. It was definitely neat to see Harvard but I wouldn't go again.
translated_text: It was amazing to see such a prestigious school but unless you pay for the tours there is only so much you can see as everything is restricted to members. The area around Harvard was really cool though. A lot of little different kinds of shops. It was definitely neat to see Harvard but I wouldn't go again.

title: Relax and take a stroll ...
text:
If you want a view off Cambridge and all it has to offer along with Harvard University itself - WALK!

Walk from HSq. through the Yard and back again ... THEN  walk along Massachusetts Ave. towards Central Square, have lunch in Central Square and the walk down River Street to the Charles River and circle back to HSq.
ENJOY!
translated_text:

ENJOY!

title: Neat experience
text: What's more iconic Cambridge than Harvard Yard? Definitely a must-see if you visit Boston or Cambridge. Venture a bit farther than just the Yard, though, and check out the architecture along the river, and even walk across to visit Harvard Business School. Plan on a lot of walking. There's plenty of restaurants, shopping, and bars nearby if you need a break.

There's plenty of restaurants, shopping, and bars nearby if you need a break.

title: Harvard
text: Nice tour of Harvard University. It was snowing when we went, but It was nice to walk around the campus.
translated_text: Nice tour of Harvard University. It was snowing when we went, but It was nice to walk around the campus.

title: It's Harvard afterall..
text:
Probably one of the things I was most excited about seeing while in Boston, was Harvard University. I mean, it's Harvard afterall, one of the most prestigious universities in the world. 
Harvard University is located in Cambridge, just a short metro ride out of downtown Boston. Once in Cambridge, it isn't hard to find Harvard University since it seems that the little town sprung up because of the University. Book stores, coffee shops and cafes line the sidewalks of Cambridge; everything I had always imagined this little place would be. I love it! 
Once on the campus of Harvard, just walking around is the perfect tour, as the college seems to speak for its self with the beautiful architecture and tree lined sidewalks and walkways. The campus offers tours, but I would suggest looking on line for further details on that. 
I suggest grabbing a picnic and a good book, and sitting under one of the many old trees on the campus. The hustle and bustle of the students going back and forth, the professors running here and there, all make for the perfect afternoon at Harvard University.

title: Harvard Tour

title: Beautiful and peaceful gardens in the summer!
text: Walking there I thought that Harvard students are extremely lucky to study in such an environment. Harvard gardens are huge and beautiful, it is the perfect place for a break, a chat or a nap. It was a real pleasure to roam around and discover the buildings, sculptures and museums. If you are visiting the famous campus, keep time to walk in the gardens!

If you are visiting the famous campus, keep time to walk in the gardens!

title: cool
text: It is very cool to know Harvard because it's a very well known university. it has a lot of historical buildings and constructions. Besides that it is just a school.

title: The foyer of Memorial Hall is memorable!
text:
We visited the campus on a cold night prior to classes starting.  Most building were locked up.  Still I thoroughly enjoyed walking through and reading the various plaques.  We were able to go into Memorial Hall, or at least the foyer which is reminiscent of a castle or grand estate home of a prior century.

Take time to read as many plaques and historical markers as you can.

text: Walking the historic grounds of Harvard was such an experience! EVery building, every walkway, gate, literally EVERYTHING is beautiful! If you have time while in the Boston area than definitely make an afternoon trip to Harvard and eat at one of their pubs.

Find Mr. Harvard's golden shoe and rub it for good luck.. grab a meal, listen to some music and enjoy!

title: An iconic place
text:
Visited it in a heavy wet snow.  I find the surrounding really convenient for students.

Harvard itself stands out on its own in terms of academic excellence but getting in is a different story.

Visited it in a heavy wet snow.  I find the surrounding really convenient for students.

title: Must Visit
text: Do not miss Harvard Yard. Take a photo in Widener library steps, John Harvard statue, and say a prayer or two at the Memorial Church. Lots of restaurants to choose from, and also get a souvenir at the Harvard Coop store.
translated_text: Do not miss Harvard Yard. Take a photo in Widener library steps, John Harvard statue, and say a prayer or two at the Memorial Church. Lots of restaurants to choose from, and also get a souvenir at the Harvard Coop store.

title: overrated and expensive
text: cool kid club. snotty nosed rich kids run around Boston. Worse than expected. If you want Ivy league visit yale.
translated_text: cool kid club. snotty nosed rich kids run around Boston. Worse than expected. If you want Ivy league visit yale.

title: Mythical!
text:
I already completed my post-graduation, but I must admit that I felt quite attracted by what this mythical College offers to its students during the free presentation I attended. Those presentations are actually for potential students and their parents, and you might find it a bit long if you are not there to apply, but it is quite interesting, it is free and it is followed by an interesting campus visit.
If you visit Boston do not skip Harvard, it is a beautiful place full of fun stories and museums. You can plan a full visit there (easy to access by public transport from Boston).

title: Not a lot to see ....

title: Historic, not much to see or do
text: I have been to Harvard a couple of times, and every time I go, there really isn't that much to see or do. Yes, it is cool to be on the grounds of Harvard University, but besides walking around a big open grassy area, there isn't much! Go see John Harvard and take a picture touching his foot!

title: Amazing trip
text:
I visited Harvard as a tourist and was amazed. The campus it's self is beautiful, the atmosphere is very chilled and there are lots of tourists around taking pictures. The surrounding area has a lot to offer as well, retail shops and souvenir shops , places to eat, cafes etc. you can make a day out of it visiting Harvard or just take a quick trip there as the train form Boston city to Harvard is only around 15 minutes. 

Harvard was everything and more than you would expect from seeing it in movies and is defiantly a must see if in Boston. 

Hope this helped missmemoir.com

title: Harvard, what a stunning huge campus

The campus is so beautiful, with buildings from the seventeenth century all connected by green spaces. Lovely. I would recommend to take a tour to learn about its history too.

title: Day trip

We were able to go into the church which was beautiful and were fortunate enough to experience live music from the huge organ on the second floor (were were there on a Sunday around 10 am).

title: Great piece of American history, with array of attractions
text: If unfamiliar, sign up for the historical tour, available to general public.  Also take a self-guided tour, and be sure to visit the museums on campus.  A great walk through history and storied academia.
translated_text: If unfamiliar, sign up for the historical tour, available to general public.  Also take a self-guided tour, and be sure to visit the museums on campus.  A great walk through history and storied academia.

title: The oldest institution of higher learning in the United States
text: Harvard University was founded more than a century before the American Revolution.  By now this most well endowed institution sprawls out over much of Cambridge and neighboring Boston.  The architecture of the undergraduate campus is impressive.  They house such fine institutions as the Museum of Natural History, which has a great collection.  One irritant:  the library is completely inaccessible without a university ID.  This seems unnecessarily effete:  I don't want to check out books, just browse.  Nonetheless, my wife, daughter and son in law enjoyed strolling about the grounds
translated_text: Harvard University was founded more than a century before the American Revolution.  By now this most well endowed institution sprawls out over much of Cambridge and neighboring Boston.  The architecture of the undergraduate campus is impressive.  They house such fine institutions as the Museum of Natural History, which has a great collection.  One irritant:  the library is completely inaccessible without a university ID.  This seems unnecessarily effete:  I don't want to check out books, just browse.  Nonetheless, my wife, daughter and son in law enjoyed strolling about the grounds

title: Nice tour of Campus
text: We were at MIT for the splash program over the weekend and took the opportunity to go see the Harvard Campus and tour it.  Nice experience,  and helped my daughter get a better grasp of what awaits her since she has her mind set on attending this School.

title: Feel so intelligent.
text: Just walking at the Harvard makes you feel smart. But be warn these place is a tourist magnet so there will lots of tourists on tours here at times. Come after 6pm if you want to enjoy the tranquility and feel as though you are a Harvard student yourself.

title: Gorgeous campus to explore
text: Finally made it to Harvard!! A beautiful campus with more US history available to explore. Awesome architecture and gorgeous grounds.

title: Take the Student led Harvard Tour !
text: This was such an enjoyable free activity! We began the morning by grabbing a quick breakfast at Peet's in Harvard Square. But we were disappointed that they don‚Äôt toast bagels. The day was a perfect, sunny, crisp fall day with lovely reds, yellows & golds just spilling from all the trees. You register for the tour up to half an hour before it begins. Our tour guide was a current Harvard student who was so entertaining, funny & personable that it made the time fly by. He assured us we could ask him anything & he knew all the fascinating historical facts behind the buildings we visited which helped everyone truly appreciate the surroundings that much more. Don‚Äôt forget to pass beneath the massive iron Harvard gate that students must pass beneath twice while at Harvard ‚Äì once when they enter the school & once when they leave upon graduation. Afterwards, we wandered through the massive Harvard bookstore nearby to buy some T‚Äôs & souvenirs. We discovered that right next door to the bookstore is a street vendor selling some of the identical T‚Äôs & sweatshirts for much less !   So explore a bit but definitely take in the student led tour.

title: Experience studying in HBS, simply awesome.
text: Went to the main building of Harvard Business School, with the environment and setting, no wonder it is one of the best college in the States. Don't miss it on your trip.

title: Institution of Depth and Beauty
text: We have had the honor to visit Harvard for four years. Each visit we see more and admire the history and commitment to the educational experience. Tour the campus and do not miss the amazing museums, rich in history and exhibits. Do not miss walking on the Charles and delighting in the architecture.it truly is a spectacular institution that deserves the number one rating of colleges. Cambridge is filled with fine restaurants and lodging choices.

title: Beautiful campus
text: Harvard university is definitely a must. It's full of green areas, magnificent buildings and cool young vibe. Students are very chatty especially when they hear a foreign language they don't recognize :)

title: Nice to see it in the flesh
text: Having seen Harvard in numerous films etc, it was nice to just have a stroll around the leafy grounds admiring the buildings. Worth a visit if your in Boston.

title: Campus Meeting
text: If you're visiting Boston and looking to explore some of the historical attractions in the area I would recommend a stroll through Harvard's school grounds.  It's a truly majestic campus with old hardwood trees and beautifully architected buildings.  The energy from the bustling of students between classes is enough to make one stop under a large tree and dive into a good book.
translated_text: If you're visiting Boston and looking to explore some of the historical attractions in the area I would recommend a stroll through Harvard's school grounds.  It's a truly majestic campus with old hardwood trees and beautifully architected buildings.  The energy from the bustling of students between classes is enough to make one stop under a large tree and dive into a good book.

title: Diversity Explosion
text: If you're in the Boston area, take the Red Line to Harvard Square and walk around. The people, stores, restaurants and the air will open up a whole new world. You will never be the same regardless of the time of your visit. In the Fall is the best time because the colorful leaves create an ambiance you will not forget. It's not too cold or too hot and perfect walking weather around the Charles River to view the heavenly scenes. All throughout the year you will bump into tourists and people taking in the Harvard air...go visit - you won't be disappointed.

It's not too cold or too hot and perfect walking weather around the Charles River to view the heavenly scenes. All throughout the year you will bump into tourists and people taking in the Harvard air...go visit - you won't be disappointed.

title: A nice walking tour
text: Decided to do our own tour of Harvard using an app we downloaded. We were there about 2 hours. The architecture is lovely but there isn't much else to marvel at on an autumnal morning. Glad we did it and we got the tshirt, as they say!

title: Beautiful colours in the fall!
text: The Harvard University Campus and its surroundings definitely have a special feeling to them. There is a lot to see and the trees are simply beautiful around fall. Whether you are a student or not, it's worth a little visit. Don't forget to rub the "John Harvard" statue's left shoe for good luck ;)

title: The Hahvahd Tour
text: We went on the Hahvahd Tour on quite a dull day, but our day was brightened by our super tour guide. The tour was really interesting, and as we didn't know anything about the place, we loved hearing all the facts. There is an old world charm to the buildings, and we loved all the stores. A great tour, not to be missed.

text: Always interesting to walk around the campus and spend ime in Cambridge city center. Quite a special place that revolves around a common passion for studies and success. No easy to find elsewhere in the world.

text: My wife attended a graduate training at Harvard and I tagged along. This opportunity allowed me several days to roam about, explore the rich history of the campus, and experience the wonderful people around Harvard Square. title: Legendary university with legendary grounds
text: There was a street festival complete with a parade the day we visited Harvard University. This was a complete surprise and we enjoyed watching the parade and seeing all the groups represented. We strolled along the walkways on the grounds of Harvard and sat in chairs under some ancient and beautiful shade trees. There were students giving tours if you are looking for information. We just wanted to enjoy the grounds and the people watching.

text:

title: From Connecticut to Gaby: Our Wonderful Tour Guide
text:
I went on the Free tour with a good friend and we had a great time! I believe our tour guide's name was Gaby. She was awesome! I loved how real and authentic she was. She was extremely knowledgable. The best part of going on the tour with Gaby is that she always made people feel comfortable to approach her with any questions. She did a fine job talking about the financial aid process. This is by far the best college tour I've ever taken! 

I was unsure of the gratuity situation which is unfortunate because she was stellar!

- Cory and Elaine
