title: A place to call home
text: I studied at Harvard, but I still enjoy going there.  There are some hidden places on the campus to see.  Try the Divinity school yard, have lunch at the business school.  There are always lots of events on the campus and so if you are around, please do visit.  A few other things you may want to visit is the observatory, and the many museums on campus.

title: What can I say- An Boston Institution
text: If you go for a visit you can truthfully say you have been to Harvard! We were on a motorcoach tour and stopped by only for a brief period, but Harvard is a beautiful campus rich in history.  If in Boston, then I would highly recommend making a stop at Harvard and Harvard Square. You would not regret it!  This is one attraction that will not cost you a penny.

We were on a motorcoach tour and stopped by only for a brief period, but Harvard is a beautiful campus rich in history.  If in Boston, then I would highly recommend making a stop at Harvard and Harvard Square. You would not regret it!  This is one attraction that will not cost you a penny.

title: A living history book.
text: Take time to walk around the campus and you will see history come alive.  Posted around campus are plaques commemorating important events over the last 300 years.  For example, the freshman dorm housed troops that fought in the revolutionary war!  Make sure you go into the main library.  It has fascinating architecture.
translated_text: Take time to walk around the campus and you will see history come alive.  Posted around campus are plaques commemorating important events over the last 300 years.  For example, the freshman dorm housed troops that fought in the revolutionary war!  Make sure you go into the main library.  It has fascinating architecture.

title: Overrated
text: Are people reviewing this place as a university, to get an education? Or as a tourist site? It's a pretty poor tourist site. A handful of old buildings, some really great museums (both art and natural history). But the campus itself is not particularly photogenic. The old campus is ivy covered brick but that takes a2 minutes to appreciate. Also, parking is terrible.
translated_text: Are people reviewing this place as a university, to get an education? Or as a tourist site? It's a pretty poor tourist site. A handful of old buildings, some really great museums (both art and natural history). But the campus itself is not particularly photogenic. The old campus is ivy covered brick but that takes a2 minutes to appreciate. Also, parking is terrible.

title: Beautiful grounds
text: Beautiful grounds  to walk around. We took one of those tours of the campus and we were so amazed at how lovely and charming it is. The guide told us that unlike Yale and Princeton, Harvard doesn't have to fake being old. üòÄ

title: Boston's #1 tourist attraction
text: ... by number of visitors, for good reason. It's the most prestigious university in the world, and a major historical site, with several excellent but not-too-large museums. I recommend a campus tour, though these are variable, and a visit to at least the Fogg Museum (fine art). One interesting thing about Harvard is that it's not physically impressive compared to many larger campuses across the country - it's not all about buildings.
translated_text: ... by number of visitors, for good reason. It's the most prestigious university in the world, and a major historical site, with several excellent but not-too-large museums. I recommend a campus tour, though these are variable, and a visit to at least the Fogg Museum (fine art). One interesting thing about Harvard is that it's not physically impressive compared to many larger campuses across the country - it's not all about buildings.

title: Community Treasure
text: Plenty of lectures and museums for the public, and a sterling place to get an education.  I know because our family has done so for generations.

title: dream university

title: Worth Seeing
text:
This is an icon of America and should be seen. It is an experience. I would describe it as a bee hive.There a people everywhere walking talking someone from all over the earth in one place. They make a beautiful collage of sight and sound. These students and visitors seem to fall into an easy cadence. These kids do not seem rushed or anxious. The campus is full of seats and toys. ie; the colorful chairs in the square and the exercise stations on the walk way. Make sure to check out the shops and  eateries in the mall entrance. Don't over look the lunch trucks. A walking tour is fast paced and full of information that you can not see by looking. There is a lot to see and may not be accomplished in one visit.
It is good for home schooling, dates and people watching. The students are dressed in enough interesting garb that photo studies of them in contrast to their surroundings would be fun. a trip to the museum should be a specific stop as there is so much to see. There is a cafe and in court seating.
This venue is in town. The space is smaller than anticipated. Parking is at a premium.

title: Wonderful student-led tours!
text: Harvard is a magical place and it's energizing just to walk the campus. A great way to do this is to visit the Information Center (just next to Au Bon Pain at the center of Harvard Square near the T stop) and get a ticket. It's free. The tours are led by students and, in general, are really well done. It's fun to hear the tour guide's stories, along with some fun history. If you're in the area it's definitely worth a visit and a tour.

The tours are led by students and, in general, are really well done. It's fun to hear the tour guide's stories, along with some fun history. If you're in the area it's definitely worth a visit and a tour.

title: Interesting buildings in a lovely setting
text: Go for a walk around the campus area. The buildings and gardens are wonderful. Close to T-stop on red line and close to shops at Harvard Square.

title: Architecturally beautiful!
text: We went on a walking tour of this campus that was given by a student.  I highly recommend doing this so you can appreciate what you are looking at and learn the history that is all around here.  Beautiful buildings all around.  So pretty in the fall with the changing leaves also.

title: A visit may be as close as you will get.
text: We really enjoyed our visit to Harvard it is so cool . Lots of history. We walked around the campus and it was so busy. Being from Canada the tuition is expensive to say the least. It really makes you feel good there. We stopped and looked at statutes and walked the grounds. It is well worth the visit.

title: Beautiful Grounds
text: Visiting Cambridge with friends brought us to visit Harvard University and the Harvard Yard. The grounds are so well kept, clean and peaceful. Just walking around enjoying the gardens and architecture of all the buildings was enjoyable!
translated_text: Visiting Cambridge with friends brought us to visit Harvard University and the Harvard Yard. The grounds are so well kept, clean and peaceful. Just walking around enjoying the gardens and architecture of all the buildings was enjoyable!

title: Mike & Micah Lose a Bunch of Kids in the Woods
text: Amazing play at the Loeb Theater at Harvard. Yes, my daughter has a non-speaking role in it, but it is the writing that stands out in this play. Many of the small details of growing up, friendship and making your way through college are presented in a most relatable and funny way. My wife and I are still discussing it. One more weekend remaining.

Many of the small details of growing up, friendship and making your way through college are presented in a most relatable and funny way. My wife and I are still discussing it. One more weekend remaining.

title: An invigorating place.
text:
We spent the afternoon here, we wandered around the campus, taking in the atmosphere, enjoying the beautiful architecture, sitting around on the colourful chairs, people watching. We didn't bother with the tour, but there were plenty of tours to be had.

We were lucky to see the trees in their Autumn colours, it's very beautiful place to visit.
We went into the Natural History Museum and the Peabody museum. It was disappointing that you couldn't go in any of the churches. 
Lots of great places to eat and drink in the town. There were some market stalls along side the campus, selling fruit etc and some snack bars selling food and drink, but we waited until we were back in town.

title: Country's Oldest College
text: Cupolas with weather vanes adorn many of the old buildings on this lovely wooded campus.  Harvard Yard is not unlike many other college campuses with its wooded diagonals crossing from buildings added around a long rectangular central yard.  The only downside is the sheer volume of people in such a small area.  It must have been much quieter in the 1700 or 1800's.
translated_text: Cupolas with weather vanes adorn many of the old buildings on this lovely wooded campus. The only downside is the sheer volume of people in such a small area.  It must have been much quieter in the 1700 or 1800's.

title: The Official Harvard Tour and a glimpse of Harvard University.
text:
I was in Massachusetts, USA, and since I was visiting a cafe near Harvard University, it was only natural for me to visit Harvard University. As I had only about 2 hours to spend at Harvard University, I decided I could get a glimpse of some of the highlights of Harvard University by attending one of the Official Harvard Tour.

The Official Harvard Tour has its earliest tour of the day start at 10 a.m. As I was in Harvard area very early, I signed up for the tour way before 9.30 a.m. I subsequently learnt that it was helpful to be early to sign up for the Official Harvard Tour. The tours were so popular that the 10 a.m. tour was fully booked before 9.45 a.m. However, as registration starts only one hour before a designated tour, it does help to plan ahead the visit to the Harvard Events and Information Center in Holyoke Center so as to secure a place on the Official Harvard Tour.

The Official Harvard Tour was led by one of the student volunteers. In addition to attending the Official Harvard Tour, I bought myself a copy of "A self-guided walking tour of Harvard Yard and surrounding areas".

The Official Harvard Tour brought us to various locations on Harvard Yard such as the Massachusetts Hall, the Harvard Hall, the Science Center, the Memorial Hall, the Widener Library and the site of the John Harvard Statue.

I love the spaciousness of Harvard Yard, and it was a lovely experience being there on a day in summer.

During the tour, I learnt that the Memorial Hall is the building whereby first-year students of Harvard would dine in so as to foster a sense of community. The Massachusetts Hall is the oldest building that is still standing at Harvard. I felt privileged to be visiting Harvard University which has a long history.

It would be nice to offer a gratuity at the end of the tour.

If any one wants more after the Official Harvard Tour, I heard that there is a fun alternative to the Official Harvard Tour. It's the Hahvahd Tour.

title: Jealous of kids studying here
text: The campus is just gorgeous, full of green spaces and historic buildings. I visited the campus on my own, spent more than 1 hour wandering around the campus and then Harvard Square. Put aside at least 2 hours for the visit to the school and the area around it. There's just so many thing to see and you have to take time to enjoy the scenery.

title: Harvard Yard  - Definitely worth the visit
text: Harvard Yard is very much at the heart of the University and dates from the founding of the college. It was freshers week when we visited and it has a lovely atmosphere and many impressive buildings including the Memorial Church and the Widener Library.
translated_text: Harvard Yard is very much at the heart of the University and dates from the founding of the college. It was freshers week when we visited and it has a lovely atmosphere and many impressive buildings including the Memorial Church and the Widener Library.

title: Interesting and educational
text: nice neighborhood, lots of restaurants and close to transportation. Be ready to do some walking inside the university, beautiful buildings and lost of history

title: Definitely Worth the time
text: As a retired teacher, it was a real thrill to be able to walk the grounds of Harvard.  I was mainly interested in seeing Memorial Hall and the Science Building's first computer, and these did not disappoint.  I had done some research on what we wanted to see and where it was located on campus, so we were able to walk the grounds around 8 a.m. in a self guided tour.  Some of the buildings were closed for special services, like the chapel, but it was still nice to get to see the main section of Harvard from the outside.
translated_text: As a retired teacher, it was a real thrill to be able to walk the grounds of Harvard. I had done some research on what we wanted to see and where it was located on campus, so we were able to walk the grounds around 8 a.m. in a self guided tour.  Some of the buildings were closed for special services, like the chapel, but it was still nice to get to see the main section of Harvard from the outside.

title: An Icon of Higher Education
text: Harvard is one of the foremost Universities of the world. The campus is a beautiful blend of old buildings side by side with new modern structures. The streets and squares reek with the history of modern day science and the philosophy of inventions and discoveries. The Statue of John Harvard the founder is a popular spot where most tourists love to take a picture holding on to the founders brass boots. It is so popular that the tip of the shoe alone sparkles( due to friction from regular touching) while the rest of the statue is black.

title: You must go there

title: Its like a dream come true.
text: Visiting the Harvard Business School during my Boston Visit was like a childhood dream come true. I spent 4 hours at this place and also attended a MBA class as a visitor. The way the education is delivered, the way the students interact and the facilities in the class are indeed unique and modern. Especially the Tata House that made me proud as an Indian.

title: Student led tour of Harvard Yard is excellent!
text:
Visiting Harvard University is just a subway trip away from Boston.  The meeting point is very close to the red-line Harvard Square station.

The tour is led by students and operates every hour on the hour.  It is led by students and is very informative.  The tour lasted about 1 hour.  Go to the Harvard University website to find out more about their student led tours.

The campus is a nice stop when you are in Cambridge!
translated_text:

The tour is led by students and operates every hour on the hour.  It is led by students and is very informative.  The tour lasted about 1 hour.  Go to the Harvard University website to find out more about their student led tours.

The campus is a nice stop when you are in Cambridge!

title: Beautiful campus
text: Gorgeous campus with plenty of picturesque places to sit, linger, and contemplate all that is wonderful about Boston. Step in the arched brick campus walls and you are instantly enveloped in history. Beautiful old trees shade walking paths through the grassy quad. The farmer's market is an added bonus.

Step in the arched brick campus walls and you are instantly enveloped in history. Beautiful old trees shade walking paths through the grassy quad. The farmer's market is an added bonus.

title: An excellent, fun walking tour
text: This tour which lasted 70 minutes and cost only $10 was led by two Harvard students, Joe and Martina. They were so entertaining,  and gave us loads of information about the university  as well as a lot of amusement. Well worth doing!

title: Nice way to spend an hour or two
text:
We enjoyed an hour walking round Harvard Square and Harvard Yard. We meant to also visit the book shops but there was an Oktoberfest street festival going on so we got waylaid!

The food trucks at the other side of the yard were a nice surprise and the ice cream was particularly welcome on a hot day.

title: Visit Harvard - Quaint, warm and charming
text: We were touring universities and Harvard was a must see on the list.  It's in the heart of Cambridge and feels like a small town within a city.  It's exactly what you expect but so much more. While your at it, get a T-shirt to take home.

title: Fun tour by Harvard sophomore
text:
A fun 1 hour tour led by Harvard sophomores. Our guide,  Carmack,  was a lot of fun.  He really has a lot of knowledge about the history Harvard as well as about the architecture of the place.  He also combines a lot of humor and anecdotes from the campus life.  Jokes about Harvard's main rival,  Yale,  are a big part of this tour as well.  
The tours go out every 30 minutes and start just next to the Harvard metro station.  
10$ well spent!!!
translated_text:

He also combines a lot of humor and anecdotes from the campus life.  Jokes about Harvard's main rival,  Yale,  are a big part of this tour as well.  
The tours go out every 30 minutes and start just next to the Harvard metro station.  
10$ well spent!!!

title: A Tour Worth Taking
text: Harvard tours are led by Sophomores (2nd year graduates) every 30 minutes at a cost of $10pp plus tips for the guides. The tour takes about 70 to 75 minutes and provides an opportunity for photographs as well as questions of the tour guides. Our guide (Derek) was exceptionally good with a sound knowledge of the history of the University that was established in 1636 by the Massachusetts Bay Colony. It adopted the name of its first benefactor, John Harvard who donated his cow pasture as the site where most buildings now stand. Unfortunately, entrance to buildings is not available to the public but nevertheless, the tour revealed many interesting historical facts.
translated_text: Harvard tours are led by Sophomores (2nd year graduates) every 30 minutes at a cost of $10pp plus tips for the guides. title: Good to visit only if you're in the vicinity
text: Everybody knows the Harvard University by name, so since I was in Massachusetts, I decided to make a trip to visit this renowned university. However it wasn't a great welcome for me as it was quite a pain having walked the entire yard only to realise the 'visitor centre' for the tours is actually located OUTSIDE the campus building.. After we finally reached the centre, we were told that the hourly tours were fully booked and we had to wait for the next hour. Opted to purchase a $2 Harvard self-guided tour map which turned out to be the better choice because that allowed us to choose which sites to visit and see and which to skip rather than to go to every single one which can be time consuming and to some extent boring or repetitive. Don't get me wrong, the place is nice but having been to other famous universities, Harvard does pale somewhat in comparison and isn't really worth the traveling out just to see the school.

Don't get me wrong, the place is nice but having been to other famous universities, Harvard does pale somewhat in comparison and isn't really worth the traveling out just to see the school.

title: Nice to visit, but I wouldn't make a special trip
text: I took one of the tours led by a Harvard student (recommeded) and they did a nice job.  Much better than me just walking around on my own.  It was nice to see the university, but somehow I expected "more".   Not as much "wow" factor as I expected.  (By comparison, I thought Stanford on west coast has a "wow" factor).

title: Beautiful but we expected to be more impressed by the #1 university in the world
text:
Don't get me wrong, Harvard is a nice campus. Is has a lot of history and is actually pretty impressive. But as a university campus fanatic, I am more looking at the architecture. The style at Harvard is beautiful. The thing is, I was really expected to fall on my back. I have bean a student at McGill in Montreal, and our campus is known to be stunning. I guess it may be hard to beat it, but I have seen plenty of pictures of other american campuses that are wonders of architecture. Sadly we did not have the time to pass by, but I think MIT offers more on that matter. I did love the school of business though. 

Important point for anyone planning to visit, it is VERY LARGE. Plan for at least 2h00 to visit the most important schools and be ready to walk A LOT. 

A good tip: there is free wi-fi as you arrive at Harvard Square. Take the time to download the PFD map of Harvard, which can be saved in Ibook (for IPhones...). Saved me a lot of data to get around the places.

title: Nice place to walk around any season
text: Harvard is known to be intimidating and traditional, however, when you visit the school and the square you discover that it is really welcoming and diverse. There are several entrances to the main Harvard yard and students, families and couples walk around and do various things including picnic in the summer and fall. In the winter is it a great place to sit and appreciate the serenity of snow and see students from all over the world passing by. They could have more sitting areas inside the main yard, but just outside of it they have several restaurants and cafes. It is wonderful to hear locals play their music and at times perform.

title: You Can Feel The Tradition of Centuries!
text:
We are in Boston for 3 days and decided to explore MIT and Harvard.
Both are landmark institutions that defy categorization.
But Harvard is the quintessential University!  It is referred to deferentially by all who have dealt with its graduates.  
To walk the Yard, see the buildings, feel the traditions - it was well worth our trip out here.

translated_text: John Harvard was a student at Emmanuel College, Cambridge, hence the names for the university and the place. Being a Cambridge graduate, it feels quite special to visit Harvard. It is a lovely place to have a pleasant walk. We always visit Harvard whenever we are in Boston.

title: Worth a visit
text: Harvard University is worth a visit... You grow up hearing so much about this ivy league school, that it is very interesting to take a tour of the campus and see it in person. Great town surrounding it too- just like every ivy league university town.
translated_text: Harvard University is worth a visit... You grow up hearing so much about this ivy league school, that it is very interesting to take a tour of the campus and see it in person. Great town surrounding it too- just like every ivy league university town.

title: A pleasant walk around but ar gallery now charges
text: Harvard is an quick ride on the subway - we got off at Harvard Square and went back from Central. The new students were just arriving so there was lots of activity. This is a must-see in the Boston area but we were disappointed that there is now a charge for the art gallery.
translated_text: Harvard is an quick ride on the subway - we got off at Harvard Square and went back from Central. The new students were just arriving so there was lots of activity. This is a must-see in the Boston area but we were disappointed that there is now a charge for the art gallery.

title: Stunning buildings in an iconic setting
text: About 15 minutes on the subway from the city centre. Great to stroll round and soak up the atmosphere. Overall campus is massive so unless you make a day you will only see a small part. Beautiful buildings to admire
translated_text: About 15 minutes on the subway from the city centre. Great to stroll round and soak up the atmosphere. Overall campus is massive so unless you make a day you will only see a small part. Beautiful buildings to admire

title: Salute to the Great Harvard University
text: Late evening walk at Mass Ave with my daughter near Harvard square and later we visited the great educational Harvard University. Saw many tour guides explaining its glory and splendor to the people visiting all around the world. Saw people taking pictures at the Harvard Statuei side the entrance of the university. Time worth spent here.

Saw many tour guides explaining its glory and splendor to the people visiting all around the world. Saw people taking pictures at the Harvard Statuei side the entrance of the university. Time worth spent here.

title: Nice to walk around
text: However difficult to find which direction to go. We wanted to do the tour but after being sent in different directions we gave up.
translated_text: However difficult to find which direction to go. We wanted to do the tour but after being sent in different directions we gave up.

title: the student harvard tour was fun and funny
text: we took the harvard  tour by the students. and it was well worth the  10 dollar tip we  gave. few hours of walking learning and laughing.  great times  great memories
translated_text: we took the harvard  tour by the students. and it was well worth the  10 dollar tip we  gave. few hours of walking learning and laughing.  great times  great memories

title: the House of Culture
text:
When you walk among the University buildings you can feel the history and the culture that this place contains.
Worth a visit if you are in Boston
translated_text:
When you walk among the University buildings you can feel the history and the culture that this place contains.
Worth a visit if you are in Boston

title: Highly recommend Hahvard tour
text: If you only have a short time to visit Harvard take the red line train from Boston city centre and get off at Harvard Square. The Hahvard tour guys are just outside the station when you arrive. A Harvard student will give you an amusing tour of the university and explain its history and culture for the grand sum of $10. The tours go every half hour. Our guide was Ross and he was very informative and amusing but I'm sure any of the guides would be. After all they are students at Harvard.
translated_text: If you only have a short time to visit Harvard take the red line train from Boston city centre and get off at Harvard Square. The Hahvard tour guys are just outside the station when you arrive. A Harvard student will give you an amusing tour of the university and explain its history and culture for the grand sum of $10. The tours go every half hour. Our guide was Ross and he was very informative and amusing but I'm sure any of the guides would be. After all they are students at Harvard.

title: Ugh
text: An obscure, undeservedly pretentious university in the middle of an otherwise highly educated city with a proliferation of superior higher educational institutions. Sally's Pizza, the Harkness Tower Carillon, and Mory's are far too distant for this backwater to be a credible center of learning. Go Yale!
translated_text: An obscure, undeservedly pretentious university in the middle of an otherwise highly educated city with a proliferation of superior higher educational institutions. Sally's Pizza, the Harkness Tower Carillon, and Mory's are far too distant for this backwater to be a credible center of learning. Go Yale!

title: Well Worth a visit!
text:
Easily reached from Central Boston on the red line T. It's fascinating to walk not only around the yard but down to the Charles River past the beautiful buildings that are the students and staff houses. 

There are a wonderful variety of places to eat and drink & spend a pleasant afternoon people watching!
translated_text:
Easily reached from Central Boston on the red line T. It's fascinating to walk not only around the yard but down to the Charles River past the beautiful buildings that are the students and staff houses. 

There are a wonderful variety of places to eat and drink & spend a pleasant afternoon people watching!

title: Worth the time
text: It was great to just walk around the campus of this institution...we were lucky that an alumni struck up a conversation with us...that led to an impromptu tour!  Worth the time!
translated_text: It was great to just walk around the campus of this institution...we were lucky that an alumni struck up a conversation with us...that led to an impromptu tour!  Worth the time!

title: Extensive
text: Excellent place, excellent school.  The school campus is massive.  Its like an entire community. It has its own police force and everything else you will need.
translated_text: Excellent place, excellent school.  The school campus is massive.  Its like an entire community. It has its own police force and everything else you will need.

title: Curiosity
text: You might have curiosity to visit the world most prestigious university. Don't forget to visit Harvard Yard and the statue of Harvard. The Collection of Historical Scientific Instruments is interesting, but it is just opened on weekdays from 11:00am to 4:00pm.
translated_text: You might have curiosity to visit the world most prestigious university. Don't forget to visit Harvard Yard and the statue of Harvard. The Collection of Historical Scientific Instruments is interesting, but it is just opened on weekdays from 11:00am to 4:00pm.

title: Lovely walk
text: We independently toured the grounds.  It is a beautiful campus, filled with history, and we felt quite welcomed.
translated_text: We independently toured the grounds.  It is a beautiful campus, filled with history, and we felt quite welcomed.

title: Student Led Campus Tour
text:
We were walking around Harvard Sq. and my kids wanted to see the Harvard campus. I've walked through the yard many times, but never had taken a tour before. We bought tickets at the news stand in the square and went off for our tour.

Our guide was a student named Cormac who was a rising Sophomore. This tour was excellent! Took the family and kids (middle school age). Cormac was energetic, enthusiastic, had a great sense of humor, and very informative. He kept the tour entertaining and educational at the same time. 

I would definitely recc a student led tour if you want to actually learn more about the school, campus, and architecture as opposed to just walking by the buildings.

I would definitely recc a student led tour if you want to actually learn more about the school, campus, and architecture as opposed to just walking by the buildings.

title: set some rules
text: Let's revive an old debate.  The Yard will look and feel much better if you put some caps on tour crowds and eliminate the spaghetti of asphalt walks.  Students and tourists alike can follow rules.  Pave some nice paths and ask people to use them.  It will look better.  It will save more grass.  It will make people feel better about being there.

Our guide even sent us to a  fun restaurant not loaded with tourists.  Actually the campus has\d more tourists than students.

text: I did not go inside; I just drove by.  That said, I got goosebumps knowing I was driving by one of the top 3 Ivy League schools in the US!  When I drove by, I saw ivy growing; hence the category of Ivy League School.  The ivy does not seem to be present in this pic, however.

title: Campus is good but too many tourists
text: Been there for campus visit.  Better take public transportation or it will be hard to find a parking space.  If you have to drive there, make sure to book online for one of their parking garages before you get there.

title: Take the Official Tour of Harvard University
text: Take the tour! Tour leaders are engaging and quite humorous. The campus is beautiful and historic. Try to go inside the Harvard Memorial Church and view the memorial tablets on the walls of the sanctuary.

text: We took the free student run tour and it was pretty informative. The campus is beautiful and right by Harvard Square, which has many options for food and shopping.

title: Anticlimactic
text: It was...there. Nothing like Heidelberg, Sorbonne, Tubingen, Oxford, Cambridge-or even Notre Dame or Galway. It is as overrated and boring as many of its alumni.
translated_text: It was...there. Nothing like Heidelberg, Sorbonne, Tubingen, Oxford, Cambridge-or even Notre Dame or Galway. It is as overrated and boring as many of its alumni.

title: It's Happening at Harvard!
text:
Harvard University and its courtyard were spectacular!  It is one of those experiences, free of cost, that leave you in awe.

The grounds were verdant and the structures were majestic and rich in history.

There are tours led by Harvard University students. I learned some fascinating facts, like women were not granted the same degree as men until 1998.

There are some restaurants nearby that you could take a break. I highly recommend you to explore this oasis in Cambridge.
translated_text:
Harvard University and its courtyard were spectacular!  It is one of those experiences, free of cost, that leave you in awe.

title: Disappointed with Harvard Yard
text: If you go here make sure you do some research first as there is very little in the way of information around Harvard Yard itself. Go down to the tourist information point and get on a student led tour to get the best out of your visit.

text: Who does not want to be a student in Harvard? When we visit the Austin Hall, Faculty of Law, we felt the legal flavours everywhere. Library is a uniqe piece. Gardens are better than the parks even better than the Lafayette Park in DC, much green and well maintain.

title: Famous school
text: It was fun to see such a famous place and hear amusing stories during the tour, e.g., the three ‚Äòlies‚Äô on the statue of John Harvard (wrong name, wasn‚Äôt the founder and wrong year) and what was the most expensive building per square foot (the guard station).  I‚Äôm not sure I believe the stories but it was fun.  I liked that there were chairs all around the main campus (see photo). Too bad the place is so out of touch with the rest of the country.

title: No just for students
text:
If you have the possibility to visit Boston, you cannot miss visiting this beautiful place.
It just takes 10 minutes by subway from the center of Boston.

If you have the possibility to visit Boston, you cannot miss visiting this beautiful place.

title: Harvard
text: The visit to the Harvard University was inspirational and memorable. We took photos of ourselves touching the shoe of the statue of Harvard who contributed generously towards founding the great institution which is nearly 500 years old
translated_text: The visit to the Harvard University was inspirational and memorable. We took photos of ourselves touching the shoe of the statue of Harvard who contributed generously towards founding the great institution which is nearly 500 years old

title: Eye opener on student info session
text: We took our high school age children to Harvard and MIT for info sessions and tours - all in one day.  MIT was nice but Harvard was excellent - the info session was insightful, led by an admissions counselor and 2 current students who gave their opinions, answered questions and had a rapport with the counselor that made it engaging.  It was far from the stuffy atmosphere we expected.  There was an emphasis made throughout for everyone to get the feeling there was a family atmosphere at Harvard.  The video presentation at the beginning was entertaining.  The student-led tour though was somewhat disappointing and while we know some of this may be due to the personality and knowledge of the student leading it, we never went inside any buildings - dorms, classrooms, library or any others; meanwhile at MIT it was more immersive and we felt like we knew what life would feel like there through our own eyes, not just what was told to us.
translated_text: We took our high school age children to Harvard and MIT for info sessions and tours - all in one day.  MIT was nice but Harvard was excellent - the info session was insightful, led by an admissions counselor and 2 current students who gave their opinions, answered questions and had a rapport with the counselor that made it engaging.  It was far from the stuffy atmosphere we expected.  There was an emphasis made throughout for everyone to get the feeling there was a family atmosphere at Harvard.  The video presentation at the beginning was entertaining.  The student-led tour though was somewhat disappointing and while we know some of this may be due to the personality and knowledge of the student leading it, we never went inside any buildings - dorms, classrooms, library or any others; meanwhile at MIT it was more immersive and we felt like we knew what life would feel like there through our own eyes, not just what was told to us.

title: We love our walks in Harvard
text: We love walking through Harvard Yard when visiting friends in Cambridge. I am hoping the history and prestige of being in the environment inspires my teenage daughters! Great places to eat in Harvard Square and several outstanding museums throughout campus.
translated_text: We love walking through Harvard Yard when visiting friends in Cambridge. I am hoping the history and prestige of being in the environment inspires my teenage daughters! Great places to eat in Harvard Square and several outstanding museums throughout campus.

title: Student tour
text: The student information lecture was fabulous and inspirational. Followed by student led tour that was just so-so because we didn't get to go inside any of the buildings.  Student tour guide was energetic and informative.  Biggest complaint is the severe lack of public restrooms on campus.  You have to go across the street to the campus center and wait in line for a really smelly and dirty bathroom.  I would think Harvard would be better equipped to serve visitors.
translated_text: The student information lecture was fabulous and inspirational. Followed by student led tour that was just so-so because we didn't get to go inside any of the buildings.  Student tour guide was energetic and informative.  Biggest complaint is the severe lack of public restrooms on campus.  You have to go across the street to the campus center and wait in line for a really smelly and dirty bathroom.  I would think Harvard would be better equipped to serve visitors.

title: Number one university in the world!
text: This is a spectacular university with beautiful old buildings...and some less beautiful new ones. Best to take a free tour with a current student which leaves from the center of the square near the subway entrance. Lots of history to learn and the students do a great job.
translated_text: This is a spectacular university with beautiful old buildings...and some less beautiful new ones. Best to take a free tour with a current student which leaves from the center of the square near the subway entrance. Lots of history to learn and the students do a great job.

title: Great visit
text: Attended a course at the Havard Business School. Was very impressed at the professionalism and the facilities which are modern and provide a conducive study environment.
translated_text: Attended a course at the Havard Business School. Was very impressed at the professionalism and the facilities which are modern and provide a conducive study environment.

title: The most beautiful campus ever
text: If visiting Boston, make sure to leave room for the beautiful Harvard campus. We signed up for a guided tour, lead by one of the student, and it was truly lovely. It was fascinating to learn about Harvard's history and to catch a glimpse of life on campus, daydreaming about how it would have been to be lucky enough to study in such a wonderful institution. The Harvard bookshop is also a goldmine - make time for it, but avoid my mistake: I was holed up there for two hours :)
translated_text: If visiting Boston, make sure to leave room for the beautiful Harvard campus. We signed up for a guided tour, lead by one of the student, and it was truly lovely. It was fascinating to learn about Harvard's history and to catch a glimpse of life on campus, daydreaming about how it would have been to be lucky enough to study in such a wonderful institution. The Harvard bookshop is also a goldmine - make time for it, but avoid my mistake: I was holed up there for two hours :)

title: I got a lump in my throat thinking about all of the great figures that walked these same paths as I was!
text: So beautiful. So full of history. Such a prestigious University. I found it inspirational to poke around in some of the buildings and walk the campus of our country's first College. If you love US history and/or visiting various institues of higher learning, then this is theplace to go!

If you love US history and/or visiting various institues of higher learning, then this is theplace to go!

title: Beautiful campus
text: I was in a tour group when I visited the campus.  As such, we only got to see 'highlights' of the place--Al Gore's dorm room, etc. A very nice campus.  I would have liked to spend more time strolling around.
translated_text: I was in a tour group when I visited the campus.  As such, we only got to see 'highlights' of the place--Al Gore's dorm room, etc. A very nice campus.  I would have liked to spend more time strolling around.

title: Campus Reflects Why This is One of the World's Greatest Schools
text:
Although visiting Harvard was never on my "bucket list," I knew that visiting Boston would include a visit to this hallowed institution.  

I didn't take the tour - but went with a friend who had attended Harvard (and who now works at MIT).  The campus is magnificent (bring good walking shoes!), and to try and explain everything I saw would be diminishing the overall scope of the place.  Lots of incredible/older buildings, green space, history - you name it.

Also, go to the "edges" of campus and you'll experience street performers, shops, and food trucks.
translated_text:

I didn't take the tour - but went with a friend who had attended Harvard (and who now works at MIT). Also, go to the "edges" of campus and you'll experience street performers, shops, and food trucks.

title: Take in the history and see all the sites!
text: Talk about history, architecture and fun people watching!!  This and Harvard Square are terrific places to visit.  If you want to get up close and personal, you will have to walk since you can't drive on much of the campus.  It is a great tour though!  You'll just feel smarter making the decision!

text:
Thanks the the amazing guide Oxana, my tour group learned a great deal about the life of a Harvard student and the history of the University.

I cant praise her enough

title: Great summer program at Harvard!
text:
Although the weather at Cambridge was rather odd dropping some 14degC from 21degC to 7degC in a day on 31 May (Sun), the temperature climbed to a comfortable 20degC by the end of that week and it made walking around the Harvard campus so pleasant.

The Harvard campus is well-organized so getting around campus was easy.

title: School was better than tour
text: Harvard, as a university, is a must see in my book. I am happy to have seen what it looked like including the layout and architecture. title: Good tour of he campus
text: We went to the recommended official tour, behave of the others as this one is free where the others are charging. The tour centre is in Holyoke and you must come an hour before the tour at the top of the hour. The guide was a graduate from Harvard, who better than her? Enjoyed every minute of the hour we spent there!

title: Loved it!
text: Should have done the tour! But we didn't realize it until we had to go. A tour with the college students is well reviewed and we missed out. We walked around ourselves after getting a map from a student at a store and she told us what to go and see. Thankful for her! Beautiful bldgs and lots of great history.

title: An Inspiration1
text: While Oxford and Cambridge Universities may protest, and Princeton and Yale may disagree, Harvard which was founded in 1636 making it the oldest institution of higher learning the United States by far is the greatest in the world.  Visiting here which I have done as a student and guest is always inspirational,

title: What an amazing insight
text:
I took the official Harvard Uni tour which is free and is conducted by the students of the Harvard running hourly from 10 am to 3 pm. It starts at the Harvard visitor info centre.
It was so fabulous , our guide Nathan doing his secnd year stats was superb. He told us Harvard history showed us completely around , unique heart wrenching stories of the Library and inside superstitions of Harvard Community which the community completely believes in.What a fabulous time I had, came back enriched.
From there I had food at one of the food trucks in the square outside Science Bldg and then went to their very fine Harvard Art Museum.
A day to cherish ...:):)

title: Brings back fond memories
text: I got my graduate degree from Harvard over 40 years ago and I have only been back a few times since.  I loved going to the school back in the seventies and this visit brought back many great memories of my times there.   Harvard is a great school and a great attraction for the visitor.

title: America's Cambridge . . . IN Cambridge!
text: 25 acre campus, of which you will only need to see a small part to have the 'Harvard Experience'.  Educational home of 44+ Nobel laureates, several U.S. Presidents and hundreds of major contributors to both American and world civilisation.  Your experience will be different if you are there during the school year or over the summer months.  Take the T redline to Harvard/Cambridge.  Smith Campus Information Center is right around the corner on Dunster Street, and this is where you sign up for the free Student-led tour.  Of course if you wish, you can pay up to $20 per person through Viatour, Duck Tours and others.  You will see the highlights of both Harvard Yard and Harvard Square areas, such as Massachusetts Hall (where both John Adams and John Hancock bunked as freshmen) Memorial Hall, the statue of 'John Harvard' in front of University Hall (touch his leg for luck), Sever Hall, Widener Library and the Lampoon offices.  Entry is restricted to many locations due to campus security concerns.  In the Harvard Square area you will see the Plaza, Winthrop Park and Mount Auburn Street.  Tour ends near the Shop / Bookstore so you can get souvenirs.  Many eateries close by (though some tour versions include either a stop at the Harvard Museum of Natural History, or lunch at a restaurant called 'Fire and Ice'.  Enjoy!

title: Lovely campus with a long traditional history and academic achievements!
text:
We were here in the early morning (around 8am) as part of our day tour in Boston and this was the first stop of the day. Upon arrival, we were impressed with the campus, with satellite kind of clusters among academic schools, hostels, retail and F&B outlets, among many others. We were also attracted to the various red-brick buildings. They were very nice and magnificent and solely the property of the University. In deed, this place was just like a mini-town by itself and its full of energy, vibe and activities on going.

We walked around the campus and soon we came by the most visited place in the campus. The statue of the sitting "Mr Harvard". Many people came forward to be photographed and touching the "leg" and hopefully their children/grandchildren will be blessed to be as smart. Haha, a myth? Anyway, just to clarify that this person was not Mr Harvard (the founder of the institution) himself. As in those days, the university was unable to find a photo of Mr Harvard himself when erecting a monument in honour of him, it organized a contest to look for the "most good looking" person and selected the winner to have the monument made after him. So this "Mr Harvard" was handsome. This story was shared to us by our guide.

The campus was lovely and serene, with buildings surrounding greenery landscape and with chairs and benches around for students or visitors to sit and rest while enjoying the beauty of the campus. There was a train station in the campus, besides many nice architectural buildings like churches as well.

So we walked around the campus with a feeling of being a "Harvard" student and somehow feel "proud" to be one as the university is world ranked Number 1.

We came by the campus circle where eateries, cafes and retail shops were located and had our breakfast there. People here were orderly and well mannered and polite. Prices here were reasonable and cheaper than elsewhere. Thereafter, we walked around the gift and book stores nearby, grabbing up some books and souvenirs.

Finally, we landed at the Graduate School of Arts and Social Sciences where I caught up with my associate for a while. Visited briefly on the LTs as well and was briefed about the history of the university and the years of transformation. I was then led to the Co-op store, ran by the students on vacation and bought some gift items as well as a form of support.

It was a lovely walk-around trip in Harvard university in Cambridge in Boston. The feeling was so closed to heart, perhaps due to the fact that I am an academic too. Shortly later, when returning to my coach, the place got busier and more pedestrians crowd jostling among buildings, traffic lights and cafes. Well, its the start of another day in campus!

Highly recommend for a visit!

title: A beautiful campus.
text: Try to visit in season rather than when it is closed for the summer, during which time much renovation goes on. This is a testament of great American education and philanthropy combined. A great institution that deserves a visit, allow a day, and have lunch at Harvest whilst you are there.

This is a testament of great American education and philanthropy combined. A great institution that deserves a visit, allow a day, and have lunch at Harvest whilst you are there.

title: take a walk through Harvard Yard
text: For a nice walk after the bustle of Harvard Square, take a walk through Harvard Yard, which is open to the public although most buildings are now by code card only.  A real sense of history here, generally food trucks with interesting, inexpensive food on the exterior perimeter.

title: The atmosphere of Harvard is wonderful....
text: I just enjoyed walking the campus, and sitting in the chairs under the trees in Harvard Yard at the center. The disappointing thing is that most libraries and exhibits are out of bounds if you don't have a student ID, even just to take a peek. There was a farmer's market today (every Tuesday) on the square that was fun, with live music and food trucks.
translated_text: I just enjoyed walking the campus, and sitting in the chairs under the trees in Harvard Yard at the center. The disappointing thing is that most libraries and exhibits are out of bounds if you don't have a student ID, even just to take a peek. There was a farmer's market today (every Tuesday) on the square that was fun, with live music and food trucks.

title: I was there for a college reunion
text:
I was able to walk from the hotel to Harvard Square on a clear day.
Visited Peabody Museum and the "new" (renovated and expanded) Harvard Art Museum.    There's nothing quite like a Harvard Commencement.  This year Renee Fleming (an honorary degree recipient) sang  and Gov. Duvall Patrick, another honorary degree recipient, spoke in the afternoon to the Harvard Alumni Association.

title: Informative, worthwhile.
text:
We got free tickets to do the Harvard tour when we purchased our Duck Tour tickets.  The tour was really good, definitely worth while to learn about what the different buildings are, the history of the University and get some insider info and perspective as it is the students who take the tour. 
Joe was our tour guide and he did a great job, really friendly, funny and v informative.
The tour only lasts about 1hr and we took the T to get there from Boston.

title: I love Harvard!
text: I had the immense joy of actually spending a semester here and everyday got to see the awesomeness around Harvard. I was shocked to see that so many tourists actually come here, but it was quite heartwarming as there are so many things to see on campus even if you are visiting. My parents loved spending days at the many museums, galleries and libraries and as its close to everything, its the perfect place for a day visit.

text: We took our son here in June 2015 for a campus tour and football camp.  The campus is beautiful.  The tour was nice.  We were a little disappointed the tour didn't include visiting the dorms, or allow the prospective students more of an insider's view of the buildings.

title: Great way to spend an hour
text: Went on a tour led by a sophomore called oxanna( sorry if spelt wrong) she was witty, informative and obviously in love with Harvard.  She answered all our questions and their where many considering we where from the uk and had no understanding of us university system.  Great stories from history concerning students and their antics, would loved to have seen a dorm room. Would highly recommend this tour.  Easy to get on the red line subway- please make the effort to go.

title: Prestige
text:
My wife and I caught a direct train ride from Boston to Harvard Square, where we joined a student led tour for $10 per person plus tips.

This university is impressive, as to be expected, as it is world famous.

title: Planned visit.
text: We planned this for sometime whilst we were here, and it did not disappoint, the place was like the grounds of Oxford and Cambridge, England, with its historic architecture and deep history. The day was beautiful and sunny, we sat for sometime on the main lawn near the entrance and took in the feeling of being somewhere where history was made, reading through a list of famous people who at one point walked these paths in their time. We visited the whole place, and I can say it was a marvellous, and Well worth it. We didn't pay for the tour, we just made our own way round, and grabbed info from their website as we went.

title: Cambridge &Harvard
text: This awas a very straightforward trip if you do not object to changing stations on the rapid transfer system. Start at Prudential underground station which is just around the corner from the  Sheraton and was exteremly convenient for most of our travels! For Harvard you change to the red line which takes you right to Harvard square. The tou of the university was interesting and funny with a 4th year student who directs theatre and had already been offered a position with a New York company!

Really was excited to visit the campus.

I learned a couple of interesting things about this university like that Matt Damon studied here. Well i didn't change my life but...it's just that he's a famous actor. Other than that, the rest was ok. I didn't stay there long. The students are used to see tourists.

title: Very impressed by the guide and the University
text: I recently went on a student guided tour of Harvard university as part of my Trafalgar tour. It was fantastic. Such impressive grounds made all the more interesting by our impressive Australian guide, Ben! As an Australian it was great to see he was able to attend Harvard for his studies and he was so passionate about the history of Harvard and passing on that knowledge to our group. The grounds were beautiful also. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

title: Beautiful campus
text: Duck tour tickets came with free tour of Harvard which are usually about $10. Tour guides waiting when got off redline train. Our guide was very knowledgable of history of the buildings, famous residents & stories of life as a current student. Amazing campus. Such beautiful buildings. Harvard square also contains lots of good shopping, food places & especially good was the Coop bookstore with over 3 floors of great books could spend hours in this store alone.

title: More history here than you might think
text: Yeah, it's old, but it's still just a university, right? There's more history here than you might think, considering how many presidents and famous people have walked these grounds. I highly recommend the student led tour that you can join in Harvard Square.  The most amazing part to me was that the top floor of Massachusetts House is still used as a freshman dorm, where students can be assigned the same dorm rooms used by John Adams and John Hancock.

I highly recommend the student led tour that you can join in Harvard Square.  The most amazing part to me was that the top floor of Massachusetts House is still used as a freshman dorm, where students can be assigned the same dorm rooms used by John Adams and John Hancock.

title: Great University
text: What an impressive campus. Honestly I have imagined the university area to be a bit smaller, so I was pretty impressed when getting handed a map about the area. I would recommend to do a guided tour or just to walk around and check it out. We went there in May, so the final exams where going on, and it was pretty empty around the campus.  So I would recommend to visit the university during the semester and not in the end of it. Impressive architecture and lovely parks.

title: An amazing and interesting walking tour of Harvard University
text:
A great value walking tour of the amazing Harvard Uni with our fantastic, funny, knowledgeable and charismatic tour guide Lelaina, a recent graduate who delighted us with stories and the history of Harvard. What an amazing experience to be able to attend Harvard!
The grounds and buildings were full of history and tradition with Lelaina telling us a few stories about famous past students and the buildings themselves, particularly the amazing library. We also walked around some of the student quarters and finished up at the Harvard shop run by students. We bought some stuff of course!
This tour has a very high rating from us for the importance  of its history and the people who have attended in the past; and for the people who may attend in the future. And for our tour guide who brought it all to life for us with our brief visit.

We also walked around some of the student quarters and finished up at the Harvard shop run by students. We bought some stuff of course!
This tour has a very high rating from us for the importance  of its history and the people who have attended in the past; and for the people who may attend in the future. And for our tour guide who brought it all to life for us with our brief visit.

title: Yet another time!
text: I have visited Harvard multiple times including this latest visit. Parking is a struggle in and around Cambridge so if you find a good spot to park, do so and enjoy a short walk to the University. The university grounds are usually tourist filled and everyone comes here to take a picture with the statue of John Harvard in the center of the square. The old buildings are great to watch and you can visit the library during open hours. Harvard Square in front of the campus has some restaurants and very little shopping. But I would not recommend shopping here. There are much nicer places a little further away.

title: Visited HARVARD UNIVERSITY GROUND, found it interesting but not thrilling
text:
We visited HARVARD UNIVERSITY in BOSTON just 2 weeks ago, and strolled around the well kept grounds, to get an impression how it would be  to study there.  The grounds are in the middle of town, and I found, that although it is very famous, there is not the peace and calm there, that it would benefit the students.

It is pretty crowded there, with all the people visiting town, and the buildings are for sure well built.  But if they are still suitable for a more modern way of studying is the question. 

I must admit, it is a famous university,
it has lots of reputation,
the students have all the advantages of being hired after they studied there,
but..... I would prefer a different university to do my own studies if I would have to
do it again.

It is just too restrictive, too formal for my liking.  But I am an old geezer, and that might
be the reason why I do not fall into the trap of reputation of some institute.

title: Wonderful Tour of Harvard
text:
Loved this walking tour of Harvard University led by Eli on May 17th.  He was informative, humorous and full of fun facts.  Eli is so talented, he can walk backwards faster than I can walk forwards!  We covered the main campus - Harvard Yard, Widner Library and several dorms.  He had stories about each of the buildings including why they were built, who lived there and other interesting facts.  

You can't cover the entire campus in a little over an hour, but this gave you some fun facts and the opportunity to ask questions.  We bought our tickets at the news stand near the info desk about a half an hour before the tour.  So, probably no need for reservations.  The price was the same as the on-line price.

Eli also recommended a lunch spot that was just great, Grendel's.  I strongly recommend the portobello reuben.

title: Tour Of The Campus.
text:
Guided walking tour of the campus with Eli. This guy was extremely knowledgeable,he had many informative tidbits of information. He was funny, witty and his dialogue was riddled with puns which kept his,all aged, audience attentive. 

He told us that his concentrator was Human Evolutionary Biology and his secondary was drama! I will definitely be looking for him on Broadway in the not too distant future. 

I highly recommend this tour and if you manage to get Eli it will be a bonus. 

Good luck in your future endeavours Eli

title: A great university

In the summer, you might see students who look much too young -- this is not just because you are getting older, but because it is Harvard Summer School, which enrolls many high school students.

title: Nice walk and photo-taking
text:
The University, being an Ivy League, is something one of us wouldn't like to miss. And when you're already in Boston, don't miss this, it's a few minutes drive from the city. 

Strolling around and in the campus premises is a good exercise. Walking past the Harvard Square, you'll see inside the campus John Harvard's statue and the Library. Unless you want and intend to get in this University, I don't think you need to walk all around and see the entire campus. Nevertheless, it is interesting to see and be in its vicinity. Missing university days.

title: Ivy League,splendour
text: A beautiful campus full of some of Americas Brightest. I was fortunate enough to see some of the engineering labs and the clean lab in particular. The gardens are well maintained and the architecture is stately. I went into the chapel and library. Beautiful buildings with memorials to those from Harvard that had given their lives. I also went into the museum of natural history. An extremely interesting museum and in particular an old fashioned setting for many of the displays which showed the part of the extensive collection used for education over the years. Particularly impressive are the glass flower displays

title: Quick trip to see some friends.
text:
We strolled through Harvard Yard for the first time since my daughter graduated. It was bittersweet. Harvard Yard and it's surrounding buildings are very beautifully maintained and just lovely. There was much preparation going on for the upcoming graduating class. 
We hope to return this summer and take more time to enjoy the yard.

title: What a lovely place to study

title: "When I was at Harvard..."
text:
How many of us have wanted to say, "When I was at Harvard..." Well, for $10 you can! The 90 minute tour of the Harvard campus is a really great way to glean a little about the history of this great institution. 

The tour is conducted by Harvard students and our guide, a sophomore from Vermont, was excellent. She was fully conversant with the history, had an engaging personality and a great sense of humor. 

It was interesting to hear about the 'back stories' of some of the personalities who have made this institution a world leader. It wasn't all 'historic' in that sense; we were introduced to two of the university's modern influential characters: Gates and Zuckerberg. 

The Harvard student led tour is a great experience.  Afterwards, hang around Harvard Square and enjoy the ambience.

title: It was a good overview tour
text: I took the student-led tour. It was informative. I was surprised how poorly the tour guides (this was the official tour for the University) and the people on the tour are treated while on campus. There was one instance of what I took to be a professor openly mocking our tour guide and people in another building telling our tour that we could not stay in their building - it was only for people associated with the University. However, the lore of Harvard managed to over-ride the snobbishness of some of its staff. I then extended my tour by walking over much of the rest of the campus - a fascinating campus to explore.

title: Very impressive
text: Go to the Information Center and thake a guided tour by Harvard students. It starts every hour, if there is a group of min. 10 people. They tell show you the historic part of the campus and tell you much about the history of the Harvard University - it's for free and you get a -15% voucher for the Harvard store :)

title: A Beautiful and Historic Campus
text:
Few universities boast as beautiful and as historic a campus as Harvard. If you want to see one of the oldest universities in the United States, a tour of Harvard is worth your time. The Harvard Yard is both aesthetically pleasing and immaculately maintained; and when you walk through the arches to enter the yard, you quickly realize you are stepping back into history-- in fact, some of the buildings go back several hundred years. 

The campus has a number of excellent museums which are open to the public, and the Harvard Archives are a delight for any historian or researcher who wants to learn more about the many famous people who attended Harvard.  You don't have to be a student to appreciate what the Harvard campus has to offer, from art and natural history exhibits to educational lectures to music festivals; and if you take the tour, you will also see many interesting varieties of architecture.  It is not surprising that so many out-of-town tourists make sure a visit to Harvard is part of their trip to the Boston/Cambridge area. While walking around Harvard Yard or taking the tour is free, some of the museums do have an admission charge, but it is generally very reasonable.  There is limited on-street metered parking available, but a few parking lots are in close proximity.  However, if possible, you are better off going by public transportation, which will give you more freedom to take your time, wander the campus, and enjoy all that Harvard University has to offer.

translated_text: Went on the guided student tour with Francesca, a Harvard student (astro physics), and it was definitely the best guided tour we've ever been to! She was knowledgable, witty, revealed Harvard inside info, mixed historical and architectural input with fun little stories. An absolute must do if you are visiting Harvard - and try to find out when Francesca is doing the tour! :)

title: Skip the tour
text:
Ok, Ok, the tour is free.  You sign in at the tour center across the street from the campus and you're shown, oh, about three buildings and told the usual anecdotes.
But do you learn anything interesting?  Not if you have a tour book or access to the Internet.
We did learn, however, about the tour guide's roommates.  And why she came to Harvard.  And what her major is.  And that Lady Gaga has visited.  Oh, and that George Washington kept some of his troops there during the *civil* war.

title: Interesting Campus
text:
We visited here with a tour group on 4/6/15.

Unless you have a tour guide (which we did) to point out some of the historical buildings and share stories of their significance, there is not much to really see on the Harvard campus.

The history is definitely interesting, but for the average sightseer there is not much to it.

title: Beautiful campus in the heart of Cambridge
text:
My son is college shopping.  We had visited Tufts the day before, and while that campus was lovely, it has nothing on the history and tradition of the Harvard grounds.  Beautiful quads, scattered across a walkable distance, old buildings mixed with new, the great student vibe - you couldn't ask for a better day out.

The only drawback was the hugely rude man at the visitor's center.

title: Harvard University Grounds
text: The university grounds were still covered with snow when we visited but we can imagine how beautiful they will be later in the year.  The old university campus is stunning.  Understandably access to buildings e.g. the amazing  Library are not accessible to visitors.

title: Loved it!
text: You can take a tour of Harvard & Harvard Square but we just walked around by ourselves...not really much open when we went but was so lovely to walk around. The buildings and gardens are so pretty and the atmosphere in the square is buzzing, even when it was freezing cold! Would love to go back in the summer and have more time to explore all the little places!

Would love to go back in the summer and have more time to explore all the little places!

title: Take the Free Tour!
text: The free hour long student lead tour is a MUST!  Visiting the campus is a treat but learning the historical context and modern uses of the buildings makes the experience far more enjoyable.  The Visitor's Center is across the street from Harvard Yard and the students working there are helpful and friendly.  Our two sons, 8 and 10 years old, were entertained as well!  We could hear them sharing the details of the tour with their grandmother over the phone that evening.  Don't miss out on this opportunity to enjoy Harvard's history!

The Visitor's Center is across the street from Harvard Yard and the students working there are helpful and friendly.  Our two sons, 8 and 10 years old, were entertained as well!  We could hear them sharing the details of the tour with their grandmother over the phone that evening.  Don't miss out on this opportunity to enjoy Harvard's history!

title: Lovely place to stroll
text: Harvard Yard is the heart of the original college. With free WIFI and Harvard mobile tour you could walk around yourself and take your time. Or you could take the Harvard Student-Led Walking Tour which is informative and friendly.

title: Read Up Before Visiting or Regret It
text: Didn't really see much of this place as it was crowded with tourists on a Sunday in the middle of summer and we were passing through to get to the campus proper. There's so much to this place. Surely for the unprepared like us, we owe this place another visit.

title: Good walking
text: Once you leave the Harvard Square area, it is very pleasant walking amongst the buildings of this old, established University. Much of it is of course not open to the public, but you can admire the atmosphere and architecture.

title: Beautiful
text: A very bad winter, I know, but the snow-laden Harvard Yard was doubly scenic at this time of year. Definitely worth a leisurely amble through.
translated_text: A very bad winter, I know, but the snow-laden Harvard Yard was doubly scenic at this time of year. Definitely worth a leisurely amble through.

title: Memorial Hall/Sanders Theater is Handsome but Also Deeply Touching
text:
We have been attending concerts at Sanders for 45 years; it is our favorite intimate concert hall in Boston. Its major negative is the discomfort of the too shallow/ crowded bench seating, (and the [basement level] bathrooms are reached down long steep stairways) but the rich beauty of the interior design, wood panelling and the stained glass windows and carved quotes, along with the warm clear acoustics, easily offset the discomfort. 
What never ceases to move me is in the high vaulted space of the lobby. Memorial Hall was indeed built as a memorial- to all the Harvard boys who died in the Civil War. When you read the marble plaques that line the walls,with their names and the places where they died,  you really do realize the sadness of that War- that was so essential to forming the country that we have become. It always makes me stop and reflect, and appreciate the sacrifice of such young boys. 

Memorial Hall was designed by the very famous Victorian architects, Ware and Van Brunt, and within a block of it are many other famous buildings. The modern School of Architecture and Landscape Design is right across the street, designed by local architect, Graham Gund. Just down the street is the Carpenter Center of Visual Arts, the only American building designed by le Corbusier. And more examples abound throughout the campus.

title: Is this what Ivy League looks like?
text: We took a group of top students to a Harvard invitational event. The representatives of Harvard were not welcoming. As a matter of fact, they were rude. There were no places for our students to sit. It was in the middle of a snowstorm and people were coming in and out of the building covered in snow. With no where to sit, our students had no choice but to sit--in their dress clothes--on the damp floor. There wasn't enough seating, enough food, or enough space for the number of students competing. None of the (dirty, seemingly forgotten) rooms were marked nor set up for our events. This was Harvard's chance to impress and inspire these high school students; instead, the students left wondering what all the hype is about. A very disappointing experience after working so hard to earn this trip.

A very disappointing experience after working so hard to earn this trip.

title: Arts First
text: Check out Harvard's Arts Festival, usually held the first few days of May.  What an amazing experience!  Harvard students studying music, present dance, vocal, stage and instrumental performances in at least twelve different venues, including Harvard Yard, Memorial Church, and Sanders Theatre.  It's a feast for the senses, and an opportunity to visit historic buildings.  This all takes place in the middle of Harvard Square, the heart of Cambridge, MA.

title: Amazing 1636 history all around you!!!
text: For me, the fact that this instruction has been around since 1636 gives a since of wonderment on how many scholars had stood in the same I had. It is truly an institution of higher learning. My son is now a junior, and the pride of his accomplishment is unexplainable. Their are plaques and momentos of passed students and their accomplishments that one can only take pride in. I am visiting Boston and Harvard in a week. The snow that has fallen in recent weeks does not deter me one bit. This condition has been endured by others, which has results in their success ultimately. Go to Harvard university with a full day to take everything in, a half day is not enough in my opinion. Learn to use the subway system, and your travels will be less of a strain on your finances. There is history at Harvard and Cambridge enjoy it.

title: Harvard for the museum especially
text: See the new Fogg, Sackler, and Busch-Reisinger museum in the renovated Harvard Art Museum, an ambitious and memorable new project by Renzo Piano.  Amazing German art in the Busch rooms.

title: Living History
text: Harvard Yard is the old center of activity. The paths were determined by where people walked, a brilliant method called "Lines of Desire" ‚Äî now accepted by landscape designers the world over. Two of the big brick dorms house POWs ‚Äî redcoats captured further north in the first winter of the war of independence. Many stories. Try to guess which of the people you see are future Masters of the Universe, and which are just wannabes like you and me.

Try to guess which of the people you see are future Masters of the Universe, and which are just wannabes like you and me.

title: Very pleasant walk
text: If you have ever wondered what it would be  like to attend a top notch university then if you are in Cambridge Boston try a sunny walk around the campus .As we only had a short time we strolled around but you can also take guided walks , there are some very fine buildings and the central campus is also green with lots of grass and trees , a very pleasant day .It is easily reached via Underground tube and there are plenty of Cafes and restaurants in the local area with some quite quirky shops .

One small downside is that you cannot visit the inside of the buildings or see any lectures ongoing (understandable for the disruption this would cause to the students).

So much stories to learn and to tell. I spent a half day, walk from main campus, cross the bridge to Harvard Business School, one of my dream :). 
Don't forget to sign up the free tour, the main counter in front of the MRT station. Also grab some souvenir near by. I like the campus of HBS cos less people and very romantic, along the river.

title: Crimson Commons - Great Food

I have 7 meals here and all were very good. I appreciate the effort put into having quality food, especially since we were captive (pre-paid meal) customers which generally leads to lower quality.

title: Historic and Cinematic
text:
It was a great tour of Harvard by my colleague who teaches there. It's surprising how much I recognised from watching so many American films that have used it as a location.

American history isn't a long affair, but at a place like Harvard you get a sense of it, even on a chilly December day.

Really great experience.
translated_text:
It was a great tour of Harvard by my colleague who teaches there. It's surprising how much I recognised from watching so many American films that have used it as a location.

American history isn't a long affair, but at a place like Harvard you get a sense of it, even on a chilly December day.

Really great experience.

title: Worth a walk through
text: This is an American institution and it's definitely worth a walk through the Yard. Few of the educational buildings are open to the general public, but it's nice to see the architecture and soak up some history (or relive some of your favorites moments from books, memoirs, and movies). With Harvard Square nearby full of shopping and restaurants, this is a good place to come before or after a meal.
translated_text: This is an American institution and it's definitely worth a walk through the Yard. Few of the educational buildings are open to the general public, but it's nice to see the architecture and soak up some history (or relive some of your favorites moments from books, memoirs, and movies). With Harvard Square nearby full of shopping and restaurants, this is a good place to come before or after a meal.

title: Probably the best place to see in Harvard - definitely worth a visit
text:
We took the Red Line transit from Boston to Harvard - less than 20 minutes from central Boston.

Harvard Yard is very close to the transit station and was the highlight of my visit to Harvard/Cambridge. Some lovely large old buildings and coloured chairs on the lawns. If you are there in the Fall/Autumn the trees are changing colour and offer some lovely picture opportunities. Obviously a place steeped in history and learning and we just wandered around by ourselves soaking up the atmosphere for half an hour or so.

It is well worth a visit and the best and most memorable part of my morning in Harvard. If you are visiting from Boston then we found a morning or afternoon was enough.
