title: Breathtaking campus and excellent free tour!
text:
Visited Harvard on a recent trip to Boston. It was a short "T" trip via the red line, headed towards Alewife. The station name is "Harvard" and it brings you right to the famous Harvard Square. We joined a Student-Led Tour that departed from the Harvard Information Center, in the Smith Campus Center.

It was a walking tour of adult tourists not students. Our student leader was Jimmy. He was very familiar with the campus history, facts and details of the buildings interjected with lots of personal antidotes. Very enjoyable, personable and interesting young man.

We enjoyed the wonderful warm fall day and toured the following: Harvard Yard, Freshman dorms, Tercentenacy Theater, Widener Library, Memorial Hall, a Science centre, the John Harvard Statue and more. We did not enter any of the buildings except for the Memorial Hall. The building are amazing...red brick, some 300 years old. There are mature trees and wonderful roof lines to admire as well as steeples and grassy slopes. The architecture was striking...with a mix of traditional striped roofs and modern glass buildings from the 1070s.

After completing the tour we ambled around the campus to look at the Harvard Lampoon building. A quirky building with a smiling mouth and eyes. We recommend wandering the campus and enjoying all the free statues and the heritage buildings with their dormer windows. Breathtakingly Beautiful!

If you have time and the weather is fair, I recommend a short walk along the Charles River for a look at the buildings and bridges

Being tourists, we also stopped into the Coop store for some retail therapy. Lots of Harvard souvenirs to be purchased!

The campus is well worth an afternoon of touring! Apparently there are 100 plus iron gates...we only saw a few, maybe next time!

title: Enjoyed our tour with a non-quintessential student at Harvard
text: We did the formal information session followed by the tour of Harvard because my son is considering attending there.  The student who guided us was quite delightful and did not fit my image of a typical Harvard student at all.  I was particularly impressed with the way she talked about the dorm living there and how students are matched with roommates.  I could almost picture the "sorting hat" from Harry Potter, calling out the names of the students and which house they would be placed in for that year.

title: Informational and Entertaining
text: If you have the time, be sure to take the Harvard campus tour.  Our tour leader, "Ollie", was fantastic.  The tour included both the Old and New Harvard Yard as well as the Memorial Chapel.
translated_text: If you have the time, be sure to take the Harvard campus tour.  Our tour leader, "Ollie", was fantastic.  The tour included both the Old and New Harvard Yard as well as the Memorial Chapel.

title: Lovely
text: I would highly recommend a trip out to Harvard. It was so beautiful and just a world apart from the downtown city. Its incredible to see this place for real after seeing it in so many movies! Go have a coffee and a wander enjoy the buzz
translated_text: I would highly recommend a trip out to Harvard. It was so beautiful and just a world apart from the downtown city. Its incredible to see this place for real after seeing it in so many movies! Go have a coffee and a wander enjoy the buzz

title: Wow! Who knew there was a 'John Harvard''?!
text: We came to the Harvard-Yale football game and made a point to walk Harvard Yard during pre-game festivities. I knew Harvard was older (1633) than our country, but we're never told about John Harvard.  Fortunately his statue draws a crowd in the Yard and we came across it.  Glad to know more about the founding father of this fine academic institution!

I knew Harvard was older (1633) than our country, but we're never told about John Harvard.  Fortunately his statue draws a crowd in the Yard and we came across it.  Glad to know more about the founding father of this fine academic institution!

title: Helpful people
text: WE went to an athletic event --the security people were helpful and very polite --speaks well for Harvard
translated_text: WE went to an athletic event --the security people were helpful and very polite --speaks well for Harvard

title: Spectacular Experience
text: Was at Harvard for a meeting and got a guided tour of Harvard University. Was fascinating to see the famous University and learn more about its history and what makes it unique. Was able to rub the famous shoe for good luck at the statue although I was pleasantly surprised to learn that the statue is actually not for Harvard and that it was not Harvard who founded this famous University. Spectacular place to be.

Was able to rub the famous shoe for good luck at the statue although I was pleasantly surprised to learn that the statue is actually not for Harvard and that it was not Harvard who founded this famous University. Spectacular place to be.

title: Be sure to take a tour
text: We had a tour by a member of the Crimson Key Society. Excellent tour guides!! Even if you have done an admissions office tour, this will be different. Loved it!
translated_text: We had a tour by a member of the Crimson Key Society. Excellent tour guides!! Even if you have done an admissions office tour, this will be different. Loved it!

title: Awe inspiring !
text: Endless amazing buildings, thousands of students, huge spaces, gardens, all help to create the feeling that you are in the midst of an academic powerhouse. Worth visiting Harvard Yard and the buildings if you can gain access. The libraries, in particular, are especially impressive.
translated_text: Endless amazing buildings, thousands of students, huge spaces, gardens, all help to create the feeling that you are in the midst of an academic powerhouse. Worth visiting Harvard Yard and the buildings if you can gain access. The libraries, in particular, are especially impressive.

title: Autumn at Harvard
text: It is amazing walking through Harvard's yard and all the buildings. Brownstone building at the Yard are the classic view of Harvard, but all the others outside yard constructions are also spectacular. Beautiful at autumn.
translated_text: It is amazing walking through Harvard's yard and all the buildings. Brownstone building at the Yard are the classic view of Harvard, but all the others outside yard constructions are also spectacular. Beautiful at autumn.

title: Some really interesting sites
text: If you get a chance to go to Cambridge (small city (town?)) across the river from Boston, stroll the downtown area and tour Harvard. Harvard has many interesting buildings and sites (such as a stained glass hall devoted to victims of wars) and a tour will surely keep your interest. After your tour, stroll the charming shops of Harvard Square.

Harvard has many interesting buildings and sites (such as a stained glass hall devoted to victims of wars) and a tour will surely keep your interest. After your tour, stroll the charming shops of Harvard Square.

title: I Recommend Self-Guided Harvard Yard Tour on Mobile App
text:
We went to Harvard on a drizzling day and without knowing better, joined the free (you pay tips) student-run tour departing from the student center. After 10 minutes we had to leave the tour - while it's pretty interesting to hear the world-leading uni's story from an actual Harvard student, her voice was totally overwhelmed by the rain and I could hardly hear her in a 30-strong crowd. 

I ended up downloading the free Harvard Yard tour app on my iPhone and did my own exploration. The app depends on Internet access to function but throughout the Harvard Yard you should be able to access the free (albeit slow) uni guest wifi access. The app does a pretty good job at providing historical and sometimes humorous perspective on the famous university. 

Overall I enjoyed the visit to the university - but I am a nerd and being in Harvard was half the enjoyment itself. If "one of the world's best universities" does not interest you on itself, you may not find the Harvard Yard interesting. Most buildings are off limit so all you could see is really just the facade of the buildings, and this may not be all that interesting if you belong to the "sightseeing tourist" category.

title: That is the teaching and learning edifice, I've heard most about, so far !
text:
And now as the final point and one of the most precious moments, that happened to us during our short visit to Boston, I must mention the glorious site of the Harvard University in Cambridge.
This beautiful town Cambridge across the River Charles, off the Boston, counts for its own as the city ,though one could assume that it is one extension of the main city of the Massachusetts.
Here, whole campus with grounds ,yards, gorgeous buildings of different fields of the science, the monuments of the most deserved men throughout the history of the Harvard are at the reach of us, the visitors, the tourists. Like for instance, the sitting statue of the first  Harvard benefactor, John Harvard ,who was also the alumnus of the University of Cambridge. After his decease ,the name of Harvard College was honored to the existant institution of Cambridge University.
That was in the 1636, the year of Harvard University establishment.
We enjoyed at the times to walk on these green yards and around the buildings, perceiving this splendid architecture of the edifices, acknowledging the great University history and also getting acquainted with the nowadays life of that grand Campus.
We saw within these grounds, the greatest library in the world, the Widener Library.
Some sculptures of the renown sculptors as Henry Moore adorn the Harvard University gardens.
That is outstanding place to be seen for all the times.

title: Living History Since 1636
text: Even if you‚Äôre not a student here, the Yard speaks its history to you as you walk around.  Take a tour, or not, it doesn‚Äôt matter.  Sit on one of the terrific, colorful metal chairs everywhere and drink in the uninterrupted centuries passed under these same trees by young people going back so far that George Washington kicked out a dorm full of them in order to quarter his troops during the Revolutionary War.  It‚Äôs amazing, really, and it‚Äôs all free.

title: Tour of  Harvard.
text: This was an exciting & enjoyable  tour of the Famous Harvard University given by a  Harvard student  guide.  ($10) The magnificent buildings, grand Harvard history, beautiful grounds, & the life at Harvard University. Delightful Tour!
translated_text: This was an exciting & enjoyable  tour of the Famous Harvard University given by a  Harvard student  guide.  ($10) The magnificent buildings, grand Harvard history, beautiful grounds, & the life at Harvard University. Delightful Tour!

title: There were no caars  in the Haarvard  Yaard
text: There were students, tourist and lots to see. Our tour group was small and the guide was had lived in the area all her life. She had many stories about former Presidents and important people who attended Harvard. Admission was free. If you don't factor in the price of the cruise. Boston is a must see, we'll be going back.

She had many stories about former Presidents and important people who attended Harvard. Admission was free. If you don't factor in the price of the cruise. Boston is a must see, we'll be going back.

title: Harvard Yard and Square
text: Well-worth a visit: buzzy and safe.  Many of the college buildings are accessible and the grounds pleasant.  Frequent exhibitions in some buildings.  Also a good place to eat.  Almost a attractive as Cambridge, Cambs!
translated_text: Well-worth a visit: buzzy and safe.  Many of the college buildings are accessible and the grounds pleasant.  Frequent exhibitions in some buildings.  Also a good place to eat.  Almost a attractive as Cambridge, Cambs!

title: A wealth of history
text: A great place to just walk around the gardens, although the university itself is off limits to the general public it is still a fascinating place to visit.
translated_text: A great place to just walk around the gardens, although the university itself is off limits to the general public it is still a fascinating place to visit.

title: Great place to be in the Summer and fall and good pics in winter and spring
text: The yard is alive with activities, tourists and nature during all seasons. In the summer and fall lots of people and activities for family fun and  nice for romantic walks; in the winter and spring you get great pictures of nature. And if you are from Boston you can get excited about being inside Harvard yard with its rich history and the statue of John Harvard...

title: Harvard is lovely but the area around is a mess
text: We were interested to see Harvard and it was very interesting and lovely to see. We wondered for about an hour. Worth a look however I thought the area around was a mess and let's the whole place down.
translated_text: We were interested to see Harvard and it was very interesting and lovely to see. We wondered for about an hour. Worth a look however I thought the area around was a mess and let's the whole place down.

title: History, prestige and fascinating stories!
text: Take a tour with the Harvard student - led group (free!) by registering in the Harvard information center in Harvard Square. The groups are large and you might have to ask the student to speak louder but the (approximately) hour long tour is great! It includes history, personal anecdotes and all questions are answered intelligently, of course!

The groups are large and you might have to ask the student to speak louder but the (approximately) hour long tour is great! It includes history, personal anecdotes and all questions are answered intelligently, of course!

title: Harvard Yard Is Worth A Visit
text:
While Harvard sprawls into the area surrounding 
Harvard Square, and many of the buildings are non-remarkable, the same cannot be said of Harvard Yard, which is pretty and has a palpable sense of history. It is a very short walk from the Harvard Square Subway Station.
translated_text:
While Harvard sprawls into the area surrounding 
Harvard Square, and many of the buildings are non-remarkable, the same cannot be said of Harvard Yard, which is pretty and has a palpable sense of history. It is a very short walk from the Harvard Square Subway Station.

title: Informative and Entertaining
text: The tour is lead by students who make it informative as well as very entertaining. I thoroughly enjoyed my $10 tour, which was a bargain considering it is at least an hour long. I expressed my appreciation by purchasing lots of things in the official student shop at the end of the tour.
translated_text: The tour is lead by students who make it informative as well as very entertaining. I thoroughly enjoyed my $10 tour, which was a bargain considering it is at least an hour long. I expressed my appreciation by purchasing lots of things in the official student shop at the end of the tour.

title: Lovely afternoon walk
text: We enjoyed strolling around the area. Sat on the lawned area near John Harvard statue and was able to log on the free Harvard wifi. There were lots of chairs scattered about for anyone to use. A great idea.
translated_text: We enjoyed strolling around the area. Sat on the lawned area near John Harvard statue and was able to log on the free Harvard wifi. There were lots of chairs scattered about for anyone to use. A great idea.

title: Nice to walk around
text: Didn't have enough time to go on one of the guided tours so have a little walk around by myself. The buildings are gorgeous. Enjoyed my brief visit.
translated_text: Didn't have enough time to go on one of the guided tours so have a little walk around by myself. The buildings are gorgeous. Enjoyed my brief visit.

title: Alumna memories
text: It was all I remember, but better (flowers, nicer weather).  Loved seeing my old stomping grounds and Memorial Church is more lovely than I remembered
translated_text: It was all I remember, but better (flowers, nicer weather).  Loved seeing my old stomping grounds and Memorial Church is more lovely than I remembered

title: University
text: University like many others. I don't have any connections to Harvard and never even wanted to study there so it was rather boring for me.
translated_text: University like many others. I don't have any connections to Harvard and never even wanted to study there so it was rather boring for me.

title: University
text: Although one of the best, it's still just a university and people study there. So unless you have some kind of special connections to this place, nothing really special.
translated_text: Although one of the best, it's still just a university and people study there. So unless you have some kind of special connections to this place, nothing really special.

title: Attended a seminar there
text: Beautiful location.  Free student tours. Highly recommend the tour to get the real story of the history, the statues, and the life of a Harvard student.
translated_text: Beautiful location.  Free student tours. Highly recommend the tour to get the real story of the history, the statues, and the life of a Harvard student.

title: America's most famous campus
text: Just like every picture or film made at this place lovely to walk around remembering all the times I had read about this place in a book or seen a film with this at the heart of a character's life
translated_text: Just like every picture or film made at this place lovely to walk around remembering all the times I had read about this place in a book or seen a film with this at the heart of a character's life

title: Great Area. Lively. Football Game Fun
text:
What an awesome area. Very lively and fun. Lot to see.  Took in a  Harvard football game which was actually pretty good.  They're on a roll so the game was fun to watch. 

The historic stadium looks as such and bring a cushion to sit on. The entire Harvard Stadium is one big block on concrete.  It's a great place to watch a football game. Easy in and out.  Site lines great  and as a season ticket holder for the NY football Giants I had a better experience here than I ever do in that billion dollar dump of a football stadium in the swamp called Metlife Stadium.

title: Student Watching/Nationalities Galore
text: Harvard Yard area is a feel for the international.  So many people from all over the world. The area is so busy and bustling. Watch, listen, absorb. You are in a great place of academia!
translated_text: Harvard Yard area is a feel for the international.  So many people from all over the world. The area is so busy and bustling. Watch, listen, absorb. You are in a great place of academia!

title: Great University Experience
text: With family members having attended and also taught at Harvard, a return to the Cambridge area was fabulous. Take the time to look at statues, sit in the commons, check out the architecture of the buildings and just people watch.  Most fun!
translated_text: With family members having attended and also taught at Harvard, a return to the Cambridge area was fabulous. Take the time to look at statues, sit in the commons, check out the architecture of the buildings and just people watch.  Most fun!

title: Went to bookstore
text: We went to the co op bookstore and looked at all the Harvard books and items. Then we walked to Harvard yard and looked at the John Harvard statute, saw also a library, many buildings and a pretty church. The gates to Harvard were pretty,.  It was a nice day and had lots of interesting things to see.

Then we walked to Harvard yard and looked at the John Harvard statute, saw also a library, many buildings and a pretty church. The gates to Harvard were pretty,.  It was a nice day and had lots of interesting things to see.

title: Great for a wander
text: We took the Metro Red Line out to Cambridge and enjoyed a pleasant stroll through the university grounds. Having been to Cambridge, England earlier in the year it made for an interesting comparison. We chose not to join a tour group and having obtained a free map from a nearby student in Harvard Square we had a pleasant amble.

Having been to Cambridge, England earlier in the year it made for an interesting comparison. We chose not to join a tour group and having obtained a free map from a nearby student in Harvard Square we had a pleasant amble.

title: Ivy League
text:
So glad we went here. There are free tours given by students and although our paper guide said they would not be running at the time we arrived about 3 pm, we latched onto a tour which had just started. A really fascinating place, the students were back and at work or play. Our guide was very informative and answered lots of questions. She had some great anecdotes about the place and it made us both wish we could relive our university years at Harvard, even hough we are both over 60.
Well worth a visit.

A really fascinating place, the students were back and at work or play. Our guide was very informative and answered lots of questions. She had some great anecdotes about the place and it made us both wish we could relive our university years at Harvard, even hough we are both over 60.
Well worth a visit.

title: Very interesting - but not free!
text:
Firstly, Francesca, our tour guide was great.  She is a sophomore studying Astro-physics and a lovely, vibrant young lady.  Her style was efficient and humourous and just what you would expect from a tour guide.

We were under the impression that the tour was free but was suprised to learn that there was a cost of $10pp - what the?  We thought this was a bit pricey for a tour that lasted 40mins and  just toured the grounds - it didn't go into any buildings.  That being said, the tour was interesting and the grounds beautiful.

title: Harvard is a Great Place to Visit
text: Harvard University is a great place to visit. Begin in Harvard Square (which is very interesting in itself) and go right through the gate into Harvard Yard. Check out the buildings, students and scene as you walk around and take a selfie at John Harvard's statue. Continue your walk though the far side gate onto Quincy Street and turn left. The Harvard Art Museum is on this street. Cross Broadway and continue on Quincy Street, the large church looking structure on the left is Sanders Theater. Turn right onto Kirkland and left onto Divinity and wander around (or go into) the museums of Archaeology, Natural History & Zoology. Meander over to Oxford Street and back to Harvard Yard or Harvard Square.
translated_text: Harvard University is a great place to visit. Begin in Harvard Square (which is very interesting in itself) and go right through the gate into Harvard Yard. Check out the buildings, students and scene as you walk around and take a selfie at John Harvard's statue. Continue your walk though the far side gate onto Quincy Street and turn left. The Harvard Art Museum is on this street. Cross Broadway and continue on Quincy Street, the large church looking structure on the left is Sanders Theater. Turn right onto Kirkland and left onto Divinity and wander around (or go into) the museums of Archaeology, Natural History & Zoology. Meander over to Oxford Street and back to Harvard Yard or Harvard Square.

title: A beautiful campus seen through eyes of a student guide!
text:
One of our son's friends, gave us a personal tour of "his school", and we had such a lovely afternoon.  It is a beautiful campus, with the red brick buildings, beautiful old trees, and many walking pathways to discover between the buildings.  There are many eateries, shops, and services available to student, professor, and tourist around the perimeter of the campus.

Walking over the bridge and watch the rowers go by is a great way to spend a few minutes and soak in the view of the school.  It is a beautiful place of learning.
translated_text:

It is a beautiful campus, with the red brick buildings, beautiful old trees, and many walking pathways to discover between the buildings.  There are many eateries, shops, and services available to student, professor, and tourist around the perimeter of the campus.

Walking over the bridge and watch the rowers go by is a great way to spend a few minutes and soak in the view of the school.  It is a beautiful place of learning.

title: Would have enjoyed it more with a guide
text: Had some time to kill in Boston and decided to visit Harvard.  Took the T as it is the best way to get around the Boston area.  Very nice campus with some beautiful buildings.  I bet us tourists get on the students' nerves!
translated_text: Had some time to kill in Boston and decided to visit Harvard.  Took the T as it is the best way to get around the Boston area.  Very nice campus with some beautiful buildings.  I bet us tourists get on the students' nerves!

title: Breath in the significance!
text: One of the most pre-eminent Universities in the World, not just the USA. In a nice area, and well maintained (as you would expect). Take a tour with one of the students, and listen to all the stories - historical and of the achievements of the Alumni. You can't help but be impressed.
translated_text: One of the most pre-eminent Universities in the World, not just the USA. In a nice area, and well maintained (as you would expect). Take a tour with one of the students, and listen to all the stories - historical and of the achievements of the Alumni. You can't help but be impressed.

title: A Truly American Classic
text: While in town, this is a must see outdoor amenity of Cambridge.  Great for people watching.  Be certain to criss-cross the yard along one of its diagonals and suck in the experience that too many students take for granted.
translated_text: While in town, this is a must see outdoor amenity of Cambridge.  Great for people watching.  Be certain to criss-cross the yard along one of its diagonals and suck in the experience that too many students take for granted.

title: Always a Fun Place to Visit
text: The heart of American higher education is always fascinating to visit.  Awesome resources that only a school with a huge endowment can afford.
translated_text: The heart of American higher education is always fascinating to visit.  Awesome resources that only a school with a huge endowment can afford.

title: Great with a good guide!
text: Visited with Daniel Berger-Jones, a local history guide, as our guide.  What a contribution he made to our understanding of the place.  It has a fascinating history but little is apparent to the casual visitor, but with a guide it comes to life!
translated_text: Visited with Daniel Berger-Jones, a local history guide, as our guide.  What a contribution he made to our understanding of the place.  It has a fascinating history but little is apparent to the casual visitor, but with a guide it comes to life!

title: Harvard University - Interesting to visit, great for pictures, not so much "to do"
text:
Easy to get to, we decided to visit Harvard with some time to kill in Boston. It was a great diversion, as it is a beautiful campus with some very nice sights. There are lots of places to get some nice photos, and the area around the campus is a typical college-type atmosphere.

We did not take a formal tour, instead opting for just walking around campus. We hit the area right outside the "T", and started walking. The buildings are beautiful, the campus well taken care of, and the students seem quite pleasant - given there are tourists plowing around.

There are tons of restaurants and other shopping conveniences around the campus, so take your time and enjoy the ambiance.
translated_text:

title: a great place to tour
text:
If you could thru osmosis gain knowledge, my brain would explode.
Take lots of pictures, take your time.
translated_text:
If you could thru osmosis gain knowledge, my brain would explode.
Take lots of pictures, take your time.

title: It's Harvard!
text: What to say?? The grounds are absolutely gorgeous! Loved spending the day here and walking through the whole campus.....visiting the bookstore....entering a few buildings.....Harvard square...meeting students...the whole experience was great! (And yes I bought Harvard jogging pants!)
translated_text: What to say?? The grounds are absolutely gorgeous! Loved spending the day here and walking through the whole campus.....visiting the bookstore....entering a few buildings.....Harvard square...meeting students...the whole experience was great! (And yes I bought Harvard jogging pants!)

title: Soaked in the Smartness
text: I had a great time touring around the campus. I started with the free campus tour and them walked around on my own. A student provided the tour. And it was great to get some insight on student life on campus.
translated_text: I had a great time touring around the campus. I started with the free campus tour and them walked around on my own. A student provided the tour. And it was great to get some insight on student life on campus.

title: Beautiful campus
text: Easy trip on the "T" and when you go up the steps, you are at the gates of the campus. Get a campus map and start walking. Lots of people were doing a student led tour but we did our own thing. You can go in the basement of the Science Research Bldg. To find a restroom.  We also walked down towards the river and caught a glimpse of the rowing team. Then we toured Harvard Square and had ice cream at J. P. Licks.  Wear comfortable shoes.
translated_text: Easy trip on the "T" and when you go up the steps, you are at the gates of the campus. Get a campus map and start walking. Lots of people were doing a student led tour but we did our own thing. You can go in the basement of the Science Research Bldg. To find a restroom.  We also walked down towards the river and caught a glimpse of the rowing team. Then we toured Harvard Square and had ice cream at J. P. Licks.  Wear comfortable shoes.

title: Excellent Attraction
text: This tour give you a fascinating look at life at Harvard University.  Tour guide and Harvard student Alexis possesses  an extraordinarily dynamic personality that constantly held our attention.   Learn about the many luminaries that resided in their dorms right  here before going on to great fame and fortune by changing the world! Learn about the Harvard primal scream and little known Harvard University stories and traditions. Definitely worth it!!!!   We purchased our tickets at the newsstand in Harvard Square  where the tour begins.

Tour guide and Harvard student Alexis possesses  an extraordinarily dynamic personality that constantly held our attention.   Learn about the many luminaries that resided in their dorms right  here before going on to great fame and fortune by changing the world! Learn about the Harvard primal scream and little known Harvard University stories and traditions. Definitely worth it!!!!   We purchased our tickets at the newsstand in Harvard Square  where the tour begins.

title: gorgeous campus, wonderful museum
text: We had only about 5 hours to explore the Peabody museum, and we could have spent a couple of days. The exhibit of hand-made glass flowers was like nothing anywhere else in the world, and the rocks and minerals exhibit was gorgeous.
translated_text: We had only about 5 hours to explore the Peabody museum, and we could have spent a couple of days. The exhibit of hand-made glass flowers was like nothing anywhere else in the world, and the rocks and minerals exhibit was gorgeous.

title: great tour
text: Lovely way to see the campus and hear a little bit about the history of Harvard. It's a great idea to have students run the tour. The random anecdotes were enlightening. It's not easy to simultaneously please parents who are college shopping with their teenagers and tourists who just want to be entertained. I think our tour guide did a great job!
translated_text: Lovely way to see the campus and hear a little bit about the history of Harvard. It's a great idea to have students run the tour. The random anecdotes were enlightening. It's not easy to simultaneously please parents who are college shopping with their teenagers and tourists who just want to be entertained. I think our tour guide did a great job!

title: Interesting Walk for an Hour
text: It's a nice walk between the old campus buildings, but I wouldn't go much out of my way to see it. The surrounding town has a good range of eateries, some at student prices.
translated_text: It's a nice walk between the old campus buildings, but I wouldn't go much out of my way to see it. The surrounding town has a good range of eateries, some at student prices.

title: Best in class
text:
Harvard University and it's environs represents the pinnacle of meritocracy in education. It's unparalleled reputation and literal "Town & Gown" interaction creates an ethereal spiritualization of freedom of thought that both the ancient Greeks as well as our Founding Fathers imagined. As an alumnus, every time that I return to campus, I take away an endearing desire to utilize the opportunities that the Harvard relationship provides me and to be a better citizen to society as its result.
I love to share my experiences (literally) with friends, which I did last week. By the texts I received afterwards, I think that I succeeded!

title: Hallowed Turf
text: We only visited Harvard Square but the ambience was wonderful.  it was 'freshers' week and the buzz in the air was palpable. The buildings were lovely and it had a real 'Ox/Bridge feel!
translated_text: We only visited Harvard Square but the ambience was wonderful.  it was 'freshers' week and the buzz in the air was palpable. The buildings were lovely and it had a real 'Ox/Bridge feel!

title: Fun to Walk Around, but most buildings are closed to public
text: We enjoyed the stroll around Harvard Yard and seeing some of the classical architecture.  Most of the buildings have signs that the general public are not allowed--not surprising.  We had a beautiful day to walk the campus--very lively.  The adjacent village is much more interesting.
translated_text: We enjoyed the stroll around Harvard Yard and seeing some of the classical architecture.  Most of the buildings have signs that the general public are not allowed--not surprising.  We had a beautiful day to walk the campus--very lively.  The adjacent village is much more interesting.

title: Good tour
text: Harvard Yard has free wifi, and an app to download to take a self guided tour. We really enjoyed this, as our kids would not have put up with listening to a paid tour guide in a group. Tha app called "Harvard Tour" probably has most of the same info anyway.
translated_text: Harvard Yard has free wifi, and an app to download to take a self guided tour. We really enjoyed this, as our kids would not have put up with listening to a paid tour guide in a group. Tha app called "Harvard Tour" probably has most of the same info anyway.

title: Harvard is an amazing place to visit
text: The people are gracious, the location is filled with so much beauty and history, and the vibe is Harvard.  I smile and I light up whenever I have the opportunity to speak about my time spent at Harvard.
translated_text: The people are gracious, the location is filled with so much beauty and history, and the vibe is Harvard.  I smile and I light up whenever I have the opportunity to speak about my time spent at Harvard.

title: Great Place for a Walk
text: We were fortunate to have good weather for a nice stroll around the campus.  Well worth the visit if you know any Harvard history.
translated_text: We were fortunate to have good weather for a nice stroll around the campus.  Well worth the visit if you know any Harvard history.

title: If you only visit one university ...
text: Easily accessible by train, this part of Boston (Cambridge) is worth a visit. This is the US equivalent of Oxford or Cambridge - communities which have developed around a university. It is possible to just go for a wander, win the help of a map, or to join a tour guided by a Harvard student. These are promoted at the station exit. Look out for the statue of the three lies - a  fascinating example of not letting the truth get in the way of a good story. The range of authentic Harvard-branded goods on sale in the Coop is massive, if this is what you want. There are lots of eating options in the area as well. This is a great way to occupy half a day.

title: Famous Harvard University
text: We took a student lead tour of this historic university, which was free. You can grab your free tickets (for a specific timed tour) from Harvard Information Centre across the gates into Harvard on Massachusetts Avenue. The girl we had, had just  graduated from Harvard and this was her last tour. She did a great job of providing us with the history of Harvard. Explained what the buildings were used for, what life was like at this university. It made the tour very informative and personal for us. The campus itself was very beautiful, the architecture of the buildings was just stunning. And the tree lined grounds making it a wonderful place to study or just relax after class. We had a great time visiting and the surrounding area is also very nice to visit. There's plenty of caf√©s around to enjoy a coffee afterwards.

title: Worth it
text: Drove up on the long weekend from our stay in Beacon hill just so we could say we did. You can feel the history as you walk around. Beautiful setting and buildings. Book store was a nice break with the kids. If you have an hour of so it is a neat thing to do.....surrounding neighborhood is amazing and I am sure if you have time a few of the local restaurants and watering holes would be fun to visit.

title: Harvard University
text: It is a beautiful campus during the summer, but because of the hype around it I find I built up my expectations too much and was therefore a little disappointed. I have seen other american university campuses that are much more beautiful and interesting.

title: Beautiful buildings!
text: Its really interesting to visit the Yard here. It was the day they were welcoming first year students so it was really fun to see that. I used the Harvard Tour app, which was helpful but I wished it had audio for everything. The sun makes it hard to read, and I wanted to look at more things. Really interesting history.

title: beautiful school
text: Took a prospective student tour. School is beautiful...some of students are snobs.Loved the history and the way the school is set up. Disliked attitude of students at info session. Felt like was being talked down to.

title: Students Everywhere On "Moving In" Weekend
text:
A really lovely, leafy, place with a collection of superb buildings.
Take some time to stop and stare at the world's best (ranked no.1 in 2013/14) university. See John Harvards' statue and remember that the ¬£500 bequest from this Southwark, London, publican's son is now worth $35Bn!

title: Harvard campus tour
text: We came to Boston for a dedication in memory of my best friend in the women's soccer team locker room. We watched a soccer game on the main field. Then walked around the campus. Very pretty and well maintained. Harvard square has fun shops and caf√©s. It's Harvard  so one would not expect anything less!

title: Busy Yard
text: Chairs were all over as they were in preparation for the school opening. I like the feeling of being in the yard  though it is quite small.
translated_text: Chairs were all over as they were in preparation for the school opening. I like the feeling of being in the yard  though it is quite small.

title: Classic and Awesome
text: My first time in Harvard. The feeling is marvelous. I feel like a genius. The campus was on the preparation mode for the freshmen.
translated_text: My first time in Harvard. The feeling is marvelous. I feel like a genius. The campus was on the preparation mode for the freshmen.

title: Had the Student Tour
text: Quite a few of us on the tour but our guide - a third year student I think, was professional and gave us the basic history of Harvard in the appropriate manner. It was all smaller than I thought.
translated_text: Quite a few of us on the tour but our guide - a third year student I think, was professional and gave us the basic history of Harvard in the appropriate manner. It was all smaller than I thought.

title: This is the Ivy League?
text: My friend and I were both highly disappointed by the Harvard Campus. Perhaps it's because of the way Hollywood makes it look in movies like Legally Blonde, but the old historical part of campus (Harvard Yard) is quite small. It's a pleasant space, no doubt. Chairs scattered across the lawn shaded by tall trees make for a nice place to stop and rest. However, the rest of campus is a vast expanse of nondescript brick buildings. Even the few free museums we went into failed to impress. The Semitic Museum's collection seemed to comprise solely replicas of famous artifacts, although it did have a lot of information on Cyprus, which I suppose impressed us. Boston if full of historical buildings and shady green spaces to wander around. Harvard didn't stand out from any of the others, and they don't require a long metro ride.

title: Pleasant stroll
text: One can appreciate why Harvard is such a great place to study. And, it is pleasant to wander around.
translated_text: One can appreciate why Harvard is such a great place to study. And, it is pleasant to wander around.

title: Inspiration for Youth of All Ages
text:
We took our kids for a tour of the campus and I think they enjoyed the tour, but getting an honest opinion about a site seeing adventure is like asking if they washed their hands before dinner.
 
Get used to the tour guides calling the it Hah-vard.  Although we weren't able to tour any of the buildings from the inside, viewing the historic architecture from the outside was a treat and I can only imagine the feeling of gratification of attending class there.  

The tour is well worth the donation and the guide was friendly and very informative.  I would definitely recommend the tour for children and adults of all ages.

title: It's Harvard!
text: What a gorgeous campus!  The architecture, the history...what can you say?  I made it a point to visit here on a vacation to Boston, and it didn't disappoint!  I may be in trouble, though...after seeing the campus, my daughter now wants to attend college there.  Heck, I want to go back and attend college here ;-)  It's definitely worth a stop if you're in the area.

I may be in trouble, though...after seeing the campus, my daughter now wants to attend college there.  Heck, I want to go back and attend college here ;-)  It's definitely worth a stop if you're in the area.

title: Worth it for the architecture
text: We were lucky enough to hear an orientation being given so got a little extra history lesson, but if you have even a little bit of time, it's worth going here just for the architecture of the buildings alone.  The gardens are also very pretty.  In fact, the whole campus is very nice and peaceful (we were there early in the morning).  I must admit I wouldn't think walking around a college campus would make for a good attraction, but I found myself glad I did this one.

I must admit I wouldn't think walking around a college campus would make for a good attraction, but I found myself glad I did this one.

title: Not so old
text: Pleasant enough but cannot be compared with the beauty of Cambridge University in the UK. The nearby square is very commercial and embarrassingly lacking in rest rooms!
translated_text: Pleasant enough but cannot be compared with the beauty of Cambridge University in the UK. The nearby square is very commercial and embarrassingly lacking in rest rooms!

title: Bow to the temple of learning
text: The best time to visit Harvard University, Cambridge is towards the last week of May when a variety of Commencement functions are held at all the Schools. Weather-wise it is very welcoming, neither cold nor hot, of course, there might be occasional drizzles. Fresh intelligent faces are in all smiles because the exams are over and now it is party time. Some are perhaps little sad because the time has come to bid adieu to this wonderful place and their pals, join the real world and contribute to the welfare of mankind. It is a common sight to find youngsters with their parents and siblings who have come from long distances just to be with the graduating wonder in this joyous occasion. They proudly sport caps, t-shirts, jackets etc with logo of Harvard Dad/Mom/ Brother et al. The shopkeepers first congratulate them before doing the business. Service staff in restaurants, many of whom are students themselves, welcome these guests with words which come from their deep within. Cabbies entertain with all kinds of questions. Even the Police, who usually maintain a stony countenance, are a smiling lot. Joy is all-pervasive; it is beyond description. You have to be there to get a real feel of it.

title: HARVARD
text: What else do we need to say about this place it is the BEST and most phenomenal institution of higher learning in the United States and probably the world!! Beautiful gardens and walk spaces. I spent a week learning from the best in my field.
translated_text: What else do we need to say about this place it is the BEST and most phenomenal institution of higher learning in the United States and probably the world!! Beautiful gardens and walk spaces. I spent a week learning from the best in my field.

title: Beautiful, great people watching
text: This is the perfect spot to take a break and people-watch,  I was there in the summer and they had tons of lawn chairs for you to arrange to your liking.  Lots of interesting people passing through.  Lovely surroundings.  Food trucks close by for lunch or a snack.
translated_text: This is the perfect spot to take a break and people-watch,  I was there in the summer and they had tons of lawn chairs for you to arrange to your liking.  Lots of interesting people passing through.  Lovely surroundings.  Food trucks close by for lunch or a snack.

title: Love this place
text: We love the collection of French Fermob chairs on the Yard. It feels like we are home (we are living in Paris) and it makes the yard a different place every time we visit as the colorful display of chairs and benches is changing every day.
translated_text: We love the collection of French Fermob chairs on the Yard. It feels like we are home (we are living in Paris) and it makes the yard a different place every time we visit as the colorful display of chairs and benches is changing every day.

title: Dramatic and impressive
text:
We stepped out of the subway and were then in the University grounds.  Lots of red brick, lots of large buildings, a dramatic library and lots of student-y atmosphere.  

We didn't feel the need to do a tour, we saw enough just walking around, and got a good sense of things. There is money here.

It's not possible to do a drive through, and parking in Harvard looked difficult, so we felt we did the right thing to go on the subway.

Lots of good touristy things to do nearby, great place to see with much significance.  All this and MIT too!

title: Old architecture
text: Amazing walk through time. Very old well maintained buildings. Nice to see that old institutions are still in for the younger generation.
translated_text: Amazing walk through time. Very old well maintained buildings. Nice to see that old institutions are still in for the younger generation.

title: A very nice choice for a half day visit
text: Harvard University is located in the Cambridge area of Boston and is very easily accessible with the underground. We spend there a little more than a half day and it definately worthed it. The campus is green and well maintained and there's always people walking around. There are several historical buildings that you can visit and also a handful of nice museums. We visited the museum of natural history which was very interesting and holds an outstanding collection of flowers made of glass. We also had the chance to follow a free guided tour of the university held by a student which was very nice and informative.

We visited the museum of natural history which was very interesting and holds an outstanding collection of flowers made of glass. We also had the chance to follow a free guided tour of the university held by a student which was very nice and informative.

title: Very nice for a walk and maybe the museum ...
text:
The architecture itself was amazing ... the ambiance and weather permitted us to take a very nice stroll ... I heard the Natural History Museum is nice but could not go on this trip.

Worth it just because you get to see this legendary landmark in world education!

The architecture itself was amazing ... the ambiance and weather permitted us to take a very nice stroll ... I heard the Natural History Museum is nice but could not go on this trip.

title: Great for the Gardener and the Cook!
text: I loved the illustrations and displays of the edible flora from cocoa beans to vanilla trees along with mollusks and other marine delicacies.  Also loved the glass flowers!
translated_text: I loved the illustrations and displays of the edible flora from cocoa beans to vanilla trees along with mollusks and other marine delicacies.  Also loved the glass flowers!

title: Interesting
text: Harvard university is a must see if you come to the Boston area. They have free tours guided by Harvard students that range from one to two hours. A good opportunity to learn a little bit of history.
translated_text: Harvard university is a must see if you come to the Boston area. They have free tours guided by Harvard students that range from one to two hours. A good opportunity to learn a little bit of history.

title: So open and grand
text: With a daughter who is interested in studying in USA we decided to have a quick visit while in Boston. Grand style but so open - lots of people just wandering around - chairs every where. Still quiet and serene.
translated_text: With a daughter who is interested in studying in USA we decided to have a quick visit while in Boston. Grand style but so open - lots of people just wandering around - chairs every where. Still quiet and serene.

title: Nice Experience!!!
text:
It was good to visit Harvard Yard on a fine Sunday afternoon. I enjoyed sitting there for a while and enjoying weather.  
I agreed with couple of other reviews like place is too crowded with visitors, but I enjoyed.
It would be great if you take a Harvard walking tour or download audio tours/mobile tours from site. You will enjoy listening to facts.

title: Not really what I was expecting
text: To be fair, when we decided to go to Harvard, we didn't allow ourselves enough time to get out of the car and walk the grounds properly, not did we do a proper tour, so that is definitely skewing my review. We decided to drive around the grounds to see the buildings and try and get a feel for the campus. Well, the campus is huge and with all of the construction going on it was difficult to do a proper "drive-thru." The buildings we did see were old and impressive, but not really the WOW factor I was expecting. Wish we had given ourselves more time to see what we were maybe missing.
translated_text: To be fair, when we decided to go to Harvard, we didn't allow ourselves enough time to get out of the car and walk the grounds properly, not did we do a proper tour, so that is definitely skewing my review. We decided to drive around the grounds to see the buildings and try and get a feel for the campus. Well, the campus is huge and with all of the construction going on it was difficult to do a proper "drive-thru." The buildings we did see were old and impressive, but not really the WOW factor I was expecting. Wish we had given ourselves more time to see what we were maybe missing.

title: Beautiful campus!
text: We decided to take our pre-teens to see Harvard. It definitely did not disappoint!  It's a beautiful campus with landscaping and historic brick buildings.  There is also a great campus store for apparel and some shops.  Just really a great area.
translated_text: We decided to take our pre-teens to see Harvard. It definitely did not disappoint!  It's a beautiful campus with landscaping and historic brick buildings.  There is also a great campus store for apparel and some shops.  Just really a great area.

title: Awesome campus and friendly staff
text: Harvard's campus is a great place to walk around. A lot of history here. Plenty of trees and shade to walk around in and enjoy the grounds. Shops and restaurants of Harvard Square are right outside the gate. Staff is very friendly. Met a very friendly security guard originally from Pakistan (sorry, don't remember his name), who was very helpful and went out of his way to provide directions. (Thank you!)
translated_text: Harvard's campus is a great place to walk around. A lot of history here. Plenty of trees and shade to walk around in and enjoy the grounds. Shops and restaurants of Harvard Square are right outside the gate. Staff is very friendly. Met a very friendly security guard originally from Pakistan (sorry, don't remember his name), who was very helpful and went out of his way to provide directions. (Thank you!)

title: Take the student guided tour; informative, interesting and fun.
text: We had been advised that student tours of the campus were free but apparently this is only the case from September and not during the summer vacation.  In any event we purchased our tickets, $10, at Out of Town News kiosk just a short walk from the metro station, and were soon off on a guided tour of the campus with Eli, a delightful and entertaining student going into his junior year.  The tour was just over an hour long but it was Eli that made it interesting and informative; he focussed on the history of Harvard - including the buildings, architecture and statues - Harvard traditions and some of the famous people who have attended Harvard.  He was a great story teller and wove in his personal experience of this great University.  He was also very patient and was very happy to answer a range of questions including one or two from some pretty precocious little kids! Highly recommend doing the tour and hope you have as good a guide as Eli!
translated_text: We had been advised that student tours of the campus were free but apparently this is only the case from September and not during the summer vacation.  In any event we purchased our tickets, $10, at Out of Town News kiosk just a short walk from the metro station, and were soon off on a guided tour of the campus with Eli, a delightful and entertaining student going into his junior year.  The tour was just over an hour long but it was Eli that made it interesting and informative; he focussed on the history of Harvard - including the buildings, architecture and statues - Harvard traditions and some of the famous people who have attended Harvard.  He was a great story teller and wove in his personal experience of this great University.  He was also very patient and was very happy to answer a range of questions including one or two from some pretty precocious little kids! Highly recommend doing the tour and hope you have as good a guide as Eli!

title: Pretty nice
text: This was good too.. it's more like a luxury hotel. Good fun to walk around and see the buildings.MIT is a better bet though.
translated_text: This was good too.. it's more like a luxury hotel. Good fun to walk around and see the buildings.MIT is a better bet though.

title: Now I can say I "went to" Harvard (last weekend)...
text: Harvard is probably my favorite area in Boston, lots of interesting architectures, not your typical college town (probably more of a fancy college town since I don't believe many of those stores will survive in a poor college town).  We also joined the tour, it was funny and enjoyable. The museum of natural histroy has a lot to see.  We had lunch with food prepared by food truck "Bon Me" on campus. The wheelchair accessibility is slightly better than the rest of Boston.

title: Free Harvard Tour
text: Free tours are offered by students (tip afterward if guide did a good job). Meet in the information store which is across the street in the large building, next door to the student clothing store. The tour does provide some interesting historical  information about Harvard and also some of those traditional tales stated over the years.  The tour is slanted more for families who have students that will be attending Harvard and although our son-in-law is attending there, he is a Masters student and obviously independent. Therefore, when conversation about housing and finance began, we had to be patient in order to continue on with the tour.

title: Worth a walk to soak up history and boost the IQ.
text: The older part of Harvard Yard reeks history, tradition and has done a great deal to shape US and world history by serving as a place of learning for generations of leaders.  Hard not to feel the historic aspect as you stroll around and through the gates.  Cambridge is well worth a visit.  Visiting Harvard and MIT is a great thing to do with young teens to help motivate them to be aspirational in their academic and life goals.
translated_text: The older part of Harvard Yard reeks history, tradition and has done a great deal to shape US and world history by serving as a place of learning for generations of leaders.  Hard not to feel the historic aspect as you stroll around and through the gates.  Cambridge is well worth a visit.  Visiting Harvard and MIT is a great thing to do with young teens to help motivate them to be aspirational in their academic and life goals.

title: Worth a visit if you have time
text: Glad to have been and maybe we should have taken a tour to learn more but on the surface a beautiful collection of old buildings housing a wonderful university with a statue of the benefactor out front.  But that was all...
translated_text: Glad to have been and maybe we should have taken a tour to learn more but on the surface a beautiful collection of old buildings housing a wonderful university with a statue of the benefactor out front.  But that was all...

title: INTERESTING
text: Coming from the UK we were very interested to visit Harvard.  As we walked around the yard we saw various actors dressed in period costumes.  At one point, we listened to a talk about the history and statue of John Harvard.  It was lovely to see, what to us could only be seen in films, come to life.

At one point, we listened to a talk about the history and statue of John Harvard.  It was lovely to see, what to us could only be seen in films, come to life.

title: So?
text: Interesting. No, not the Harvard Yard. But some people who give a good rating to this place on Tripadvisor. They left a comment like, "I finally made it!" Psshh. Yes this place is historical and can be seen as "amazing," but really - reality is..Harvard Yard is so crowded by tourists,visitors, and students by day. Students don't mind throwing dirty looks to random passengers often times, Camera flashes everywhere, limited footpaths, and it is a very very small yard overall. Not impressed.

title: Harvard grounds
text: Just great to soak up this amazing atmosphere.  Better to have a guide but you can walk the grounds yourself. Check out the science area and the first computer

title: A great way to spend the day.
text: We took the Hahvahd tour that was a walking tour and our student tour leader was Jason, a bright and entertaining young man.  Many things were off limits to the public but a very nice look at this beautiful campus and Cambridge area.  We enjoyed it so much, after a wonderful lunch at Sandrine's, went back to sit at the campus and enjoy the beautiful weather and atmosphere, very nice day.

title: Beautiful
text: Beautiful campus. You can download a free app to take a tour. Its quite big and you can go and have a nice picnic. The architecture is amazing and has several different buildings.

title: Splendid Colonial Buildings & Peaceful Gardens
text: Step back in time and enjoy walking through the tree-lined quadrangle surrounded by handsome period buildings. The noise levels from the city outside subside and you can sit and enjoy the architecture and beauty of the university.

title: Must Visit
text: Some parts fo the campus are under reno at the moment - suggest an evening visit when crowds are low

title: Walk through the yard
text: A green oasis in the middle of Harvard Square.  Be sure to walk through the yard.  Lots of activity and chairs where you can rest for a moment.

title: Great place to walk....
text: And just take in how many notable people have walked these same steps.  Seaver hall has a very cool whispering brick archway where you can hear what people whisper from the other side of the arch.  I think it was Seaver.  I know it started w an S.  Beautiful architecture.

title: I have to agree with the "average" reviewers
text: If you haven't seen it, then you have to visit. Just be aware that just looking at the buildings isn't that great. It's really not that picturesque a school. Buildings are very old, and guess what, they look very old. Take a tour to get some insight, or visit the museums, etc. Lots of tourists wandering through, so lots of unfriendly people. Probably ticks off the students too, who seem to be typically uncaring to others, drifting through their millennial world. Surrounding area, Harvard Square, busily annoying.

title: Feel smarter just to be here
text: One of the best university in the world. Always want to check it out. Old and full of historical buildings. Make you feel smarter even just to be there.
translated_text: One of the best university in the world. Always want to check it out. Old and full of historical buildings. Make you feel smarter even just to be there.

title: Very interesting and worth the time
text: Our tour guide Laura did a great job.  As a student attending the university she was able to give a first hand experience of the school. Although the tours are free of charge they only permit 35 people per tour.  We got there ~ 0950 and the 1000 tour was full.  You can get tickets an hour before the next tour.  So we waited around till 1000 and got the tickets for the 1100 tour, and then went walking around the area.  The office gets congested as people are either waiting for the tour to begin or waiting to get tickets.  Parking in the area is dear.  It cost us $29 to park for the short time we were there.

title: Quite boring, architectures in quite similar style.
text:
I visited there with my friend in a local tour and Harvard University was one of the spot.
The history of it was not interesting at all to me, I found some of the buildings were building in the similar style.
The story of the school was quite interesting instead, for example like the pig-head gate curse and Mr. Harvard's statue's one.
I even found that hanging outside the campus was even more interesting than what we had done inside it.
Maybe I am not that kind of person who is so into how a university was from.

title: Okay, Not Awesome
text: We did a self guided tour using their Yardtour app. If you are in the area it is definitely worth a visit, but if you are short on time, you can skip it. There isn't that much to "see"-  I found Yale prettier - but you may want to go just because it is Harvard.

title: Great tour and very interesting
text:
The grounds are spectacular and the buildings steeped in history.
We decided to take the tour guided by one of the students.  Very interesting as you also caught glimpses of the school from his perspective.  
Interesting to find out also that he was lucky enough to be here on scholarship (although I don't think they call it that) but basically not at any cost to him.  Of course he must have been an exceptionally bright fellow as only  a small percentage of applicants get accepted.
Very enjoyable-glad we did it.

title: Harvard. You should visit but it is nothing that special.
text: I live in a town with an old urban university, not as old as Harvard, but old none the less.  Harvard was fun to visit and the buildings are interesting but in the end it is not hugely special. Chalk it up as something you should do when travelling to Boston but you only need 3 to 4 hours. Note that there is expensive meter parking and different blocks have different maximum times. The maximum of the maximums is 2 hours. There are garages but you can take the subway right into to Harvard Square.

title: #tourofivies
text: My wife and I were in the boston area for a RedSox game and decided to stop by Harvard and look around. It seemed like any other college town. The area was more tourist friendly than other areas and it seemed as though there were many more people doing what we were doing (looking around Harvard) than I expected. Glad we did it.

title: Great Tour
text: We decided to visit Harvard University & glad we did. We took the red line subway from our hotel. We were staying in Beacon Hill section & had a pleasant 10 min ride to the Harvard station. As you exit the train station to your right is a tour for $10 given by Harvard students. The tours start at 10:30 & run until 3:30 every half hour. Our tour guide, Francesca, was very informative, interacted with the group, and had a lot of information to share. The tour lasts about an hour & is held outside. The area around Harvard had plenty of shopping & restaurants as well.
translated_text: We decided to visit Harvard University & glad we did. We took the red line subway from our hotel. The tours start at 10:30 & run until 3:30 every half hour. Our tour guide, Francesca, was very informative, interacted with the group, and had a lot of information to share. The tour lasts about an hour & is held outside. The area around Harvard had plenty of shopping & restaurants as well.

title: It's Harvard.....
text: Took the Subway to Harvard and well what can one say.. It was Harvard.  A must see if you are in Boston simply because it is the oldest university,the alumni, and the famous people that started there and then left.. The libraries are amazing.  It is all Red as we learned that the color is Crimson in memory of the blood shed during the Revolutionary War.  We did not take a guided tour but walked the campus.  Great architecture and plenty of shops and places to eat.

title: One of those places you visit when in Boston
text: The entire place is worth the visit.  Tradition, history, atmosphere. Take a slow walk, download the apps, hear all about the yard.  Its easy to get to if you are taking the train from Boston
translated_text: The entire place is worth the visit.  Tradition, history, atmosphere. Take a slow walk, download the apps, hear all about the yard.  Its easy to get to if you are taking the train from Boston

title: horribly disappointing
text: As a university student, I could not have been more disappointed in the Harvard campus. It lacked flow, the paths seemed to randomly go in any direction, other than three buildings, the rest looked the same, a very plain red brick. Not impressed at all. As the oldest school in America I would've expected a lot more to come from the grounds. Overall, not worth the trip up to Cambridge to visit the campus, you're really not missing out on much.

As the oldest school in America I would've expected a lot more to come from the grounds. Overall, not worth the trip up to Cambridge to visit the campus, you're really not missing out on much.

title: A must on any visit to Boston
text: I loved my tour of Harvard. This is a free tour given by a student. It was an hour packed with information and insights on the history of Harvard & a sneak peak into life as a Harvard student. I loved it!
translated_text: I loved my tour of Harvard. This is a free tour given by a student. It was an hour packed with information and insights on the history of Harvard & a sneak peak into life as a Harvard student. I loved it!

title: Beautiful historic University
text:
We walked through the grounds of Harvard University when we went to brunch at the Sheraton Commander Hotel.  We were amazed at how beautiful the university grounds are.  

Some of the architecture is spectacular and the grounds are really pretty.  Having only seen the universities in Sydney and some of the regional NSW universities back home, none of the Australian campuses compare to the history of Harvard.

title: Finally saw Harvard
text: Visited friend on Broadway in Cambridge. A short walk up Broadway past exquisite old New England Victorian Colonial homes, each bigger and more unique than the last, if that is possible, to arrive at Harvard itself. FInally took the time to wander the campus with its trees and unique buildings. What a pleasure.

title: It is what it is.
text: We voted it a five because although there are many other beautiful college campuses in the world to see, well, it's Harvard. If nothing else, you should see it because it's....Harvard. Lots of places to eat and cool architecture in the area. Make sure to stop by the Natural History museum while there.

title: Great tour
text: I did the paid tour of Harvard. The place is hugee and I thought it would be better to have a guided tour. My tour guide was Samantha and she was just great!! Our group was pretty big that day but Sam was able to engage everyone and boy did she have a loud voice! Lol! No way anyone could say they could not hear what she was saying. Harvard is so full of history! A really great tour to check out! It is worth the $10 in my opinion!

title: pretentious

title: Quick relaxing stroll around the campus
text: We passed through Boston on our way to Niagara Falls and took a quick break at Harvard U. It took us quite a while to find a parking and to find the entrance to the campus. The campus was quiet and peaceful. We were there in late afternoon and the wind was very cool. It was quite a relaxing stroll around. Too bad we don't have someone who was familiar with the place to tour us around.

Too bad we don't have someone who was familiar with the place to tour us around.

title: Do not rub the foot of John Harvard statue...
text:
(5) ... because this statue is frequently peed upon for good luck. It is also not John Harvard - no one knows how he looked.

(4) do take a photo at the steps of the Widener Library. It is a memorial to Harry Widener, who perished with the Titanic in 1912. Harry has a study room inside, and a desk with  a vase replenished with fresh flowers every day. The library has 50 miles of shelves and Harvard students aim to make out among the shelves once before graduating.

(3) do visit Harvard Yard during Winter - the snowmen outside the freshmen halls range from Easter Island statue lookalikes to Picasso-esque women.

(2) do enjoy Harvard Yard on a Sunday morning - the bells of Memorial Church ring first, then near to noon, the bells of Lowell Hall chime fantastically for about an hour. In between there is quiet and beauty, birds, squirrels and rabbits.

(1) do visit on Moving- in Day (end Aug). See the freshmen from all over the US and the world move in to the freshmen halls which surround The Yard. There is a festive air. Student advisors are on hand to tell visitors all about Harvard and various groups give out Harvard memorabilia, chilled lemonade and brochures.
translated_text:
(5) ... because this statue is frequently peed upon for good luck. It is also not John Harvard - no one knows how he looked.

(4) do take a photo at the steps of the Widener Library. It is a memorial to Harry Widener, who perished with the Titanic in 1912. Harry has a study room inside, and a desk with  a vase replenished with fresh flowers every day. The library has 50 miles of shelves and Harvard students aim to make out among the shelves once before graduating.

(3) do visit Harvard Yard during Winter - the snowmen outside the freshmen halls range from Easter Island statue lookalikes to Picasso-esque women.

(2) do enjoy Harvard Yard on a Sunday morning - the bells of Memorial Church ring first, then near to noon, the bells of Lowell Hall chime fantastically for about an hour. In between there is quiet and beauty, birds, squirrels and rabbits.

(1) do visit on Moving- in Day (end Aug). See the freshmen from all over the US and the world move in to the freshmen halls which surround The Yard. There is a festive air. Student advisors are on hand to tell visitors all about Harvard and various groups give out Harvard memorabilia, chilled lemonade and brochures.

title: Worth a quick train ride to Cambridge
text: We wanted to see Cambridge and why not start at Harvard?  It was move in day for summer school, so it was fun to see all the students and their parents.  Made us realize that Harvard students aren't that different from the rest of us - all of them have that deer in headlights look the first day.  The campus was beautiful and we enjoyed looking at all the buildings.  It was easy to get to via the metro and worth an hour or so on a nice afternoon.

Made us realize that Harvard students aren't that different from the rest of us - all of them have that deer in headlights look the first day.  The campus was beautiful and we enjoyed looking at all the buildings.  It was easy to get to via the metro and worth an hour or so on a nice afternoon.

title: Nice place
text: Really it is a nice place, I have been there in the summer and it was really pleasant, there were  a lot of students in the yard, the day was really enjoyable.

title: Escorted tour of campus - Harvard university
text:
The tour guides are located in the main square in Cambridge MA and for 10# per head, small groups are given a tour of Harvard University campus.
Our guide on May 29th was Eli - a student who was knowledgeable and amusing. A visit on our own would have been very superficial so we feel the money was well spend and made an enjoyable afternoon.

The tour guides are located in the main square in Cambridge MA and for 10# per head, small groups are given a tour of Harvard University campus.
Our guide on May 29th was Eli - a student who was knowledgeable and amusing. A visit on our own would have been very superficial so we feel the money was well spend and made an enjoyable afternoon.

title: Fantastic walk
text: Loved the architecture, the shops near Harvard square, the faculty of sciences's mini-museum (a hidden gem with the original Mark I computer from the 40s) and much more. Well worth the visit and accessible by subway.

title: Harvard, an amazing place
text: Any trip to Boston is not complete without a trip across the Charles River to Harvard University. The school is historic and amazing, but the quaint area of Cambridge is a joy as well. We enjoy discovering new restaurants and sites each time we return to visit our daughter who is a student at Harvard.

title: The closest i'll ever get to Harvard
text: The university is majestic and are filled with visitors. It is easily found but the people in Harvard are not so friendly. Worth visiting though :)

title: Harvard Student tour
text: A  trip via the subway to Harvard on the Red Line is certainly worth a visit. This university dates back to 1636 . The one hour tour of the University Square and a number of other buildings is conducted by current students. Our guide was Eli who was just great, a touch of theater and 2 years experience as a student gave us an insight of the Universities history, and current life as a student. A great visit.

title: Very different from what you might expect
text: I'm not sure what I expected, but what we found on a Sunday afternoon was a cool place with laid back people content to do their own thing. From competitive chess matches you are welcome to watch to semi-homeless musicians and mac writing professor types, this is the kind of place you can wear a fedora or put flowers in your hair. Great little shops around, I suggest the dessert shop Finale, it was Wiked Pissah.

title: Beautiful College Campus
text: Clearly modelled on Oxford and Cambridge Universities in the UK, with their Quads and Courts, Harvard Yard exudes pre-eminence - which Harvard has in abundance. There are walking tours, but it is good enough just to wander around at a leisurely pace and soak it in.

title: A real disappointment
text: This place is world-famous, but why? Where is it? There's this big yard with green grass and lots of buildings and people wearing funny hats, but there's no there there, if you know what I mean. I kept asking students where Harvard University is, and they kept saying "Right here!" But I left no smarter than when I arrived.

title: All that crimson gets tiresome
text: I happened to be there on their so-called "Commencement Day" and there were all sorts of people wearing silly hats and Hogwarts-style robes. What gives? Also, speeches are dull. It's hard to believe that all those people are really that smart. Harvard must hand out diplomas like politicians hand out promises.

text: You almost forget what year it is when you stop by in the Yard. The buildings, trees and even the students seem like they've been there forever and you can easily blend in. In the summer there are chairs on the lawn that are great to rest in and watch people go by.

title: history & present meet in Harvard Yard
text: It's true that Harvard Yard -- there are two, actually, old and new yards -- are the center of a twenty first century campus. at times they are filled with the day to day doings of current students. there are times, though, especially when it's quiet, that you can feel the presence of those, recent and centuries ago, who've walked this place before you.

historical campus and you will see the great harvard university

title: Great experience

title: Food Carts & Historic Campus
text:
Try and time your trip here to include lunch at the food trucks so you can take in the activity of campus life. There were three food options when I visited, and I believe all accepted both credit cards and cash (though you don't get a receipt, so if you're there for work make sure you use the email receipt option. Campus is beautiful and there are many colorful chairs in the open yard space, if you don't want to lounge in the grass and eat lunch, which is something I highly recommend. 

I didn't take the tour, but enjoyed wondering around campus. I'm at another ivy league school, so beautiful old building's and history are something I'm used to, but it was still well worth the trip up to Cambridge!

title: You can always say you went to Harvard
text:
A trip to Greater Boston isn't really complete without visiting one of the most famous universities in the world. Particularly if you're from the western part of North America, the age of some of the  the buildings alone will keep you interested. (Harvard was founded in 1636) We wandered down the hallways of one of the older buildings, and overheard a student being examined by a panel of professors - in Latin. There are several good places on campus and nearby to grab some good souvenirs like the requisite t-shirt or hoodie. 
A tip: if you want the true student experience, schedule your visit over lunch, and eat in the freshmen's cafeteria. Online reviews of the food rate it as good/not great. These are obviously people who haven't gone to school elsewhere; by cafeteria standards it's above par. The attraction is the room itself, called the Memorial Hall, built to honor the Harvard Alumni who perished during the American Civil War in defence of the Union. It's quite the building, and the meal is reasonably priced.
