title: Classic College "Quad" But Beware the Tourists
text: At times, it seems as if the tourists crowding around John Harvard's statue and rubbing his toe (rumor has it that it is not really rubbing that has caused the toe to be shiny, but certain bodily fluids surreptitiously deposited in the dark of night) and snapping photos.  Best to walk around the permitter and soak in the history.  The Harvard walking tour app for your phone is a good companion.

title: It is world renown, for a good reason
text: It's Harvard.  Yes, folks here can be pretentious I suppose, but every single student and staff member I met seemed really genuinely happy to be here and appreciated what an amazing and historical place this really is.

title: Great for having a walk
text: Take the 50 minutes tour. If not, just walk Arround and watch all the old buildings and beautifull churches. Also have lunch at shake shack hamburgers in Harvard square.
translated_text: Take the 50 minutes tour. If not, just walk Arround and watch all the old buildings and beautifull churches. Also have lunch at shake shack hamburgers in Harvard square.

title: Students/Academics can access libraries if you come prepared
text:
Harvard is a beautiful campus to wander with its historic buildings and spacious grounds. 

As a foreign PhD students and university lecturer it is possible to gain access to the many libraries as a "visiting researcher" - I took a simple letter from my university and with my passport was able to get free 3 month access to both the standard libraries and the Special Collections from the Library Privileges Office. Even for just a 2 day visit it was great to be able to go inside and see the immense collections, as well as read some 400+ year old books that I have not been able to find copies of at home.
translated_text:

Even for just a 2 day visit it was great to be able to go inside and see the immense collections, as well as read some 400+ year old books that I have not been able to find copies of at home.

title: Harvard -- Nothing More Needs to be Said!!!
text: My wife and I visited Harvard where our son is in his second year at Harvard Law School.  The campus is historic, not only as one of the oldest universities in America, but also because of the many notable people who have attended Harvard, including President John F. Kennedy.  Harvard Square, which is the open space at the center of the university, offers a quiet place to reflect on your visit to Harvard.

title: Historic Harvard
text: People visiting the Boston area like going to visit Harvard because of Harvard, but also because of Harvard Square. Haavard is historic with lovely buildings and spacious quadrangles to walk around on a sunny day. The students are busy, but friendly. Most people do not know however, that there are several museums on the harvard campus. They cannot compete with Boston's Museum of Science and Museum of Fine Arts.  Harvard square is an always active  milieu with panhandlers, restaurants, street musicians and shops. A ride on the T can augment this visit if there is time and it is convenient.

title: Such history!
text:
We took in several museums (we especially liked the natural history museum, and the display of historic scientific instruments in the Science Center) and enjoyed walking around on our own.  

We also did an information session and tour.  The information session was in Sanders Theatre, which is a beautiful building.  The tour was led by 2 current students, and they gave us a good perspective on the House system and other aspects of the university.

title: A beautiful walk
text: Wandering around Harvard's historic campus is very relaxing...(unless you are a student stressing out because of exams, of course). There's plenty of trees and grass and at just a few minutes away from the subway stop, you find yourself wandering around a beautiful and old campus where there's hardly any noise from cars and where the vibe is completely different from anywhere else in the Boston area.

The Harvard Museums are incredible and really reasonably priced.  The Museum of Natural History really engages children as well.

text:
The admissions tour can be done through the admissions office.  The regular Harvard Tour which is free can be arranged at the Holyoke Center.  And the funny spoof but enlightening tour can be arranged from venders in Harvard Square or online.

Harvard is a place of History and interesting buildings.  You will enjoy it if those are your interests

title: Don't bother unless you are planning to apply.
text: It looks like any other university. I have lived in Cambridge for more than 50 years and attended graduate school at Harvard. Go to the Museum of Natural History, the Sackler Museum but the University itself is boring.
translated_text: It looks like any other university. I have lived in Cambridge for more than 50 years and attended graduate school at Harvard. Go to the Museum of Natural History, the Sackler Museum but the University itself is boring.

title: Not much to see
text: I didn't get a chance to visit any of the Harvard Museums but the campus itself looks like any other part of New England: brick buildings with white roof and trimmings around quaint grassy courtyards and squares. The free tour is a waste of time: you go nowhere that is not already publicly accessible and learn nothing you don't get from signs or guidebooks. It was nice to visit such a famous place and to see the John Harvard statue but it is a stop in Boston that can easily be skipped.

title: OK, I was a grad student there for 6 years and my son was just accepted!
text: I loved living at Harvard as a tutor at Lowell House and studying there in the Archaeology wing. I will agree with many others that it is the top university in the world. Just as I enjoyed visiting Cambridge University in England many years ago, I would say that anyone visiting Boston should visit Harvard. I have photographed the sights of Harvard in all seasons, but I enjoyed the snow on the elaborate wrought iron fences around the yard the most. The Head of the Charles Regatta is an opportunity for a brilliant cavalcade of color as the crews race on the Charles. A football game creates tail gating like you have never seen. I look forward to visiting my son as he starts his adventure at Harvard.

title: A must see!
text: Visiting Harvard was on my bucket-list. They have a visitors center that offers tours every hour on the hour. That was perfect! Our student tour guide was very knowledgeable and took us all across the campus. We learned quite a bit of history and information about the school and the community. Being from the south, Ivy League schools appear so distant and unobtainable, but the feel of the environment made you feel that anything is possible with hard work. I'd definitely recommend the tour and recommend walking around Harvard Square. They have tons of shops and restaurants to visit. The T rail stops right at the front gate too. Also visit the student-ran book store too. They have way cheaper prices that others.

title: Really?  Why Bother?
text:
Maybe it's because I've lived near Harvard for 25 years.  Maybe it's because the institution has been coasting on its reputation for a century.  Maybe it's because I read one story after another in the local papers about its attempts to manipulate the community.  But there's not that much to see here.  Harvard's grounds are not that attractive -- not nearly so as any of a hundred campuses across the country.  One can listen to the stories of past notables.  Or one can consider the embarrassments of the current institution -- the B-School which helped drag down the economy, the Ed-School which has mucked up the system of public education in this country. 

Want to go for a place for a nice walk?  Try the Fresh Pond Reservoir, the Minuteman Bike Trial, the Charles River trails, or the Mt. Auburn Cemetery.  Wander around a bit at Harvard if you want to see some stodgy, rather unattractive buildings, but god help you if you spend money for a tour. Does Harvard need $10 to promote its mythology when it has a $30 billion endowment?  I think not.
translated_text:
Maybe it's because I've lived near Harvard for 25 years.  Maybe it's because the institution has been coasting on its reputation for a century.  Maybe it's because I read one story after another in the local papers about its attempts to manipulate the community.  But there's not that much to see here.  Harvard's grounds are not that attractive -- not nearly so as any of a hundred campuses across the country.  One can listen to the stories of past notables.  Or one can consider the embarrassments of the current institution -- the B-School which helped drag down the economy, the Ed-School which has mucked up the system of public education in this country. 

Want to go for a place for a nice walk?  Try the Fresh Pond Reservoir, the Minuteman Bike Trial, the Charles River trails, or the Mt. Auburn Cemetery.  Wander around a bit at Harvard if you want to see some stodgy, rather unattractive buildings, but god help you if you spend money for a tour. Does Harvard need $10 to promote its mythology when it has a $30 billion endowment?  I think not.

title: the US version of Oxford
text: the setting by Charles River helps, as did the sunshine today, but the money clearly lavished on restoring tower tops pays off as the scenery as one drives around the University is attractive. Liked Mr Harvard and his gold shoe which duly touched.

title: Great walking tour of Harvard
text:
We completed a terrific tour of Harvard University.  Hannah a student at the uni was our tour guide and explained the history of the place and answered all questions with great expansion.  Some fantastic historical buildings throughout the grounds.  Good to see where 'Facebook' was created!!  If you do the Boston Duck tour, there is no additional fee for the tour.
Easy to get to via the subway and worth the trip if you have some time to spare in Boston.

title: Hahvahd Tour
text:
We shunned the free tour and opted for the Hahvahd Tour run by students - cost $10 per person and worth it too! Our tour guide Pryanka was excellent. She had a great insight into the history of the University and mixed fact with myth in a very entertaining way.

The free map provided with the tour points you into the excellent delights the surrounding streets have to offer. We happily spent a whole day in the area.

title: Every student shall see it
text: Harvard is not only one of the oldest but also the best university in the world, so every student shall see it if they visit Cambridge. The Harvard Yard represents the historic and traditional side of Harvard, while the campus behind is the center of knowledge and research. Many libraries with different names and functions are located in the yard and the campus, so if you have time, you should pay a visit there. Labs and museums are also impressive

title: Get your photo rubbing John Harvard's shoe

So don't feel like you won't fit in because you're not a college student, you'll be right at home in the yard. 

I think tours leave hourly from the Holyoke Center, you can always just join one going on while you're walking by!

title: It is Harvard...
text: America's oldest and arguably most famous university located just outside Boston Massachusetts has a cozy campus with a rich history.  The area is nice and quiet, but one would expect more from the campus.  Other campuses have more to offer visitors and I would imagine students and faculty.  I am a big fan of architecture and unique buildings, but there was not much to offer.  Maybe the university is steep in the tradition and history and keep true to that identity which I can appreciate.  I am sure if I spent more time in the area I would find the appeal, but first impressions leave with the overrated label.

title: I went to Harvard..
text:
Yes I went to Harvard for a visit!!  A walk through the Harvard Yard it well worth doing - we went in late October so the autumn colours added to the sense grandeur of this institution and the grounds.  Students were also on campus as it was term time and there was a sense of things happening when classes finished and students came out of the buildings and moved about the grounds to their next class.  If you have time visit the Memorial Church and stand in front of Widener Library & take in the enormity of this building and of course don't forget to touch the foot on the John Harvard Statue.
There is a walking tour which is conducted by students and is called Hahvahd Tour - it starts from just outside the Harvard T stop - if I had know about this before arriving I would have connected with this tour as it looked like it was fun and informative the couple of times I crossed paths with the tour group on my walk through the campus.  There is a small cost if you join a tour, but just walking through the campus grounds is free.

title: Visit the Yard
text: A slow walk through Harvard Yard may give you a sense of the quiet, peaceful, intensity of this college.  A visit in the autumn is probably best -- students walking to and from classes, and colored leaves on the many trees.  Rub the toe of John Harvard's boot for luck.  If you have time, arrange before your visit for a tour, guided by one of the current students -- they're knowledgeable, and funny.

If you have time, arrange before your visit for a tour, guided by one of the current students -- they're knowledgeable, and funny.

title: Get the App!
text:
You need to download the app available via Itunes or Harvard's website.
If you are using Android, download the Boston city guide from Tripadvisor and you will find the Harvard Yard Tour and its great!
Free Wifi available on campus, makes your visit so much more enjoyable and interactive with all the Historic infomation you can find on the App.
Best way to get there is with the T red line, you get off right at Harvard Square. Walking along surrounding streets is also great, nice neighborhood and safe.

title: the yard gives people inspiration, the museum of glass flowers is worthwhile to see
text: I like the colorful chairs in the yard, which can inspired people, but there are not many beautiful building, there is a student canteen which is gorgeous, but it only allows student to enter. As I have a friend who works in Harvard, so I can visit the museum for free, it normally seems costs $12 (you may double check it for sure), but the glass flowers exhibition is really worthwhile to see, the plants were made with glass, but they are so real that you may be unable to tell the difference from the real one just by seeing with eyes.

We visited one of the original yards, & saw the Statue of the Three Lies, saw some of the older buildings and library.  But the campus is massive...as a Fringe junkie it would have been nice to see the portion they used for filming, but we were part of a larger tour & that wasn't on the agenda. :)

title: Harvard University
text: If you plan on visiting Cambridge, don't skip going to Harvard Yard or taking the tour of the campus.  This tour is well worth it.  I had family visit from overseas and this was a staple they wanted to see.  Everyone around the world knows about Harvard University.  The campus is lovely and well worth it.

I had family visit from overseas and this was a staple they wanted to see.  Everyone around the world knows about Harvard University.  The campus is lovely and well worth it.

title: Harvard University
text: If ever there was a brand name in colleges, Harvard is it. The campus is well worth the visit from "Harvard Yard" where the freshmen are housed, to Widener Library, named after a victim of the Titanic, to Memorial Hall, the monument to Harvard men who died (on the Northern side) of the Civil War. The campus stretches along the Charles River with the beautiful Business School across from the Cambridge side. The Fogg Art Museum is closed right now, under renovation but the Peabody Museum of Natural History is open and filled with interesting things. The famous Glass Flowers are found there. Buildings by IM Pei and LeCorbusier can be found as well as those from early architects such as Henry Hobson Richardson. After the visit, wander the stores of Harvard Square and have lunch in one of the many restaurants.
translated_text: If ever there was a brand name in colleges, Harvard is it. The campus is well worth the visit from "Harvard Yard" where the freshmen are housed, to Widener Library, named after a victim of the Titanic, to Memorial Hall, the monument to Harvard men who died (on the Northern side) of the Civil War. The campus stretches along the Charles River with the beautiful Business School across from the Cambridge side. The Fogg Art Museum is closed right now, under renovation but the Peabody Museum of Natural History is open and filled with interesting things. The famous Glass Flowers are found there. Buildings by IM Pei and LeCorbusier can be found as well as those from early architects such as Henry Hobson Richardson. After the visit, wander the stores of Harvard Square and have lunch in one of the many restaurants.

title: Harvard visit and Yard
text: Since visitors cannot enter Harvard buildings, the best way to taste the spirit of this great university is to visit the yard, its surroundings and Harvard Square.

title: Harvard yard --so lovely..
text:
if you plan to visit Cambridge, don't miss the Harvard Yard. Just to see young people walking around the paths, through beautiful trees and lawns to get to classes and the monumental Widener Library, is exhilarating.  Very easy to reach on the T (public transport.) Guided tours will tell you that the much visited statue of John harvard has nothing to do with the man ! it's charming all the same.
One can combine this visit with another at MIT, or with having a meal around Harvard Square. So time of visit can vary from one to four hours.

title: It is Harvard

The architecture and the history is quite apparent. It is a must see. I would recommend anytime before October because therevis always something going on which can really enhance your visit. However you cannot you will still enjoy it.

title: Think smart, look smart
text: Harvard is a large institution with lots to see. Architecture (old and new), outdoor spaces (Harvard yard, Radcliffe yard, area around the law school, etc., the Harvard coop store,  and some fun museums. title: SO MUCH  HISTORY IN  ONE  PLACE
text: But  You  really  cannot  "pahk your  cah in Hahvard Yahd"  It is  a  quadrangle of  residence  halls.  Great  for  walking   and  for  walking  your  bike  through.  The  John  Harvard  Statue is  a  popular  photo  op.

title: Must see on a visit to Boston and Cambridge
text:
If you go to Boston, you must go to Harvard University.  It is easily accessible by train, but we were driving and had no difficulties getting a park nearby.  I had been before with a tour, so this time we just wandered, and really enjoyed the experience.  Do some reading beforehand about John Harvard, the library which burnt down and the candle story, the massive library just to name a few, and you will appreciate it so much more.  

Full of history and amazing achievement, it is worth a visit for a few hours, and you can finish with a stop at the COOP where you can buy great memorabilia, and a reasonably priced coffee and sandwich at the cafe upstairs, as there isn't much choice in the food department downstairs on the Square.

title: Worth a visit
text: We were looking for a grand entrance to Harvard.  But we found only a small gate leading to the university.  It was a sunny fall day which made it very pleasant to visit the campus.  The Statue of John Harvard was a popular site for photography.  A mixture of old and new architectures in the campus.  Heard so much about it and well worth a visit while touring Boston.

title: Nice fall visit
text: Cool brisk weather, fall leaves makes strolling through Harvard a great afternoon activity. It sprawls along a fairly big area. Some students offer a tour and it is a nice option.

title: Harvard Tour- Overall Disappointing
text:
We set out to compare both the Yale and Harvard campus tours within a couple days time. There are a few options for tours of Harvard but we elected the official tour provided by current students. This was apples to apples to the Yale tour we took. 

We were expecting much more from the Harvard tour. Unfortunately, it was rather boring as compared to the Yale tour. Perhaps it was the guide, but there were few fun, interesting historical stories. The tour was so dry, I think we would have had a better experience just roaming on our own. 

Harvard Yard is pretty with nice grassy areas and trees. It had colorful chairs in the center of the grass where students can hang out. There are a lot of historical buildings but the architecture isn't nearly as interesting as that of Yale. It was all just a little disappointing but we are glad we did it. Honestly, the campus is nothing special compared to many other campuses we have attended or explored. 

If we were students comparing the schools and taking the tours, we'd pick Yale hands down. 

Another note, there are no parking lots in the area. You have to use metered parking which is a max of 2 hours and accepts only quarters. If you plan on touring around, you will need to have quarters handy and be ready to make your way back to the meter a few times to add time.

title: Impressive
text: My girlfriend and I went on a self guided tour of Harvard University at around 10:00 p.m. on Thursday evening, October 3, 2013.  Fortunately, it was not raining.  I must say that it took a while to find parking at Harvard Square, even at this time of night.  In any case, we walked the campus for about an hour and could have easily got lost.  This university is spread out like a small city.  Of course, the buildings here have such architectural beauty.  What surprised me is that the students I spoke with for directions were all so polite.  One even went out of his way to let us into the Harvard Law School library using his student key card.  Apparently this library is open all the time  during school hours.  It was a pleasure to see one of America's finest universities firsthand.

Apparently this library is open all the time  during school hours.  It was a pleasure to see one of America's finest universities firsthand.

title: I truly enjoyed the Campus
text: I had the opportunity to visit Harvard during a business travel and I was echanted by the autumn colors of the Harvard Yard. I went on Saturday from Boston, it's well connected via train and next to the Station. The Campus is open to visitors in the common areas and I could visit the church and some open classrooms. Everywhere an incredible quiet and a sense of respect.

Everywhere an incredible quiet and a sense of respect.

title: What is great about America
text:
Just walking on the campus made us feel smarter, and proud.
Harvard University is how I always imagined- structured. Intellectual, momentous. It truly made me realize how wonderful our educational system could and should be.
The campus was buzzing with young, enthusiastic minds, the structures were statuesque, and the grounds beautiful.
The day we went it was cold and breezy. The leaves we're kicking around, which made the experience that much more surreal.

title: Institute of Higher learning
text: Harvard is very prestigious, both educationally and historically.  It offers opportunities in all professional fields to those who are willing to study hard and apply their skills in and out of this university.  I enjoyed the varied living and adaptive centers for all levels whether family or single.  Harvard offers many benefits for those who achieve a doctorates in their specified fields.

title: Great but missed the tour
text: If you are in the area be sure to catch a tour of the university. We were there on a Sunday and didn't get a tour of the campus and were disappointed. Take the train as parking is horrible and you won't be able to see anything from the car. Lessons learned from our trip!

title: Excelent visit
text:
I highly recommend while visiting Boston to go see Harvard University. 
As you get off the subway you will see some students from HU are there to offer a free guide while telling some of their personal experiences. This is great. 
You can walk all around the campus and the outsides which are also beautiful. There is a little centre where you can have something to eat or buy Harvard merchandising products.
When you visit is finished i suggest you walk south by the river side right to the Boston University which is also very big and beautiful. The walk by the riverside is beautiful. !!

title: A nice respite from traffic
text: Cut off from the noise of the street, the Harvard Yard allowed us to walk diagonally through campus and view the students assembled in brightly colored chairs engaging in conversation or reading.
translated_text: Cut off from the noise of the street, the Harvard Yard allowed us to walk diagonally through campus and view the students assembled in brightly colored chairs engaging in conversation or reading.

title: A nice stroll through Harvard Yard
text: On our way from the Red Line station we strolled through Harvard yard where many colored chairs were available for group sessions.  We went on to visit the Semitic and the Peabody museums as well as the museum of National History.
translated_text: On our way from the Red Line station we strolled through Harvard yard where many colored chairs were available for group sessions.  We went on to visit the Semitic and the Peabody museums as well as the museum of National History.

title: Hovering Harvard
text: We visited Boston via a cruise ship in mid-September and decided to take time to visit Harvard by the taking the T (metro) there.  The trip on the T was entertaining and an interest grabber for first timers in Boston - very easy to access and find your way about - also a lot less costly than taking a cruise ship excursion.  We loved walking through the grounds and while we didn't have time to take a guided tour we picked up on enough of the history to appreciate the surroundings.  The historic buildings emit an atmosphere of devotion to education and learning amid abounding stories of notable Americans.  We saw evidence of the Kennedys attendance here and a bit of nostalgia surrounding the era of the Kennedy family.  A stroll through the town-like streets was picturesque and low-key but enjoyable.  We visited the student run book store and bought a Harvard baseball hat for a relative - great little store.  Harvard is not a show-stopper but it is worthy of a visit just to say you've been there.

title: HAHVAHD
text: We went to get a T-shirt and it should have read, "My dad went to Harvard and all he got me was this crappy T-shirt." Yes, there are plenty of souvenir shops and tourists, but the tour provides an informative historical perspective. Easy access from Boston by cab or transit. Food and souvenirs are reasonably priced (you get a discount if you've taken the tour). Let's face it, most schools look like glorified prisons, but that doesn't mean you can't visit and have a good time.

title: Harvard Business School, best there is
text: We were there for a 45th reunion , very well attended, great campus, great lectures, great people! One of the best Bussiness Schools of this planet.
translated_text: We were there for a 45th reunion , very well attended, great campus, great lectures, great people! One of the best Bussiness Schools of this planet.

title: Interesting with a great student-led tour
text:
Took a $10 student-led tour of the Harvard yard and a couple of the neighbouring streets. Our (student) guide, Brie ("like the cheese") was anything but shy and probably born to do these kinds of tours; for more than an hour, she - despite a sour throat - constantly talked, explained, shared anecdotes and entertained our group. She had no written script and certainly wouldn't have needed one. She encouraged us to ask questions and did - as far as I can tell - a great job of answering them. All in all, this added a lot to our experience of Harvard and its history.

The Harvard yard itself (open and free of charge to visit) is rather impressing, with old buildings where lots of old presidents and other famous business people and celebrities have waked the corridors. Having been to Cambridge (England) and stayed in a college dorm room there for a short while, I was maybe not as hugely impressed with the Harvard campus as I otherwise would have been, yet it is indeed a place where it's well worth spending a few hours.

title: beautiful
text:
The campus is very beautiful. A lot of visitors. Widener Library is a must to visit, and it will be funny if you did some homework on the stories (some are fake) of this library. Drawback is the library is not open to public.

The Harvard statue is a statue of three lies. The inscriptions in the statue are all "fake". Do check this before visiting!

There are some restaurant outside the campus on Mass Ave. Chinese, italian, so on. The Harvard Coop store might be interesting to people who would like to take something about Harvard back home. Although they items are mostly overpriced, with a Harvard logo.

Harvard Museum of Natural History is my favorite site in the campus. There is an admission fee around $12 ($10 for students). It will take a whole day to take a through tour of it.

title: Incredible and Beautiful
text: We wandered around in awe as our daughter showed us her stomping grounds.  Simply said, this campus is astoundingly beautiful.  Leave yourself lots of time to explore the campus, it is huge.  And definitely take the student run tour.  They have a wealth of information at their fingertips.  Walk back in history as you learn how the school was started, and how Cambridge grew around this incredible institute of higher learning.  You won't be sorry you took the time to visit this incredible institution of higher learning.  If you have the opportunity, sit in on a class.  I feel like I learned more in one class at The Kennedy School than I did in four years of undergraduate work elsewhere.

title: underwhelmed
text: Im not sure what I was expecting.  Its overrun with tourists, we made a comment about feeling bad for the students.  The campus is average and the surrounding town was common.  Im glad we went and getting there on the T was easy but all in all there isn't much too it.  I wouldn't see the need to go back the next time Im in Boston

title: Great student-led tour
text: If you're interested and have the time, I highly recommend taking the student-led tour of Harvard Square.  These students have memorized a ton of history about the college and devote some of their personal time to share it with you.  Also, be sure to take advantage of the walking time with the student if you have kids interested in attending - they can provide good insight into what it's really like...but don't forget to tip them if you enjoyed it - they are college students after all...
translated_text: If you're interested and have the time, I highly recommend taking the student-led tour of Harvard Square. Also, be sure to take advantage of the walking time with the student if you have kids interested in attending - they can provide good insight into what it's really like...but don't forget to tip them if you enjoyed it - they are college students after all...

title: Slightly underwhelmed
text: I was very much looking forward to this visit having studied at Cambridge University, UK and spent a considerable amount of time at Oxford also I was expecting similar visual splendour. Although the buildings were very impressive I disappointingly I felt a little underwhelmed particularly the grounds appeared somewhat tired. Perhaps a reflection of a true working University maybe? Nevertheless, a pleasure to wander around one of the premier institutes of academia in the world.

Although the buildings were very impressive I disappointingly I felt a little underwhelmed particularly the grounds appeared somewhat tired. Perhaps a reflection of a true working University maybe? Nevertheless, a pleasure to wander around one of the premier institutes of academia in the world.

title: Great time
text: Had a great time touring the grounds. Be sure to cross the river and check out the business school and stadium. We were lucky enough to catch the rowing team as well.
translated_text: Had a great time touring the grounds. Be sure to cross the river and check out the business school and stadium. We were lucky enough to catch the rowing team as well.

title: A Must Do
text: If you are in the area, don't pass this up.  Wonderful history, beautiful buildings, enchanting students.
translated_text: If you are in the area, don't pass this up.  Wonderful history, beautiful buildings, enchanting students.

title: A great experience
text: Waking in this Historic place makes you enjoy your own college experience once more.  You will wish you were young again and able to be a part of this experience
translated_text: Waking in this Historic place makes you enjoy your own college experience once more.  You will wish you were young again and able to be a part of this experience

title: Over scripted with very little real life information - Student Harver tour
text:
We did the student Havard tour while visiting Cambridge. It was $10 per person for a 1 hour guided tour through a small part of Harvard university as the university is very spread out.
Our guide was a student of Harvard. It was overall a disappointing tour. The guide stuck to her script (even closed her eyes when reciting it back to us) and the humour was really poor and much too scripted. The guide also was required to walk backwards which was very disconcerting and I felt that I had to watch out for her in case she would walk into something/someone.
We didn't actually get much of an insight into student harvard life nor were we told a lot about some of the more famous people who would have passed through the university.
I think the organisers of this tour should do a little bit of investigation into how other historical universities carry out their tours. My husband was on the Trinity College tour in Dublin a couple of weeks later and even though it was only 30 mins long he thought it was far superiour to the Harvard Tour and the guide was excellent.

title: Wish I was studying here!
text: Walk around the campus, through the squares and between the beautiful buildings - just a shame you can't go inside!
translated_text: Walk around the campus, through the squares and between the beautiful buildings - just a shame you can't go inside!

title: Great Campus
text: If only all uni campuses were like this! Great place to visit and the guided tours are very good. Lovely setting in quaint Cambridge in autumn/fall.
translated_text: If only all uni campuses were like this! Great place to visit and the guided tours are very good. Lovely setting in quaint Cambridge in autumn/fall.

title: Must visit
text: Great university, great campus, great overall feel and the area that Harvard is at is worth spending a whole day. Go inside the chapel and make sure you speak to the university police they have the best tips about the place and nice secrets and stories to share. DO NOT touch the foot of Harvard, the statue....ask the police why

Go inside the chapel and make sure you speak to the university police they have the best tips about the place and nice secrets and stories to share. DO NOT touch the foot of Harvard, the statue....ask the police why

title: Simply the Best!
text: I had the best educational and social experience when I studied at Harvard. I was challenged and inspired whilst getting the best possible education and instruction. This is simply the best university in the world, and I am humbled to have studied there.
translated_text: I had the best educational and social experience when I studied at Harvard. I was challenged and inspired whilst getting the best possible education and instruction. This is simply the best university in the world, and I am humbled to have studied there.

title: Feel a Historic Academe
text: We were able to go around this famous institution, and it gives a nostalgic feeling.  Parking around the university was a nightmare, however.   We were able to find a paid public parking, but the spaces were so small, that I wished that my car had a door in the back, like a SUV, so I can crawl out.  I am a very slender person, and I cannot hardly come out of the driver's seat. Likewise, pedestrians do not follow traffic lights and just cross the streets without looking.

I am a very slender person, and I cannot hardly come out of the driver's seat. Likewise, pedestrians do not follow traffic lights and just cross the streets without looking.

title: Mediocre Campus
text: I have been to many college campuses and this one did not impress me.  We walked through the main quad area which was okay but nothing better than any other major university.  The buildings were classic and interesting but again, nothing that stands out from other similar institutions I have visited.  Harvard Square was pretty exciting and made the bike ride out there worth it but not by a lot.

The buildings were classic and interesting but again, nothing that stands out from other similar institutions I have visited.  Harvard Square was pretty exciting and made the bike ride out there worth it but not by a lot.

title: Nice tour
text: We liked touring the #1 Award Winning University in the World.  It took us about an hour and 20 minutes to tour the buildings on the outside.  You are not really allowed to go inside any of the buildings.
translated_text: We liked touring the #1 Award Winning University in the World.  It took us about an hour and 20 minutes to tour the buildings on the outside.  You are not really allowed to go inside any of the buildings.

title: Tours
text:
Make sure you take the student tour as it is one of the better ones.
The students tell you how it really is and give you incite you would not necessarily get. Walk the campus as it is drop dead gorgeous.
translated_text:
Make sure you take the student tour as it is one of the better ones.
The students tell you how it really is and give you incite you would not necessarily get. Walk the campus as it is drop dead gorgeous.

title: Harvard Yard - great experience!
text:
We took the Hahvahd tour during the day to explore the Harvard Yard and vicinity! Worth it every minute!
At night, we bought pizza at Otto's pizza and sat at the yard. The lawn chairs were inviting me and my family to enjoy a beautiful night under the starts and quietness of the yard. 
A magic moment as family where we felt isolated from the business of the streets outside of the yard and just relax!

title: Beautiful campus
text: A beautiful and lively campus. Be prepared to wait in line if you want to take a picture with Harvard's statue. Wish we had spent more time here to learn about the buildings - would definitely return to see more!
translated_text: A beautiful and lively campus. Be prepared to wait in line if you want to take a picture with Harvard's statue. Wish we had spent more time here to learn about the buildings - would definitely return to see more!

title: Beautiful Campus
text: An inviting studying environment with the most impressive bookstore that we have seen on campuses around the world.
translated_text: An inviting studying environment with the most impressive bookstore that we have seen on campuses around the world.

title: Not Special
text: There's nothing particularly remarkable about Harvard Yard compared to any other college campus. It has grass, buildings, and statues. There honestly isn't much else to say about it. The grounds seem to be well-maintained, and there were plenty of places to sit either by yourself or with a group and enjoy an ice cream or good book.
translated_text: There's nothing particularly remarkable about Harvard Yard compared to any other college campus. It has grass, buildings, and statues. There honestly isn't much else to say about it. The grounds seem to be well-maintained, and there were plenty of places to sit either by yourself or with a group and enjoy an ice cream or good book.

title: So educational!
text: The student I had gave an excellent tour, I wish I could remember her name now... But she was very educated, explained a lot. I recommend doing the walking tour because you don't learn anything walking through the campus on your own.
translated_text: The student I had gave an excellent tour, I wish I could remember her name now... But she was very educated, explained a lot. I recommend doing the walking tour because you don't learn anything walking through the campus on your own.

title: Fun and informative Cambridge Historical Tour
text: The hour went too quickly. Walked through the Harvard campus with a costumed guide from Cambridge Historical Tours.  "Henrietta" had been an astronomer at Harvard (true story) in the late 1800's.  Started the tour at Harvard Square information booth across from the Coop.  Great stories about campus pranks e.g. Crimson vs. Lampoon.  Interesting info about John Harvard, Widener Library, some of the Harvard Yard Gates for example.   It was the highlight of our trip to Cambridge.

Great stories about campus pranks e.g. Crimson vs. Lampoon.  Interesting info about John Harvard, Widener Library, some of the Harvard Yard Gates for example.   It was the highlight of our trip to Cambridge.

title: Place to visit in Cambridge
text: A totally new feeling compared to busy Boston. Nice place to hangout, have some good food and spend time enjoying history at Harvard.
translated_text: A totally new feeling compared to busy Boston. Nice place to hangout, have some good food and spend time enjoying history at Harvard.

title: Student walking tour
text: We bought the student walking tour. Justin, our guide was very nice and funny. He gave us lots of inside information. My college daughter loved it but my youngest daughter wasn't has excited. It would be nice if the tour included a visit of one residence or the librairy.
translated_text: We bought the student walking tour. Justin, our guide was very nice and funny. He gave us lots of inside information. My college daughter loved it but my youngest daughter wasn't has excited. It would be nice if the tour included a visit of one residence or the librairy.

title: Busy area, despite the school break
text:
As part of our Harvard tour, the yard was a major part! Again this seems to be the central area for students as all the dorms are all around including the huge library. Depsite the fact that this was summer break, it was still fairly busy. There were several other tours coming and going, 
I can only begin to imagine how crowded this would be when school is in full swing.
translated_text:
As part of our Harvard tour, the yard was a major part! Again this seems to be the central area for students as all the dorms are all around including the huge library. Depsite the fact that this was summer break, it was still fairly busy. There were several other tours coming and going, 
I can only begin to imagine how crowded this would be when school is in full swing.

title: Walking in Footsteps
text: Recently toured a small portion of Harvard. It wasn't until I looked at the map of Harvard that I realized how large this campus is and how it has expanded over the years. The history, alone is enough to justify a quick viewing. Our tour guide gave us a brief history about how the dormitory's are named, including the naming of the Library. The "3 Lies" of the statue of John Harvard. I would suggest getting a tour from someone. Just wandering around, is only part of the story, without an informed guide to tell you all the little things, you will miss out!

Just wandering around, is only part of the story, without an informed guide to tell you all the little things, you will miss out!

title: Loafing around here can't be beat
text: This is one of my favorite things to do: sit in Harvard Yard and surf the internet (free internet wifi) or just watch the people go by. Sometimes I catch a tour and listen. The speakers can be really funny.
translated_text: This is one of my favorite things to do: sit in Harvard Yard and surf the internet (free internet wifi) or just watch the people go by. Sometimes I catch a tour and listen. The speakers can be really funny.

title: Such a nice please to visit
text: The buildings, the lawns, the atmosphere, the history...a perfect package, certainly recommendable. Worth every minute we spent there.
translated_text: The buildings, the lawns, the atmosphere, the history...a perfect package, certainly recommendable. Worth every minute we spent there.

title: Played on the field!
text: We showed up and walked around the campus and then the softball team practicing let us come onto the football field! Awesome experience!
translated_text: We showed up and walked around the campus and then the softball team practicing let us come onto the football field! Awesome experience!

title: Amazing campus and history.
text: Loved all the history and wish the library had been open. Also loved the local area..Harvard square. Great brunch places! Make sure to walk across the river to see the Harvard Business School and buy your attire from one of the student managed stores! Just ask. Wonderful area. Easy T Line access.
translated_text: Loved all the history and wish the library had been open. Also loved the local area..Harvard square. Great brunch places! Make sure to walk across the river to see the Harvard Business School and buy your attire from one of the student managed stores! Just ask. Wonderful area. Easy T Line access.

title: A Must Visit
text:
Harvard may be an almost untouchable university for most people as far as acceptances go, but who says you can't enjoy the gorgeous campus of the first university in the United States. 

We enjoyed an entire evening chilling and strolling around the oldest part of the university. You can sit around on the chairs, or have picnics on the lawn. 

My kids ran around and enjoyed some of the artifacts and statues that are placed all over the place. 

I'm a big fan of visiting Universities, and this one has been one of my favorite ones so far. And maybe the scholarly atmosphere rubbed off on my kids too.

I'm a big fan of visiting Universities, and this one has been one of my favorite ones so far. And maybe the scholarly atmosphere rubbed off on my kids too.

title: What a place.
text: The moment you enter the Yard, you feel the history of the place. So many students have walked in this Yard the past century, and still do. Despite the tourists it remains a unique, calm place to visit and admire.
translated_text: The moment you enter the Yard, you feel the history of the place. So many students have walked in this Yard the past century, and still do. Despite the tourists it remains a unique, calm place to visit and admire.

title: Student tour was great
text: We got a great tour from a Harvard student for only $10.  They are standing around at the train station exit with maps to give away for free even if you don't want to do the tour.  We had only a short time there so it was great to hear the history of Harvard with all the funny insider information that you aren't going to get by wandering around.  There are no buildings open to the public, so it is an outdoor tour, but still well worth it in my opinion.  I don't blame them for keeping their buildings closed to the public.  Make sure you hear the Conan O'Brien story!
translated_text: We got a great tour from a Harvard student for only $10.  They are standing around at the train station exit with maps to give away for free even if you don't want to do the tour.  We had only a short time there so it was great to hear the history of Harvard with all the funny insider information that you aren't going to get by wandering around.  There are no buildings open to the public, so it is an outdoor tour, but still well worth it in my opinion.  I don't blame them for keeping their buildings closed to the public.  Make sure you hear the Conan O'Brien story!

title: Beautiful campus
text: After visiting the campus, I had to research WHY everyone wanted to touch the left foot of the John Harvard statue.  It was what I expected...just for luck!  I also discovered online that the statue was created by the same man that did the Lincoln memorial in Washington, DC.  And that the statue has 3 lies... Cool history to discover!

I also discovered online that the statue was created by the same man that did the Lincoln memorial in Washington, DC.  And that the statue has 3 lies... Cool history to discover!

title: Lovely setting
text: Took a stroll round the pleasant yard, sat in the gardens a nice respite from the busy Harvard Square area. Lots of places to explore many of which seem to be open to the public.
translated_text: Took a stroll round the pleasant yard, sat in the gardens a nice respite from the busy Harvard Square area. Lots of places to explore many of which seem to be open to the public.

title: Interesting.....
text: Great to see somewhere like this. Not what I expected. Kind of scattered all around town. Lines of people getting their picture taken with the John Harvard statue on the main campus.
translated_text: Great to see somewhere like this. Not what I expected. Kind of scattered all around town. Lines of people getting their picture taken with the John Harvard statue on the main campus.

title: Interesting if you're a Harvard alum
text: This was the first stop on a tour that took us to Lexington and Concord. Saying this will probably seem like a heinous crime to Harvard alums, but I think you really have to be one of them to get truly excited about this. But it does embody some history, so perhaps a peek at it is called for.

But it does embody some history, so perhaps a peek at it is called for.

title: A great place to visit!
text: We visited harvard during the university holidays so there was a lot of tourists. It would have been better to go on a weekday or during univeraity times to see the students and experience the grounds at a less busy time. Incredible infastructure and grounds. Perfect on a sunny day. Taking a tour is definitely worthwhile to ensure you see everything and learn about the history. We took the 'free tours by foot' company where you decide the price of the tour. It was two houra long and very informative of both harvard and the surroundinf areas!

We took the 'free tours by foot' company where you decide the price of the tour. It was two houra long and very informative of both harvard and the surroundinf areas!

title: Beautiful!
text:
This place has to be seen. I wish I would stay longer because Harvard has beautiful grounds, very old churches.

This is a must when you visit Boston for the first time, lots of history there.

Will return sometime!
translated_text:
This place has to be seen. I wish I would stay longer because Harvard has beautiful grounds, very old churches.

title: Save your time for something better
text:
As I am an academician, universities are always in my to do list. I was very excited about my Boston trip because I would be able to see Harvard, MIT and Boston University. Unfortunately, I spared two hours of my short trip to Harvard University and If I knew I could not enter any of the buildings (not even the library) I would not come to Harvard. 
If you want to see some old buildings, just walk through Boston downtown. It does not worth the long T trip. All buildings were locked, art museum was closed until Fall 2014, the library did not issue me a day pass because i did not bring a letter from my advisor (I am a PhD student and this is the most ridiculous practice I have ever seen. All researchers are welcome in my university's library, and I could enter all libraries across the country with my university ID but Harvard is an exception). 
Do you want to learn the history of the university? Read it. Buildings do not have informative signs, even the campus maps are rare.

title: Student tour
text: This was really enjoyable and a fun way to learn more about Harvard. Tours were picked up at the entrance to the T and the man at the desk was able to suggest a number of options, including tour guides in full dress. We only had an hour so didn't finish the tour - but was still good value at $10

title: Save some $- Take the free student tour!
text: As soon as you get off the subway in Cambridge hawkers approach you to take a $10 tour of Harvard University.  Take a few more steps to the Information Centre, where students offer free tours of the campus.  The history of the school is very interesting and the walk around the campus is lovely.  Students do a great job.  If you are in Cambridge, take an hour to take the tour.

Students do a great job.  If you are in Cambridge, take an hour to take the tour.

title: Steeped in history
text: The entire experience of this university city is great. Whether strolling through the campus, being helped by the campus police, (most helpful guy). Lunching at The Charles in the courtyard .... Most delicious cranberry and nut bread.  All in striking of the main campus.  Of course one must rub the toe of John Harvard's statue.

title: Informative tour of Harvard Uninversity
text: This walking tour is free, sponsored by Harvard U, gives you a history of the place and points out the famous buildings on campus.
translated_text: This walking tour is free, sponsored by Harvard U, gives you a history of the place and points out the famous buildings on campus.

title: A must-see
text: Harvard University is the main attraction in Cambridge, and there is much more than John Harvard's statue and Harvard Yard: The stadium by Charles river, Charles river itself, Annenberg hall (which unfortunately tourists can't enter) and The Coop. Science Center, JFK school of Government and the Law School are also very beautiful.

title: A must see
text: Whether you take an organized (by students) tour or not, you'll certainly enjoy walks through the old buildings and yards, where the history really breathes on you all the time...

title: Probably better if you were going there
text: Harvard is clearly a must see when you are in the city.  There are tours given by students that are fun or you can do it alone.  The buildings are beautiful and the history of the university is pretty overwhelming.  Better to do it in the summer when there are fewer people.  Its not the quintessential campus as it is in the city.  Still, its pretty.

title: Absolutely  Beautiful
text: The campus is absolutely amazing!  It's much larger than one might think and there is so much history there.

title: A nice history and education tour
text: We follow the suggested itinerary from TripAdvisor to have a self-guided tour, it took us about 1.5 hrs. Several seating area around the campus, good for our tired foot. We were there when the summer school is on going, all the building are not accessible. Several good restaurant around the campus, and several street show near the T station.

title: Not worth the visit
text: I was a little disappointed - I thought it would be a beautiful campus, but it was not well maintained.
translated_text: I was a little disappointed - I thought it would be a beautiful campus, but it was not well maintained.

title: Free, cool shade and comfy chairs
text:
This was a fun surprise after a day of walking.  The colorful metal chairs come in three types, so, seek out the slant back lounger model--the other varieties are straight back no arms, and then there straight back with arms. 

 Match up with the footstools, and you are set for a Cambridge attraction.  There are no tickets, no lines, no rental fees.  Find your favorite expanse of shade, and view the world from this centuries seasoned perch.

title: Elegant, Scenic and Classic
text: For some reason, Harvard University reminds me of University of Dhaka (mostly 60s & 70s). Maybe because of the fact that it has been the center of admiration for such a long time. I found Harvard more welcoming than expected (in terms of visiting the campus). You can roam around the campus as long as you want. The only problem: most of the buildings didn't have names/tags. For first time visitors, it's little difficult to figure out.

title: Historic place
text: A lot history. Walk the campus. Fun looking at the place. Touch the toe of john Harvard.  Wish I did the student tour so I could have learned more.

title: IS SIMILAR TO OTHER UNIVERSITIES
text: We visited Harvard University during our trip to Boston with group. I liked the campus and the English style buildings of this University, especially the bibliotheq with the Greek architecture like Parthenon. The point visiting a university is not to know it's history, as is easy to get it in internet, but to see all the atmosphere of the whole place. Really Norfolk University at Virginia, where my children are graduated, has nothing less than Harvard, either buildings, gardens, very big bibliotheq and even a school for the kids of students that have no where to leave them during studing at University. I believe that Harvard University is like an attraction at Cambridge after  people that were graduated, became famous.

I liked the campus and the English style buildings of this University, especially the bibliotheq with the Greek architecture like Parthenon. The point visiting a university is not to know it's history, as is easy to get it in internet, but to see all the atmosphere of the whole place. title: Just for the name! - Nothing else is special
text:
I visited this place only for the reputation it had. As a tourist, it was nothing so great. Didn't get into the museum though. Unless, getting here gives you some inspiration or a satisfaction, I wouldn't recommend this place. 

It is just another university campus - except for the great Harvard brand.. So if you have better things to do, please go ahead.. I wouldn't go again if I get a chance to..

There are some harvard tours too. I don't think it is worth spending on them, unless you badly want to see it..

text: Walked around the campus.  Lots of tourists & tours.  Beautiful day to be outside.  Pleasant campus vibe.

title: We got to to to the gift shop.
text: We should have either took a taxi or booked a tour. When got there the only parking available was meter parking that would only let you pay for an hour. We still got to walk around for a little while and go to the gift shop. I have worn my Harvard shirt at least once a week ever since.

title: Bring your kids and/or grandkids
text: I graduated from this fine institution many years ago and have never regretted it. Worth a visit, both for the splendid university it is and also as an unforgettable piece of American history and important incubator for its future talent. Bring the youngsters along - they all need something to aspire to.

Worth a visit, both for the splendid university it is and also as an unforgettable piece of American history and important incubator for its future talent. Bring the youngsters along - they all need something to aspire to.

title: Hallowed Halls
text: What abeautiful historic establishment.  Widner Library is well worth a visit.  The historic tour was informative and worthwhile providing both relevant facts and some funny and quaint facts
translated_text: What abeautiful historic establishment.  Widner Library is well worth a visit.  The historic tour was informative and worthwhile providing both relevant facts and some funny and quaint facts

title: Beautiful Campus
text: If you are near Cambridge, you must see the university. We walked from our hotel as I'm sure parking would be impossible. Lots of historic buildings to see and enjoy the beauty of the campus in the city.

title: college
text: I travelled by train to the University and got some excellent pictures there. Very nice area and very historic. I recommend checking it out if you are in the Boston area.

title: Student Walking Tour of Harvard University 5/6/2013- A great half day activity.
text:
Student Walking Tour of Harvard University 5/6/2013

A great half day activity that doesn't break the bank. Take the 15-20 minute subway trip out to Cambridge and take the Student lead tour through Harvard University. The cost of the trip is $10.00 and money well spent. The tour company is run by Harvard University students and all the proceeds go back to the students. The tour start is located at the main exit  from Cambridge Subway. You will be meet by a person who will direct you to a small newspaper stand where you pay your money and get your ticket.  You then take your ticket back to the person who then gives you a sticker. It is a little round about but it works.

Our tour guide was a third student who was 5 foot and 1 inch tall named Brett (This is how he introduced himself). He was a pocket rocket, he was very enthusiastic about showing the group around, telling great stories of the going on's of the students, pointing out where famous graduates or 'non graduates' lived and studied and informing the group of the history of America's oldest university. The tour is two hours long and finishes at a park just outside the university walls. There is a great cafe located here for lunch and just around the corner is the subway for the trip back to Boston. My wife and I enjoyed it no end.  We explored the campus further after the tour and their Business College campus were beautiful with well manicured gardens!

title: Informative tour
text: We went on the free student led tour on a weekday morning with a group of about 30 people. The student guide was friendly and informative and answered guest questions. She made the history of the buildings come alive and included some of her personal experiences as she talked about her major, which dorms she lived in, etc.

She made the history of the buildings come alive and included some of her personal experiences as she talked about her major, which dorms she lived in, etc.

title: Great small university town!
text: The fact that the university is pretty much integrated into the town gives it a terrific 'Oxford/ Cambridge' feel.
translated_text: The fact that the university is pretty much integrated into the town gives it a terrific 'Oxford/ Cambridge' feel.

title: Take the Hahvahd tour!! So funny!!
text: I had a great time. When we got out of the train, students were right at the exit to get a new group of travellers. Super easy, no need for booking. The students giving the tour were so funny. We laughed, learned, walked around. You give the amount you want at the end of tour.
translated_text: I had a great time. When we got out of the train, students were right at the exit to get a new group of travellers. Super easy, no need for booking. The students giving the tour were so funny. We laughed, learned, walked around. You give the amount you want at the end of tour.

title: Student Led Tours
text: There are student led tours for free of the campus. It gives you background that walking around the campus would not give you. Stories about how freshman are picked for their upperclassmen house and what happened the morning after the library burned down. When you get off the subway there is an information booth that will point you to where the free tours are. They also sell a great map for 25 cents. The bookstore The Coop is a good place to buy a souvenir. L. A. Burdick is a chocolate shop right by Harvard. Expensive but nice. Your can walk to Brattle Street nearby and take a tour of Longfellow's house. It is an amazing tour and worth the 15 minute walk from the campus.
translated_text: There are student led tours for free of the campus. It gives you background that walking around the campus would not give you. Stories about how freshman are picked for their upperclassmen house and what happened the morning after the library burned down. When you get off the subway there is an information booth that will point you to where the free tours are. They also sell a great map for 25 cents. The bookstore The Coop is a good place to buy a souvenir. L. A. Burdick is a chocolate shop right by Harvard. Expensive but nice. Your can walk to Brattle Street nearby and take a tour of Longfellow's house. It is an amazing tour and worth the 15 minute walk from the campus.

title: Amazing
text: This campus is stunning,  its a beautiful array of historical buildings.  Take the student led tour on campus it's free and very informative.  The whole community is gorgeous! Breath of fresh air from the big city of Boston.  Right off the T subway.
translated_text: This campus is stunning,  its a beautiful array of historical buildings.  Take the student led tour on campus it's free and very informative.  The whole community is gorgeous! Breath of fresh air from the big city of Boston.  Right off the T subway.

title: The cradle of American Liberal Arts Education!
text: England has Oxbridge, the US  has Harvard! Lovely setting in the very middle of Cambridge. Visit both the Old and the New Yard, Memorial Church, Widener Library (the second largest library in the US after the Library of Congress), walk where so many past Presidents, famous economists, scientists, psychologists, experts have done before!
translated_text: England has Oxbridge, the US  has Harvard! Lovely setting in the very middle of Cambridge. Visit both the Old and the New Yard, Memorial Church, Widener Library (the second largest library in the US after the Library of Congress), walk where so many past Presidents, famous economists, scientists, psychologists, experts have done before!

title: I want to be an undergrad
text: The admissions tour along with a guided tour made me wish I could re-do my undergrad years, but do it at Harvard.  I now understand the remarkable draw of the residential college system and the incredible number of activities available to the students.  It is in a great location with mass transit readily available.  A must see when in Cambridge!!
translated_text: The admissions tour along with a guided tour made me wish I could re-do my undergrad years, but do it at Harvard.  I now understand the remarkable draw of the residential college system and the incredible number of activities available to the students.  It is in a great location with mass transit readily available.  A must see when in Cambridge!!

title: Lots of amazing buildings
text:
The campus is one great building after another. Students are giving out free maps in the main square. You can join a student tour with them at 10 dollars. I decided to stroll around on my own.
Easy to get to with the T.

The campus is one great building after another. Students are giving out free maps in the main square. You can join a student tour with them at 10 dollars. I decided to stroll around on my own.

title: Can't miss Harvard's campus
text: Graduation had just take place and they were getting ready for another one. Slipped in to take a picture with the famous statue. Grounds are beautiful and everyone allowed the visitors to enjoy what they get to see daily. The entire area is very friendly and there are lots of pick up gifts right outside. A map of the campus is available and there's the museum if you have time to visit.

Grounds are beautiful and everyone allowed the visitors to enjoy what they get to see daily. The entire area is very friendly and there are lots of pick up gifts right outside. A map of the campus is available and there's the museum if you have time to visit.

title: Don't Park your Car in Harvard Yard, take the T
text: You have to go and walk the Harvard Yard.  it is a short T ride and when you get off the T Stop you are there.  So it is easy and something you should do.  there are also some great places around there as well.
translated_text: You have to go and walk the Harvard Yard.  it is a short T ride and when you get off the T Stop you are there.  So it is easy and something you should do.  there are also some great places around there as well.

title: 2013 Commencement
text: the 2013 Commencement is a great joy for all!, With Oprah and fellows its always a great tradition to continue threw the years. Harvard has so much to offer, and so much to give not only to the students but to the community at hand. Harvard is and always will be the great Cambridge Institution where people come to learn from great minds.

Harvard is and always will be the great Cambridge Institution where people come to learn from great minds.

title: Free campus tours are great
text: I have toured Harvard Campus with three different students and each time I have learned a different aspect of Harvard's history and present day personality. The university is rich with stories.
translated_text: I have toured Harvard Campus with three different students and each time I have learned a different aspect of Harvard's history and present day personality. The university is rich with stories.

title: Map for money!
text: In general i enjoyed the trip to Harvard. However i find it rediculous that the information center charge 2 dollars for a map of the campus. And it is the only option. Stingy much?
translated_text: In general i enjoyed the trip to Harvard. However i find it rediculous that the information center charge 2 dollars for a map of the campus. And it is the only option. Stingy much?

title: Busy location
text: We found our visit to Harvard interesting, but it was extremely busy. We encountered many tourist groups (30+ people) on our wander around the grounds, which wasn't a problem but you need to be patient for photo opportunities, especially around the John Harvard statue.  Glad we visited - but not a great deal for the kids to do.
translated_text: We found our visit to Harvard interesting, but it was extremely busy. We encountered many tourist groups (30+ people) on our wander around the grounds, which wasn't a problem but you need to be patient for photo opportunities, especially around the John Harvard statue.  Glad we visited - but not a great deal for the kids to do.

title: Classic ivy league Campus
text: From the exterior setting (a quiet oasis within bustling Harvard Square) to the stately old buildings, the campus is definitely somewhere that everyone living or visiting Boston should stop by.
translated_text: From the exterior setting (a quiet oasis within bustling Harvard Square) to the stately old buildings, the campus is definitely somewhere that everyone living or visiting Boston should stop by.

title: a great university
text: Because as far as I know so many great  minds, presidents, bigwigs, celebrities, political people and great lawyers of the country and known around the world studied there. The education cost is expensive and only those who can really afford can study there, of course even scholars need to have their own personal  expense, too. When we entered the grounds, I already felt its greatness and now it is still one of the great universities around the world, that even royal people felt honored to study and graduate there. the grounds are really wide and it took sometime for us to finish the walk, and to take pictures of the different areas. It also took a while to pose in front of the statue of the founder of the university. The trip was really worth it!
translated_text: Because as far as I know so many great  minds, presidents, bigwigs, celebrities, political people and great lawyers of the country and known around the world studied there. The education cost is expensive and only those who can really afford can study there, of course even scholars need to have their own personal  expense, too. When we entered the grounds, I already felt its greatness and now it is still one of the great universities around the world, that even royal people felt honored to study and graduate there. the grounds are really wide and it took sometime for us to finish the walk, and to take pictures of the different areas. It also took a while to pose in front of the statue of the founder of the university. The trip was really worth it!

title: History, grandeur
text: Great for a visit (and education - i have heard...). Would definitely take a tour. awesome place to see one of the oldest institutions of learning (in America).
translated_text: Great for a visit (and education - i have heard...). Would definitely take a tour. awesome place to see one of the oldest institutions of learning (in America).

title: Take The Tour
text: We visited Harvard twice on our vacation. The first time we walked through on the way to the Peabody Museum but the second time we took the 1 hr tour. It was led by one of the students who was very entertaining. Brent, Bret, Brad (sorry I can't remember his name) gave us some very interesting information on the history and lore of Harvard. Well worth the $10.
translated_text: We visited Harvard twice on our vacation. The first time we walked through on the way to the Peabody Museum but the second time we took the 1 hr tour. It was led by one of the students who was very entertaining. Brent, Bret, Brad (sorry I can't remember his name) gave us some very interesting information on the history and lore of Harvard. Well worth the $10.

title: A bit of history - definitely go into the church
text: If you're a tourist in Boston, Harvard University is definitely worth a visit even if it's just to walk around the square to take the history in. It's a good way from the centre of Boston but easily accessible by T line or bus.  We were there when it was pouring with rain so ran for shelter into the church.  This turned out to be a major result as it was stunning and a real example of Boston's historical past. We were doubly lucky in that we had it all to ourselves and then a gentleman started to play the wonderful organ.  It was like a wonderful oasis from the weather and the traffic.
translated_text: If you're a tourist in Boston, Harvard University is definitely worth a visit even if it's just to walk around the square to take the history in. It's a good way from the centre of Boston but easily accessible by T line or bus.  We were there when it was pouring with rain so ran for shelter into the church.  This turned out to be a major result as it was stunning and a real example of Boston's historical past. We were doubly lucky in that we had it all to ourselves and then a gentleman started to play the wonderful organ.  It was like a wonderful oasis from the weather and the traffic.

title: Nothing more than a yard
text: It's just a yard. really. and it's not like you could even picnic on it.  No reason to visit it unless you plan on visiting Harvard itself.  Then you might as well stroll across it because you can get a vibe for the students and faculty or even take a tour.
translated_text: It's just a yard. really. and it's not like you could even picnic on it.  No reason to visit it unless you plan on visiting Harvard itself.  Then you might as well stroll across it because you can get a vibe for the students and faculty or even take a tour.

title: Fun Walk
text: Our family walked around the campus while in Cambridge to cheer our son in the Boston Marathon.  Amazing architecture, lovely grounds and tons of history.  A pleasant afternoon
translated_text: Our family walked around the campus while in Cambridge to cheer our son in the Boston Marathon.  Amazing architecture, lovely grounds and tons of history.  A pleasant afternoon

title: Been there got the tee-shirt!
text: It is worth a visit primarily because it is so famous throughout the world. It is good to see what it is all about and has some pretty (if slightly plain) buildings. It certainly is no where near as pretty as the likes of Cambridge and Oxford in the UK. We visited the Natural History Museum which was quite good and you get access to the Peabody museum included. Didn't seem too many (food & drinks) facilties for non students but it was nice to meander around and observe. We enjoyed the John Harvard Statue where local legend has it if you touch his left foot then your IQ will increase; there may be something in this as my wife did and over the next couple of days she did have a couple of very insightful moments!!
