title: Didn't do much for me
text: Our son was cross admitted to Yale and Harvard. We visited Yale 1st and Harvard just couldn't live up to the beauty. The people there also lacked the warm and welcoming attitude that seemed to ooze from the folks at Yale. Guess which college he will be attending in the fall???
translated_text: Our son was cross admitted to Yale and Harvard. We visited Yale 1st and Harvard just couldn't live up to the beauty. The people there also lacked the warm and welcoming attitude that seemed to ooze from the folks at Yale. Guess which college he will be attending in the fall???

title: Of course you have to see it
text: Would have been nice if there were more on campus for visiting parents to do, like even an open coffee shop.  The  museum is great but there really wasn't any place to duck in and relax.
translated_text: Would have been nice if there were more on campus for visiting parents to do, like even an open coffee shop.  The  museum is great but there really wasn't any place to duck in and relax.

title: Day trip
text: Went to Cambridge to see what Harvard was all about. Did not go on any organised tours. Spent half a day around the campus. Lots of little pubs and restaurants. There is Harvard Shirt store on Mass  ave, that have all the choices, and prices are a lot less than in a souvenirs stores in Boston.
translated_text: Went to Cambridge to see what Harvard was all about. Did not go on any organised tours. Spent half a day around the campus. Lots of little pubs and restaurants. There is Harvard Shirt store on Mass  ave, that have all the choices, and prices are a lot less than in a souvenirs stores in Boston.

title: Great and informative experience!
text: I went on one of the free tours given by Harvard students and was amazed by their knowledge and understanding of the history and present day use of the University.  The information jam packed into an hour was amazing and the personal antedotes made the experience more valuable.
translated_text: I went on one of the free tours given by Harvard students and was amazed by their knowledge and understanding of the history and present day use of the University.  The information jam packed into an hour was amazing and the personal antedotes made the experience more valuable.

title: You should visit when students are not on a break
text: Harvard yard is very strange, when students are on a break.  So, try to schedule your visit when the yard is full of students, going to the libraries or running to the next class. Say "hello" to John Harvard, walk the steps of Widener's library. You can visit it too!  Walk into the Emerson hall, which houses the Philosophy department. Walk out of the yard, and visit the Art museum (from Harvard Square entrance, across the yard)  If you have a full day, see if there is an interesting film at Harvard Film Archives (Carpetner Center, practically next to the Art Museum). If you have more than 1 day for a visit, check out Science center, just across the Harvard Yard and many Harvard Museums.
translated_text: Harvard yard is very strange, when students are on a break.  So, try to schedule your visit when the yard is full of students, going to the libraries or running to the next class. Say "hello" to John Harvard, walk the steps of Widener's library. You can visit it too!  Walk into the Emerson hall, which houses the Philosophy department. Walk out of the yard, and visit the Art museum (from Harvard Square entrance, across the yard)  If you have a full day, see if there is an interesting film at Harvard Film Archives (Carpetner Center, practically next to the Art Museum). If you have more than 1 day for a visit, check out Science center, just across the Harvard Yard and many Harvard Museums.

title: READ BEFORE YOU GO :)
text: I am amazed to see some of the reviews. I do not know what people might expect from a university, particularly such a big one, not to mention the oldest :)  Walk the Harvard yard, go to the museum of your interest - Harvard has many.  Visit the Business School area, to feel the difference :) Attend one of the concerts or a theater performance. Take a walk along Charles, and see the Harvard residential housing.  Before you go, visit the Harvard information web site, or the Information Center in Cambridge

I do not know what people might expect from a university, particularly such a big one, not to mention the oldest :)  Walk the Harvard yard, go to the museum of your interest - Harvard has many.  Visit the Business School area, to feel the difference :) Attend one of the concerts or a theater performance. Take a walk along Charles, and see the Harvard residential housing.  Before you go, visit the Harvard information web site, or the Information Center in Cambridge

title: Not only historical and beautiful, but a real crossroads.
text: The storied halls of Harvard attract not only students and prospective students, but also tourists from all over the world. They, and the world-class scholars, speakers, and other celebrities constantly passing through, give this stately old quadrangle the excited feel of an axis mundi. You are at the center of the academic world here, and you can feel it in the air. What's more, the Yard is completely open and simple to access ‚Äî just walk in. Unlike the colleges at Yale or Oxford, you are welcome to stroll through and soak in the heady atmosphere. Don't forget to rub John Harvard's left foot for good luck, peek into Memorial Church, and gaze at the massive fa√ßade of Widener Library in the New Yard!

Don't forget to rub John Harvard's left foot for good luck, peek into Memorial Church, and gaze at the massive fa√ßade of Widener Library in the New Yard!

title: A great mix of people
text: Harvard yard is a great way to go from one side of Cambridge from the common to Kirkland Street. You always see lots of students, parents, visitors and folks that want to feel the Harvard spirit. Don't forget to rug John Harvard's toe for good luck.
translated_text: Harvard yard is a great way to go from one side of Cambridge from the common to Kirkland Street. You always see lots of students, parents, visitors and folks that want to feel the Harvard spirit. Don't forget to rug John Harvard's toe for good luck.

title: Great tour of Harvard Univ from Harvard SQ
text: I was in Boston last week end and saw the volunteers from the Student organization talking about the tour. I love old architecture so I signed up for it. It was fun, funny, well researched and it was special since the students are your guide. You get the insiders view. The tour takes you to the famous yard, walks around the yard and brings you near the book store where you can get souvenir or pay the fees of ten dollars. Its pretty good for the price. Your guide will tell you all the history and fun facts about the campus. Its for an hour and I would recommend it for wanna be Bostonians or Harvardians!

title: a place to visit in Boston
text: Since we are already in Boston, we decided to see Harvard University Campus, nothing much to do there except to go around the campus, take a look at the buildings, have a picture taken on the statue of John Harvard. It's worth seeing though and I'm glad we did went there.
translated_text: Since we are already in Boston, we decided to see Harvard University Campus, nothing much to do there except to go around the campus, take a look at the buildings, have a picture taken on the statue of John Harvard. It's worth seeing though and I'm glad we did went there.

title: Not entertaining...
text:
If you are bored and want to get more bored then this is the right place to visit. 
I was surprised how badly they welcome guests in this place because I was expecting visitors center when I arrived but instead they wander around the area like headless chickens.

If you are bored and want to get more bored then this is the right place to visit.

title: A Must See!
text:
Recently visited Harvard and took the student led tour.  Our guide was Alexis who was fantastic, knowledgable and full of enthusiasm which really made the tour worthwhile.  The tour lasts for an hour and costs $10 donation per person or $20 per family up to 5 people.

A definite must do for any visitor and well done Alexis!!

A definite must do for any visitor and well done Alexis!!

title: trademark tour!
text: departs from info booth at harvard square, you visit campus guided by harvard senior students, not only you learn interesting facts about the university they also share funny anecdotes
translated_text: departs from info booth at harvard square, you visit campus guided by harvard senior students, not only you learn interesting facts about the university they also share funny anecdotes

title: Feeling history
text: I recently moved back to the Boston area and this time on the far banks of the Charles in Cambridge in Huron Village and walking around my new neighborhood took me to Harvard Yard. The Yard has that mystic and sense of privilege few Americas will ever partake. Especially in this time of shifting morality and values, walking through Harvard embudes one with an understanding of the virtues of intellectual endeavor.

The Yard has that mystic and sense of privilege few Americas will ever partake. Especially in this time of shifting morality and values, walking through Harvard embudes one with an understanding of the virtues of intellectual endeavor.

title: Beautiful campus, great free tour.
text: We went to Harvard and took the free university tour that is offered by students. It was very interesting to learn all the history of the school and funny facts about all the buildings, etc. Our tour guide was very good and also told us about her life as a student, which I found very interesting. Made it more real, plus you got an insight into what being a student at Harvard is like!

Made it more real, plus you got an insight into what being a student at Harvard is like!

title: Take the tour!
text: The Historical ($) or the General admissions (FREE) tour are great! This is History, and it is very interesting, The buildings and architecture are incredible. Spend the day! Plenty of restaurants and cafes within and around the campus.
translated_text: The Historical ($) or the General admissions (FREE) tour are great! This is History, and it is very interesting, The buildings and architecture are incredible. Spend the day! Plenty of restaurants and cafes within and around the campus.

title: Great campus tour; fab staff!!
text: Here on a college visit with my daughter.  It's #1 on her list.  Great tour, very informative & super staff!  Thanks for an awesome visit.  Keeping fingers crossed at application time!  ;). Park in a public lot or watch street signs very closely!  We were warned, but others were not so lucky.  A 10 car length stretch of road could have 3 different parking restriction signs....read the signs carefully!!  We had a nice lunch at Panera across the street & met students (all wonderful) which added to some of our tour questions & hearing things first hand.  A classic & classy college!

title: A pleasant wander on a sunny day
text: I have visited Harvard University on several occasions, the first time because  it was the setting for a novel I enjoyed. Since then it has become a semi-regular haunt, and I have visited several of the buildings as well as wandering the campus. Buildings are widely located so a rainy day is not conducive to a pleasant visit. However, if in Cambridge, it is a must.

Buildings are widely located so a rainy day is not conducive to a pleasant visit. However, if in Cambridge, it is a must.

title: Beautiful old campus!
text: I enjoyed the self-guided walking tour (pick up a brochure in a nearby info center).  I also enjoyed going into the Houghton Library with rare books and manuscripts.  It is a relaxing  walk and the tour takes about 1 hour, with good cafes nearby.  Massachusetts Hall is the 2nd oldest academic building still in use in the U.S.
translated_text: I enjoyed the self-guided walking tour (pick up a brochure in a nearby info center).  I also enjoyed going into the Houghton Library with rare books and manuscripts.  It is a relaxing  walk and the tour takes about 1 hour, with good cafes nearby.  Massachusetts Hall is the 2nd oldest academic building still in use in the U.S.

title: Seminar at the Grad School of Education
text: Had an excellent experience at a professional seminar at the Harvard Graduate School of Education. Mostly held in Larsen Hall and Gutman Library, the conference was well-organized, food was good, snacks were abundant, and space was comfortable. What a great experience!
translated_text: Had an excellent experience at a professional seminar at the Harvard Graduate School of Education. Mostly held in Larsen Hall and Gutman Library, the conference was well-organized, food was good, snacks were abundant, and space was comfortable. What a great experience!

title: a must for any Boston trip
text: no trip to Boston would be complete without a walk round this historical place, eight US presidents have graduated from here
translated_text: no trip to Boston would be complete without a walk round this historical place, eight US presidents have graduated from here

title: Great tour
text: My friend and I took a tour in March of 2007. We had a great time. We went to the info center to take one. We went into a couple of buildings and got loads of information. The tour was free and the student tour guide was great. It was freezing outside when we did it but she kept us moving so we wouldn't feel the cold.

title: Beautiful
text: We were in the area and knew we had to stop at Harvard (just to say we were there)!  It was pretty easy parking but we did go right away in the morning.  We walked around Harvard yard which is pretty impressive to see.  We did not go into any buildings but we did take some photos and walked around.  I'd recommend a stop if you're in the area and have some time.  Helpful tip - view the map of campus on your cellphone to help with driving in the area and walking around. It helped a lot!

I'd recommend a stop if you're in the area and have some time.  Helpful tip - view the map of campus on your cellphone to help with driving in the area and walking around. It helped a lot!

title: Pretty amazing.
text: Don't miss the Sackler Museum. It's small, but it's got an excellent collection, and shouldn't be overlooked if you're in Cambridge. There are tours, both official and unofficial, of Harvard. And restaurants abound. To walk through The Yard is a treat on a Sunday morning, especially since the students are all still asleep in their dorms!
translated_text: Don't miss the Sackler Museum. It's small, but it's got an excellent collection, and shouldn't be overlooked if you're in Cambridge. There are tours, both official and unofficial, of Harvard. And restaurants abound. To walk through The Yard is a treat on a Sunday morning, especially since the students are all still asleep in their dorms!

title: Do the student-led walking tour! A must.
text: You can find info about student-led tours on the Harvard website. I am so glad we chose to do this tour because A: It's free and B: It's very informative, and a great way to learn about the school's history. Our tour guide was a senior at the school and very humorous and knowledgeable. What would have been a few minute walk around the school by ourselves wondering what things are turned into an hour of entertainment and information with the tour guide. Highly recommend!
translated_text: You can find info about student-led tours on the Harvard website. I am so glad we chose to do this tour because A: It's free and B: It's very informative, and a great way to learn about the school's history. Our tour guide was a senior at the school and very humorous and knowledgeable. What would have been a few minute walk around the school by ourselves wondering what things are turned into an hour of entertainment and information with the tour guide. Highly recommend!

title: Awesome experience, but I  wish I could enter more buildings
text: I have to admit the aura the surrounds Harvard lives up to it's reputation. It's easy to get  via the T, just jump on the outbound Red line.  We went a bit too late to get a tour so we walked round the Campus.We started off at the Harvard Business school which is on the Other side of the Charles River (approx 5min from the main campus) and then walked to the Main Campus. For the most part the buildings are of old architecture and definitely give that prestigious vibe. There is a photo opportunity around each corner. I'd say the one downside is you are not able to enter most buildings. We did enter the Law library after asking and I have to say it was breathtaking. I would definitely recommend trying to get into one of the libraries its totally worth it. Overall Harvard is an amazing place. You can make an afternoon of it by grabbing food at Harvard Square.

title: Nostalgia Harvard University
text: We wanted to see with our own eyes the university as famous! Beautiful nostalgic place. It's worth a visit and a full stop is required. It is to see at least once in his life, other than in the movies. Guided tours are offered by students. Do not forget to take a picture with John Harvard ... but most people on the site!!! We can walk free on the site, but we can not entry in building. No toilet!

title: Historic home for undergraduate freshmen
text: The Yard is actually home-away-from-home for most of Harvard's freshmen class.  Relax under the shady trees or join a free walking tour (go to info center in the Holoyoke center) to really learn about the history, people, landmarks.
translated_text: The Yard is actually home-away-from-home for most of Harvard's freshmen class.  Relax under the shady trees or join a free walking tour (go to info center in the Holoyoke center) to really learn about the history, people, landmarks.

title: Iconic University
text:
We brought our two sons to Harvard University last summer when we visited Boston to show them the most popular university in the US and in the world. I dont really know whether they will be inspired to study enough to gain entry to this university but just seeing this place is worth the trip.

Its such a huge campus that you would need at least a day to really get acquianted with the area.

Its such a huge campus that you would need at least a day to really get acquianted with the area.

title: Nice Place to Walk Around
text: If you are in the area, and you are bored, definitely take some time out of your day to check this out. Harvard University is known world-wide and getting to say that you stepped on some of their land is pretty special if you are visiting internationally. The actual area is quite large, but there is plenty of information available to help you get your way around easily. Lots of history is in the area and there are some pretty awesome spots to get some pictures. Another great thing is that it's right beside MIT, so you can visit both in one day. Visit if you have time!

Harvard University is known world-wide and getting to say that you stepped on some of their land is pretty special if you are visiting internationally. The actual area is quite large, but there is plenty of information available to help you get your way around easily. Lots of history is in the area and there are some pretty awesome spots to get some pictures. Another great thing is that it's right beside MIT, so you can visit both in one day. Visit if you have time!

title: Bottom line
text: Getting into Harvard is overrated.  The rigor of a Harvard education is also overrated, especially now that we know that cheating is a big problem.  The endowment is the biggest in the nation, and much of the money is being used to encroach upon a lower middle class Boston area known as Alston.  Many graduates become wealthy lawyers, doctors, and investment bankers.  No doubt Harvard students and professors have contributed much to this great country and the university is the elite of the elite.  Just ask anybody there.

title: Harvard University
text: I remember the Harvard of  1981 when I first came to the area and all of the things that were done differently than are done today. While some of it is left  and it is still interesting it is a shadow of what it was.

title: Hard to beat Harvard
text: I had always wanted to visit Harvard and it lived up to my expectations. We took the number 1 bus from the city which dropped us at the Visitors Centre right across from Harvard Yard. We took a 10am free tour hosted by one of the second year students. The guide had an extensive knowledge of the campus its history and fun facts like where Matt Damon lived when he was a student. The guide succeeded in making us very envious of her being a student. The tour was quite structured and while we did go inside one of the building a downside was the lack of access to most buildings which are for students only. The old buildings are magnificent and there are ample photo opportunites but the best part was the guide herself who was fantastic and answered many questions my wife and I had on education in the USA and how it differs from our educational experiences in Australia. Highly recommended.

title: Nice campus
text: This was my first glimpse at an American Ivy League about 10 years ago.  It's a pretty campus, and certainly has an air of prestige, but I'm not sure if it's all cracked up to what people say it is.  I have since visited other non-Ivy league schools such as Stanford and I much prefer the laid back country club style atmosphere I experienced there.  Less snobbery and more relaxed!

Our guide was fantastic and very knowledgeable and was able to answer all our questions. We got to see the uni and the squirrels. The only down side is that we are unable to go into the buildings. Uh are also able to purchase Harvard memorabilia from the store, it's well priced. It's a great tour and history I defiantly recommend it.

title: Nice peaceful setting that makes you feel smarter just being there.
text: On our visit to Cambridge we came upon Harvard Yard. I must have heard of it before,as the name resonates with me. A large green courtyard with might maple trees surrounded by halls of knowledge. There the statue of John Harvard watches in repose as small flocks gather to reflect...Or eat lunch,nap or consult there personal electronic devices. Here on the green are arranged some simple chairs that are quite comfortable to sit in and observe from. Somehow I felt like a scholar as I sat and took it all in. Sun streamed through the trees dressed in there full autumn flame and warmed the hearts of all who took pause...there upon the yard.

title: Nice historic campus
text: As a visitor to Boston/Cambridge it is worthwhile to take one of the walking tours of Harvard University. We took an unofficial tour that was run by a group of Harvard students (its free, but tips are suggested). The students gave us a very interesting overview of the campus and the history of the university buildings as well as several funny incidents along the way. If you cannot take the tour, a simple walk through the campus is nice to get a feel of the institution. Afterwards a walk through Harvard Square, and a visit to the Harvard Coop is a must.

If you cannot take the tour, a simple walk through the campus is nice to get a feel of the institution. Afterwards a walk through Harvard Square, and a visit to the Harvard Coop is a must.

Afterwards, we went to the Carpenter Center for Visual Arts - the only building in the US designed by Le Corbusier.

title: A few things to do here
text: Some people may want to see Harvard just to get an idea of what a great university looks like, but there really isn't much to do in Harvard itself.  There are a few museums operated by the university (reviewed separately), but visitors mostly just walk through the courtyards.  The surrounding shopping and dining area is fun, however, and, for some, it's exciting just to be in an atmosphere of people who are dedicated to learning.

title: The most famous university in the world
text: Harvard square is always a bit hectic, but the tour is worth it.  There are historic tours and campus tours - choose the historic tour.  So many brilliant folks graced these grounds its amazing to learn about it!

title: Great tour by Harvard Students
text: This hour long tour is guided by Harvard University students, at a small suggested cost of $10 per person.  The student lead us around a large section of the University highlighting important, well known buildings and structures, giving us great inside information at the same time.  Who knew that Al Gore & Tommy Lee Jones shared a room in their freshmen year, & are still great friends today? We thoroughly enjoyed the tour & were left hungry for more information.  Just go to the information booth in Harvard Square & spend a wonderful hour in an iconic institution.

title: Footy
text: We went to a Harvard Holy Cross football game in the rain and soaked in the best of the Crimson's fighting spirit.  The stadium is colloseumesque and very picturesque.  The food attendants did not mind explaining the nuances of American food.  (Not exactly a 4 n' 20).

title: 376 Years Old University
text:
My first visit to Harvard University was over 20 years ago. My first impression was that the campus had some very old buildings, and some of them were closed due to lack of maintenance. It might be there was not enough funding at the time. Recently, I revisited Harvard University, and it completely changed my opinion. I am glad that we made the right decision to learn more about this renowned and historical school. We took the subway to Harvard Square Station and walked to Harvard Information Center in the Holyoke Center Arcade. This was a good start because they offer a free tour of the Harvard Yard, which is led by a senior student. Normally, it has 3 scheduled guided tours (10 am, 12 pm and 2 pm) everyday. It is suggested to check the schedule before you go because it might not have the tours due to various reasons. It is a one-hour walking tour, and it covers most of the campus and its history. You do not need to make a reservation, but sometimes you might need to wait for the next available tour. If you prefer self-guided walking tour, you can visit their mobile tour website.

Harvard University is an American private Ivy League research university which celebrated its 376th anniversary in 2012. It is the oldest institution of higher education in the United States. There are many historic buildings in Harvard Yard. The high Victorian Gothic style Memorial Hall is one of the iconic buildings on the campus. It was built in 1870s to honor the Harvard graduates who fought for the Union in the American Civil War. Today, the Sanders Theatre is a lecture and concert hall, and the Annenberg Hall is used as the dining hall for the freshmen. The interior of Memorial Hall is a must see, and you might need to wait in line because it is the most impressive place on the campus. Another interesting location you can‚Äôt miss is the John Harvard statue and its ‚ÄúStatue of the Three Lies‚Äù. You can easily see his shining shoe because Harvard students and tourists believe rubbing the shoe will bring you luck.

I thought there must have been many directors who use the Harvard campus in their movies. However, I was wrong. Because the movie staff of The Love Story (1970) caused damage to the Harvard campus, the university administration refused most subsequent requests for filming on Harvard.
translated_text:

It might be there was not enough funding at the time. Recently, I revisited Harvard University, and it completely changed my opinion. I am glad that we made the right decision to learn more about this renowned and historical school. We took the subway to Harvard Square Station and walked to Harvard Information Center in the Holyoke Center Arcade. This was a good start because they offer a free tour of the Harvard Yard, which is led by a senior student. Normally, it has 3 scheduled guided tours (10 am, 12 pm and 2 pm) everyday. It is suggested to check the schedule before you go because it might not have the tours due to various reasons. It is a one-hour walking tour, and it covers most of the campus and its history. You do not need to make a reservation, but sometimes you might need to wait for the next available tour. If you prefer self-guided walking tour, you can visit their mobile tour website.

Harvard University is an American private Ivy League research university which celebrated its 376th anniversary in 2012. It is the oldest institution of higher education in the United States. There are many historic buildings in Harvard Yard. The high Victorian Gothic style Memorial Hall is one of the iconic buildings on the campus. It was built in 1870s to honor the Harvard graduates who fought for the Union in the American Civil War. Today, the Sanders Theatre is a lecture and concert hall, and the Annenberg Hall is used as the dining hall for the freshmen. The interior of Memorial Hall is a must see, and you might need to wait in line because it is the most impressive place on the campus. Another interesting location you can‚Äôt miss is the John Harvard statue and its ‚ÄúStatue of the Three Lies‚Äù. You can easily see his shining shoe because Harvard students and tourists believe rubbing the shoe will bring you luck.

I thought there must have been many directors who use the Harvard campus in their movies. However, I was wrong. Because the movie staff of The Love Story (1970) caused damage to the Harvard campus, the university administration refused most subsequent requests for filming on Harvard.

Of course, we did the bow, and yes we know about the chilling night events,truly we know have a better understanding  of life at Harvard. A free will donation at the end made it all good. I think eveyone should visit this place

title: A great place to hang out.
text: On warm days, there are tons of people sitting in the yard, chatting or reading. It's nice that the university provides chairs and foot stools, so you'll likely have a place to sit down. Great atmosphere.
translated_text: On warm days, there are tons of people sitting in the yard, chatting or reading. It's nice that the university provides chairs and foot stools, so you'll likely have a place to sit down. Great atmosphere.

title: Beautiful
text: Just a short way out of the city of Boston is this beacon of learning. The grounds are superb and the interiors of the buildings are lovely.
translated_text: Just a short way out of the city of Boston is this beacon of learning. The grounds are superb and the interiors of the buildings are lovely.

title: Student Free guided tour of Harvard.
text: You really should make time, a couple of hours to enjoy this place. Lilley was beginning her last year of study there. She took the group around for a hour or so giving us the history of the Uni and an insight of what it is like being a student there. My thanks to her.
translated_text: You really should make time, a couple of hours to enjoy this place. Lilley was beginning her last year of study there. She took the group around for a hour or so giving us the history of the Uni and an insight of what it is like being a student there. My thanks to her.

title: good free tour
text: Find the visitor information centre and go on one of the hour long free tours led by a Harvard student - very engaging!
translated_text: Find the visitor information centre and go on one of the hour long free tours led by a Harvard student - very engaging!

title: Absolutely beautiful & stores nearby
text: If you have the spare time while in Boston or Cambridge going to Harvard is a good thing to add to your list. The buildings are beautiful and Harvard Square, the nearby shopping area, is a great place to roam around on a good weather day (all outdoors). Highly recommended from a new Boston local. :)
translated_text: If you have the spare time while in Boston or Cambridge going to Harvard is a good thing to add to your list. The buildings are beautiful and Harvard Square, the nearby shopping area, is a great place to roam around on a good weather day (all outdoors). Highly recommended from a new Boston local. :)

title: So much excitement!
text: I loved just walking through Harvard Yard and watching all of the students! So much excitement and activity! I always feel so comfortable there and its nice to grab a snack in the Science Center.
translated_text: I loved just walking through Harvard Yard and watching all of the students! So much excitement and activity! I always feel so comfortable there and its nice to grab a snack in the Science Center.

title: Quirky tours for visiting parents et al
text: I thought the tour was great.  I especially like the bits about pranks, e.g., the stories of Harvard versus the city of Cambridge and the year a student (I shall not name him here to spoil the fun) who pitted two police forces (Harvard v. Cambridge) against each other one year.
translated_text: I thought the tour was great.  I especially like the bits about pranks, e.g., the stories of Harvard versus the city of Cambridge and the year a student (I shall not name him here to spoil the fun) who pitted two police forces (Harvard v. Cambridge) against each other one year.

title: I live near here and really love it
text: There is always something to see in the Yard, even if it is just the buildings, the configuration and the trees.  However, the visitors are great to see, the tours are fun to hear and the mix of faculty, students, visitors, parents and locals is great fun.  Drew Faust had lovely colored chairs put on the lawn of the yard, so people just come and read or eat or talk in the yard.  The Memorial Church and Widener Library face each other and are really impressive; go during graduation and see the magic of the individuals who have worked so hard and their parents.
translated_text: There is always something to see in the Yard, even if it is just the buildings, the configuration and the trees.  However, the visitors are great to see, the tours are fun to hear and the mix of faculty, students, visitors, parents and locals is great fun.  Drew Faust had lovely colored chairs put on the lawn of the yard, so people just come and read or eat or talk in the yard.  The Memorial Church and Widener Library face each other and are really impressive; go during graduation and see the magic of the individuals who have worked so hard and their parents.

title: Spend some time here
text: So much history here.  Go on an official Harvard tour.  Spend some time in the Harvard yard and take it all in.  This is one of the most celebrated of American traditions.
translated_text: So much history here.  Go on an official Harvard tour.  Spend some time in the Harvard yard and take it all in.  This is one of the most celebrated of American traditions.

title: Great View of Foliage in the Fall in Historic Setting
text: I've been to Harvard Yard a dozen times, but in October it is really special- the colors rival any Vermont tour you can take.  Avoid rubbing the statue of John Harvard for luck.  It is customary for students to urinate on it.
translated_text: I've been to Harvard Yard a dozen times, but in October it is really special- the colors rival any Vermont tour you can take.  Avoid rubbing the statue of John Harvard for luck.  It is customary for students to urinate on it.

title: What a beautiful campus
text: Attended campus tour on 9/29/12 and even with the weather being a little cloudy/rainy we were so impressed by this campus and the town of Cambridge. What a beautiful place to attend college for 4 years.
translated_text: Attended campus tour on 9/29/12 and even with the weather being a little cloudy/rainy we were so impressed by this campus and the town of Cambridge. What a beautiful place to attend college for 4 years.

title: Gorgeous campus
text: Definitely worth exploring when you visit.  We only walked/ran around, but it's a huge area with some open days, worth taking advantage of if/when you can.
translated_text: Definitely worth exploring when you visit.  We only walked/ran around, but it's a huge area with some open days, worth taking advantage of if/when you can.

title: Stately and academic halls.
text: I wandered around the halls while my step son took a student tour.  There was a lot of marble and lots of students.
translated_text: I wandered around the halls while my step son took a student tour.  There was a lot of marble and lots of students.

title: Good ideas
text: I had not visited since the late 80's and the place is much more urbanized now, so the campus and the Square have lost the Boho vibe.  Still, it has everything you could want in terms of stores, the arts, and history.
translated_text: I had not visited since the late 80's and the place is much more urbanized now, so the campus and the Square have lost the Boho vibe.  Still, it has everything you could want in terms of stores, the arts, and history.

title: Nice to visit
text: My wife and I spent just a few minutes here, as we were limited in time. I am sure it would have been much more interesting if we had taken a guided tour or at least spent some more time there. We had a nice visit and it is a very pastoral setting.
translated_text: My wife and I spent just a few minutes here, as we were limited in time. I am sure it would have been much more interesting if we had taken a guided tour or at least spent some more time there. We had a nice visit and it is a very pastoral setting.

title: Nice buildings, but...
text: As a tourist, I went to walk around the Harvard campus and enjoyed seeing the campus buildings, however I was disappointed that it wasn't easy to find out the basic history about the buildings.  You could tell some were older than others and I would have loved to have known their history.
translated_text: As a tourist, I went to walk around the Harvard campus and enjoyed seeing the campus buildings, however I was disappointed that it wasn't easy to find out the basic history about the buildings.  You could tell some were older than others and I would have loved to have known their history.

title: Harvard Yard
text: This is a must see if you are visting Boston.  So much history - unique place.  I loved walking around the entire complex and grounds
translated_text: This is a must see if you are visting Boston.  So much history - unique place.  I loved walking around the entire complex and grounds

title: Student Led Tour at Harvard
text: We opted for the 'free', student led tour of Harvard - if you don't enjoy it, you don't pay; if you do, the recommended gratuity is $10.  Our tour was well worth the money. Guide 'Jess Lucy' poked fun at the 'Hahvahd' accent, and shared lots of 'inside' stories from the uni. She pointed out where all the famous graduates were housed, and told short, historical anecdotes at every turn.  Our group was around 20 people from all over the world. The full tour takes an hour and you walk 1.5 miles - at a very leisurely pace, with lots of stops.  A good way to see the campus.
translated_text: We opted for the 'free', student led tour of Harvard - if you don't enjoy it, you don't pay; if you do, the recommended gratuity is $10.  Our tour was well worth the money. Guide 'Jess Lucy' poked fun at the 'Hahvahd' accent, and shared lots of 'inside' stories from the uni. She pointed out where all the famous graduates were housed, and told short, historical anecdotes at every turn.  Our group was around 20 people from all over the world. The full tour takes an hour and you walk 1.5 miles - at a very leisurely pace, with lots of stops.  A good way to see the campus.

title: Stare at Harvard students not studying
text: It's a campus courtyard.  There is a big statue of John Harvard, and in a good year he's wearing MIT's ring.  The yard was designed for through traffic - really not much to visit and not even the prettiest campus green space in town.
translated_text: It's a campus courtyard.  There is a big statue of John Harvard, and in a good year he's wearing MIT's ring.  The yard was designed for through traffic - really not much to visit and not even the prettiest campus green space in town.

title: Harvard university
text: Because it is such a famous place, we were thrilled to be able to go to the campus and have a brief look around the grounds.  Very special.
translated_text: Because it is such a famous place, we were thrilled to be able to go to the campus and have a brief look around the grounds.  Very special.

title: Always a great campus to walk through
text: Always a nice campus to walk through.  They've done interesting things to keep it vibrant (chairs in quads, etc...).  There's a bit of construction going on, and sometimes can be problematic to navigate (especially in the rain)
translated_text: Always a nice campus to walk through.  They've done interesting things to keep it vibrant (chairs in quads, etc...).  There's a bit of construction going on, and sometimes can be problematic to navigate (especially in the rain)

title: Lovely on a sunny day
text: How many public spaces leave our garden chairs so there's somewhere to relax?  Great vibe with a mix of Harvard students, other locals and tourists, some trees for shade, and just a really nice place to chill for an hour or two on a nice day.
translated_text: How many public spaces leave our garden chairs so there's somewhere to relax?  Great vibe with a mix of Harvard students, other locals and tourists, some trees for shade, and just a really nice place to chill for an hour or two on a nice day.

title: Beautiful and historic
text: I work here, so I am lucky to spend a lot of time walking through "The Yard". When the weather is nice you can sit in the colorful chairs on the lawn. It is open to the public and tours are available.
translated_text: I work here, so I am lucky to spend a lot of time walking through "The Yard". When the weather is nice you can sit in the colorful chairs on the lawn. It is open to the public and tours are available.

title: Pure awesomeness
text: The campus is beautiful in its austerity and history. The surrounding area teems with restaurants, clubs and boutiques. Everyone seems to be excited and happy in Harvard Square. No place like it in the US.
translated_text: The campus is beautiful in its austerity and history. The surrounding area teems with restaurants, clubs and boutiques. Everyone seems to be excited and happy in Harvard Square. No place like it in the US.

title: Not Worth It
text: If you are going for the architecture then skip it.  Unlike many historical universities around the world Harvard is very bland and boring in both an architectural and interest sense.  Sadly when we went we did not get to take in a tour (they start in mid Sept) which would have provided us with some history but as far as walking around the campus and checking out the architecture it was a total dud.
translated_text: If you are going for the architecture then skip it.  Unlike many historical universities around the world Harvard is very bland and boring in both an architectural and interest sense.  Sadly when we went we did not get to take in a tour (they start in mid Sept) which would have provided us with some history but as far as walking around the campus and checking out the architecture it was a total dud.

title: Harvard
text: Nice architecture. Nice info. session. Our tour was lacking in substance and we didn't see a great deal other than the architecture, and it was supposed to be an academic tour. We did see the foyer of the freshman cafeteria, but no classrooms, libraries, or dorms.
translated_text: Nice architecture. Nice info. session. Our tour was lacking in substance and we didn't see a great deal other than the architecture, and it was supposed to be an academic tour. We did see the foyer of the freshman cafeteria, but no classrooms, libraries, or dorms.

title: Harvard Univ tour by students
text: This tour is led by students - ours was extremely knowledgeable, with a great personality and delivery style.  We walked through the yard, and onto the extended campus.  Our guide was able to answer our questions and provide us with entertaining history and tid-bits.  The published cost is "free" but with a suggested tip of $10/pp or $20/per family - well worth it!  The tour is offered 7 days/wk Mar - Dec.
translated_text: This tour is led by students - ours was extremely knowledgeable, with a great personality and delivery style.  We walked through the yard, and onto the extended campus.  Our guide was able to answer our questions and provide us with entertaining history and tid-bits.  The published cost is "free" but with a suggested tip of $10/pp or $20/per family - well worth it!  The tour is offered 7 days/wk Mar - Dec.

title: HavAHd YAHy
text: The sights, sounds, people, and stories within Harvard Yard are always amazing....take the Tour...get the real story about the oldest college in the US
translated_text: The sights, sounds, people, and stories within Harvard Yard are always amazing....take the Tour...get the real story about the oldest college in the US

title: Hahvard!!!
text: Fantastic history and everything you would expect of the place. Having 2 sons go there, I am biased. The only downer are the number of Asian tourists taking pictures of every squirrel on the campus.
translated_text: Fantastic history and everything you would expect of the place. Having 2 sons go there, I am biased. The only downer are the number of Asian tourists taking pictures of every squirrel on the campus.

title: Another institution worth seeing
text: An important university and a cool place to see. To me not as lovely as MIT but still a great sight to see.
translated_text: An important university and a cool place to see. To me not as lovely as MIT but still a great sight to see.

title: Lovely for a wander on a sunny afternoon
text: Nice place to just wander through on a pleasant afternoon. Sunshine is a must to make this place look at its best. Square is bustling with street entertainers and offers a fantastic place to grab fro-yo (Pinkberry)
translated_text: Nice place to just wander through on a pleasant afternoon. Sunshine is a must to make this place look at its best. Square is bustling with street entertainers and offers a fantastic place to grab fro-yo (Pinkberry)

title: Interesting walk
text:
We went last weekend, which means moving in weekend for all the new and returning students. It was a lot of fun and very interesting to wander on the campus. Very nice students helped us find the Le Corbusier building, but we all had trouble finding the Gropius Building - unfortunately.
They offer free tours of the campus, run by student volunteers - the one we saw, was so passionate about sharing her stories of Harvard - she was great!
translated_text:
We went last weekend, which means moving in weekend for all the new and returning students. It was a lot of fun and very interesting to wander on the campus. Very nice students helped us find the Le Corbusier building, but we all had trouble finding the Gropius Building - unfortunately.
They offer free tours of the campus, run by student volunteers - the one we saw, was so passionate about sharing her stories of Harvard - she was great!

title: Myself1942
text: Wow, I understood that as a silly question. Don't you know Harvard University? Man it is well cherished all over the world for the last 400 years!
translated_text: Wow, I understood that as a silly question. Don't you know Harvard University? Man it is well cherished all over the world for the last 400 years!

title: Lives up the the reputation
text: I spent several years there for Grad School.  It is worth a walk through.  You would then be able to say you "have gone to Harvard"  LOL.
translated_text: I spent several years there for Grad School.  It is worth a walk through.  You would then be able to say you "have gone to Harvard"  LOL.

title: So much to see and do
text: I spent two days moving my son into his dorm at Harvard.  Everyone was helpful and friendly.  I loved all the old buildings and learning about the history.
translated_text: I spent two days moving my son into his dorm at Harvard.  Everyone was helpful and friendly.  I loved all the old buildings and learning about the history.

title: Moved my son into his Harvard dorm
text: Great experience!  Loved Harvard Square and touring Harvard Yard.  I look forward to coming back in October.  Weather was great!
translated_text: Great experience!  Loved Harvard Square and touring Harvard Yard.  I look forward to coming back in October.  Weather was great!

title: Must see
text: I had an opportunity to tour this wonderful establishment and i was very impressed. Our guide told us stories of Conan Obrien and Bill gates and Mark Zuckerberg. The primal yell was awesome as well.  Its the oldest college in the States. If you get a chance take it.
translated_text: I had an opportunity to tour this wonderful establishment and i was very impressed. Our guide told us stories of Conan Obrien and Bill gates and Mark Zuckerberg. The primal yell was awesome as well.  Its the oldest college in the States. If you get a chance take it.

title: Free tour of Harvard Yard by students
text:
Kids wanted to see Harvard and so do we. And even though I have downloaded free app and audiobook for the visit, having human guide is always better. Sam was just great - telling the facts in a very entertaining way and with a lot of jokes. Definitely worth the time spent!
I think this tour is organized by visitor center but maybe it is an initiative by students themselves.
translated_text:
Kids wanted to see Harvard and so do we. And even though I have downloaded free app and audiobook for the visit, having human guide is always better. Sam was just great - telling the facts in a very entertaining way and with a lot of jokes. Definitely worth the time spent!
I think this tour is organized by visitor center but maybe it is an initiative by students themselves.

title: Like in a movie
text: How can you not love Harvard. Place and people are great. Students are so lucky to live there, even if for a short period of their life. I bet it will be in their mind for the rest of their life.
translated_text: How can you not love Harvard. Place and people are great. Students are so lucky to live there, even if for a short period of their life. I bet it will be in their mind for the rest of their life.

title: Nice to See but not a "Don't Miss"
text: Very cool just to walk around, but it wasn't something I'd do again. I don't know anyone who attends/ed, but I enjoyed it nonetheless just for the historical perspective.
translated_text: Very cool just to walk around, but it wasn't something I'd do again. I don't know anyone who attends/ed, but I enjoyed it nonetheless just for the historical perspective.

title: Interesting - better with Trip Advisor Guide
text: Walking through Harvard Yard and the entire campus is like strolling through history. If you don't know what you are looking at it could be quite boring. The best option is to download the Boston City Guide available free from Trip Advisor as an application on your smart phone or i-phone. The guide has a Harvard Yard guide that explains each building you are looking at with history and interesting facts. There is also an application called "Every Trail". You can download this too and it has guides as well as GPS driven with live maps. Also FREE and a Trip Advisor company.
translated_text: Walking through Harvard Yard and the entire campus is like strolling through history. If you don't know what you are looking at it could be quite boring. The best option is to download the Boston City Guide available free from Trip Advisor as an application on your smart phone or i-phone. The guide has a Harvard Yard guide that explains each building you are looking at with history and interesting facts. There is also an application called "Every Trail". You can download this too and it has guides as well as GPS driven with live maps. Also FREE and a Trip Advisor company.

title: Must see!
text: When in Boston, it is worth the small cab fare to visit Harvard. Grab a coffee from Starbucks and Walk around to get a feel for the area. Great cafes close by. Friendly people. Interesting sites.
translated_text: When in Boston, it is worth the small cab fare to visit Harvard. Grab a coffee from Starbucks and Walk around to get a feel for the area. Great cafes close by. Friendly people. Interesting sites.

text: i loved it , harvard is a great place to be around! great atmosphere and there are all different kinds of people that walk around there. its great for people watching
translated_text: i loved it , harvard is a great place to be around! great atmosphere and there are all different kinds of people that walk around there. its great for people watching

title: What a Marvel
text: A visit to Harvard's campus is a must do.  The history and the architecture are captivating.  Americans have every right to be so proud of this historic institution.
translated_text: A visit to Harvard's campus is a must do.  The history and the architecture are captivating.  Americans have every right to be so proud of this historic institution.

title: Such history, fascinating.
text: We could not believe it when we entered the grounds of such an amazing university with such history. We loved hearing the stories of John Harvard and the Library etc. Fascinating. Loved it. I understand you can walk around by yourself but really you would be doing yourself a misservice as we had a wonderful guide that gave us so much information that we would not have known otherwise, so please go with a guide. They bring it to life.
translated_text: We could not believe it when we entered the grounds of such an amazing university with such history. We loved hearing the stories of John Harvard and the Library etc. Fascinating. Loved it. I understand you can walk around by yourself but really you would be doing yourself a misservice as we had a wonderful guide that gave us so much information that we would not have known otherwise, so please go with a guide. They bring it to life.

title: What a historical place
text: After a very interesting presentation we visited the campus with one of the students and heard the history of Harvard. It¬¥s an amazing place, you feel the importance, knowledge and the history that surrounds you.
translated_text: After a very interesting presentation we visited the campus with one of the students and heard the history of Harvard. It¬¥s an amazing place, you feel the importance, knowledge and the history that surrounds you.

title: Enjoyable free history tour
text: I decided to go to visit Harvard after a recommendation from a friend. I'm glad I did as I found it a beautiful, interesting place. I went early and managed to get on a tour with a current student. I would definitely recommend this, as I think without it you would not appreciate the history of the site, or its relevance to the current students. It was also great to see some students moving in, and reminded you that this is still a working university, as well as a place steeped in history.
translated_text: I decided to go to visit Harvard after a recommendation from a friend. I'm glad I did as I found it a beautiful, interesting place. I went early and managed to get on a tour with a current student. I would definitely recommend this, as I think without it you would not appreciate the history of the site, or its relevance to the current students. It was also great to see some students moving in, and reminded you that this is still a working university, as well as a place steeped in history.

title: You can't park there
text: You can't park in Harvard Yard, but it's great to walk through and enjoy the history.  The Chapel has services some Sundays too.
translated_text: You can't park in Harvard Yard, but it's great to walk through and enjoy the history.  The Chapel has services some Sundays too.

title: Harvard tour led by students
text: Harvard students offered tours of campus.  My tour guide was very friendly and full of energy.   He showed us sights on campus including dorms where famous people resided.  Pretty short tour, I would have like to see more of the campus.   I wondered around for Abut another hour.
translated_text: Harvard students offered tours of campus.  My tour guide was very friendly and full of energy.   He showed us sights on campus including dorms where famous people resided.  Pretty short tour, I would have like to see more of the campus.   I wondered around for Abut another hour.

title: A nice walk through History
text: I really enjoy strolling through Harvard Yard, having read a great deal of history from the period when Harvard was established, it is amazing to think of what happened in this yard.  You are hanging out where some of the most famous people in history have likely had lunch, read the paper, perhaps stumbled back from a local pub...in fact you could be standing there right now with some of the famous people of tomorrow....and then, a really fun place, Harvard Square.
translated_text: I really enjoy strolling through Harvard Yard, having read a great deal of history from the period when Harvard was established, it is amazing to think of what happened in this yard.  You are hanging out where some of the most famous people in history have likely had lunch, read the paper, perhaps stumbled back from a local pub...in fact you could be standing there right now with some of the famous people of tomorrow....and then, a really fun place, Harvard Square.

title: History!
text: There is a lot of history and wonderful stories here.  I recommend taking one of the student led tours to hear them.   Go to Holyoke Center or the vendors on the street outside.
translated_text: There is a lot of history and wonderful stories here.  I recommend taking one of the student led tours to hear them.   Go to Holyoke Center or the vendors on the street outside.

title: Fun tour of "Hahvahd" led by current student
text: Our tour guide, Brie, was funny and could really project her voice, which is key to a good tour. My husband, teen and pre-teen daughters and I all enjoyed the tour. Interesting info, with only enough history to inform without overwhelming us with details.
translated_text: Our tour guide, Brie, was funny and could really project her voice, which is key to a good tour. My husband, teen and pre-teen daughters and I all enjoyed the tour. Interesting info, with only enough history to inform without overwhelming us with details.

title: Good Place to Walk Your Dog
text: Visit this place in the summer when the University is not in session.  It's a good place to read, relax, or walk the dog.
translated_text: Visit this place in the summer when the University is not in session.  It's a good place to read, relax, or walk the dog.

title: Harvard University
text: Harvard University is like any other large university campus.  There is nothing special about this location.  However, the shopping and restaurants around the campus are quite nice.
translated_text: Harvard University is like any other large university campus.  There is nothing special about this location.  However, the shopping and restaurants around the campus are quite nice.

title: Inspirador...
text:
This place, buildings and garden are very nice and inspiring...
Nice and quite...

This place, buildings and garden are very nice and inspiring...
Nice and quite...

title: Enjoyable walk within the historical campus grounds
text:
Beautiful and peaceful campus. Gives you a glimpse of what student life is like in this historical place. We took a self-guided tour of Harvard using the free Harvard Yard Tour app, which provides a map plus helpful information on buildings of interest. The place is really worth a visit and easy to tour even without a map.

There were loads of tourists when we were there but that's probably because it was summer.
translated_text:
Beautiful and peaceful campus. Gives you a glimpse of what student life is like in this historical place. We took a self-guided tour of Harvard using the free Harvard Yard Tour app, which provides a map plus helpful information on buildings of interest. The place is really worth a visit and easy to tour even without a map.

There were loads of tourists when we were there but that's probably because it was summer.

title: Whe-uh NAWT to Pahk yo-uh Cah
text: Beside being a Boston must-see, the Yard is a lovely urban enclosure--even if it's almost always busy with foot traffic.  Pat ol' John Harvard on the toe before you go.
translated_text: Beside being a Boston must-see, the Yard is a lovely urban enclosure--even if it's almost always busy with foot traffic.  Pat ol' John Harvard on the toe before you go.

title: Love IT!
text: We love all things Harvard!  Fantastice atmosphere...Harvard Square is where it is at :)
translated_text: We love all things Harvard!  Fantastice atmosphere...Harvard Square is where it is at :)

title: Beautiful Campus
text: We walked the campus and wandered in and out of Harvard Square. It was such a beautiful, peaceful area. I read a book on a lawn while my boyfriend fell asleep. And for July, the weather was so pleasant. The buildings are beautiful and it was so interesting to see the mixture of designs.
translated_text: We walked the campus and wandered in and out of Harvard Square. It was such a beautiful, peaceful area. I read a book on a lawn while my boyfriend fell asleep. And for July, the weather was so pleasant. The buildings are beautiful and it was so interesting to see the mixture of designs.

title: Not just for students
text: Even though you may not be able to get into Harvard, you can feel special being part of the Cambridge crowd.
translated_text: Even though you may not be able to get into Harvard, you can feel special being part of the Cambridge crowd.

title: One of the oldest universities in the US
text: It's really an experience visiting this university. Many coffee shops in the area. Great neighborhood.
translated_text: It's really an experience visiting this university. Many coffee shops in the area. Great neighborhood.

title: Worth a stroll through
text: During May, we witnessed a game of frisbee, study sessions, students and professors milling about as we walked through the Yard.
translated_text: During May, we witnessed a game of frisbee, study sessions, students and professors milling about as we walked through the Yard.

title: A must see
text: Do not miss out on a quick visit to Haravard's commomns and its library.  The grounds are very nice and has a lot of history.  look at the river and see if you can spot any rowers.
translated_text: Do not miss out on a quick visit to Haravard's commomns and its library.  The grounds are very nice and has a lot of history.  look at the river and see if you can spot any rowers.

title: Beautiful campus and great energy
text:
We really enjoyed our visit to Harvard.   The tour we took was helpful, fun & informative, and we got to experience the great energy of the students.  

I can't imagine what it must be like to be a student at this beautiful school, but I think there must be an annoying piece to have to dodge tourists while heading to class.  That being said, everyone we talked to was generous, kind, outgoing and warm.

It was a delightful visit and we recommend it.
translated_text:
We really enjoyed our visit to Harvard.   The tour we took was helpful, fun & informative, and we got to experience the great energy of the students.  

I can't imagine what it must be like to be a student at this beautiful school, but I think there must be an annoying piece to have to dodge tourists while heading to class.  That being said, everyone we talked to was generous, kind, outgoing and warm.

It was a delightful visit and we recommend it.

title: Traditional and Historical
text: We had big expectations of what we thought Harvard would be like.  Needless to say, it is not one of the most beautiful campuses I have ever seen, it is not even in the top 10.  A prestigious school yes, and the surounding town is cute, but the campus itself was not as thrilling or exciting as we expected. I love its history and the buildings are old and somewhat charming, but the surround town and bookstore were more exciting.

title: The Best There Is

title: A Taste of Harvard's Past and Present
text: Walking through Harvard Yard surrounded by the historic buildings, libraries, dorms, and greenery there is a magical feeling in the air. There is definitely a strong feeling of people and events from the past as you stroll about, however, watching the current students studying, chatting, and walking about going to classes or their activities is inspiring and exciting. The Harvard tours are very informative and the students leading the groups are very dedicated and will give you a good history lesson of the sites in the yard.

Our son touched John Harvard's foot hopefully to bring him back to study here.

title: Some history

If you love history, then this is a must do activity!

title: Harvard University
text: Our class of 21 enjoyed our time touring Harvard University. We got to see all of the iconic places in Harvard. We saw the Harvard yard and during our trip, learned many interesting facts about this Ivy League school. After visiting the yard, we went to the library, all of the freshman dorm buildings, the freshman lunch area, the presidents office, the science building, a building with the names of all of the civil war Harvard students, and finally, we stopped at the Natural History Museum in the city of Cambridge. The also has many other shops you can stop at after visiting Harvard. Enjoy your time!

title: Visiting the University's historic nucleus.
text:
Located roughly in the center of campus, Harvard Yard is the oldest and arguably most celebrated portion of the campus.  It is roughly divided into two portions: The Old Yard (western third) and everything else, the latter including the Widener Library and Tercentenary Theater.  I toured here first as part of a group (Hahvahd tours ‚Äì see separate review) and then the next day on my own with a tour book.  While at first this may look like a ‚Äúgroup of old buildings with a statue in the middle‚Äù I‚Äôm happy to report that looks in this case are quite deceptive.  Many of these buildings are Centuries old and have history dating to the pre-Revolutionary War period;  Massachusetts Hall at different times housed John Adams, John Hancock, Sam Adams, and a contingent of the Continental Army during the Revolutionary War.  It seemed at every corner I ran into something historically significant (JFK‚Äôs dorm), artistically intriguing (John Harvard‚Äôs statue) or both (Holden Chapel).

You won‚Äôt be spoon fed information while walking around here (sorry, no fancy descriptive plaques or audio guide) but Harvard Yard is as much an integral part of American history as anything else in New England.  Highly recommended.

It is roughly divided into two portions: The Old Yard (western third) and everything else, the latter including the Widener Library and Tercentenary Theater.  I toured here first as part of a group (Hahvahd tours ‚Äì see separate review) and then the next day on my own with a tour book.  While at first this may look like a ‚Äúgroup of old buildings with a statue in the middle‚Äù I‚Äôm happy to report that looks in this case are quite deceptive.  Many of these buildings are Centuries old and have history dating to the pre-Revolutionary War period;  Massachusetts Hall at different times housed John Adams, John Hancock, Sam Adams, and a contingent of the Continental Army during the Revolutionary War.  It seemed at every corner I ran into something historically significant (JFK‚Äôs dorm), artistically intriguing (John Harvard‚Äôs statue) or both (Holden Chapel).

You won‚Äôt be spoon fed information while walking around here (sorry, no fancy descriptive plaques or audio guide) but Harvard Yard is as much an integral part of American history as anything else in New England.  Highly recommended.

title: A must see if in Cambridge, whether or not you're a student
text: It's beautiful and historic and got great energy, plus it looks exactly the way you expect a top-tier Ivy League school in New England should. And Harvard Square is right there.  Take a tour if you can.
translated_text: It's beautiful and historic and got great energy, plus it looks exactly the way you expect a top-tier Ivy League school in New England should. And Harvard Square is right there.  Take a tour if you can.

title: If you've been to Cambridge UK, this is dull.
text:
Americans are very proud of Harvard University. They have buildings dating from the 1800s and lots of advances and studies have been made there. Harvard is unusual in the US, as I understand - redbrick buildings laid out in courts and quads and serious people wandering around thinking serious things. 
Unfortunately, I come from the UK, which has both Cambridge and Oxford universities with buildings dating back to the 1400s and older and the whole place just reeks of history, if that's what you're looking for. 
I understand I could have taken a tour, but the tour that was pushed quite heavily around Harvard was (unsurprisingly) the "alternative and unofficial" student tour, where you pay a student to tell you about their wacky student lifestyle. I didn't fancy that much either. 

I really can't think of much to recommend about Harvard University. As the title says, if you come from the UK and have been or lived in Cambridge or Oxford, or have visited them, Harvard feels very much like a poor relation. But if you've never been to either, you might find it a bit more interesting.
translated_text:
Americans are very proud of Harvard University. They have buildings dating from the 1800s and lots of advances and studies have been made there. Harvard is unusual in the US, as I understand - redbrick buildings laid out in courts and quads and serious people wandering around thinking serious things. 
Unfortunately, I come from the UK, which has both Cambridge and Oxford universities with buildings dating back to the 1400s and older and the whole place just reeks of history, if that's what you're looking for. 
I understand I could have taken a tour, but the tour that was pushed quite heavily around Harvard was (unsurprisingly) the "alternative and unofficial" student tour, where you pay a student to tell you about their wacky student lifestyle. I didn't fancy that much either. 

I really can't think of much to recommend about Harvard University. As the title says, if you come from the UK and have been or lived in Cambridge or Oxford, or have visited them, Harvard feels very much like a poor relation. But if you've never been to either, you might find it a bit more interesting.

I strongly recommend it!

Walking around MIT is far more interesting due to the presence of architecturally interesting buildings.

title: You can breath history
text: I go to the yard as often as possible, mostly when I have visitors that want to see Harvard.  But in general, you can spend such a nice time just strolling around and checking out the buildings around it as well as the students rushing in from their classes, etc. Bring some food/snacks and have yourself a picnic if you wish.
translated_text: I go to the yard as often as possible, mostly when I have visitors that want to see Harvard.  But in general, you can spend such a nice time just strolling around and checking out the buildings around it as well as the students rushing in from their classes, etc. Bring some food/snacks and have yourself a picnic if you wish.

title: great tourist destination
text: Great to walk around and see the history. It s nice that you can go in without a fee and see the area
translated_text: Great to walk around and see the history. It s nice that you can go in without a fee and see the area

title: My husband is a student here!
text: Very beautiful campus! We occasionally go sculling down the Charles River. My hubby graduates in May! I will miss.
translated_text: Very beautiful campus! We occasionally go sculling down the Charles River. My hubby graduates in May! I will miss.

title: John Kennedy spoke there just before being sworn  as President
text: Freshmen stay in te 18th-century dormitories that line the "Ya'd."  Rooms where Kennedy and FDR lived can be pointed out by more informed persons than I.  I was there when JFK spoke.  It was an exciting moment in my life.
translated_text: Freshmen stay in te 18th-century dormitories that line the "Ya'd."  Rooms where Kennedy and FDR lived can be pointed out by more informed persons than I.  I was there when JFK spoke.  It was an exciting moment in my life.

title: Don't miss it
text: When I have guests coming from out of town, I make sure to never miss taking them to Harvard Yard. It's one of my favourite places in town.
translated_text: When I have guests coming from out of town, I make sure to never miss taking them to Harvard Yard. It's one of my favourite places in town.

title: Disappointed
text: I was very disappointed, I guess the images you have of this great college are just better than what is there.  Beautiful buildings but nothing to tell you about them and the people were not friendly.  Great bookstore though.
translated_text: I was very disappointed, I guess the images you have of this great college are just better than what is there.  Beautiful buildings but nothing to tell you about them and the people were not friendly.  Great bookstore though.

title: Barker Center - nice conference place
text: This was a very convenient place for the literary conference I attended.  Nice rooms and easy to find.
translated_text: This was a very convenient place for the literary conference I attended.  Nice rooms and easy to find.

title: I feel smottah now
text: Ok I went to a different school but I can still say I went to Hahvid because I did.Several times in fact as a visitor.. I feel much smottah because of the experience. If you love history, nice restaurants nearby, old architecture, oh and you must go to the Peabody Museum on campus, you will love this place.

title: BEAUTIFUL
text: Harvard is a beautiful campass no matter what time of the year.
translated_text: Harvard is a beautiful campass no matter what time of the year.

title: Beautiful campus
text: Harvard is a great place to walk around and look at some beautiful buildings, historic statues, and large lawns.  The setting is really lovely.  The surrounding area of Harvard Square is a wonderful place to browse stores and have lunch or dinner at the nice variety of restaurants.
translated_text: Harvard is a great place to walk around and look at some beautiful buildings, historic statues, and large lawns.  The setting is really lovely.  The surrounding area of Harvard Square is a wonderful place to browse stores and have lunch or dinner at the nice variety of restaurants.

title: You Can't Not Go
text: It's Harvard for cripes sakes!  Gorgeous campus.  Harvard Sq. is eclectic and fun, offering great restaurants and hip stores.  Oh and don't forget John Harvard's for you beer lovers.  You won't want to leave.
translated_text: It's Harvard for cripes sakes!  Gorgeous campus.  Harvard Sq. is eclectic and fun, offering great restaurants and hip stores.  Oh and don't forget John Harvard's for you beer lovers.  You won't want to leave.

title: Historic
text: Harvard does a great job of making sure tourists as well as prospective students get a chance to see the University. There are certainly no frills but just the sheer size of the University and all of the history that goes along with is, makes a trip to Harvard worth it.
translated_text: Harvard does a great job of making sure tourists as well as prospective students get a chance to see the University. There are certainly no frills but just the sheer size of the University and all of the history that goes along with is, makes a trip to Harvard worth it.

title: At one time George Washington slept here !!
text:
General Washington borrowed Harvard Yard in July ,1775,to use as Americas first Army base during the 11 month long Siege of British occupied Boston. Washington filled the dorms and classrooms with his new US Army, and Martha came to live with the General. 
  Harvard U. was already 139 years old when the American Revolution began. 8 US Presidents have Harvard degrees.
translated_text:
General Washington borrowed Harvard Yard in July ,1775,to use as Americas first Army base during the 11 month long Siege of British occupied Boston. Washington filled the dorms and classrooms with his new US Army, and Martha came to live with the General. 
  Harvard U. was already 139 years old when the American Revolution began. 8 US Presidents have Harvard degrees.

title: A Fabulous Place!
text: The campus of Harvard is an exciting place to visit. You can sense that wonderful things are happening for students here. Walking around one sees history and hope for the future.
translated_text: The campus of Harvard is an exciting place to visit. You can sense that wonderful things are happening for students here. Walking around one sees history and hope for the future.

title: SUCKS........so badly...it's not funny
text:
Who the hell was the architect of Harvard??? It sucks! Ugly buildings, red-bricked walls everywhere....it feels like I'm in an abandoned factory in Europe where the windows are cracked (not in Harvard) and the buildings look soo old and unattended....

The only nice places are the Yard, the Dining hall (the one that looks like a Romanic church....yeah....are we in harry potter...?) and the Biology Building, which is my favortie, it has a beach volleyball court in the middle, and animals bas-relieves all over their walls representing different animals in Latin; and then two copper rhinos guarding the entrance and the doors are also sculpted with golden insects and such.
translated_text:

title: It's nice to be outside, they have chairs, uncomfortable tho...they could spend a lil' more on them after all the money

title: Look, but dont touch the statue of John Harvard!
text: History, beautiful architecture, and fantastic surroundings. This is a great day trip.

title: Historical Grounds Worth Visiting
text: So much history of great minds that have attended and movie fame shot right here on the campus of one of the most famous college campuses in the world.  If you are in the Boston area, you'll enjoy a visit to Harvard.  Beautiful brick buildings and a sprawling campus right in the heart of Cambridge make this a worthwhile visit for sure!

title: it's harvard.
text:
what can i say? 
most  visitors to boston want to and do visit harvard.  
i don't actually think it's all that special, there are plenty of other university campuses that are far more impressive.  i find harvard a bit underwhelming.  
but it's right off the t stop, and harvard square is a great, lively place to walk around, shop, and eat, SO... why not visit?

title: kinda interesting
text: I went on a self guided tour to the Harvard University Yard. A lot of "old" buildings with some history. It is a nice place to visit if one has not many things to do. But the Memorial Hall is a must. The design and architecture is very interesting and definitely worth seeing.

title: Harvard University is great
