title: Beautiful campus
text: We didn't take a tour, but simply walked around on campus and it was a lovely experience.  The Occupy Harvard tent and information area was out in the middle of Harvard Yard, but with few participants, and with college on winter break, it was a quiet and peaceful experience to roam the area.

title: Great, historical and beautiful university.
text: Well I work here, so I have to give it a great review! Honestly though, Harvard is an amazing place. If I were visting, Harvard would be on my list to see and take a tour. The history of Harvard is really interesting and they are doing unbelievably innovative things here. Everyone should walk through Harvard Yard at least once in their lifetime! Harvard Square is also known for great food (better than in Boston, I think) so grab a bite while you are here!

title: As of Dec 2011 - closed to public
text: Just want to let potential visitors that as of Nov or Dec 2011, Harvard Yard is mostly closed to the casual public.  Only Harvard University members (students, faculty, staff, etc.) are permitted to walk within the gates with photo ID.  I imagine if you're on a sanctioned campus tour, it's fine - but if you're just in the area and want to walk around for a few minutes, unfortunately it isn't permitted.

title: First thing u should do if u are a student
text: It really feels good when u are arrive in the harvard subway station and start looking at all of those people who are propably the next presidents, nobels etc, and just look like hurried kids..The place is inspiring and full of history, the walking tour they offer in Harvard square is worthy, specially if u are a student or if u like those american movies. It feels like you are a part of that for one day.

title: Worth a visit

title: Great visit to a historical institution
text: We spent an afternoon in Harvard Square and a couple of hours in Harvard University. Visit the Student Services office located across the street from Harvard and sign up for a free student-led guided tour of the University campus.  Our tour guide was very upbeat and told a few stories of the Universtiy's buildings, traditions, and great stories of the school.  The tour lasts about an hour, but it's a great way to learn a great deal about the school and history.

title: Harvard has so much history and character.
text: We are most impressed and pleased with the quality of education our children are recieving.  The feel of this place has such a rich feel of history.  The age and quality of the buildings and the architecture is amazing.  We were there right after the leaves had fallen off the trees and it was still beautiful.  We have to come back in the Spring and Fall.

We have to come back in the Spring and Fall.

title: A great day out with T.S.Elliot's room mate!
text: Our Freshman guide, Lenzo, really was terrific. We were the only people on his tour that day (which was free but voluntary donation is welcomed)but he showed no sign of disappointment at having to spend a couple of hours in the company of a pair of pensioners! Indeed he went out of his way to instill his enthusiasm for his university into us. He did the whole tour walking backwards while talking to us about the buildings we were looking at. He had many anecdotes to share which made the tour interesting and fun, including the fact that he was living in T.S. Elliot's old dorm - how cool is that!

He had many anecdotes to share which made the tour interesting and fun, including the fact that he was living in T.S. Elliot's old dorm - how cool is that!

title: They locked the gates
text: Because of "Occupy Harvard" you could not get onto campus unless you had a valid student ID.  People come from all over the world to see this campus, and it was just a shame we had to walk all the way around to get to the museum and theatre were were attending.  There has to be a better way to police the encampment and keep the students safe but still let visitors see the campus during the day.

title: Cant get in there

title: A must to see
text: You sense the atmosphere of intellect and culture and amibition
translated_text: You sense the atmosphere of intellect and culture and amibition

title: OK
text: Some really interesting nooks and crannies, but Oxford/Cambridge it ain't. Oldest buildings of some interest, otherwise pretty utilitarian.
translated_text: Some really interesting nooks and crannies, but Oxford/Cambridge it ain't. Oldest buildings of some interest, otherwise pretty utilitarian.

title: Pretty spot - interesting history
text: We took a bus from Boston to Cambridge and stopped right outside the Harvard University Information Centre on Mass. Ave. A tour of Harvard Yard was just about to start so we joined on. The tour is free, but a donation is requested. The tour lasted for over an hour and was conducted by one of the students, Emily. She was a very good presenter and told us lots of interesting facts and stories about the history of the university and its buildings, as well as her experiences as a student there. Her enthusiasm for the university was infectious. Harvard Yard itself is a beautiful spot, but the tour brought it all to life, with explanations of what happens where, and who does what. We weren't really expecting to do the tour, but we were so glad we did. If you are visiting Harvard, try to get on a tour - it's much more informative and entertaining than the self-guided brochure.
translated_text: We took a bus from Boston to Cambridge and stopped right outside the Harvard University Information Centre on Mass. Ave. A tour of Harvard Yard was just about to start so we joined on. The tour is free, but a donation is requested. The tour lasted for over an hour and was conducted by one of the students, Emily. She was a very good presenter and told us lots of interesting facts and stories about the history of the university and its buildings, as well as her experiences as a student there. Her enthusiasm for the university was infectious. Harvard Yard itself is a beautiful spot, but the tour brought it all to life, with explanations of what happens where, and who does what. We weren't really expecting to do the tour, but we were so glad we did. If you are visiting Harvard, try to get on a tour - it's much more informative and entertaining than the self-guided brochure.

title: A famous University to visit
text:
This is a university campus you must visit because of all the prestigious that Harvard has. You will see the statues and historic buildings that made it famous.

You can easily take the subway from Boston to Cambridge, there is an specific stop at Harvard University. There are many gift stores and restaurants in the area to enjoy as well. You can also tour the areas around the campus which are easily accessible by walking.

You can easily take the subway from Boston to Cambridge, there is an specific stop at Harvard University. There are many gift stores and restaurants in the area to enjoy as well. You can also tour the areas around the campus which are easily accessible by walking.

title: Great Afternoon lounging and enjoying Harvard Square
text: With an afternoon to spare I decided to bring the family to Harvard. I figured with 12 year old twins they may be inspired to work harder at school when we got home. Harvard square is a great little trendy area to enjoy a Java and kick back. We sat in a park and just people watched. If Harvard is stressful you sure couldn't tell by hanging out. Spent 3 hours just roaming around campus and I'd recommend for anyone looking for a relaxing afternoon in Boston. Kids enjoyed many of the shops and appreciated the institution.

Harvard square is a great little trendy area to enjoy a Java and kick back. We sat in a park and just people watched. If Harvard is stressful you sure couldn't tell by hanging out. Spent 3 hours just roaming around campus and I'd recommend for anyone looking for a relaxing afternoon in Boston. Kids enjoyed many of the shops and appreciated the institution.

title: Check it out!
text: An interesting place to walk around and explore. Looks like it does in the movies :)  SOme good places to eat around and very lively area on the weekends in the evening.
translated_text: An interesting place to walk around and explore. Looks like it does in the movies :)  SOme good places to eat around and very lively area on the weekends in the evening.

title: The center of "Capitalism"
text: Take a tour of Harvard Yard and shop at the coop. Make sure to eat at a local restaurant to get the flavor of a great school.
translated_text: Take a tour of Harvard Yard and shop at the coop. Make sure to eat at a local restaurant to get the flavor of a great school.

title: Good Academics, Bad Attitude
text: The academics and opportunities are unbeatable, but there is a bit of an elitist air (I hate to say it) and they don't treat medical leave students well.
translated_text: The academics and opportunities are unbeatable, but there is a bit of an elitist air (I hate to say it) and they don't treat medical leave students well.

title: The "free" tour was good, it just wasn't free
text:
A good day trip from Boston on the subway, especially if you have an interest in higher education. The museum of natural history had some pretty good exhibits on glass flowers, minerals, evolution and such things. Art museum was ok.

The "free tour" advertised and run by Harvard undergraduate students was quite good, however it should more accurately be described as a "tip-only" tour. Everyone was expected to tip $10 each (or $20 for family) - this sounds like a scam, but give the tipping culture, is actually not that out of place in USA.

Our guide regaled us with interesting facts and history about the university, the town, and of course the famous students that studied at harvard over the years.
translated_text:
A good day trip from Boston on the subway, especially if you have an interest in higher education. The museum of natural history had some pretty good exhibits on glass flowers, minerals, evolution and such things. Art museum was ok.

The "free tour" advertised and run by Harvard undergraduate students was quite good, however it should more accurately be described as a "tip-only" tour. Everyone was expected to tip $10 each (or $20 for family) - this sounds like a scam, but give the tipping culture, is actually not that out of place in USA.

Our guide regaled us with interesting facts and history about the university, the town, and of course the famous students that studied at harvard over the years.

title: An oasis
text: When you walk through Cambridge, people and traffic are everywhere.  Then you enter Harvard Yard--quiet, interesting architecture, and a chance to see where higher education began in the United States.  You can stroll at your leisure.
translated_text: When you walk through Cambridge, people and traffic are everywhere.  Then you enter Harvard Yard--quiet, interesting architecture, and a chance to see where higher education began in the United States.  You can stroll at your leisure.

title: Must see
text: This is a must see place in Boston, plus plenty of places to eat.
translated_text: This is a must see place in Boston, plus plenty of places to eat.

title: Very impressive!
text:
We took the guided tour offered, given by students of the university.  There was about 50 people in our group, but since the tour is mostly outside, it didn't feel crowded.  From what I understand the group was large compared to what they usually get, it was the high season.  The student spoke loudly and clearly, and was quite amusing.  It was very interesting to hear about each of the building - the tour wasn't as much about the history of Harvard as what happens in each building today, and how life is on campus.  The guide was quite candid in answering questions about why he thinks he got in, how much it cost each year, etc., but would preface every answer by making it clear that it was his own experience.

The tour lasted about an hour and it was interesting throughout.  It is free, but the students are not paid, so the only money they make is from the tips that they get.  We gave our tour guide $10.

title: Not a lot to see
text: Not really a place to take teenagers.  The Coop bookshop was excellent but the area whilst architecturally ok is not really of interest to teenage boys. The clothes shops were! If you are staying in Boston I would use your time there.

title: Iconic Institution-a Classic!!
text: While in Boston I stopped in Cambridge to visit Harvard. Wow!! I have been to other Ivy League schools, and this was the most impressive. The old Buildings of red brick just scream history as you look at them. It's a very calm campus. It was fun to walk and see where great historic people and events took place. Spent a couple of hours and enjoyed it. Great place for pics. When in Boston-go check out Harvard. It's a great experience.

The old Buildings of red brick just scream history as you look at them. It's a very calm campus. It was fun to walk and see where great historic people and events took place. Spent a couple of hours and enjoyed it. Great place for pics. When in Boston-go check out Harvard. It's a great experience.

title: Very historic... a lovely campus
text:
During vacation times, campus tours are offered to visitors. ¬†Times and information are easy to find on Harvard's website ¬†Unfortunately we arrived a week after these finished for the summer and therefore had to make our own way around. ¬†There is however a very good self guided audio tour and map to download from the Harvard website and I would highly recommend doing this before your visit as you will get so much more out of it. ¬†The best tube to get to is Harvard on the red line and the university is just across the road.
Once in the campus, to be honest there is virtually nothing you can go inside of, the university only allows you to walk around outside. ¬†As long as you keep this in mind and appreciate the exterior of the buildings and the squares you will enjoy your visit.
Some buildings not to be missed are the Memorial Hall, the Henry Widener library, the church opposite the library and the John Harvard statue. It's certainly an area to spend some time in, as the buildings are beautiful and very historic. It's a very calm atmosphere to walk around and you could easily spend an hour or 2 appreciating the history.

title: OK, but not great
text: Took the guided tour of Harvard this morning and the guided tour of MIT this afternoon.  The Harvard tour was OK but all we really saw were the dormitory buildings in Harvard Square.  These were the original classrooms back in the day.  The tour was good if you're interested in the history of Harvard, not so good if you want to know about the school today.  The MIT tour on the other hand was excellent.  They went into both the history of the school as well as the current curriculum.  Both schools are in Cambridge, two stops away from each other on the subway.  Both schools have plentry of places to eat lunch and both sell cool stuff in their book store.

title: VERY INTERESTING AND MOTIVATING
text: Great visit and tour guided by one of the students. This is a free tour and you should not miss it.  The tour begins across from the University in a gallery

title: Great tour of Harvard University
text:
We took a 10:30 tour of Harvard university led by a Harvard student Eddy. Wow! It was great! Eddy was fun and interesting to listen to. He provided the group with interesting historical facts as well as some funny stories. The tour lasted 90 min and covered a lot of the campus. Unfortunately we didn't go inside any of the halls. But we thoroughly enjoyed the tour.
The tour is free of charge (surprise!) but tips are greatly encouraged. In fact, after such a wonderful tour we wanted to show our appreciation anyway.

title: Magnificent
text:
Was staying in boston and decided to take a short drive over for a view of the renowned harvard campus.

Many of the buildings/infrastructure had such a history to it as evidenced by the design, carvings, material of the building etc. Being able to take a drive through the campus was also a great experience, especially when harvard is a ground for many of the brilliant minds of this world. 

What struck me most was that Harvard had a kind of a city centre for itself and seems very much like a warm, close knitted community.

A truly remarkable experience and makes me wanna study all over again.

title: Great walking tour by the students
text:
Hi

We were visiting Boston over 5th to 8th July and took the metro to Harvard Uni thinking we would just have a quick wander around with the aid of our guidebook. As we came out of the station there were some harvard students milling around in their distinctive t shirts. Asked if we would like to join the tips only walking tour we decided to do just that. Best idea of the day! Our guide was a third year government law student who was full of enthusiasum, anecdotes, history and a blast to be with. The tour last about 1 1/2 hours and was pretty hard-paced, but you saw such a lot and learnt far more than you would from the guidebooks. Highly recommended. They suggest $10 per person and we were more than happy to hand over our $20 dollars at the end. The tour ends at the student gift shop which is run by the students and all profits are ploughed back into helping students. Prices were very reasonable - much cheaper than in Boston and I managed to get a uni hoodie for my daughter (who is off to uni in the UK soon) for about $15 dollars cheaper than I had saw in Boston. Around the gift shop there are plenty of places to eat and we had a late lunch at a great student pub, again very reasonable.

If you only have a short time to see Harvard I would definitely recommend this walking tour.

title: Harvard U-must see!
text: We toured Harvard University in Cambridge with a university student for FREE! The tour lasts about an hour and gives you great insight into Harvard's long storied past. Just sign up at the student center. Tours run throughout the day.The university is a short subway ride from downtown Boston. You can then have a bite to eat anywhere in the area-lots to chose from. It's a must see attraction.

title: A lot of history but still just a college campus...

Cool to wander through the university but after a while it looks like most college campuses. 

It is a large campus so we recommed you decide what you'd like to see first then head over there.

title: Beautiful school with lots of history
text:
We took a tour led by students working for a Harvard store. They were easy to spot with their "Hahvahd" shirts and energy. They took us on a quick, lively tour of the school. We enjoyed the humor and energy of the students. 

Please note that this is not a "free" tour, but runs on tips and is basically a sales pitch for the store, which is where the tour ends; however if you just want a quick tour, this is the one to go on.

title: Be sure to visit not only the old-yard! Several other places of H great too.
text: Most tourists visit only the Harvard old-yard (around Harvard Hall and the freshman housing), either via the Hahvahd/Harvard tour or by themselves. Make sure you visit also the Memorial Hall (dining hall Freshman) at the rear entrance (front entrance only for H-students), the Harvard Museum of Natural History and one of the Harvard Art Museums. If you have time left, stroll via Adam's House / Quincy house towards the Charles River and bring a visit to the Harvard Business School campus. You are able to enter most of the buildings, for instance the Bloomberg Library with a small exhibition. Just orientate more instead of only the old-year with the squirrels.

You are able to enter most of the buildings, for instance the Bloomberg Library with a small exhibition. Just orientate more instead of only the old-year with the squirrels.

title: High energy tour...great for tweens and teens!
text: We highly recommend the "Hahvahd" Tour guided by Harvard students. ¬†Our girls, especially, appreciated the humor and interesting tidbits from these very enthusiastic tour guides! It's fast paced...and, at least on our tour, we didn't enter any buildings which was a disappointment for me...but just fine with my tweenage kids.  Fun trivia and some history without spending an entire day (which I would have loved as well!)

title: Tour of Harvard University - A must!
text: On our recent vacation to Boston, we wanted to have our high school aged daughter take a look at Harvard's campus. We took the subway to Harvard and fully intended to merely walk around the campus on our own. As soon as we exited the subway station we were greeted by three delightful Harvard students advertising their "Hahvahd tour". They were so humourous that we decided to go along with it. Fee is by donation only and lasts approximately 1 1/2 hours. We had a blast! I am SOOOO glad that we went on this tour. Gabrielle was our guide and she was wonderful! My father graduated from Harvard many moons ago and I thought I knew many stories. Gabrielle gave us so much of harvard's history that the general public just does not know. She presented the entire tour as a 'story teller' and really made it all come to life. (I know she said she was an "English concentrator", but she sure has a knack for public speaking!) We came home telling my father stories that not even 'he' did not know! The history behind the library is truly a great one. If you plan on going to Cambridge to see Harvard, excuse me..."Hahvahd",  you MUST take this tour. Cambridge and Harvard are beautiful areas....close to a big city...small town atmosphere....intellectual vibe....benches, parks, birds singing. Nice.

title: The Most Student Friendly City
text:
A stay in Boston is incomplete without a visit to Harvard University, Freedom Trail, Prudential Towers and the Harvard Museum of Natural History.

My visit to Harvard University turned out to be very different in a decidedly intellectual way. The first stop was the Harvard Business School. To walk in the corridors of the world‚Äôs Best Business School is a totally awe inspiring experience that takes you back in time. 

Within the Harvard campus, I stumbled upon a stone edict dating back to 1636!

Next, I hopped across Charles over the Pedestrian Bridge from HBS into Cambridge which led me to Harvard Square. 

Harvard Square is an ideal weekend getaway for students from both Harvard and MIT. And if you get hungry due to the walk, what could be more irresistible than a hot bowl of soup with rich Indian spices at the Bombay Club that I found cuddled in a corner of JFK Street.

title: Wandering the Unviersity Campus
text: Wandering around the Cambridge campus of Harvard is a pleasant way to get from one end of Cambridge to another.  The architecture is impressive (although now an amalgam of old and new buildings and styles), and on a good day, sitting on the lawn in front of the Widener Library playing with the squirrels is a stress reducing activity.  It's one of the top universities in the world, and does have that traditional 'sandstone' feel about it.  Because it is a university populated by students though, you might also see some odd sights, as we did the day we were there in January. The sun was out, and the sky was blue, and there was a group of three women in bikinis on the lawn.  Mind you, the temperature was about 3 degrees celsius at the time, so I'm not sure if they were on a dare, and I am sure they wouldn't have stayed there for very long!   Because the campus is so spread out, it's probably not a typical 'tourist' destination, but I would recommend wandering through the campus instead of walking around it if you get the chance.

title: Sch√∂nes Universit√§tsgel√§nde
text:
Sehr sch√∂nes Universit√§tsgel√§nde mit dem Spirit einer Top-Universtit√§t. Harvard geh√∂rt zur sog. Ivy League (= 8 Eliteuniversi√§ten in den USA), denn die Alumni dieser Universit√§t erhielten mit inzwischen > 160 Nobelpreise, mehr Auszeichnungen als Abg√§nger anderer Hochschulen.

Leider mit dem Auto als "Tourist" schlecht erreichbar, da sehr ung√ºnstige Parkplatzsituation um das gesamte Gel√§nde - d.h. lieber etwas weiter wegparken und zu Fu√ü hingehen.
translated_text:
Very beautiful university campus with the spirit of a top university. Harvard belongs to the so-called Ivy League (= 8 elite universities in the USA), because the alumni of this university have received more awards than graduates of other universities, with > 160 Nobel Prizes.

Unfortunately, it is difficult to reach by car as a "tourist", as the parking situation around the entire campus is very unfavorable - i.e. it is better to park a little further away and walk there.

translated_text:
In mid-November, the leaves have already started to change color on campus and it is very beautiful.
It is convenient to drive, but I think it is more convenient to take the underground to Harvard Station. The subway is very quiet outside of commuting hours.
As you can see in the photo, the red and yellow leaves of the trees against the green of the lawn matched the marble and brick buildings, and it was very nice.
There are also squirrels on campus, who sometimes show up to entertain us.
Please note that on holidays and during late hours, you will be asked to show your ID at the gate.

title: Tr√®s int√©ressant
text: Juste promener dans le campus est un exp√©rience en soi. L'architecture des b√¢timents historiques est vraiment superbe. Le campus √©tait quasiment vide car nous y sommes all√©s en Juillet. Cela doit √™tre impressionnant de le visiter en p√©riode universitaire.
translated_text: Just walking around the campus is an experience in itself. The architecture of the historic buildings is truly superb. The campus was almost empty as we were there in July. It must be impressive to visit during university time.

title: un giro nella prestigiosa harvard
text: il campus √® molto grande, tuttavia non so se mi sia perso qualcosa, ma di fatto non si pu√≤ entrare nella stragrande maggioranza degli edifici (come visitatori, quindi non studenti o affiliati); si nota comunque la grande internazionalit√†, con studenti, famiglie e visitatori da ogni parte del mondo; del resto √® una delle universit√† migliori del mondo e non potrebbe essere altrimenti, oltre che la pi√π antica degli stati uniti; ho visitato il museo di storia naturale di cui scriver√≤ una recensione a parte; l'universit√† √® a cambridge che √® una citt√† teoricamente separata da boston, anche se il campus √® facilmente raggiungibile impiegando circa 20 minuti di metro rossa dal boston common; diciamo che merita un giro pi√π per il nome che per altro
translated_text: the campus is very large, however I don't know if I missed something, but in fact you can't enter the vast majority of the buildings (as visitors, so not students or affiliates); however, you can see the great internationality, with students, families and visitors from all over the world; after all, it is one of the best universities in the world and it couldn't be otherwise, as well as the oldest in the united states; I visited the natural history museum of which I will write a separate review; the university is in cambridge, which is a city theoretically separate from boston, although the campus is easily reached by taking about 20 minutes on the red subway from boston common; let's just say it's worth a tour more for the name than anything else

title: Emouvant
text: Quelle classe. On y revoit des films. On pense √† Harry Widener noy√© dans le Titanic, tristesse en voyant la biblioth√®que qui porte son nom. Biblioth√®que fig√©e dans le temps; elle ne peut pas s‚Äôagrandir. C‚Äôest le deal.
translated_text: What class. You see movies again. We think of Harry Widener drowned in the Titanic, sad to see the library that bears his name. A library frozen in time; it can't grow. That's the deal.

title: Inimitable
text:
Une universit√© √† l'ancienne.
Harry Potter y serait parfaitement √† l'aise.
Superbes b√¢timents de briques.
Il y en a un fait par Le Corbusier, mais √ßa d√©tonne vraiment dans le d√©cor.

An old-fashioned university.
Harry Potter would fit right in.

translated_text: For those of us who have heard of it often, it was an intriguing university campus for me. We joined the Boston tour just to see this place. Touching the shoe of the statue of J. Harvard has become a ritual for visiting students and parents. It is believed to bring good luck in education. There are historical buildings. It's a beautiful campus.

ŒúœÄŒøœÅŒµŒØœÑŒµ ŒΩŒ± œáŒ±Œ∂ŒµœàŒµœÑŒµ œÑŒ∑ŒΩ œÄŒ±ŒΩŒµœÄŒπœÉœÑŒ∑ŒºŒπŒøœçœÄŒøŒªŒ∑ Œ±ŒΩŒ¨ŒºŒµœÉŒ± œÉœÑŒ± Œ¥Œ≠ŒΩœÑœÅŒ± Œ∫Œ±Œπ œÉœÑŒ± Œ¥œçŒø Œ∫ŒµŒΩœÑœÅŒπŒ∫Œ¨ Œ∫œÑŒØœÅŒπŒ± œÄŒøœÖ ŒµŒØŒΩŒ±Œπ Œ∑ memorial ŒµŒ∫Œ∫ŒªŒ∑œÉŒØŒ± Œ∫Œ±Œπ Œ∑ Œ≤ŒπŒ≤ŒªŒπŒøŒ∏ŒÆŒ∫Œ∑ Widener Œ±œÄŒø œåœÄŒøœÖ ŒºœÄŒøœÅŒµŒØœÑŒµ ŒΩŒ± œÑœÅŒ±Œ≤ŒÆŒæŒµœÑŒµ Œ∫Œ±œÑŒ±œÄŒªŒ∑Œ∫œÑŒπŒ∫Œ≠œÇ œÄŒ±ŒΩŒøœÅŒ±ŒºŒπŒ∫Œ≠œÇ œÜœâœÑŒøŒ≥œÅŒ±œÜŒØŒµœÇ œÑŒøœÖ œÄŒ±ŒΩŒµœÄŒπœÉœÑŒ∑ŒºŒØŒøœÖ.
translated_text: Founded in 1636, it is the oldest university in the United States. Among its most notable alumni are seven US presidents. You can zoom around the campus among the trees and the two main buildings which are the Memorial Church and the Widener Library from where you can take amazing panoramic photos of the university.

title: –ì–∞—Ä–≤–∞—Ä–¥—Å–∫–∏–π —É–Ω–∏–≤–µ—Ä—Å–∏—Ç–µ—Ç
translated_text: Why should a Russian tourist come to Cambridge, a suburb of Boston, a small town on the other side of the Charles River? First of all, to learn, and for some people to remember that American Cambridge is a different, not English Cambridge, and from this a little disappointed... Therefore, the phrase "we have been to Cambridge", on educated and trained listeners will not make a special impression, especially after specifying which Cambridge you have been to. However, you will have a trump card move in store when you say that you went to Cambridge to see Harvard! Now that's a different matter! The elite university is Cambridge's main attraction. After seeing several of the university's historic brick buildings, including Harvard Hall, the President's Office, and the University Memorial Church, you'll be able to say, "Well, we didn't graduate from Harvard, but we've been to Cambridge and seen how it works...". In fact, with the tour you will see from the outside a very small part of this giant elite university, a member of the "Ivy League", with more than two thousand teachers and seven thousand students. Its alumni include the largest number of billionaires in the United States.  There are now seven faculties, which we would call liberal arts. Exact and technical sciences at the respective faculties are studied at the famous Massachusetts Institute of Technology, located here in Cambridge.

title: Erfolgsschmiede...
text:
Unz√§hlbare Pers√∂nlichkeiten entwickelten sich auf dieser Uni. Es gibt auch vermutlich niemanden, der den Namen dieser Universit√§t nicht in irgendeinem Zusammenhang schon mal geh√∂rt hat. Dementsprechend ein MUSS f√ºr jeden Boston-Urlauber. 
Jetzt wird jeder, der bereits (mit kleinen Ausnahmen) deutsche Unis kennt, sagen: Was soll denn da sch√∂n sein? Aber die Antwort ist recht einfach: ALLES!
Ob wundersch√∂ne nostalgische Geb√§ude, die sauberen und strahlenden Gr√ºnfl√§chen oder die gesamte Historie, die sich hinter dieser Uni versteckt... Hier h√§tte auch ich vermutlich jeden Vorlesungstag mit Freude entgegengefiebert.
translated_text:
Countless personalities developed at this university. There is probably no one who has not heard the name of this university in some context. Accordingly, it is a MUST for every visitor to Boston.
Now anyone who already knows German universities (with a few exceptions) will say: What's so nice about it? But the answer is quite simple: EVERYTHING!
Whether it's the beautiful nostalgic buildings, the clean and shiny green spaces or the entire history hidden behind this university... I would probably have looked forward to every day of lectures here too.

title: El campus puede resultar un poco fr√≠o, se respira el aire elitista
text:
Visit√© Harvard durante mi visita a Boston. Es muy f√°cil llegar al campus en Metro.
Mi conclusi√≥n fue un poco decepcionante. No es factible ingresar a la enorme Biblioteca que tiene la entidad, ni a pr√°cticamente ninguno de los edificios.
No es un lugar muy amigable, los estudiantes est√°n en su propio clima y no registran a los visitantes.
He estado en otros campus mucho m√°s amigables (ej Trinity College en Dublin, los College en Oxford), no repetir√≠a ni aconsejar√≠a la visita.
translated_text:
I visited Harvard during my visit to Boston. It is very easy to get to the campus by Metro.
My conclusion was a bit disappointing. It is not feasible to enter the huge Library that the institution has, nor virtually any of the buildings.
It is not a very friendly place, the students are in their own climate and do not register visitors.
I have been to other much friendlier campuses (e.g. Trinity College in Dublin, the College at Oxford), I would not repeat or advise the visit.

title: Wissen ist sp√ºrbar
text: Da dies eine der besten Universit√§ten weltweit ist und schon sehr viele bekannte Pers√∂nlichkeiten hier studiert haben, sollte man unbedingt vorbei schauen. Von √ºberall zug√§nglich, kostenfrei und auch gut mit den √∂ffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln zu erreichen.
translated_text: As this is one of the best universities in the world and many well-known personalities have studied here, you should definitely stop by. Accessible from anywhere, free of charge and easy to reach by public transport.

title: Mythique
text:
Un endroit mythique m√™me s'il n'y a pas grand chose √† voir ! Juste y √™tre et s'y promener !
L'√©glise, la grande biblioth√®que n√©o-classique, le hall de la facult√© de science plus sans compter la statue de M.Harvard dont il faut toucher le pied pour la r√©ussite des examens...
L'entr√©e des b√¢timents est la plupart du temps interdite aux visiteurs.
translated_text:
A mythical place, even if there's not much to see! Just be there and walk around!
The church, the great neo-classical library, the science faculty hall plus the statue of Mr. Harvard whose foot you have to touch to pass your exams...
Most of the buildings are closed to visitors.

title: Qu√© bueno!!!!
text: Participamos con mi mujer del momento en que los nuevos estudiantes van a ocupar sus habitaciones para el ciclo lectivo 2019/2020, qu√© momento, qu√© emoci√≥n. Las familias llevando todo lo que sus hijos van a usar o necesitar... Estudiantes de niveles superiores recibi√©ndolos, con refrescos, recomendaciones, etc. Qu√© organizaci√≥n, que bienvenida!!!! Inolvidable...
translated_text: We participated with my wife in the moment when the new students are going to occupy their rooms for the 2019/2020 school year, what a moment, what an excitement. Families carrying everything that their children will use or need.... Upper level students welcoming them, with refreshments, recommendations, etc. What an organization, what a welcome!!!! Unforgettable...

title: Lugar incr√≠vel
text: A institui√ß√£o por si s√≥ j√° dispensa avalia√ß√µes, mas, n√£o tem como n√£o citar a arquitetura e a organiza√ß√£o de todo o complexo, que √© simplesmente espetacular.
translated_text: The institution itself is not worth mentioning, but the architecture and organization of the whole complex is simply spectacular.

title: Campus bajo la lluvia
text: Visitamos las instalaciones de la Universidad de Harvard bajo la lluvia pero de todas maneras pudimos admirar sus edificios, la famosa estatua de John Harvard e imaginarnos en las tantas pel√≠culas filmadas all√≠.
translated_text: We visited the Harvard University facilities in the rain but we could still admire its buildings, the famous statue of John Harvard and imagine ourselves in the many movies filmed there.

title: „Éú„Çπ„Éà„É≥„ÅÆÂ≠¶‰ºö„ÅÆÂêàÈñì„Å´
text: „Éú„Çπ„Éà„É≥„Åß„ÅÆÂ≠¶‰ºö„ÅÆÂêàÈñì„Å´„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶„Å´Ë°å„Åç„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Ç≠„É£„É≥„Éë„Çπ„ÅØ„Å®„Å¶„ÇÇÂ§ß„Åç„Åè„Å¶Á∑ëË±ä„Åã„ÅßÁ∂∫È∫ó„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇËøë„Åè„Å´„ÅØÁîüÂçî„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çä„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÈñ¢ÈÄ£„Ç∞„ÉÉ„Ç∫„Åå„Åü„Åè„Åï„Çì„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Ç∞„ÉÉ„ÉÑ„ÅØÂ≠ê‰æõÁî®„Åã„ÇâÂ§ß‰∫∫„Åæ„Åß‰Ωï„Åß„ÇÇÊèÉ„Å£„Å¶„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ
translated_text: I went to Harvard University in between conferences in Boston. The campus was very large, lush and beautiful. There is a co-op nearby and there were many Harvard related goods. They had everything from children's to adult goods.

title: Cen√°rio de v√°rios filmes
text: O campus √© cen√°rio de v√°rios filmes, lindeza de tirar o f√¥lego finalizada por esquilos subindo e descendo das √°rvores, para ‚Äúbrasileiro nenhum botar defeito ‚Äú!
translated_text: The campus is the setting for several films, breathtaking beauty finished off by squirrels climbing up and down the trees, for "no Brazilian to fault"!

title: Incre√≠ble el campus y la vida que tiene el lugar
text: Pod√©s ir hasta Harvard sin problemas, no hay mucho lugar para estacionar adentro, asi que dejaria el auto un poco mas lejos y caminar. Hay 2 partes, la de postgrados que es lindo, pero nos gust√≥ mucho m√°s el campus de grado, con parque, un peque√±o puente, mucho mas vida. Fuimos un s√°bado por lo que habia mucha gente haciendo deporte y visitando, muy recomendable.
translated_text: You can go to Harvard without problems, there is not much parking inside, so I would leave the car a little further away and walk. There are 2 parts, the graduate campus is nice, but we liked the undergraduate campus much more, with a park, a small bridge, much more life. We went on a Saturday so there were a lot of people playing sports and visiting, highly recommended.

title: Fonte do Saber
text: Caminhar pelos jardins de Harvard √© inspirador. Esse lugar com quase 400 anos de ensino e por onde diversos l√≠deres mundiais j√° passaram, √© uma visita imperd√≠vel para quem visita Cambridge.
translated_text: Walking through Harvard Gardens is inspiring. This place with almost 400 years of teaching and where several world leaders have passed through, is a must-see for anyone visiting Cambridge.

title: Viaggio USA settembre 19
text: Ho visitato il campus dell'Harvard University √®  stata una esperienza bellissima vedere quanti studenti da tutto il mondo sono presenti. Se avete tempo ne vale veramente la pena consigliatissima. Anche al MIT veramente fantastico.
translated_text: I visited the campus of Harvard University it was a wonderful experience to see how many students from all over the world are there. If you have time it is really worth it highly recommended. Also at MIT really great.

title: Nova escola
text: Fomos conhecer a universidade de Harvard. Os jardins s√£o bem amplos, tem diversos pr√©dios. Como est√°vamos na √©poca de natal o clima n√£o estava dos melhores e os granados estavam com um pouco de neve. No ver√£o a paisagem deve ser muito mais bonita!
translated_text: We went to see Harvard University. The gardens are very large and there are several buildings. As it was Christmas time, the weather wasn't the best and the garnets had a bit of snow on them. In summer the landscape should be much more beautiful!

title: Impressionnant
text: Nous y sommes all√©s sans grande conviction mais avons √©t√© charm√©s par les b√¢timents majestueux et l'immensit√© du campus. √Ä faire par beau temps car on ne peut entrer dans les b√¢timents.
translated_text: We went without much conviction, but were charmed by the majestic buildings and the vastness of the campus. To be done in good weather, as you can't get inside the buildings.

title: Leuke buurt en mooie campus
text: Gelegen in cambridge ligt de harvard campus. Je kan er niet veel doen maar het is mooi om te zien. Je kan via de app je eigen tour doen en ondanks dat je niet echt ergens in mag zijn veel gebouwen en lokalen open. Loop ook even naar het business gedeelte aan de andere kant van de rivier. Bij grendels denn kan je goedkoop en lekker eten en drinken bij happy hour
translated_text: Located in cambridge is the harvard campus. You can't do much there but it is nice to see. You can use the app to do your own tour and even though you are not really allowed in anything many buildings and classrooms are open. Also take a walk to the business section on the other side of the river. At grendels denn you can eat and drink cheap and good at happy hour.

title: Harward
text: En anrik och sp√§nnande milj√∂ som var b√•de kul och intressant att bes√∂ka. V√§dret bj√∂d dock p√• - 12 grader och bl√•st vilket vilket bidrog till att vi ska √•ka tillbaka hit under varmare √•rstider. Vi fick muta barnen med DD.
translated_text: An ancient and exciting environment that was both fun and interesting to visit. However, the weather offered - 12 degrees and windy which contributed to the fact that we will go back here in warmer seasons. We had to bribe the children with DD.

title: Recorrido Historico
text: Dar un paseo por el recorrido hist√≥rico de Harvard es hermoso. El campus hermoso, lleno de historia y todo el mundo super amable. Fuimos sin tour y la verdad igual lo disfrutamos.
translated_text: Taking a walk through Harvard's historic tour is beautiful. The campus is beautiful, full of history and everyone is super friendly. We went without a tour and really enjoyed it anyway.

title: Universidad hist√≥rica
text: Harvard University... una de las mejores y m√°s famosas universidades del mundo mundial... la mas antigua de USA. Centro cultural, educacional e hist√≥rico... un paseo de varias horas. Puedes tomar un tour guiado por alumnos. Se llega f√°cilmente en metro, linea roja .... o caminando desde Boston, cruzando alg√∫n puente sobre el Charles River. Un imperdible para gente educada...
translated_text: Harvard University... one of the best and most famous universities in the world... the oldest in the USA. Cultural, educational and historical center ... a walk of several hours. You can take a tour guided by students. Easily reached by subway, red line .... or walking from Boston, crossing a bridge over the Charles River. A must-see for educated people...

title: Un buen paseo por la academia
text: Es f√°cil llegar desde Boston. Se puede acceder solo al campus (a los edificios solo con credencial, excepto a la iglesia). Un paseo para 20 minutos
translated_text: Easy to get to from Boston. Access to campus only (buildings by credential only, except for the church). A 20-minute walk

title: Majestosa
text:
No centro de Cambridge, Harvard √© um sonho.
√â poss√≠vel adquirir um city tour nas proximidades e vale muito a pena. A biblioteca √© fantastica!
translated_text:
In the center of Cambridge, Harvard is a dream.
You can buy a city tour nearby and it's well worth it. The library is fantastic!

title: Familia
text: Passeio obrigat√≥ria desde sempre. Para todos os gostos. Para entender melhor contrate um aluno e aproveite melhor. O museu √© √∫nico e de gra√ßa.
translated_text: It's always been a must. For all tastes. To understand it better, hire a student and enjoy it more. The museum is unique and free.

title: CUNA DE MENTES BRILLANTES!!
text: La gran Universidad de USA y del mundo, cuna de grandes cientificos, economistas, y mentes brillantes del universo. Visitar todo el campus, con los distintos edificios tanto los habitaciones como los que contienen las aulas es muy grato. Me impresiono ver la primer computadora que existi√≥, una mole de IBM del tama√±o de una habitaci√≥n. Como ser√° el orden que existe que hasta una policia propia tienen.
translated_text: The great University of the USA and the world, cradle of great scientists, economists, and brilliant minds of the universe. Visiting the entire campus, with the different buildings, both the rooms and those containing the classrooms, is very pleasant. I was impressed to see the first computer that ever existed, an IBM computer the size of a room. How is the order that exists that they even have their own police force.

title: Le coeur des universit√©s mondiales
text: Dans un campus assez resserr√©, de nombreux endroits remarquables comme l'√©glise (non confessionnelle), la grande biblioth√®que n√©o-classique, le hall de la facult√© de science avec le plus ancien ordinateur IBM... sans compter la statue de Harvard dont il faut aller toucher le pied pour r√©ussir ses examens...
translated_text: On a tightly-packed campus, there are many places of note, such as the (non-denominational) church, the large neo-classical library, the science faculty hall with the oldest IBM computer... not to mention the Harvard statue whose foot you have to touch to pass your exams...

title: Deludente
text:
Passare per Boston e non andare ad Harward √® praticamente impossibile.
Quando ci si arriva, per√≤, soprattutto se si √® gi√† visitata Georgetown a Washington DC o le britanniche Oxford e Cambridge, √® altrettanto impossibile non rimanere delusi.
Da visitare con il sole, ha ampi prati, tra un edificio e l'altro, ma nessuno di essi √® architettonicamente rilevante.
La sua fama √® superiore alla sua forma.
translated_text:
Going through Boston and not going to Harward is virtually impossible.
When you get there, however, especially if you have already visited Georgetown in Washington DC or Britain's Oxford and Cambridge, it is equally impossible not to be disappointed.
Best visited in the sunshine, it has wide lawns, between buildings, but none of them architecturally significant.
Its fame is greater than its form.

title: una visita muy buena para incorporar
text: Nos atendieron de primera, nos hicieron un tour dentro de la universidad y nos explicaron todo, luego visitamos las aulas y todos los lugares del predio
translated_text: They gave us a tour of the university and explained everything to us, then we visited the classrooms and all the places on the campus.

title: Incontournable mais d√©cevant
text: Rien de sp√©cial √† voir une fois sur place, juste y √™tre. Des travaux g√¢chent un peu la vue. Un petit tour, quelques clich√©s sur les marches de la biblioth√®que et puis s'en va. M√™me les 2 boutiques de souvenirs trouv√©es aux abords sont peu engageantes.
translated_text: Nothing special to see once there, just to be there. Work is spoiling the view. A quick tour, a few shots on the steps of the library and off you go. Even the 2 souvenir stores on the outskirts of the building are a bit uninviting.

title: Un istituzione
text: Una volta arrivato a Boston credo sia impossibile non visitare Harvard, l'universit√† pi√π famosa ed importante nel mondo. La visita pu√≤ essere effettuata da soli o accompagnati da matricole al prezzo di 10$ circa. Noi abbiamo effettuato la visita con uno studente molto simpatico, capace di intrattenervi per tutto il tempo a patto che capiate molto bene l'inglese in quanto gli Americani parlano molto veloce ed a Boston mangiano un po' le parole. La visita √® stata molto piacevole, l'atmosfera all'interno del campus √® incredibile. Se dovessi valutare solamente il luogo darei sicuramente il massimo del punteggio ma ci sono state delle cose che non sono piaciute: partendo dal fatto che siamo nell'universit√† pi√π prestigiosa del mondo e che gli studenti, anche quelli '' meno facoltosi''' provengono da classi molto agiate della societ√†, trovo assurdo il continuo far riferimento al gift shop e alle mance da dover lasciare agli studenti che vi accompagnano.
translated_text: Once you arrive in Boston I think it is impossible not to visit Harvard, the most famous and important university in the world. The visit can be done on your own or accompanied by freshmen for about $10. We made the visit with a very nice student, able to entertain you the whole time as long as you understand English very well as Americans speak very fast and in Boston they eat their words a bit. The visit was very pleasant, the atmosphere inside the campus is incredible. If I had to evaluate only the place I would definitely give it top marks but there were some things that I did not like: starting with the fact that we are in the most prestigious university in the world and that the students, even the '' less wealthy'' ones come from very affluent classes of society, I find absurd the constant reference to the gift shop and the tips you have to leave for the students accompanying you.

title: Un mito!

title: Imprescindible visita en Boston
text: Merece la pena ir a Harvard solo por tantas pel√≠culas que hemos visto al respecto. Es un paseo agradable y llegar en metro desde Boston es muy f√°cil. El ambiente por la noche en los alrededores tambi√©n es digno de ver.

Muito agrad√°vel conhecer um pouquinho desse mundo dos feras... e tem muito mais... tour guiado por um aluno, biblioteca e mesmo o caminhar sozinho e descobrir cada lugarzinho.
translated_text: As with the whole region, inside the gates of the university, the tour gives you a huge desire to observe the dynamics of the students coming and going from the buildings, reading in the chairs scattered around the lawn, the tiny accommodation and the many tourists taking photos. It's very pleasant to get to know a little bit of this world of beasts... and there's much more... a student-guided tour, the library and even walking around on your own and discovering every little place.

title: Sensaciones

translated_text: I flew into Boston airport and my first stop was the University.... It took me a while to take a picture of the Harvard statue, touching its feet. The old buildings give off an atmosphere that I've never seen in the West. They make great backdrops for photos.

title: Visite Harvard avec Boston le nez en l‚Äôair
text: Il serait dommage de ne pas  visiter le campus de Harvard lorsque l‚Äôon visite Boston. translated_text: It would be a shame not to visit the Harvard campus when visiting Boston. Doing so with Valentine was essential, as the buildings can't be visited without explanations. Valentine is a friendly guide who gave us plenty of information about studying in the USA and the requirements for admission to this prestigious university.

title: Quanto avrei voluto studiare l√¨
text:
Un complesso di edifici, alcuni dei quali di grande profilo storico, si susseguono in questo che sembra un paesino di altri tempi con una dimensione a s√© rispetto al resto della citt√†. Mentre attraversavo il campus il mio pensiero ricorrente era che mi sarebbe piaciuto tanto poter studiare l√¨. Poter entrare nella grande biblioteca del campus , il cui ingresso √® permesso solo agli studenti o comunque al personale universitario, e perdermi in quelle enormi stanze.
Consiglio una visita, anche in solitaria, non √® necessaria la guida.
translated_text:
A complex of buildings, some of them of great historical profile, line this seemingly small town from another time with a dimension of its own compared to the rest of the city. As I walked through the campus my recurring thought was that I would have loved to be able to study there. To be able to enter the large campus library , whose entrance is allowed only to students or at any rate university staff, and get lost in those huge rooms.
I recommend a visit, even on my own; no guide is necessary.

title: icono
text: vale la pena visitarla ya que ademas de ser un icono mundial es un parque y unas construcciones muy lindas. comodo de llegar

Seeing the parents and students complete the necessary items for their rooms, from fans to pillows, was very moving. Seeing the upperclassmen welcome the new students with refreshments, donnats, water, juices and so on was very impressive. It is an excellent University.

The surroundings are really interesting, with more historic buildings, good caf√©s and bookshops. For those interested in getting to know it, the first week of September there are several graduations and many new students. Various parties and celebrations in the square.

title: Storia
text: Sicuramente una delle pi√π famose universit√† del mondo, se si passa da Boston non pu√≤ mancare una passeggiata all'interno del campus. Un po' fuori dal centro ma con la fermata della metro proprio davanti all'ingresso principale

We visited Harvard with my family.

 What campus life is like

title: Flotte bygninger
text: Bes√∏kte Harvard for √• se campus. Flotte bygninger og mye historie. Da vi bes√∏kte stedet var det starten p√• sommerskole, med mye aktivitet.

title: Visita tur√≠stica obligada

text:

title: Int√©ressant
text:
M√™me si on ne peut pas p√©n√©trer dans les b√¢timents, une balade √† travers le Harvard Yard permet de se faire une id√©e de la puissance et de l‚Äôinfluence de cette universit√©. Les plus vieux b√¢timents ont 300 ans et ont abrit√© les troupes de George Washington, mais on peut aussi admirer la seule ≈íuvre de Le Corbusier en Am√©rique du Nord (le Carpenter Center for Visual Arts) ou la belle extension du Harvard Mus√©um of Arts que l‚Äôon doit √† Renzo Piano.
Plus de 100 nationalit√©s sont repr√©sent√©es sur le campus qui a abrit√© plus de 60 prix Nobel.
La qualit√© des √©quipements, la richesse du patrimoine, la diversit√© des disciplines enseign√©es et des laboratoires d√©montrent la sup√©riorit√© du syst√®me √©tasunien de recherche et d‚Äôenseignement sup√©rieur.
De m√™me, la visite de la Coop, le magasin de produits d√©riv√©s g√©r√© par les √©tudiants, est assez √©difiante.
translated_text:
Even if you can't get inside the buildings, a stroll through Harvard Yard gives you an idea of the power and influence of this university. The oldest buildings are 300 years old and once housed George Washington's troops, but you can also admire Le Corbusier's only work of art in North America (the Carpenter Center for Visual Arts) or Renzo Piano's beautiful extension to the Harvard Museum of Arts.
More than 100 nationalities are represented on the campus, which has been home to more than 60 Nobel Prize winners.
The quality of the facilities, the richness of the heritage, the diversity of the disciplines taught and the laboratories demonstrate the superiority of the American system of research and higher education.
A visit to the Coop, the student-run merchandising store, is equally edifying.

title: Bello campus
text:

title: Une exp√©rience en soi!
text: Il faut prendre le temps pour se render sur le campus de Harvard. L'endroit est surprenant. Allez voir la statue de John Harvard et apprenez=en un peu plus sur les trois mensonges √† son sujet et au sujet de sa statue. Tr√®s int√©ressant. On est all√© en metro. C'est facile de s'y rendre.

title: Tienes q hacerlo
text: Muy buen recorrido pero no vayas solo, necesitas a alguien q conozca la historia . Que te lleve a todas las partes importantes,no dejes de ir a book store de Harvard pasando la calle. Todo es muy interesante y el campus es muy bonito y alberga mucho conocimiento.

title: Se respira conocimiento
text: Definitivamente este lugar se ha ganado su fama bastante bien. Cada rinc√≥n resulta sorprendente y deja descubrir muchas cosas que cre√≠as saber y otras que tienes que aprender. translated_text: This place has definitely earned its fame quite well. Every corner is surprising and lets you discover many things you thought you knew and others that you have to learn. Museums, buildings, halls, libraries and cultural spaces everywhere and each one with its own history. How many famous people have passed through here, but only a few have managed to break the mold and transcend. Not to be missed

title: Imperdible si visitas Boston/cambridge

title: Beroemde (oudste) universiteit van de US
text: Beroemde (oudste) universiteit van de US ca 10 km ten Noordwesten van het  centrum van Boston. In het Harvard Information Centre kan je boeken voor een 1 uur rondtoer die vele keren per dag vertrekt. Dat brengt je langs alle hoogtepunten van dit Centre of science

title: Imperd√≠vel !

text: ÏÑ∏Í≥Ñ ÏµúÍ≥†Ïùò ÎåÄÌïôÏù¥ÎùºÍ≥† Ìï¥ÏÑú Í≥µÎ∂ÄÎßå ÌïòÎäî ÌïôÏÉùÎì§Îßå ÏûàÏùÑ Ï§Ñ ÏïåÏïòÎäîÎç∞ ÏûêÏú†Î∂ÑÎ∞©Ìïú Î∂ÑÏúÑÍ∏∞ÏóêÏÑú Í∞ÅÏûê Ìï† ÏùºÏùÑ Ïó¥Ïã¨Ìûà ÌïòÎäî Î™®ÏäµÏùÑ Î≥¥Î©¥ÏÑú Î™ÖÎ¨∏ÎåÄ ÌÉÄÏù¥ÌãÄÏù¥ Í¥úÌûà Î∂ôÏó¨ÏßÑÍ±¥ ÏïÑÎãàÍµ¨ÎÇò Ïã∂ÏóàÏùå
translated_text: I thought that the best university in the world would only have students studying, but I realized that the title of a prestigious university is not for nothing when I saw students doing their own thing in a free-spirited atmosphere.

title: La instituci√≥n acad√©mica m√°s antigua de Estados Unidos
text:
Harvard es la instituci√≥n acad√©mica m√°s antigua de Estados Unidos y una de las universidades m√°s prestigiosas del mundo, fundada en 1636  por la Corte General  de Massachusetts con el nombre de New College o The College at New Town. En 1639 se le cambio el nombre a Harvard College en recuerdo a  su primer benefactor John Harvard. 
Esta instituci√≥n acad√©mica privada, en la actualidad est√° organizada en once unidades separadas - tres facultades y el Instituto Radcliffe para Estudios Avanzados- con campus en todo el √°rea metropolitana de Boston aunque su campus principal se centra en el Harvard Yard en Cambridge
translated_text:
Harvard is the oldest academic institution in the United States and one of the most prestigious universities in the world, founded in 1636 by the General Court of Massachusetts under the name of New College or The College at New Town. In 1639 the name was changed to Harvard College in memory of its first benefactor John Harvard.
This private academic institution is currently organized into eleven separate units - three colleges and the Radcliffe Institute for Advanced Study - with campuses throughout the greater Boston area, although its main campus is centered in the Harvard Yard in Cambridge.

title: Dispersiva
text: √â vero che non √© propriamente un‚Äôattrazione turistica ma √® pur vero che essendo una delle universit√† pi√π famose del mondo √® visitata ogni giorno da turisti, qualche indicazione ci dovrebbe essere ... abbiamo girato un po‚Äô per i vialetti, assistito alla cerimonia di inizi√≤ anno e siamo andati via....

title: Un campus maravilloso
text: Es una de las mejores universidades del mundo y cada edificio lo demuestra. Hermoso, dan ganas de quedarse y estudiar ah√≠. Adem√°s, los alrededores en Cambridge son muy lindos, las construcciones no parecen las t√≠picas del resto de Estados Unidos.

title: Indrukwekkend
text: We hadden meer een campus idee voor ogen toen we op zoek gingen naar deze bekende universiteit. Dat was het wel en ook weer niet, er is gebied wat omgeven door een muur, het oudere gedeelte en voor het overige heel veel gebouwen door dit gedeelte van de stad heen. Leuk om te mogen ervaren.

title: beau site
text:
Cr√©√©e en 1636,  c'est la plus vieille universit√© d'Am√©rique du Nord et une des plus prestigieuse. 

Il ya de belles fa√ßades de briques rouges anciennes pour les divers b√¢timents et certains sont plus r√©cents mais cela fait un beau m√©lange. 

La biblioth√®que est un bel √©difice plus r√©cent selon moi. Elle compte plus de 15 millions d'ouvrages. Harvard poss√®de donc  la plus importante biblioth√®que universitaire du monde.

Juste devant, on voit des gens se faire prendre en photo devant la statue de John Harvard. Son pied en bronze est rendu luisant par les frottements. 

Nous nous sommes promen√© sur le campus car aucune visite int√©rieure n‚Äôest permise.

Plusieurs pr√©sident am√©ricains et des laur√©ats du prix Nobel ont fr√©quent√© l'endroit. 

nous avons bien aim√© cette visite, ce moment de d√©tente, de calme et de nature.
translated_text:
Founded in 1636, it is the oldest university in North America and one of the most prestigious.

There are beautiful old red brick facades for the various buildings and some are newer but it makes a nice mix.

The library is a beautiful newer building in my opinion. It contains over 15 million books. This makes Harvard the largest university library in the world.

Just in front, you can see people having their photo taken in front of the statue of John Harvard. His bronze foot is gleaming from friction.

We wandered around the campus, as no indoor visits are allowed.

Several U.S. presidents and Nobel Prize winners have visited here.

We really enjoyed this visit, this moment of relaxation, calm and nature.

translated_text:
I went to Cambridge and visited the famous and oldest Harvard University. It occupies a large territory, tourists are allowed on the territory. On the territory there is a statue of Harvard, a large library, campuses, academic buildings, a large park area. A large number of squirrels, a lot of unusual trees.
 unusual trees.The bells of the university belfry are cast in Russia in Voronezh.All buildings are made of red brick.In general, not a bad place to walk.

title: Fundamental ir para conhecer
text: Caminhar pela universidade e arredores foi muito bom para conhecer o clima da deste lugar t√£o conhecido no mundo todo.

title: One of The Best and The Oldest University in the World
text:
Harvard University merupakan salah satu University tertua di Amerika yang didirikan oleh John Harvard. 

Suhu udara yang diperkirakan ‚Äúhanya‚Äù 3 derajat anjlok menjadi 0 derajat padahal matahari bersinar dengan sangat cerahnya.
Di dalam halaman universitas Harvard terdapat patung perunggu dari John Harvard sang pendiri. Saya  heran, kenapa sepatu patung tampak kuning mengkilat sedangkan patungnya berwarna bronze. Ternyata ada kepercayaan bhw siapa yang mengelus sepatu patung John Harvard bakalan diterima di Harvard. Suatu kepercayaan aneh, tapi peserta tour banyak yang berfoto sambil memegang sepatu Sang Pendiri. 

Kampus harvard yang masih sepi karena baru jam 8.30 pagi membuat kami leluasa berfoto di sudut kampus yang instagramable itu.
translated_text:
Harvard University is one of the oldest universities in America, founded by John Harvard.

The temperature, which was estimated to be "only" 3 degrees, plummeted to 0 degrees even though the sun was shining brightly.
Inside the courtyard of Harvard University is a bronze statue of John Harvard the founder. I wondered why the statue's shoes looked shiny yellow while the statue was bronze. Apparently there is a belief that whoever strokes the shoes of the statue of John Harvard will be accepted at Harvard. A strange belief, but many tour participants took pictures while holding the founder's shoes.

The Harvard campus was still quiet because it was only 8.30 in the morning so we were free to take pictures in the instagramable corner of the campus.

title: Sonho de universidade!
text: Em Cambridge, procure pela Harvard Square. Chegando l√°, f√°cil de localizar o Centro de Informa√ß√µes. Ali, uma simp√°tica senhora dar√° um mapa de Harvard e do MIT e algumas orienta√ß√µes para o passeio. Logo ao lado fica o Harvard Yard, entrando nele, √© poss√≠vel conhecer uma parte do campus, que √© enorme. Tudo muito organizado, limpo e bonito. Fora do campus, muitos caf√©s e restaurantes onde indico uma parada para um lanche.
translated_text: In Cambridge, look for Harvard Square. Once there, it's easy to find the Information Center. There, a friendly lady will give you a map of Harvard and MIT and some directions for the tour. Right next door is Harvard Yard, where you can see part of the campus, which is huge. Everything is very organized, clean and beautiful. Outside the campus, there are lots of caf√©s and restaurants where I recommend you stop for a snack.

title: Fant√°stico ‚ô°
text: Amei lugar √© grande bastante espa√ßo ate mesmo para andar de bicicleta o dia que fomos estavam em formatura todos felizes e lindos. Muito organizado limpo e seguro qualquer pessoa pode entrar ali vale a pena.Reserve ao menos uma hora para esse local.
translated_text: I loved the place, it's big and there's plenty of space even to ride a bike. The day we went there was a graduation ceremony, everyone was happy and beautiful. Very organized, clean and safe, anyone can go there, it's worth it. Set aside at least an hour for this place.

title: Universidade Linda
text: N√£o sei se pela fama ou pelos filmes, mas tinha um sonho de conhecer essa universidade, fiquei encantada com a visita √© simplesmente enorme, nunca imaginei que era do tamanho que √©. Um passeio que com certeza quem vem a Boston tem que fazer. Impressionante a organiza√ß√£o.
translated_text: I don't know if it's because of the fame or the movies, but I had a dream of visiting this university. I was delighted with the visit, it's simply huge, I never imagined it would be as big as it is. A tour that anyone who comes to Boston should definitely do. The organization is impressive.

title: Emblem√°tico e Hist√≥rico!
text: Um campus enorme! Repleto de estudantes e turistas, muita hist√≥ria e tradi√ß√£o envolve uma das universidades mais famosas do mundo. Celebridades e nomes conhecidos estudaram e ainda estudam l√°! Se estiver em Boston pegue o metro e visite Cambridge, Harvard.
translated_text: A huge campus! Filled with students and tourists, a lot of history and tradition surrounds one of the most famous universities in the world. Celebrities and well-known names have studied and still study there! If you're in Boston, take the subway to Cambridge and Harvard.

title: Cambridge
text: Vale a visita √† Harvard quando estiver em Boston. Chega- se facilmente de metr√¥ pela linha vermelha desde o centro de Boston. √â f√°cil acessar a p√© o complexo de pr√©dios hist√≥ricos da universidade bem como os arredores com livrarias, caf√©s, lanchonetes e lojas de souvenirs.
translated_text: Harvard is well worth a visit when you're in Boston. It is easily reached by subway on the Red Line from downtown Boston. It's easy to walk to the university's complex of historic buildings as well as the surrounding area with bookstores, caf√©s, snack bars and souvenir stores.

title: Conhe√ßa este √≠cone mundialmente famoso
text: A pouca dist√¢ncia de Boston fica a cidade de Cambridge, que √© onde se localiza esta famos√≠ssima Universidade. Voc√™ pode andar pelo campus por conta pr√≥pria ou atrav√©s de passeios guiados, j√° que n√£o se pode atrapalhar os alunos perguntando coisas acerca do campus. N√£o esque√ßa de passar a m√£o no p√© do fundador para, como diz a supersti√ß√£o, seus filhos tenham chance maior de estudar nesta famosa e car√≠ssima universidade. Caminhe tranquilamente pelo campus e conhe√ßa, al√©m da amior biblioteca do mundo, o primeiro computador da IBM. Na sa√≠da, passe em uma das muitas lojas para levar lembran√ßas com o nome desta universidade.
translated_text: A short distance from Boston is the city of Cambridge, where this famous university is located. You can wander around the campus on your own or through guided tours, as you can't disturb the students by asking questions about the campus. Don't forget to put your hand on the founder's foot so that, as the superstition goes, your children have a better chance of studying at this famous and very expensive university. Take a leisurely stroll around the campus and see the world's largest library and IBM's first computer. On your way out, stop by one of the many stores to pick up souvenirs bearing the name of this university.

title: Passeio inesquec√≠vel em Cambridge
text:
Passeamos por Harvard Square e depois entramos pelos port√µes da universidade.
Simplesmente de tirar o f√¥lego, tudo. Cada pr√©dio, cada detalhe, uma pena a temperaturA estar t√£o baixa que atrapalhou caminharmos pelas pra√ßas do campus.
A biblioteca central deve ser visitada. Uma maravilha.
translated_text:
We strolled through Harvard Square and then entered the university gates.
Everything was simply breathtaking. Every building, every detail. It's a shame the temperature was so low that we couldn't walk around the campus squares.
The central library must be visited. A marvel.

title: Visita ao Campus
text: Como turista confesso que fiquei decepcionado com o Campus da Universidade. J√° vi campus muito mais bonitos e charmosos. Peguei o metro a partir da South Station e desci na Harvard Square Station. Esta√ß√£o suja e sem mobilidade urbana (elevadores ou escadas rolantes).

title: „Éú„Çπ„Éà„É≥„Å´Ë°å„Å£„Åü„Å™„ÇâÊòØÈùû
text: ‰∏ÄË®Ä„ÅßË®Ä„ÅÜ„Å™„Çâ„ÄÅÂ∫É„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÅåË°ó„ÇíÂê´„ÇÅ„Å¶‰Ωú„Å£„ÅüÊÑü„Åò„ÅåÂàÜ„Åã„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Ç§„Ç∞„Éé„Éº„Éô„É´Ë≥û„ÅÆÊéàË≥ûÂºè„ÅÆÂª∫Áâ©„ÇÇ‰∏≠„Å´ÂÖ•„Çå„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÊ≠£ÈñÄ„ÇíÊé¢„Åô„Å†„Åë„Åß„ÇÇÈù¢ÁôΩ„ÅÑ„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
translated_text: In a word, it is spacious. You can see the feeling that the university has included the city in its construction. We were also able to go inside the building where the Ig nobel prize was awarded. It would be interesting just to find the main gate.

title: Come ritornare studenti
text: Passeggiando all‚Äôinterno delle aree comuni di Harvard ti sembra di essere all‚Äôinterno di un film americano. Si respira un‚Äôaria particolare e di ‚Äúprestigio‚Äù.
translated_text: Walking inside the common areas of Harvard makes you feel like you are inside an American movie. There is a special air of "prestige" about it.

title: ottimo
text: appena entrati nel college, si respira aria di intelletualismo, anche dai vari personaggi che son passati in queste mura. ampio parco, in quel momento era radunato tutto il senato accademico per dare il benvenuto a circa 400 matricole, pertanto non abbiamo potuto visitare nulla dell'interno dell 'edificio a cominciare dalla biblioteca. A parte l'alone che circonda questa universit√†, vi sono solo degli immobili in uso agli studenti abbastanza anonimi visti dall'esterno.
translated_text: as soon as we enter the college, there is an air of intellectualism, even from the various people who have passed through these walls. large park, at that time the entire academic senate was gathered to welcome about 400 freshmen, so we could not visit anything inside the 'building starting with the library. Apart from the halo that surrounds this university, there are only buildings in student use that are quite anonymous when viewed from the outside.

title: Einen Besuch wert
text:
Diese weltber√ºhmte Uni ist wirklich einen Besuch wert. F√ºr 12$ kann man eine von Studenten gef√ºhrte Tour machen. Diese starten an einem Kiosk vor der Uni unweit der Metrostation. Sehr zu empfehlen, um mehr Informationen zu erhalten.
