Surprisingly, in the morning Harvard breathes full of student life: professors walking around drinking hot coffee, students in hoodies running around in the drizzling rain! The campus is very beautiful, old, there is a lot of greenery and colorful leaves, bright chairs are right on the lawn. The library is of unprecedented size. The atmosphere itself has an extraordinary desire to open some giant dilapidated book and immerse yourself in it.

title: –Ω–∞—Å—Ç–æ—è—â–∏–π –¥—É—Ö –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏—è
translated_text: huge number of languages sounds from all sides. you realize that really one of the main universities of the world. Be sure to take a picture with the Harvard pack (3 wrongs) just don't rub his shoe, learn about the traditions associated with it first)

title: Recorrido muy recomendable
text: Una hermosa Universidad para visitar y caminar por todo el campus y edificios plagados de historia. Hay tours guiados disponibles, algunos realizados por los mismos estudiantes. Est√° algo alejado de la ciudad de Boston pero se puede llegar f√°cilmente en transporte p√∫blico. El barrio alrededor de la Universidad es tambi√©n muy lindo de caminar, lleno de locales para comprar recuerdos o comer algo. Sin dudas, recorrer Harvard es algo muy recomendable para todo el mundo.
translated_text: A beautiful University to visit and walk around the campus and buildings steeped in history. Guided tours are available, some given by the students themselves. It is a bit far from the city of Boston but can be easily reached by public transportation. The neighborhood around the University is also very nice to walk around, full of places to buy souvenirs or eat something. Undoubtedly, touring Harvard is something highly recommended for everyone.

title: Un tour ext√©rieur
text: Le tour guid√© d'Harvard, qu'il faut √† tout prix utiliser pour maximiser votre visite, en plus c'est gratuit, nous fait aller et venir dans le nombreuses cours ext√©rieures des diff√©rentes facult√©s de l'√©tablissement. Les commentaires des guides sont excellents et remplis d'anecdotes et de retours historiques. Par contre, on ne visite que l'ext√©rieur. Les b√¢timent sont pratiquement tous ferm√©s aux visiteurs.
translated_text: The guided tour of Harvard, which you should definitely use to maximize your visit, plus it's free, takes us back and forth through the many outdoor courtyards of the institution's various faculties. The guides' commentaries are excellent, full of anecdotes and historical insights. However, we only visit the outside. Almost all buildings are closed to visitors.

title: Imponente
text: Tal como en las pel√≠culas, esta alta casa de estudio alberga a miles de estudiantes, con un inmenso parque en el medio de los dormis, una impresionante biblioteca ocupa mas de tres manzanas. Digno de recorrerlo.
translated_text: Just like in the movies, this high school houses thousands of students, with a huge park in the middle of the dorms, an impressive library occupies more than three blocks. A must-see.

title: Un sue√±o
text: No se pierdan de visitar esa incre√≠ble universidad. Es maravilloso el campus y cada uno de los lugares que tiene. los edificios enormes! la vida acad√©mica de ese lugar. Todos son bien yankees bien pel√≠cula.. Harvard es un sue√±o para quienes amamos conocer  las universidades mas importantes del mundo¬∞!
translated_text: Don't miss to visit this incredible university. It is wonderful the campus and every single place it has. the huge buildings! the academic life of that place. They are all very yankee and very movie-like.... Harvard is a dream for those of us who love to visit the most important universities in the world¬∞!

title: Ir a Boston e n√£o ir a Harvard, √© a mesma coisa que ir a Roma e n√£o ver o Papa!
text: Ir a Boston e n√£o ir a Harvard, √© a mesma coisa que ir a Roma e n√£o ver o Papa! Aconselho fazer um tour guiado pelos pr√≥prios estudantes para iniciar o passeio e ter uma melhor localiza√ß√£o dos pr√©dios e locais de interesse. Ali se v√™ o conceito de uma universidade t√≠pica americana: totalmente aberta, amplos espa√ßos, jardins e centros de conviv√™ncia.
translated_text: Going to Boston and not going to Harvard is like going to Rome and not seeing the Pope! I recommend taking a tour led by the students themselves to start the tour and get a better idea of the buildings and places of interest. There you can see the concept of a typical American university: totally open, large spaces, gardens and community centers.

title: Sekolah ternama dan impian pelajar dari seluruh dunia
text: Merupakan sekolah utama di dunia yang dalam bidang ilmu bisnis, hukum, politik dan pemerintahan maupun sains. Suasana kampus yang apik dan nyaman tersebar namun mudah dicapai antara gedung fasilitasnya. Suasana yang dirasakan pada lingkungan ini sangat multinasional dan multikultur dengan adanya pelajar serta pengajar yang berasal dari segala penjuru dunia.
translated_text: It is the world's premier school of business, law, politics and government as well as science. The campus is chic and cozy, spread out yet easily accessible between buildings and facilities. The atmosphere felt in this environment is multinational and multicultural with students and faculty coming from all over the world.

title: Preciosa Universidad y barrio universitario
text: Llegamos hasta Harvard v√≠a Metro (tren subterraneo) , al llegar nos encontramos con un barrio bullante de gente, mayoritariamente estudiantes, muy entretenido. Hay un kiosko de informaciones donde se puede adquirir un mapa y planificar su recorrido, en general  las facultades y residencias universitarias se situan en hermosas edificaciones de estilo, rodeadas de areas verdes muy agradables de recorrer, el  barrio en general es muy arm√≥nico y bien cuidado. Coincidente al sector donde esta la estacion se situa la zona comercial, donde hay tiendas y restaurantes.
translated_text: We arrived at Harvard via Metro (subway train), upon arrival we found a bustling neighborhood of people, mostly students, very entertaining. There is an information kiosk where you can buy a map and plan your tour, in general the faculties and university residences are located in beautiful style buildings, surrounded by green areas very pleasant to walk around, the neighborhood in general is very harmonious and well maintained. Coincident to the sector where the station is located is the commercial area, where there are stores and restaurants.

title: suggestivo
text: Il campus si trova a pochi chilometri da Boston in una cittadina molto carina, Cambridge. Le zone limitrofe sono piene di ragazzi e di vita, ristoranti e negozi pieni di gente! L'interno del campus √® davvero suggestivo, si respira un'aria di cultura. Gli edifici sono immersi nel verde, tutto √® ben tenuto e curato. Noi siamo andati da Boston a Cambridge in auto, il parcheggio si trova facilmente ma si pu√≤ raggiungere anche con i mezzi.
translated_text: The campus is located a few miles from Boston in a very nice town, Cambridge. The surrounding areas are full of kids and life, restaurants and stores full of people! The interior of the campus is really atmospheric, there is an air of culture. The buildings are surrounded by greenery, everything is well maintained and cared for. We went from Boston to Cambridge by car, parking is easy to find but you can also get there by transportation.

title: Inversi√≥n de medio d√≠a
text: Apartado del centro de Boston y a pocos minutos en transporte, se encuentra la ciudad educativa de Harvard, resulta agradable recorrer los jardines de la Universidad y visitar las instalaciones de las distintas facultades. Anotarse previamente las facultades que uno desea recorrer facilita la visita y ahorra tiempo.
translated_text: Away from downtown Boston and just a few minutes away by public transportation, the educational city of Harvard is a pleasant place to tour the University's grounds and visit the facilities of the different faculties. Making a note in advance of the faculties you wish to visit facilitates the visit and saves time.

title: mucha historia
text: vale la pena tomarse una ma√±ana para ir a conocer harvard, tratar de encontar algun tour para conocer la historia, anecdotas tanto de cada edificio como de los estudiantes.
translated_text: it is worth taking a morning to visit harvard, try to find a tour to learn about the history, anecdotes of each building and the students.

title: Harvard University, perfeita!!!
text:
Como pensar em Boston sem pensar na Universidade de Harvard? A Universidade √© linda e a cidade respira cultura!
J√° visitei a cidade 2 vezes e retornaria mais tantas outras! Maravilha!!!
Curtam bastante! Deborah Azevedo.
translated_text:
How can you think of Boston without thinking of Harvard University? The university is beautiful and the city breathes culture!
I've visited the city twice and would return many more times! Wonderful!!!
Enjoy! Deborah Azevedo.

title: Historia, calidad y educacion
text: Estar en Harvard, es estar en un lugar con prestigio, se respira historia y orden..Me gusto mucho las dependencias de la universidad, que es muy grande, son mas de 200 edificios y es dif√≠cil recorrerlos todos en un solo d√≠a. Es una verdadera cuidad universitaria, con sus restaurant, tiendas y bibliotecas. Sin duda, este es un lugar sello de la cuidad de Boston y es una visita obligada para cualquiera que va a esta historica y bella cuidad.
translated_text: To be at Harvard is to be in a prestigious place, you can breathe history and order... I really liked the university buildings, which are very large, there are more than 200 buildings and it is difficult to visit them all in one day. It is a real university city, with its restaurants, stores and libraries. Undoubtedly, this is a hallmark of the city of Boston and is a must for anyone who goes to this historic and beautiful city.

title: Tradicional e surpreendente!
text: Voc√™ se sente em um filme. A universidade √© tradicional e impec√°vel e ao mesmo tempo leve e cheia de estudantes para todos os lados. Tem seu com√©rcio e os pr√©dios dos cursos. Lindo, vale a pena, principalmente se for na √©poca de formaturas!!
translated_text: You feel like you're in a movie. The university is traditional and impeccable, but at the same time light and full of students everywhere. There are shops and course buildings. Beautiful, well worth a visit, especially if it's graduation time!!!

title: Merita una visita.
text: Anche se la maggior parte degli edifici √® off-limits per i turisti, Harvard merita sicuramente una visita se siete a Boston. Per un'atmosfera migliore, √® consigliato visitare il campus durante la settimana e non quando gli studenti sono in vacanza, o si rischia di trovare solo turisti in giro. Molto carini i negozi di souvenir nella piazzetta.
translated_text: Although most of the buildings are off-limits to tourists, Harvard is definitely worth a visit if you are in Boston. For the best atmosphere, it is recommended to visit the campus during the week and not when the students are on vacation, or you are likely to find only tourists around. Very nice souvenir stores in the small square.

title: Parece que voc√™ est√° em um filme
text: Visitar Harvard University √© se sentir toda energia daquele lugar. Energia dos grandes cientistas, pensadores, acad√™micos que fundaram e estudaram em Harvard. O campus √© um mundo pr√≥prio, muitas pessoas, grandes edificios, muita organiza√ß√£o. N√£o deixe de tirar foto com a est√°tua do fundador.
translated_text: To visit Harvard University is to feel the energy of the place. The energy of the great scientists, thinkers and academics who founded and studied at Harvard. The campus is a world of its own, lots of people, big buildings, lots of organization. Don't forget to take a photo with the statue of the founder.

title: El top universitario
text:
Llegar a Harvard y recorrer sus jardines y aulas, es como sentirse en el punto m√°s importante para cualquier universitario del mundo. Diversos monumentos en su interior recuerdan a los forjadores de la ense√±anza, y muchos alumnos leyendo o pasando tiempo en los jardines completan nuestra visi√≥n.
Al salir hay varios locales de venta de recuerdos.
translated_text:
Arriving at Harvard and walking through its gardens and classrooms is like being in the most important place in the world for any university student. Several monuments inside remember the forgers of learning, and many students reading or spending time in the gardens complete our vision.
On the way out there are several shops selling souvenirs.

title: Top
text: Ritornarci √® sempre un piacere, peccato non averci studiato! Il campus merita la visita come anche i negozi con tutti i gadget. Unico neo √® la mancanza di parcheggi low-cost.
translated_text: Returning there is always a pleasure, too bad we didn't study there! The campus is worth a visit as are the stores with all the gadgets. The only drawback is the lack of low-cost parking.

title: Especial
text: O campus √© um mundo pr√≥prio, muitas pessoas, grandes edificios, muita organiza√ß√£o.A Harvard n√£o √© somente o campus mas tudo que est√° em volta, com√©rcios, igrejas, pra√ßas, enfim um local com uma agita√ß√£o caracteristica de um campus.
translated_text: The campus is a world of its own, lots of people, big buildings, lots of organization. Harvard is not just the campus but everything around it, shops, churches, squares, in short, a place with the bustle characteristic of a campus.

translated_text: Harvard University, the oldest private institution of higher education in the United States, was founded on September 8, 1636, 16 years after the first colonists arrived on the American continent.The university was named after its first patron, John Harvard, a young minister who, after his death, left half of his property and a library to the new institution.

title: Nada anormal...

translated_text: The truth is that I didn't think it was a big deal. Yes, it is very clean and has those movie-like buildings, but.... The good thing is that it is free admission (except for some buildings) and you can sign up on a list so that a student can show you around and tell you the history of the university. It is a must see if you are in Boston, you can get there by subway or even on foot!

text: ÔºëÔºñÔºìÔºñÂπ¥ÂâµÁ´ã„ÅÆ„Ç¢„É°„É™„Ç´„ÅßÊúÄ„ÇÇÂè§„ÅÑÂ§ßÂ≠¶„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ‰∏ñÁïåÁöÑ„Å´„ÇÇÊúÄÈ´ò„É¨„Éô„É´„ÅÆÂ§ßÂ≠¶„Å†„Åë„ÅÇ„Å£„Å¶„ÄÅ„Ç≠„É£„É≥„Éë„Çπ„ÇíÊ≠©„Åè‰∫∫„ÄÖ„ÇÇË≥¢„Åù„ÅÜ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„Éª„É§„Éº„Éâ„ÇíÊï£Á≠ñ„Åó„ÄÅ„ÅÑ„Åè„Å§„Åã„ÅÆÂª∫Áâ©„ÇíË¶ãÂ≠¶„Åó„ÄÅ„Ç∏„Éß„É≥„Éª„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„ÅÆÈäÖÂÉè„Å®Ë®òÂøµÊíÆÂΩ±„Åó„ÄÅÊôÇÈñì„Å´‰ΩôË£ï„Åå„ÅÇ„Å£„Åü„ÇâÁæéË°ìÈ§®„ÇÑÂçöÁâ©È§®„ÇíË¶ãÂ≠¶„Åô„Çã„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÑ„Åß„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÇËã±Ë™û„ÅÆËÅû„ÅçÂèñ„Çä„Å´Ëá™‰ø°„Åå„ÅÇ„Çå„Å∞„ÉÑ„Ç¢„Éº„Å´ÂèÇÂä†„Åô„Çã„ÅÆ„ÇÇ„ÅÑ„ÅÑ„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
translated_text: Founded in 1636, it is the oldest university in the United States. It is one of the best universities in the world, and the people walking around the campus look smart. You can stroll around Harvard Yard, visit some of the buildings, take a photo with the bronze statue of John Harvard, and if you have time, visit the museums and art galleries. If you are confident in your English listening skills, you can take a tour.

title: bella universit√†
text: splendida universit√† immersa nel verde , pensare che alcuni di quei ragazzi diventeranno famosi avvocati ci emoziona
translated_text: wonderful university surrounded by greenery , to think that some of those kids will become famous lawyers excites us

title: Visita interessante
text: Visita interessante. Os pr√©dios e os jardins cheios de estudantes no dia a dia da universidade. Fizemos uma visita com guia e super recomendo!
translated_text: An interesting visit. The buildings and gardens are full of students going about their daily lives at the university. We had a guided tour and I highly recommend it!

title: Un autre univers
text:
Nous n'avons pas pu entrer dans les b√¢timents, mais le simple fait de se promener dans le parc √©tait d√©j√† super.
Architecture splendide , on se serait cru au si√®cle dernier.
Cambridge, non loin de Boston est une ville √† d√©couvrir √©galement.
translated_text:
We weren't able to enter the buildings, but just walking around the park was great.
Splendid architecture, it was like being in the last century.
Cambridge, not far from Boston, is another city worth discovering.

title: Aire central de Harvard
text:
Harvard Yard est la cour central du site universitaire, √† l'int√©rieur de l'enceinte m√™me de Harvard

Si vous vous tenez au centre, vous √™tes entour√© par, un grand b√¢timent blanc, c'est le University Hall qui abrite les bureaux administratifs depuis 1815. De l'autre cot√© de cet immeuble vous y trouverez une statue de John Harvard ... apparemment, toucher son pied gauche apporte la chance et le savoir.

L'immense b√¢timent avec plusieurs colonnes, c'est la Harry Wilkins Widener Library, une biblioth√®que qui contient 3,5 millions de livres. Nomm√© en l'honneur de Harry Elkins Widener, un √©tudiant qui a gradu√© de Harvard en 1907. Elle a √©t√© construite par sa m√®re apr√®s la mort de celui-ci dans le naufrage du Titanic en 1912.

Face √† la biblioth√®que, au bout du terrain, vous avez le Memorial Church (1744) -- en m√©moire des dipl√¥m√©s tu√©s au combat de la 1e et 2e guerre mondiale, celle de Cor√©e et du Vietnam. Leur noms sont inscrits sur les murs int√©rieur de l'√©difice.

Le terrain entre les 2 b√¢timents, c'est le Tercentenary Theater -- l√† o√π sont align√©es toutes les chaises blanches des √©tudiants et parents lors de la graduation annuelle lors de la remise des dipl√¥mes.
translated_text:
Harvard Yard is the central courtyard of the university site, within Harvard's own grounds.

If you stand in the center, you're surrounded by a large white building, University Hall, which has housed the administrative offices since 1815. On the other side of this building you'll find a statue of John Harvard... apparently, touching his left foot brings luck and knowledge.

The huge building with several columns is the Harry Wilkins Widener Library, which contains 3.5 million books. Named in honor of Harry Elkins Widener, a student who graduated from Harvard in 1907. It was built by his mother after his death in the sinking of the Titanic in 1912.

Opposite the library, at the far end of the grounds, you'll find Memorial Church (1744) - in memory of graduates killed in action in WW1, WW2, Korea and Vietnam. Their names are inscribed on the interior walls of the building.

The area between the 2 buildings is the Tercentenary Theater - where all the white chairs are lined up for students and parents at the annual graduation ceremony.

title: L'universit√© la plus prestigieuse des USA, √† voir une fois dans sa vie!
text:
Cr√©e en 1636, Harvard est la plus ancienne et la plus prestigieuse institution de haut-savoir des USA. Il regroupe plus de 400 b√¢timents dont certains abritent des mus√©es qui sont ouvert au public.

Une des nombreuses entr√©e du campus universitaire, celles sur Massachusetts Avenue, est la plus proche d'acc√®s en arrivant par m√©tro.

En entrant par ce portail, √† votre droite, vous aurez le Massachussetts Hall, √©rig√© en 1720, c'est le plus vieux b√¢timent du site. Le bureau du recteur et les √©tudiants de 1e ann√©e s'y trouvent.

√Ä votre gauche vous avez Harvard Hall qui fut d√©truit par un violent incendie qui brula le tiers du campus en 1764.

Si vous contourner Harvard Hall, derri√®re, vous y trouverez une petite chapelle, la Holden Chapel -- construite en 1744, elle servi de chapelle, caserne de pompier, labo de chimie, et maintenant c'est un lieu de chorale.

Revenez sur vos pas, l'immense b√¢timent blanc en plein centre tu terrain, c'est le University Hall qui abrite les bureaux administratifs depuis 1815. Devant vous y trouverez une statue de John Harvard ... apparemment, toucher son pied gauche apporte la chance et le savoir.

Contourner vers la droite et derri√®re vous arriverez √† la Harry Wilkins Widener Library, biblioth√®que qui contient 3,5 millions de livres. Nomm√© en l'honneur de Harry Elkins Widener, un √©tudiant qui a gradu√© de Harvard en 1907. Elle a √©t√© construite par sa m√®re apr√®s la mort de celui-ci dans le naufrage du Titanic en 1912.

Face √† la biblioth√®que, au bout du terrain, vous avez le Memorial Church (1744) -- en m√©moire des dipl√¥m√©s tu√©s au combat de la 1e et 2e guerre mondiale, celle de Cor√©e et du Vietnam. Leur noms sont inscrits sur les murs int√©rieur de l'√©difice.

Le terrain entre les 2 b√¢timents, c'est le Tercentenary Theater -- l√† o√π sont align√©es toutes les chaises blanches des √©tudiants et parents lors de la graduation annuelle lors de la remise des dipl√¥mes. 

Cela fait le tour des b√¢timents important √† l'int√©rieur de l'enceinte m√™me ... tout le reste est b√¢ti autour : 

- Fogg Art Museum o√π on peut admirer plusieurs toiles de Rembrandt, Monet, Picasso, Renoir & Degas 

- Memorial Hall (1870) -- centre communautaire pour √©tudiants de 1e ann√©e, Avec son allure de cath√©drale gothique, elle se veut un hommage en m√©moire des dipl√¥m√©s tu√©s au combat de la guerre de s√©cession.

- Caserne de pompier de Cambridge desservant Harvard.

- Harvard Museum of Natural History 

... et plein d'autres choses √† voir. Tout cela fait partie le l'universit√© Harvard

Quelques c√©l√©brit√©s ont fr√©quent√© Harvard : Tommy Lee Jones, Mira Sorvino & Natalie Portman, pour en nommer quelques uns
translated_text:
Founded in 1636, Harvard is the oldest and most prestigious institution of higher learning in the USA. It comprises over 400 buildings, some of which house museums open to the public.

One of the many entrances to the university campus, on Massachusetts Avenue, is the closest to the subway station.

Entering through this portal, on your right is Massachusetts Hall, erected in 1720 and the oldest building on the site. It houses the Rector's Office and the 1st year student lounge.

To your left is Harvard Hall, which was destroyed by a violent fire in 1764, burning one-third of the campus.

If you go around Harvard Hall, behind it, you'll find a small chapel, Holden Chapel - built in 1744, it served as a chapel, fire station, chemistry lab, and now as a choir house.

Retrace your steps to the huge white building in the center of the grounds, University Hall, which has housed the administrative offices since 1815. In front of it you'll find a statue of John Harvard ... apparently, touching his left foot brings luck and knowledge.

Go around to the right and behind you you'll come to the Harry Wilkins Widener Library, which contains 3.5 million books. Named in honor of Harry Elkins Widener, a student who graduated from Harvard in 1907. It was built by his mother after his death in the sinking of the Titanic in 1912.

Opposite the library, at the far end of the grounds, you'll find Memorial Church (1744) - in memory of graduates killed in action in WW1, WW2, Korea and Vietnam. Their names are inscribed on the interior walls of the building.

The area between the 2 buildings is the Tercentenary Theater - where all the white chairs are lined up for students and parents at the annual graduation ceremony.

It circles all the important buildings within the grounds ... everything else is built around it:

- Fogg Art Museum, with paintings by Rembrandt, Monet, Picasso, Renoir & Degas

- Memorial Hall (1870) -- community center for 1st-year students. With its Gothic cathedral-like appearance, it stands as a memorial to graduates killed in action during the Civil War.

- Cambridge fire station serving Harvard.

- Harvard Museum of Natural History

... and lots more. All part of Harvard University

Some celebrities attended Harvard: Tommy Lee Jones, Mira Sorvino & Natalie Portman, to name but a few.

title: Grande Universit√†!!
text: Bella visita in una delle universit√† pi√π famose al mondo. Siamo capitati in un momento in cui si vedevano pochi studenti ma soltanto gruppi di visitatori, in maggioranza giapponesi che purtroppo si soffermavano a lungo davanti agli imponenti edifici e ai punti di interesse impedendoci di assaporare al meglio la bellezza e la tranquillit√† di questo campus. Certamente luogo da visitare considerata anche l'importanza che ha avuto nel forgiare illustri personalit√† della storia americana.
translated_text: Nice visit to one of the most famous universities in the world. We happened to be there at a time when few students were to be seen but only groups of visitors, mostly Japanese who unfortunately lingered for a long time in front of the imposing buildings and points of interest preventing us from savoring the beauty and tranquility of this campus to the fullest. Certainly a place to visit considering also its importance in shaping distinguished figures in American history.

title: Muito Legal
text: Parece aquelas cenas de filmes, o pessoal se reunindo no campus. S√≥ que √© gigante! L√° o pessoal tem muito orgulho de serem americanos, da gosto de ver. sempre tem alguem pra ser guia, como em escala. Procure sobre as 3 mentiras da estatua no campus rs

title: Universidade dos Sonhos

translated_text: To visit Harvard University is to feel the energy of the place. The energy of the great scientists, thinkers and academics who founded and studied at Harvard. A must-see.

text: „Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÅÆË¶ãÂ≠¶„ÉÑ„Ç¢„ÉºÂèÇÂä†„Åó„Åæ„Åó„ÅüÔºÅÂèãÈÅî„ÅØËã±Ë™û„Åå„Åß„Åç„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅßÊ•Ω„Åó„Çì„Åß„Åæ„Åó„Åü„Åå„ÄÅÁßÅ„ÅØ„Åï„Å£„Å±„ÇäËÅû„ÅçÂèñ„Çå„Å™„Åè„Å¶ÊÆãÂøµ„Åß„Åó„Åü„Åå„ÄÅ„Åù„Çå„Åß„ÇÇÊ•Ω„Åó„ÇÅ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÊ°àÂÜÖ„Åó„Å¶„Åè„Çå„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅØÁèæÂΩπ„ÅÆÂ≠¶Áîü„Åï„Çì„Å™„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅ„ÇÅ„Å£„Å°„ÇÉË≥¢„Åù„ÅÜ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ‰∏ÄÁ∑í„Å´ÂÜôÁúü„ÇÇÊíÆ„Å£„Å¶„ÇÇ„Çâ„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ
translated_text: I took a tour of Harvard University! My friends enjoyed it because they can speak English, but unfortunately I couldn't understand a word they were saying, but I still enjoyed it. The tour guide was a current student, so he seemed very smart. We even had our picture taken with him.

title: Inspirador
text:
Como toda la zona universitaria, es admirable, por lo linda, limpia, y ese aire juvenil que circula..
Todo est√° muy cuidado, los edificios son imponentes, cada uno con su estilo... Uno se siente en una pel√≠cula caminando por ah√≠. Vale la pena dejar cruzar el rio para dar una visita a harvard.
translated_text:
Like the whole university area, it is admirable, because of its beauty, cleanliness, and the youthful air that circulates...
Everything is very well cared for, the buildings are imposing, each one with its own style... You feel like you are in a movie walking around. It is worth crossing the river to visit Harvard.

title: De pel√≠cula
text:
Llegu√© a Harvard el √∫ltimo lunes de agosto y coincidi√≥ con el d√≠a de inauguraci√≥n de semestre, estaba todo decorado y lleno de estudiantes con cara de principiantes y otros avanzados recibi√©ndolos.
Como en las pelis, llegaban los chicos con sus papas y los autos cargados de valijas.. Muy lindo!
Se llega con la l√≠nea roja del metro hacia Alewife, la estaci√≥n es Harvard y durante el recorrido el subte sale al exterior y da una hermosa vista de la ciudad. 
Apenas sal√≠s del subte a la plaza, esta la oficina de turismo para tomar un mapa y recorrer. Las puertas est√°n abiertas y a pesar de no ser alumno o prof. Te tratan muy bien como visitante, es una linda experiencia para hacer en unas pocas horas y llevarse un lindo panorama, hay mucho verde donde parar a descansar, y est√° tan cerca de boston que vale la pena tomarse una ma√±ana o media, por ah√≠.
Despu√©s volviendo a tomar la linea roja se regresa al centro para seguir recorriendo.
translated_text:
I arrived at Harvard on the last Monday of August and it coincided with the opening day of the semester, everything was decorated and full of students with beginners' faces and other advanced students welcoming them.
As in the movies, the kids were arriving with their parents and cars loaded with suitcases. Very nice!
You take the red subway line to Alewife, the station is Harvard and during the ride the subway goes outside and gives a beautiful view of the city.
As soon as you get out of the subway to the square, there is a tourist office where you can get a map and take a tour. The doors are open and even though you are not a student or teacher, they treat you very well as a visitor, it is a nice experience to do in a few hours and get a nice view, there is a lot of green to stop and rest, and it is so close to Boston that it is worth taking a morning or half a morning, that way.
Then you can take the red line back to the center to continue touring.

title: Impecable
text: Ir a la mejor universidad del mundo, por lo menos a pasear, es sensacional. Es la universidad m√°s perfecta que he visto hasta ahora. Sus parques y su biblioteca son un Must para el que la recorre.
translated_text: Going to the best university in the world, at least for a walk, is sensational. It is the most perfect university I have seen so far. Its parks and library are a must for anyone who walks through it.

text:

I wrote "courtyard" because Harvard Yard is surrounded by buildings, so you have to find the entrance to enter.
It is a nice place to enjoy the atmosphere.

Â∏∞„Çä„ÅÆÈ£õË°åÊ©ü„ÅßÊò†Áîª„ÇΩ„Éº„Ç∑„É£„É´„Éª„Éç„ÉÉ„Éà„ÉØ„Éº„ÇØ„ÇíË¶ã„Åü„ÅÆ„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅÂÆüÈöõ„Å´„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÇíË¶ã„Å¶„Åø„Çã„Å®„Äå„Å™„Çã„Åª„Å©„Äç„Å®Á¥çÂæó„Åï„Åõ„Çâ„Çå„Çã„Å®„Åì„Çç„ÅåÂ§ö„Åã„Å£„Åü„Åß„Åô„ÄÇËâØÂÆ∂„ÅÆÂ≠êÂ•≥„ÅåÂÖ•„ÇãÊúâÂêçÂ§ßÂ≠¶„Å´Á¥õ„ÇåËæº„Çì„Å†Â§©Êâç„Éó„É≠„Ç∞„É©„Éû„Éº„ÅÆÊÇ≤Âäá„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„Åã„ÄÅÂéÑ‰ªã„Åî„Å®„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„Åã„ÄÅÊò†Áîª„ÅÆ„ÅÇ„Çâ„Åô„Åò„Åß„ÅØË¶ã„Åà„Å´„Åè„ÅÑÂé≥ÁÑ∂„Å®„Åó„Åü„Ç®„É™„Éº„ÉàÊÑèË≠ò„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„Å´ÂÆüÈöõ„ÅÆ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÅÆÈõ∞Âõ≤Ê∞ó„ÇíË¶ã„Å¶Ê∞ó„Å•„Åã„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Çà„Åè„Åß„Åç„ÅüÊò†Áîª„Å†„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
„Åï„Å¶„ÄÅ„ÅäÂúüÁî£„ÅØÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÂÜÖ„Åß„ÅØË¶ã„Å§„Åã„Çâ„Å™„Åã„Å£„Åü„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„Éª„Çπ„ÇØ„Ç®„Ç¢ÈßÖËøë„Åè„ÅÆThe Harvard Coop(Êú¨Â±ã„Åï„Çì„Åß„Åô„Åå)„ÅßHarvard„ÅÆÊñáÂ≠ó„ÅÆÂÖ•„Å£„ÅüT„Ç∑„É£„ÉÑ„ÇíË≤∑„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Éê„ÉÉ„Ç∞„Å´„ÅØMIT„ÅÆ„Ç≥„Éº„Éó„Åß„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´Êõ∏„Åã„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„Åå„ÄÅMITÁ≥ª„ÅÆ„Ç∞„ÉÉ„Ç∫„ÅØË¶ãÂΩì„Åü„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÂü∫Êú¨„ÅØÊú¨Â±ã„Åï„Çì„Å™„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅÂà•„ÅÆË¶≥ÂÖâÂú∞„ÅßÂ£≤„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÇãÊèêÊê∫„Ç∞„ÉÉ„Ç∫„ÇíÊé¢„ÅôÊñπ„ÅåÂäπÁéá„ÅØ„ÅÑ„ÅÑ„Åã„ÇÇ„Åó„Çå„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇ„ÇÇ„Å°„Çç„ÇìÊú¨„ÅØ„ÅÑ„Å£„Å±„ÅÑ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ(Âü∫Êú¨Ëã±Ë™û„Åß„Åô„Åå)
translated_text:
It was one of the world's leading universities, which could be said to have become even more famous in 2014, and how it is a famous school with a long history.
Although the place name is Cambridge, Cambridge University is a British university. The grounds are basically open because it is a university, but I did not go inside the building because I did not think it was a good place for tourists to walk around. We did not go into the "Harvard Museum of Natural History" because I did not think it was a good place for tourists to walk around in the building. (I am not interested in that kind of things.) However, it might be a good idea to enter the museum as a historic building.
It was a Saturday in early September, and I saw a couple of young men carrying a large sofa by two people before going to Harvard. Why? I wondered why, but I found out the reason when I entered the campus. It seemed they were having a flea market for unused items, and they were selling sofas and even crooked wire hangers. There was also a party(?) on the lawn in front of the museum. It was very interesting to see a part of students' life.
I saw the movie "Social Network" on the plane on the way back to Japan, and I was convinced that Harvard University is a good place to study. It was a tragedy or a trouble for a genius programmer who got mixed up in a famous university where children of good families enter, and the actual atmosphere of Harvard made me realize the strict elitist consciousness that is difficult to see in the synopsis of the movie. I think it is a well-made film.
I couldn't find any souvenirs on campus, so I went to The Harvard Coop (a bookstore) near Harvard Square station and bought a T-shirt with the word Harvard on it. The bag was written as if it was also an MIT Coop, but I did not find any MIT-related goods. Since it is basically a bookstore, it might be more efficient to look for affiliated goods sold at another tourist attraction. Of course, there are lots of books. (Though they are basically in English).

title: Visita interessante
text: Vale la pena venire ad Harvard e farsi raccontare da uno studente dell'ultimo anno o appena laureato come si trascorre la giornata in questa universit√†, con qualche aneddoto spiritoso e qualche informazione interessante sulla storia dell'edificio e dei personaggi famosi che l'hanno frequentata. Visita di un'oretta abbondante. Possibilit√† di un pranzo veloce nei paraggi.
translated_text: It's worth coming to Harvard and having a senior or recently graduated student tell you how the day is spent at this university, with some witty anecdotes and some interesting information about the history of the building and the famous people who attended it. Visit lasting a good hour or so. Possibility of a quick lunch nearby.

title: ‰∏ñÁïå„ÅÆÊúâÂêçÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÔºÅ
text: Ë®Ä„Çè„Åö„Å®Áü•„Çå„Åü‰∏ñÁïå„ÅßÊúÄ„ÇÇÊúâÂêç„Å™Â§ßÂ≠¶„ÅÆ‰∏Ä„Å§„ÅÆ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„ÄÇÊúÄÂØÑ„Çä„ÅÆÂú∞‰∏ãÈâÑËøë„Åè„Å´„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÊúâÂêç„Å™ÂÉè„ÅßÂÜôÁúü„ÇíÊíÆ„Çä(Ë∂≥„ÇíËß¶„Çã„ÅÆ„Çí„ÅäÂøò„Çå„Å™„ÅèÔºÅ)„ÄÅÊßãÂÜÖ„ÇÑËøëËæ∫„ÇíÊï£Ê≠©„Åô„Çã„Å®ËâØ„ÅÑ„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇËøë„Åè„Å´„ÅØÂ§ßÂ≠¶„Ç∞„ÉÉ„Ç∫„ÅåÂ£≤„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÅäÂ∫ó„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
translated_text: Harvard, as it is known, is one of the most famous universities in the world. It was located near the nearest subway. Take a picture with the famous statue (don't forget to touch its feet!) ) and take a walk around the campus and neighborhood. There is also a store nearby that sells university goods.

title: Che bello...
text:
E' una delle universit√† pi√π famose al mondo e, quando si entra nei suoi confini, l'atmosfera che vi si respira √® particolare. Si vedono tanti giovani che girano, studiano, chiacchierano, giocano nei suoi numerosi parchi. Gli edifici che lo compongono sono imponenti e mettono una cerca soggezione.
Da visitare assolutamente.
translated_text:
It is one of the most famous universities in the world, and when you enter its boundaries, the atmosphere there is special. You see many young people walking around, studying, chatting, playing in its many parks. Its buildings are imposing and awe-inspiring.
Definitely worth visiting.

title: Campus maravilhoso
text: Estudar aqui deve ser um sonho. S√£o poucos os pr√©dios que se tem acesso, mas passear pelo Campus j√° √© uma del√≠cia. Super arborizado, estudantes passando de um lado para o outro. N√£o deixe de tirar foto com a est√°tua do fundador e depois pesquise sobre tudo que est√° de errado nela. Muito interessante!
translated_text: Studying here must be a dream. There are only a few buildings you can access, but walking around the campus is a delight. It's overgrown with trees, with students passing from one side to the other. Be sure to take a photo with the statue of the founder and then research everything that's wrong with it. Very interesting!

title: fucina di personalit√†
text:
Visitare Harvard e sentire lo spirito del campus universitario fa capire come da questa scuola siano usciti tanti laureati che hanno fatto poi la storia della nazione.
Credo che dovremmo pendere esempio.
translated_text:
Visiting Harvard and feeling the spirit of the university campus makes you realize how so many graduates came out of this school who went on to make the nation's history.
I think we should set an example.

title: Inspiraci√≥n para el conocimiento
text: La visita a Harvard es indiscutiblemente un complemento interesante en la visita a Boston. Las colecciones de Harvard en sus museos son completas y conservadas. Quiz√° el pecado es la falta de espacio de las colecciones. Por lo dem√°s, el campus de la Universidad no solo es una de las cunas del conocimiento m√°s importantes que existen, sino que es un destino lleno de vida, color y gente interesante. La ciudad universitaria dispone asimismo de una oferta de comercios y establecimientos satisfactoria.
translated_text: A visit to Harvard is undoubtedly an interesting complement to a visit to Boston. Harvard's collections in its museums are complete and well preserved. Perhaps the sin is the lack of space in the collections. Otherwise, the University campus is not only one of the most important cradles of knowledge in existence, but also a destination full of life, color and interesting people. The university town also has a satisfactory range of stores and establishments.

title: Splendido!
text: Incredibile differenza tra le universit√† italiane e queste americane. Ecco perch√© gli States sono cos√¨ avanti... Wow!
translated_text: Incredible difference between Italian universities and these American ones. That's why the States are so far ahead.... Wow!

title: Encanto cl√°sico
text: Si se aprecian los lugares con historia, cl√°sicos y de alg√∫n modo rom√°nticos, es simplemente maravilloso y deslumbrante visitar Harvard. Para quienes sienten debilidad por los espacios intelectuales podr√°n comprender que s√≥lo con estar en Harvard, se puede sentir un estremecimiento y respeto profundos. Un lugar que no se debe dejar pasar.
translated_text: If you appreciate historical, classical and somehow romantic places, it is simply wonderful and dazzling to visit Harvard. For those who have a weakness for intellectual spaces you can understand that just by being at Harvard, you can feel a deep thrill and respect. A place not to be missed.

title: Fascinante
text: Es espectacular sumergirse entre los senderos de esta inmensa Universidad. Uno tiene la posibilidad de conocer su cultura y ver como se vive. Recomendable.
translated_text: It is spectacular to immerse oneself in the trails of this immense university. One has the possibility to get to know its culture and see how it is lived. Highly recommended.

title: Eccezionale!
text: Harvard non ha bisogno di presentazioni, tuttavia √® degno nota questo tour organizzato interamente dagli studenti :) Prienka √® stata la nostra guida: non solo molto chiara nelle spiegazioni ma anche disponibile e sempre con la battuta pronta! Complimenti!
translated_text: Harvard needs no introduction, however this tour organized entirely by students is noteworthy :) Prienka was our guide: not only very clear in explanations but also helpful and always with a ready joke! Kudos!

title: Un lugar que hay que conocer.
text:
La universidad, es inmensa. Se puede recorrer durante unas cuantas horas. Hay tours gratuitos que ofrecen los estudiantes, contando varias de las historias de la famosa Universidad (el tour es en ingl√©s).
Se puede acceder a algunas de las diversas universidades que contiene el inmenso campus de Harvard, ver sus aulas, apreciar las casas donde se hospedan algunos de los estudiantes.
translated_text:
The university is huge. It can be toured for a few hours. There are free tours offered by the students, telling many of the stories of the famous University (the tour is in English).
You can access some of the various colleges that contain the huge Harvard campus, see their classrooms, appreciate the houses where some of the students stay.

title: Interessante
text:
L'universit√† di Harvard √® sempre stata il mio sogno. Il Campus √® molto bello anche se molto simile alle Universit√† Inglesi di Cambridge e Oxford. Organizzato molto all'americana con gli studenti che gestiscono il merchandising e anche le visite guidate sebbene nel mese di agosto ci hanno detto che i tour organizzati dagli studenti non ce ne erano, abbiamo poi scoperto che non c'erano quelli propri dell'universit√† ma c'√® ne erano comunque di tour, complessivamente una visita interessante con la brochure( costo 2 dollari anche in italiano
) che spiega perfettamente tutti i luoghi.
translated_text:
Harvard University has always been my dream. The campus is very beautiful although very similar to the English universities of Cambridge and Oxford. Organized very American style with students running the merchandising and also the tours although in August we were told there were no student-organized tours, we later found out there were no university's own but there were still tours, overall an interesting visit with the brochure( cost $2 also in Italian
) that explains all the places perfectly.

title: Impresionante arquitectura
text: Puedes pedir un paseo por la Casa Central. √âsta la realiza un estudiante que te cuenta c√≥mo se construy√≥ los edificios, historia, y famosos qui√©nes estudiaron ah√≠. Es gratis, solo debes dejar propina. Si lo quieres solicitar, se pide afuera del Subway "Harvard". Es interesante y muy entretenido.
translated_text: You can ask for a tour of the Casa Central. This is conducted by a student who tells you how the buildings were built, history, and famous people who studied there. It is free, you just have to leave a tip. If you want to ask for it, you can ask for it outside the "Harvard" Subway. It is interesting and very entertaining.

title: Centro de excel√™ncia em medicina mas tamb√©m em outras tantas √°reas
text: Visita muito interessante aos edif√≠cio do campus que s√£o de fato cinematogr√°ficos j√° que serviram in√∫meras vezes a Hollywood como loca√ß√£o de muitos filmes. O parque √© belo tanto no ver√£o quanto no inverno! E a evolu√ß√£o tecnol√≥gica dos laborat√≥rios na escola de medicina √© fabuloso! Adorei em todos os sentidos!
translated_text: A very interesting visit to the campus buildings, which are in fact cinematographic, as they have served Hollywood many times as locations for many films. The park is beautiful in both summer and winter! And the technological evolution of the laboratories in the medical school is fabulous! I loved it in every way!

title: Imponente.
text:
Es una imponente universidad. Dan ganas de estudiar all√≠.
Es enorme, llena de lugares al aire libre. Se puede entrar y visitar.
translated_text:
It is an impressive university. It makes you want to study there.
It is huge, full of outdoor places. You can go in and visit.

title: Um sonho a ser perseguido
text:
O campus √© organizado e um sonho para os jovens.
Adorei conhecer a atmosfera dessa universidade secular e que tanto contribui para o conhecimento mundial.
translated_text:
The campus is organized and a dream for young people.
I loved getting to know the atmosphere of this secular university that contributes so much to world knowledge.

title: Da non perdere
text: La visita alla storica universita' deve essere un must per chi viene a visitare Boston; noi abbiamo fatto il tour degli studenti, interessante e ben organizzato. Da non perdere assolutamente.
translated_text: A visit to the historic university must be a must for anyone coming to visit Boston; we took the student tour, which was interesting and well-organized. Absolutely not to be missed.

title: –§–∞–Ω—Ç–∞—Å—Ç–∏–∫–∞!
translated_text: Fantastic feeling of touching the Legend of education of the planet! The best of the best are trained here! The spirit of education and the future is everywhere,,,,,,,))))))

title: che meraviglia!
text: Tempio della cultura made in usa, l' universit√† pi√π famosa del mondo offre di s√© uno spettacolo incredibile.  Il contrasto cromatico tra il rosso delle pietre dei suoi edifici, i cornicioni sapientemente sbiancati, il verde dei prati e dei parchi.... questo perfetto blend crea emozioni a non finire. Chi non ha mai sognato di poter essere parte di tutto ci√≤?  Io da sempre!
translated_text: Temple of made-in-the-USA culture, the world''s most famous university offers of itself an incredible spectacle.  The color contrast between the red stones of its buildings, the expertly bleached cornices, and the green lawns and parks.... this perfect blend creates endless emotions. Who hasn't dreamed of being able to be a part of this?  Me for as long as I can remember!

title: un sogno!
text:
tante volte avevo sognato, immaginato di andarfe ad Harvard..
Rimani a bocca aperta per la bellezza, l 'ordine e le dimensioni del campus..
i colori predominanti sono il rosso dei mattoni e il verde degli spazi verdi!
tutto √® pulito e ordinato.
Bellissima √® anche la chiesa all' interno del complesso.
 Da ricordare la statua di John Harvard, il primo benefattore, situata di fronte all'University Hall.
La tradizione vuole  che toccando il piede sinistro della statua porti fortuna, doni intwelligenza.. e la gente fa la coda per rispettare il detto.
translated_text:
so many times I had dreamed, imagined going to Harvard....
Be amazed at the beauty, order and size of the campus....
the predominant colors are the red of the bricks and the green of the green spaces!
everything is clean and orderly.
Also beautiful is the church within the 'complex.
 Worth mentioning is the statue of John Harvard, the first benefactor, located in front of University Hall.
Tradition has it that touching the statue's left foot brings good luck, gives intwelligence--and people queue up to respect the saying.

title: Cenografico
text: O passeio pela universidade √© bel√≠ssimo: Pra√ßas, arvores e gente jovem passando para todo lado. Imposs√≠vel n√£o se imaginar em um filme, vale a visita.
translated_text: The walk around the university is beautiful: squares, trees and young people passing by everywhere. It's impossible not to imagine yourself in a movie, it's worth a visit.

title: ‰∏ñÁïå‰∏Ä„ÅÆÂ§ßÂ≠¶

title: Imperdibile

text: Neste lugar a gente consegue ver coisas simples do dia-a-dia que fazem a diferen√ßa. Muitos dos alunos v√£o de bike para gerar conhecimento de ponta, a tecnologia que impulsa o mundo.
translated_text: Here you can see the simple everyday things that make a difference. Many of the students go by bike to generate cutting-edge knowledge, the technology that drives the world forward.

title: La visita √® un must
text: Harvard √® una delle principali attrazioni di Boston ed una visita all'universit√† non pu√≤ mancare se ci si trova nella capitale del Massachusetts. Gli studenti organizzano tour guidati all'interno del campus, gratuiti, per gruppi di una cinquantina di persone al massimo. Basta andare al centro informazioni e lasciare le proprie generalit√† per iscriversi al prossimo giro. C'√® un tour all'ora e si comincia alle 10, normalmente. translated_text: Harvard is a major attraction in Boston, and a visit to the university is a must if you are in the capital of Massachusetts. Students organize guided tours around the campus, free of charge, for groups of up to fifty people. Just go to the information center and leave your contact information to sign up for the next tour. There is one tour per hour and it starts at 10 a.m. normally. Our guide was a student from the statistics department, brilliant and very clear in his exposition, very pleasant to follow, helpful and prodigal with all kinds of information about Harvard, from historical tidbits to the human aspects to the academic and financial aspects that characterize the life of this university. The tour lasts an average of an hour or so.

title: Si vas a Boston, no dejes de ir hasta Harvard
text: Visitar el campus de esta prestigiosa Universidad , bien vale la pena, apreciar√°n sus edificios, jardines ( Wifi free) y podr√°n observar a los estudiantes intercambiando opiniones o s√≥lo leyendo o charlando

text: Estar em Harvard √© de perder o folego! Quando a imagem da Tv toma forma √© inacredit√°vel. O lugar √© abarrotado de turistas que formam filas para tirar foto junto a estatua. title: Imperdibile

title: Sensazione di immensit√† culturale
text:
E' strano, ma varcare i confini dell'harvard university mi ha fatto sentire veramente piccolo... Entrare in un mondo di cultura, fondato nel 1636 √® basato su un principio fondamentale e bellissimo: "veritas".

Ma questa universit√† e' diversa, e' IL prestigio, circondato da misteri e storie che racchiudono i 400 di vita di questa istituzione...

Da non perdere assolutamente
translated_text:
It's strange, but crossing the boundaries of harvard university made me feel really small.... Entering a world of culture, founded in 1636 is based on a fundamental and beautiful principle: "veritas."

I can't explain it well, but the feeling was between being in a movie, and experiencing the feelings that a student has when entering the university for the first time... But this university is different, it is THE prestige, surrounded by mysteries and stories that encapsulate the 400 years of life of this institution...

Not to be missed

text: Realmente √© muito impressionante! D√° muito gosto ver o valor da educa√ß√£o nos Estados Unidos - infelizmente n√£o temos o mesmo apre√ßo em nosso pa√≠s. Com certeza vale a visita se estiver em Boston ou fazendo um curso no campus.

text: ÁèæÂΩπ„ÅÆ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶Áîü„Å´„Çà„Çã„Ç¨„Ç§„Éâ„ÉÑ„Ç¢„Éº„ÅåÂÇ¨„Åï„Çå„Å¶„Åä„ÇäÂèÇÂä†„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇË™¨Êòé„ÅÆË©≥Á¥∞„ÇíÁêÜËß£„Åô„Çã„Å´„ÅØ„ÅÇ„ÇãÁ®ãÂ∫¶„ÅÆËã±Ë™ûÂäõ„ÅåÂøÖË¶Å„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅÂ∞ÜÊù•„ÄÅÁ±≥ÂõΩ„Å∏„ÅÆÁïôÂ≠¶„ÇíË®àÁîª„Åï„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÇãÂ≠¶Áîü„Åï„Çì„ÅØ„ÄÅ‰∏ñÁïåÂ±àÊåá„ÅÆÂ§ßÂ≠¶Áîü„Å´Áîü„ÅßËß¶„ÇåÂêà„ÅÜÊ©ü‰ºö„Å®„Åó„Å¶„Åø„Å¶„ÅØ„ÅÑ„Åã„Åå„Åß„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„Åã„ÄÇ
translated_text: I participated in a guided tour given by a current Harvard student. title: Un lugar " de pel√≠cula "
text: Bueno, estoy a√∫n aqu√≠ en un curso de verano. Recuerdo la emoci√≥n del primer d√≠a mientras ingresaba al campus de Harvard y ve√≠a los edificios de tantas pel√≠culas y al Sr. Harvard y su pie lustroso (todos lo tocan no se s√≠ para la buena suerte o volver). Se siente m√°gico, casi irreal. Sentarse en las sillas sobre el pasto y ver pasar a lo que sabemos, son la elite intelectual de Boston al menos. Cuantos fascinantes nerds!, y acad√©micos con caras y maletines de tal rol! Qu√© historias los habr√°n conducido a esta famosa universidad. Eso si, si quieren una foto de la estatua, vengan temprano!! Los 5 d√≠as que llev√≥ aqu√≠ me han permitido ver toneladas de personas intentando una foto en solitario! Muchos son los que vienen, grupos de turistas e incluso de ni√±os. Las ardillas, eso si, no parecen molestas a pesar de que su sociabilidad no siempre es recompensada con algo de comida de los visitantes. translated_text: Well, I am still here on a summer course. I remember the excitement of the first day as I walked onto the Harvard campus and saw the buildings from so many movies and Mr. Harvard and his shiny foot (everyone touches it I don't know if it's for good luck or to come back). It feels magical, almost unreal. Sitting in the chairs on the grass and watching what we know are the intellectual elite of Boston at least. How many fascinating nerds, and academics with faces and briefcases of such a role! What stories must have led them to this famous university. Mind you, if you want a picture of the statue, come early!!!! The 5 days I have been here have allowed me to see tons of people trying to get a solo photo! Many are those who come, groups of tourists and even children. The squirrels, mind you, don't seem bothered even though their sociability is not always rewarded with some food from visitors. It is worthwhile to come and be part of the landscape that welcomes the passer-by with tolerance (although access to some places is exclusive to its members).

title: Centro de la vida universitaria de Harvard
text: Verla en verano permite admirar un parque sumamente verde, con enormes sombras y coloridos asientos para disfrutar un descanso en medio del recorrido. Interesant√≠sima la estatua (y su historia y aclaraciones) de John Harvard y "las tres mentiras".
