title: Vale la pena ir a conocerla
text: No est√° en el centro de Bost√≥n pero se llega bien en bus o metro en solo 15 minutos. Se accede libremente solo a los jardines y el exterior de los edificios
translated_text: It is not in the center of Boston but is easily reached by bus or subway in only 15 minutes. Free access only to the gardens and the exterior of the buildings.

title: Cena de filme
text: Visita obrigat√≥ria para quem visita Boston. Vc se sente numa cena de filme. Local lindo, tranquilo e cheios de estudante. Se vc for no domingo poder√° observar v√°rios estudantes fzd apresenta√ß√£o de bandas de m√∫sicas.
translated_text: A must for anyone visiting Boston. You feel like you're in a movie scene. A beautiful, peaceful place full of students. If you go on a Sunday, you'll be able to see lots of students performing in bands.

title: Viaje en el tiempo
text: Entrar al predio de la universidad, es entrar en una miniciudad, es decir, podr√≠a definirse a Harvard como una ciudad dentro de una ciudad. Harvard tiene la vida de Boston, la ciudad de Boston es triste y apagada al lado de lo que en el campus y todo su entorno es decir, hospital, cafeterias, helader√≠as, resto, bares, pubs, boliches, florerias, todo, con ese toque de flores en los postes de luz y carteles, adoquines prolijamente puestos, estilo ingl√©s antiguo, parece una maqueta y genera la sensaci√≥n de haber traspasado un humbral hacia varios siglos detras. Dentro de la Universidad Propiamente dicha, se encuentra la estatua de John Harvard, que cuenta la leyenda que hay que tocarle la punta del zapato del pie izquierdo y pedir un deseo, que se va a cumplir. La cola para hacerlo era muuuy larga y decid√≠ no hacerlo.
translated_text: To enter the university campus is to enter a mini-city, that is to say, Harvard could be defined as a city within a city. Harvard has the life of Boston, the city of Boston is sad and dull next to the campus and all its surroundings, i.e., hospital, cafes, ice cream parlors, rest, bars, pubs, bowling alleys, flower shops, everything, with that touch of flowers on the lampposts and signs, cobblestones neatly placed, old English style, looks like a model and generates the feeling of having passed through a threshold several centuries ago. Inside the University itself, there is the statue of John Harvard, which legend has it that you have to touch the toe of his left shoe and make a wish, which will be fulfilled. The line to do so was very long and I decided not to do it.

title: Enfin j'y ai mis les pieds
text: Quel beau site √† voir. La richesse de cette architecture de tous les b√¢timents c'est √† couper le souffle. Tu peux marcher pendant des heures sur ce site. Tu peux le faire par toi-m√™me ou faire une visite guid√©e avec un guide. Beaucoup de photos √† prendre. Incroyable d'avoir gard√© les b√¢timents en si bon √©tat. A voir.
translated_text: What a beautiful site to see. The architectural richness of all the buildings is breathtaking. You can walk around this site for hours. You can do it on your own or take a guided tour. Lots of photos to take. Incredible to have kept the buildings in such good condition. A must-see.

title: Man sollte nicht zu viel erwarten
text:
Wir waren dort w√§hrend der "Semesterferien". Ja, Harvard ist ein sch√∂ner Campus. Er ist sehr im Stil der restlichen Stadt. Es macht Spa√ü die alten Geb√§ude zu sehen und mal einen etwas anderen Campus. Jedoch sollte man nicht zu viel erwarten. Harvard ist nicht so gro√ü wie es einem gerne vermittelt wird. Man hat relativ schnell alles gesehen.
Ich w√ºrde empfehlen dort einen Blick zu riskieren wenn die Studenten da sind. Zwischen den Jahren war es dort wie leer gefegt.
translated_text:
We were there during the "semester break". Yes, Harvard is a beautiful campus. It's very much in the style of the rest of the city. It's fun to see the old buildings and a slightly different campus. However, you shouldn't expect too much. Harvard is not as big as people like to make it out to be. You see everything relatively quickly.
I would recommend taking a look when the students are there. It was empty between the years.

title: Interessante
text: La pi√π prestigiosa universit√† americana... che dire? Immersa nel verde, praticamente una citt√† nella citt√†. Il tour gratuito √® tenuto da studenti universitari. A noi √® capitato uno studente di matematica, simpatico pur nella spocchia che contraddistingue questi prescelti. Al di l√† di tutto, vi verr√† voglia di fare domanda per venirci a studiare.
translated_text: America's most prestigious university-what can I say? Surrounded by greenery, practically a city within a city. The free tour is given by university students. We happened upon a math student, nice despite the snootiness that characterizes these chosen ones. Beyond all that, you will want to apply to come and study there.

title: –ê—Ç–º–æ—Å—Ñ–µ—Ä–∞ –∑–Ω–∞–Ω–∏–π
translated_text: The small city of Cambridge was the halfway point of our trip through the northeastern United States. We stopped there for half a day, as we wanted to see one of the most famous universities in the world. We parked the car in one of the underground parking lots within walking distance of the university and went for a walk. The entrance to the territory where the campuses are located is free. It feels like you are in a library, but in the open air in a park. There is a lot of greenery, open lawn areas with plastic chairs. All the people are busy doing things, some with books, some with laptops or other gadgets. Some are lying on the grass, some are sprawled out on chairs, and some are sitting in the recesses of buildings. The only people who make a fuss are the tourists taking pictures with the Harvard monument or noisily feeding the squirrels. It was very pleasant to walk around and absorb the aroma of knowledge. When we left the territory, we ducked into a typical semi-basement local bar, where in a modest atmosphere we tasted pizza and beer and discussed the charming town of Cambridge to the sounds of American soccer, which were coming from the TV on the wall.

title: Deu at√© vontade de ser intelectual
text: Lugar muito lindo. Arborizado, bem conservado , muitas pessoas por l√°. Eh bonito de ver aquelas pessoas sentadas por l√°, lendo, conversando, descansando...
translated_text: A very beautiful place. Wooded, well kept, lots of people there. It's nice to see all those people sitting there, reading, chatting, resting...

title: Mi √® piaciuto
text: Se si va a boston e si ha un p√≤ di tempo da dedicare alla visita del campus si rimarra stupiti da quante persone affollano i giardini, √® un continuo via vai di passanti. Ma fa effetto anche vedere le sedie colorate disposte ad accogliere chi √® stanco di camminare, che legge, che gioca. Consigliato e facilmente raggiungibile con la metro della linea rossa e con il bus n. 1
translated_text: If you go to boston and have some time to spend visiting the campus you will be amazed at how many people crowd the gardens; it is a constant coming and going of passersby. But it's also impressive to see the colorful chairs arranged to welcome those who are tired of walking, reading, playing. Recommended and easily reached by the Red Line subway and bus No. 1

title: –¢–∞–º –≥–¥–µ —É—á–∞—Ç—Å—è –ª—É—á—à–∏–µ
translated_text: This place is a must-visit, and if time permits, you should allocate at least half a day for it. The spirit and atmosphere of the Harvard campus is mesmerizing! The architecture of the university itself and the surrounding neighborhoods is very diverse and beautiful. For an extra fee, you can buy a tour on site, but I would recommend just walking around on your own.

title: Hermosa arquitectura
text: M√°s all√° de la reputaci√≥n acad√©mica, Harvard es una belleza arquitectonica. No se puede ir a Cambridge y no recorrer el maravilloso campus...
translated_text: Beyond its academic reputation, Harvard is an architectural beauty. You can't go to Cambridge and not tour the wonderful campus....

title: A faire
text:
Voir cette universit√© dont vous avez probablement entendu parl√© 1000 fois c'est top.
Il ne faut surtout pas h√©siter √† entrer dans les locaux comme des √©tudiants, cela nous a permis de voir cette universit√© de l'int√©rieur. Nous avons eut la chance de voir un match sur leur stade.
translated_text:
Seeing this university you've probably heard about 1,000 times is great.
You shouldn't hesitate to enter the premises as students, as this allowed us to see the university from the inside. We were lucky enough to see a match in their stadium.

title: –≤–æ—Å—Ç–æ—Ä–≥
translated_text: My husband and I were in Boston only one day, and we spent almost half of our time in this wonderful city on the territory of Harvard University. The territory is large, green, and very cozy. You can walk around for hours, watching the local students and professors, because it is a whole town. The architecture of the buildings is interesting - there are modern lecture halls and old buildings, a beautiful library with columns, a church. Opposite one of the exits from the territory there is a souvenir store, where we bought gifts for relatives and friends with the emblems of the university.

title: Hist√≥rica
text: Local hist√≥rico, com longos gramados densamente arborizados, casa dos principais pr√©dios da universidade. Muito bonito.
translated_text: Historic site with long, densely wooded lawns, home to the main university buildings. Very beautiful.

title: Imperd√≠vel!
text: Vale a pena conhecer o campus da universidade mais famosa do mundo. √â muito arborizado e agrad√°vel andar pelos pr√©dios. Fomos de Back Bay (Boston) at√© o campus da Harvard em Cambridge de bicicleta e foi sensacional o passeio.
translated_text: The campus of the world's most famous university is well worth a visit. It's very wooded and pleasant to walk around the buildings. We went from Back Bay (Boston) to the Harvard campus in Cambridge by bike and it was a sensational ride.

title: L'"universit√†" per definizione
text: Visitando Boston √® impossibile non fare una capatina in quella che √® l'universit√† per definizione. Superato il cancello ci si ritrova davanti i vari edifici in mattoni rossi visti spesso nei film e che, in parte, si possono visitare. Pensando a tutti gli intellettuali, i politici e gli scienziati che sono passati da qua non si pu√≤ non rimanerne affascinati. Tra le varie chicche, sicuramente la possibilit√† di osservare il primo vero computer della storia e la statua del (finto) fondatore di Harvard.
translated_text: Visiting Boston, it is impossible not to pop into what is the university by definition. Once through the gates one is confronted with the various red brick buildings often seen in the movies and which, in part, can be visited. Thinking of all the intellectuals, politicians and scientists who have passed through here, one cannot help but be fascinated. Among the various goodies, certainly the chance to observe the first real computer in history and the statue of the (fake) founder of Harvard.

title: IMPRESIONANTE
text: Fuimos en familia y con amigos, si bien era √©poca de receso y solo estaban los cursos de verano, nos encant√≥ la organizaci√≥n, amplitud y  orden que se apreciaba en cada edificio del Campus. Sin dudas no pod√©s dejar de visitar Harvard University si est√°n en Boston.
translated_text: We went with family and friends, even though it was recess time and there were only summer courses, we loved the organization, amplitude and order that could be appreciated in each building of the Campus. Without a doubt, you cannot miss Harvard University if you are in Boston.

title: Sem Palavras
text:
Um lugar incr√≠vel. 
Sensacional, o ensino de la √© realmente impressionante, al√©m do mais.
√â uma das universidades mais lindas que j√° vi.
translated_text:
An incredible place.
Sensational, the teaching there is really impressive, what's more.
It's one of the most beautiful universities I've ever seen.

title: Sonho real !
text: O campus todo, e sobretudo esta √°rea tradicional√≠ssima, s√£o lindos e representam um est√≠mulo constante √† busca de Conhecimentos... E √© muito mais do que aquilo que se v√™ em filmes... Sensacional !
translated_text: The whole campus, and above all this very traditional area, are beautiful and represent a constant stimulus to the search for Knowledge... And it's much more than what you see in the movies... Sensational!

title: Excel√™ncia em educa√ß√£o
text: A excel√™ncia desta universidade √© conhecida mundialmente, mas caminhar pelos campus, observar as instala√ß√µes, esculturas e jardins √© um raro prazer. Um ambiente cosmopolita que fomenta o estudo e a pesquisa.
translated_text: The excellence of this university is known worldwide, but walking around the campus, looking at the facilities, sculptures and gardens is a rare pleasure. A cosmopolitan environment that encourages study and research.

title: Muito legal!
text: A universidade √© gigantesca, os pr√©dios s√£o lindos! Vale a pena pegar um mapa para ajudar na localiza√ß√£o dos pr√©dios! Uma atra√ß√£o imperd√≠vel em Boston.
translated_text: The university is huge, the buildings are beautiful! It's worth getting a map to help you locate the buildings! An unmissable attraction in Boston.

title: visite guid√©e √† faire
text: La visite guid√©e est faite par les √©tudiants ( toutes les heures de 1√† √† 15h). Les anecdotes ne manquent pas!
translated_text: Guided tours are given by students (every hour from 1 to 3pm). There's no shortage of anecdotes!

title: Tradicao
text: Visite o famoso jardim dq universidade, faca um tour guiado, em ingles, gratis, se increva no site da faculdade pra visitar a biblioteca, eh demais.
translated_text: Visit the famous university garden, take a guided tour, in English, for free, sign up on the university website to visit the library, it's amazing.

title: Num filme em Harvard
text: Viver um momento da hist√≥ria de Harvard vale muito a pena. Visite os caf√©s e o campus dessa Universidade tradicional e respeitada. S√≥ apreciar o local j√° vai ser um momento marcante da sua viagem.
translated_text: Living a moment in Harvard's history is very worthwhile. Visit the caf√©s and the campus of this traditional and respected university. Just enjoying the place will be a highlight of your trip.

title: Dove nascono i cervelli
text:
L'impressione - varcando la soglia di Harvard (non il cancello centrale, ma quelli laterali pi√π piccoli e poi vi spiego il perch√®) - ci si sente piccoli, non tanto per l'entrata in s√® quanto prendere coscienza che i pi√π grandi intellettuali, statisti, politici, scienziati, etc. del mondo hanno frequentato questo luogo.  E' bello vedere tanti ragazzi di diverse nazionalit√† passeggiare nei giardini, oppure leggere, studiare, seduti nei prati o ai tavolini delle piazzette interne al campus, d√† un'idea di "mondo pulito" ed √® ci√≤ di cui si ha bisogno.
La visita gratuita offerta dagli studenti ai visitatori trasmette la gioia del sapere e una tappa nei negozi di souvenir √® indispensabile : almeno un articolo tra magliette, sciarpe, cappellini, felpe, biro, tazze, portachiavi, etc.etc. con il marchio della prestigiosa universit√† bisogna davvero portarselo a casa.  La spiegazione dell'entrata dai cancelli laterali  ??  Il cancello grande, importante, si sorpassa solo in uscita, ormai laureati ad Harvard.  E' pura scaramanzia ma viene osservata da tutti ...
translated_text:
The impression - crossing the threshold of Harvard (not the central gate, but the smaller side ones and then I will explain why) - one feels small, not so much because of the entrance itself as becoming aware that the world's greatest intellectuals, statesmen, politicians, scientists, etc. have frequented this place.  It is nice to see so many young people of different nationalities strolling in the gardens, or reading, studying, sitting on the lawns or at the small tables in the small squares inside the campus, it gives an idea of a "clean world" and that is what one needs.
The free tour offered by the students to the visitors conveys the joy of knowledge and a stop in the souvenir stores is indispensable : at least one item among T-shirts, scarves, caps, sweatshirts, ballpoint pen, mugs, key chains, etc.etc. with the trademark of the prestigious university you really have to take home.  The explanation of the entrance from the side gates ?  The big, important gate is passed only on the way out, now a Harvard graduate.  It is pure superstition but is observed by everyone ...

title: Incr√≠vel!!!
text: Melhor que visitar a Harvard University √© poder participar de seus eventos e seu cotidiano. Adoro aquele ambiente, as pessoas estudando, aprendendo, trocando conhecimento. √â um lugar que chega a ser m√°gico. Um tour pelos pr√©dios antigos e novas constru√ß√µes √© bem legal, afinal trata-se da melhor universidade do mundo!
translated_text: Better than visiting Harvard University is being able to take part in its events and daily life. I love that atmosphere, the people studying, learning and exchanging knowledge. It's a magical place. A tour of the old buildings and new constructions is really cool, after all, this is the best university in the world!

title: la qualit√† e la storia della pi√π prestigiosa universit√† USA
text: Che dire, Boston √® la numero 1 in tutto e come tale non poteva che  avere l'universit√† pi√π prestigiosa degli USA. Campus totalmente differente da MIT, molto pi√π english ed elegante. Molto divertente anche di sera.
translated_text: What can I say, Boston is number 1 in everything and as such could only have the most prestigious university in the USA. Totally different campus from MIT, much more English and elegant. Very fun even in the evening.

title: Muy bien cuidado
text: Vale la pena caminar x aqui, se encuentra bien cuidado y rodeado de edificios con una linda arquitectura, puedes tomar lindas fotos y relajarte caminando.
translated_text: It is worth walking here, it is well kept and surrounded by buildings with beautiful architecture, you can take nice pictures and relax walking.

title: lindo campus
text: Fuimos con nuestros amigos para tener la oportunidad de conocer esta famosa Universidad, el campus es muy bonito, la arquitectura de los edicificios es Hermosa tambien, sin lugar a dudas una visita que vale la pena hacer.
translated_text: We went with our friends to have the opportunity to visit this famous University, the campus is very nice, the architecture of the buildings is beautiful too, without a doubt a visit worth doing.

title: Um passeio agrad√°vel
text: A universidade de harvard √© tradicionalissima nos EUA e est√° aberta para visita√ß√£o o ano todo. Seus jardins s√£o muito bem cuidados e √≥timos para um passeio agrad√°vel,
translated_text: Harvard University is a very traditional university in the USA and is open to visitors all year round. Its gardens are very well-kept and ideal for a pleasant stroll,

title: L'universit√† dei sogni
text: Quando si parla di universit√† e si cit√† Harvard, si intende citare la migliore universit√† al mondo, quella da cui escono le menti pi√π brillanti, gli scienziati di domani. Per chi visita Boston credo sia obbligo andare anche a Cambridge per visitare questa universit√†, anche solo per ammirarla da fuori. E poi anche l'edificio, la sede in pratica, √® davvero bella e piacevole, sia per chi vi studia che per il turista che la deve soltanto "ammirare". Interessante.
translated_text: When people talk about universities and cite Harvard, they mean to mention the best university in the world, the one from which come the brightest minds, the scientists of tomorrow. For those who visit Boston I think it is a must to also go to Cambridge to visit this university, if only to admire it from the outside. And then also the building, the seat basically, is really beautiful and pleasant, both for those who study there and for the tourist who just has to "admire" it. Interesting.

title: Biasa Kampusnya, Luar Biasa Prestasinya
text:
Universitas Harvard sering dipilih sebagai perguruan tinggi peringkat 1 dunia, didirikan pada tahun 1636, jadi sudah berumur 378 tahun.  Harvard dan MIT persisnya berlokasi di kota yang sama, yakni Cambridge (walaupun banyak yang mengira berlokasi di Boston, karena Cambridge merupakan kota kecil berseberangan sungai dengan Boston).  Sebagai universitas tua, tentu banyak bangunan tua yang menarik untuk dilihat di kampus universitas ini.  Jarak antara Harvard dan MIT sangat dekat, berada dalam satu jalur subway (red line), hanya terpisah oleh satu stasiun saja.  Harvard dan MIT merupakan seteru abadi, namun persaingan yang sehat menyebabkan kedua universitas ini sama-sama maju pesat.

Jika anda berharap menemukan gedung-gedung ultra mewah di kampus ini, maka anda akan kecewa, karena gedung-gedung di kampus Harvard merupakan tipikal universitas tua di Amerika Serikat.  Kehebatan Harvard bukan pada fisik gedungnya, tetapi dari apa yang dihasilkan dari kegiatan akademiknya.  Harvard telah melahirkan 47 pemenang Nobel, 48 pemenang Pulitzer, dan 32 kepala negara.

Komposisi mahasiswanya juga sangat berbeda dengan perguruan tinggi di negara berkembang, termasuk Indonesia.  Di Harvard, jumlah mahasiswa S1 (undergraduate) sedikit, sekitar 6.700 orang saja, tetapi mahasiswa S2 dan S3 (graduate) mencapai 14.500 orang.  Ini merupakan salah satu ciri universitas riset. Kalau ingin memahami bagaimana perguruan tinggi seharusnya dikelola, maka Harvard bisa menjadi model yang bagus.
translated_text:
Harvard University, often voted the world's number one university, was founded in 1636, making it 378 years old.  Harvard and MIT are actually located in the same city, Cambridge (although many people think it's in Boston, as Cambridge is a small town across the river from Boston).  As an old university, there are many interesting old buildings to see on the campus.  The distance between Harvard and MIT is very close, being on the same subway line (red line), separated by only one station.  Harvard and MIT are eternal enemies, but the healthy rivalry has led to both universities progressing rapidly.

If you're expecting to find ultra-luxurious buildings on this campus, then you'll be disappointed, as the buildings on Harvard's campus are typical of older universities in the United States.  Harvard's greatness is not in its physical buildings, but in what it produces from its academic activities.  Harvard has produced 47 Nobel laureates, 48 Pulitzer winners, and 32 heads of state.

The composition of its students is also very different from universities in developing countries, including Indonesia.  At Harvard, the number of undergraduate students is small, around 6,700, but the number of graduate and postgraduate students reaches 14,500.  This is one of the characteristics of a research university. If you want to understand how universities should be managed, Harvard can be a good model.

title: Hahvahd
text: Fizemos um passeio guiado pelo campus. Foi muito interessante, cheio de curiosidades. Meus filhos e sobrinha ficaram muito bem impressionados com toda a hist√≥ria e estrutura desta universidade.
translated_text: We took a guided tour of the campus. It was very interesting, full of curiosities. My children and niece were very impressed with all the history and structure of this university.

title: Boston'a giderseniz g√∂rmeden d√∂nmeyin
text: Boston'un merkezinden metro ile ula≈üƒ±m √ßok kolay, metrodan hemen kar≈üƒ± kaldƒ±rƒ±mƒ±nda √ßƒ±kƒ±yorsunuz ve kimse size bir≈üey sormuyor, elinizi kolunuzu sallaya sallaya kamp√ºse girebiliyorsunuz. Kamp√ºs dediƒüime bakmayƒ±n, girdiƒüinizde de √ßok bir≈üey beklemeyin, ortada k√º√ß√ºk bir ye≈üil alan, her turistin mutlaka sol ayaƒüƒ±nƒ± ok≈üarken fotoƒüraf √ßektirdiƒüi John Harvard'ƒ±n heykeli ve 4 tarafƒ± kaplayan tuƒüladan binalar. K√ºt√ºphane gibi kimi binalara sadece kartla girilebiliyor ama rahatlƒ±kla girip gezebileceƒüiniz binalarda var. √áevredeki d√ºkkanlarda satƒ±lan hediyeliklerden alabilirsiniz. Kƒ±sacasƒ± √ßok bir≈üey olmasa bile bu kadar √ºnl√º bir √ºniversitenin yakƒ±nƒ±na gelipte g√∂rmemek olmaz.
translated_text: It is very easy to get to the campus from the center of Boston by subway, you exit the subway on the opposite sidewalk and no one asks you anything, you can enter the campus as you wish. Don't look at me when I say campus, don't expect much when you enter, there is a small green area in the middle, the statue of John Harvard, which every tourist takes a photo of while stroking his left foot, and the brick buildings covering 4 sides. Some buildings, like the library, are only accessible with a card, but there are other buildings that you can easily enter and visit. You can buy souvenirs sold in the surrounding shops. In short, even if it's not much, you can't come near such a famous university and not see it.

title: Linda universidade
text: Linda universidade para caminhar e conhec√™-la. H√° a tradicional foto ao lado de John Harvard. H√° tours guiados de 1 a 1:30 h. Local bacana para conhecer e tirar fotos.
translated_text: A beautiful university to walk around and get to know. There's the traditional photo next to John Harvard. There are guided tours lasting from 1 to 1.30 hours. Nice place to visit and take photos.

title: S√≠ vas a Boston no dejes de visitar Harvad
text: Vas a pensar que estas dentro de una pel√≠cula, si viste la sociedad de los poetas muertos vas a recordarlo y tambi√©n vas a pasar delante de todas las fraternidades.
translated_text: You will think you are inside a movie, if you saw the dead poets society you will remember it and you will also pass in front of all the fraternities.

title: ÂçöÁâ©È§®„Å®Êò†ÁîªÈ§®
text:
ÂÆöÁï™„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„É§„Éº„Éâ„ÇíÊï£Ê≠©„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅ„Ç∏„Éß„É≥„Éª„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂÉè„ÅßÂÜôÁúü„ÇíÊíÆ„Å£„Å¶„ÄÅCOOP„ÅßË≤∑„ÅÑÁâ©„ÄÅ„Å†„Å®„Åä„ÇÇ„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÂÄã‰∫∫ÁöÑ„Å™„Åä„Åô„Åô„ÇÅ„ÅØ„ÄÅ„Åì„Çå„Çâ„Å´Âä†„Åà„ÄÅËá™ÁÑ∂Âè≤ÂçöÁâ©È§®„Å®Êò†ÁîªÈ§®„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
Êò†ÁîªÈ§®ÔºàHarvard Film ArchiveÔºâ„ÅØ„ÄÅÂè§„ÅÑÂêçÁîª„ÇÑ„Ç¢„Éº„ÉàÁ≥ªÊò†Áîª„ÇíÊØéÊô©‰∏äÊò†„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÁâπ„Å´Êó•Êú¨Êò†Áîª„ÅåÂÖÖÂÆü„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÄÅÈªíÊ≤¢„ÇÑÂ∞èÊ¥•„ÅØ„Åã„Å™„ÇäÁä∂ÊÖã„ÅÆËâØ„ÅÑ„Éï„Ç£„É´„É†„ÅåÊÆã„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Åù„ÅÜ„ÄÇ
Ëá™ÁÑ∂Âè≤ÂçöÁâ©È§®„ÅØÂà•È†Ö„Åå„ÅÇ„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅßÁúÅÁï•„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
translated_text:
A stroll through Harvard Yard, a picture at the John Harvard statue, and some shopping at COOP are the standard. My personal recommendation is to visit the Natural History Museum and the movie theater in addition to the above.
The movie theater (Harvard Film Archive) shows old classics and art films every night. It has a particularly good selection of Japanese films, with Kurosawa and Ozu remaining in fairly good condition.
The Natural History Museum has a separate section.

title: ÁîüÂçî„Åß„Åê„Å£„Å§„ÇíË≤∑„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ
text:
‰∏ñÁïå„ÅßÊúÄ„ÇÇÊúâÂêç„Å™Â§ßÂ≠¶„Å™„ÅÆ„Åß‰∏ÄÂ∫¶„ÅØË°å„Å£„Å¶„Åä„Åç„Åü„ÅÑ„Å®„Åì„Çç„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
MIT„Å®‰∏¶„Çì„Åß„ÅÑ„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅßÁ∞°Âçò„Å´Ë°å„Åè„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Çã„Åã„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
Âú∞‰∏ãÈâÑ„ÅßË°å„Åè„ÅÆ„ÅåÊúÄ„ÇÇÁ∞°Âçò„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
ÁîüÂçî„Åß„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶„Ç∞„ÉÉ„ÉÑ„ÅåÂ£≤„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅßÊòØÈùûË≤∑„Çè„Çå„Çã„Å®ËâØ„ÅÑ„Åã„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
translated_text:
It is the most famous university in the world and you should visit it at least once.
I think it is easy to get there because it is located alongside MIT.
The subway is the easiest way to get there.
You can buy Harvard University goods at the Co-op.

title: Uma hora bem gasta
text:
Tanto Harvard quanto o MIT possuem tours guiados por alunos pelo campus. Ambos s√£o recomendados pois s√£o grandes universidades americanas e s√£o renomadas em todo o mundo.
Os tours levam de 1h a 1h30 apenas e se o grupo de pessoas for pequeno n√£o precisa fazer reserva.
translated_text:
Both Harvard and MIT have student-led tours of the campus. Both are recommended because they are major American universities and are renowned throughout the world.
The tours take between 1 and 1.5 hours and if you have a small group you don't need to book.

title: Maravilhosa at√© congelada
text: Harvard √© parada obrigat√≥ria para quem vai a Boston. E sob neve os seus jardins ficam mais encantadores ainda. Quem vai √† Harvard obrigat√≥riamente precisa passar a m√£o no p√© de John Harvard para ter sorte e entrar na universidade, ou para seus filhos.
translated_text: Harvard is a must-see for anyone going to Boston. And its gardens are even more enchanting in the snow. Anyone who goes to Harvard is obliged to put their hand on John Harvard's foot if they want to be lucky and get into the university, or for their children.

title: Boston = Harvard
text:
Visiter Harvard n'est pas pour moi visiter un b√¢timent, mais bien tout un quartier riche en histoire. En fait, le Campus d'Harvard est une petite ville. √Ä travers les buildings abritant les salle de cours, les -trop belles- r√©sidences des √©tudiants et la majestueuse biblioth√®que, on y retrouve un th√©√¢tre, du shopping de qualit√© (marques populaires ou boutique unique), des pubs et restaurants, des jardins, √©glises et cimeti√®res, etc.
Un des plus beaux endroits en milieu urbains que j'ai au √† visiter.
translated_text:
For me, a visit to Harvard is not a visit to one building, but to an entire neighborhood rich in history. In fact, the Harvard campus is a small town. In addition to the buildings housing the classrooms, the all-too-beautiful student residences and the majestic library, there's a theater, quality shopping (popular brands or unique boutiques), pubs and restaurants, gardens, churches and cemeteries, and so on.
One of the most beautiful urban places I've ever visited.

title: Parte de un film ......
text: Estuve el Harvard Yard el pasado febrero ...... todo cubierto de nieve,con las ardillas jugueteando .... me parec√≠a estar en un set de filmacion .... es un lugar incre√≠ble ...enmarcado por unos edificio fantasticos .... lo mas significativo es que como ya lo hemos visto en tantas pel√≠culas....nos resulta  familiar .....Lo que nunca imagine es que se pueda acceder tan f√°cil y libremente,Me parece interesante ir en d√≠a de semana,con todo el bullicio del ambiente estudiantil y volver un domingo ..... y disfrutar de la paz de esos jardines ........
translated_text: I was at Harvard Yard last February ...... all covered with snow, with squirrels frolicking .... I felt like I was on a film set .... is an amazing place ...framed by some fantastic buildings .... the most significant thing is that as we have seen it in so many films.... it is familiar ..... What I never imagined is that you can access so easily and freely, I find it interesting to go on a weekday, with all the bustle of the student environment and return on a Sunday ..... and enjoy the peace of these gardens ........

title: Increible !!!!!!!!!
text: El pasado febrero estuvimos de visita en Boston. Contratamoss una excelente excursi√≥n en habla hispana (DON QUIJOTE ) y luego de visitar  la ciudad,nos llevo a Cambridge hicimos una parada en la Universidad de Harvard....para nuestro asombro tuvimos libre acceso a los claustros, .Era domingo  y nos pareci√≥ interesante volver al d√≠a siguiente con plena actividad estudiantil.Asi lo hicimos..... Nosotros fuimos en auto,pero es muy sencillo tambi√©n hacerlo en subte.....Fue una experiencia maravillosa que compartimos con nuestros hijos tambi√©n estudiantes universitarios...se los recomiendo !!!!!.
translated_text: Last February we visited Boston. We hired an excellent Spanish speaking tour (DON QUIJOTE) and after visiting the city, it took us to Cambridge and we made a stop at Harvard University.... to our amazement we had free access to the cloisters. It was Sunday and we thought it would be interesting to come back the next day with full student activity. So we did it..... We went by car, but it is also very easy to do it by subway..... It was a wonderful experience that we shared with our children who are also university students...I recommend !!!!!.

title: Visita muito agrad√°vel
text: Visitamos a Harvard University e foi muito legal ver os estudantes iniciando o per√≠odo letivo acompanhados de seus pais !
translated_text: We visited Harvard University and it was really nice to see the students starting their term with their parents!

title: Medical school
text:
Per ogni medico e studente una tappa alla mitica universit√† di Harvard e' obbligatoria. 
Alle 10,30 e alle 14 c'√® una visita guidata gratuita da parte degli studenti
Molto carino il negozio di souvenirs
translated_text:
For every physician and student, a stop at the legendary Harvard University is a must.
At 10:30 a.m. and 2 p.m. there is a free guided tour by students
Very nice gift store

title: Vale a visita
text: Apesar da neve, consegui andar bem pela faculdade e conhecer n√£o s√≥ a faculdade, como algumas resid√™ncias. O refeit√≥rio pra calouros parece o do filme do Harry Potter.
translated_text: Despite the snow, I managed to get around the college well and see not only the college but also some of the residences. The freshman cafeteria looks like the one in the Harry Potter movie.

title: Pena a Neve
text:
Fiz a minha visita em Fevereiro de 2014 e apesar da muita neve consegui dar uma volta pelos meandros das faculdades e resid√™ncias de Harvard.
Gostaria imenso de ter visitado a Biblioteca, todavia a enorme seguran√ßa associada n√£o permite deixar que os n√£o-estudantes tenham acesso ao seu interior.
Por causa da muita neve, n√£o encontrei tantas informa√ß√µes como desejaria.
translated_text:
I visited in February 2014 and despite the heavy snow I was able to wander around Harvard's faculties and residences.
I would have loved to have visited the Library, but the enormous security associated with it means that non-students can't get inside.
Because of the heavy snow, I didn't find as much information as I would have liked.

title: Dentro de um filme!!!
text: Muito legal passear entre os pr√©dios da universidade, que al√©m da arquitetura do local, tudo √© muito limpo e organizado. Voc√™ se sente dentro de um filme americano! N√£o deixe de visitar a famosa est√°tua do fundador da universidade, John Harvard. Diz a lenda que os estudantes devem tocar seu p√© esquerdo para ir bem nas provas.
translated_text: It's very nice to walk around the university buildings, which in addition to the architecture of the place, everything is very clean and organized. You feel like you're in an American movie! Don't miss the famous statue of the university's founder, John Harvard. Legend has it that students must touch his left foot in order to do well in their exams.

title: Exatamente como nos filmes.
text: Todos conhecem a faculdade de Harvard, e √© bem legal ver o lugar de perto, e tirar umas fotos como se estivesse estudando ou lecionando l√°. Fomos na √©poca de volta as aulas e conseguimos entrar em uma das salas de aula onde tiramos fotos em frente ao quadro-negro se fazendo de professor. Ao redor tem muitas lojas legais. Alguns brech√≥s com pe√ßas bem interessantes e livrarias excelentes.
translated_text: Everyone knows Harvard College, and it's really cool to see the place up close and take some photos as if you were studying or teaching there. We went during the back-to-school season and managed to get into one of the classrooms where we took photos in front of the blackboard posing as a professor. There are lots of nice stores around. There are some interesting thrift stores and excellent bookshops.

title: g√©nial !
text: super campus ; acc√®s libre ; on y entre comme on veut. au centre des chaises pour admirer les batiment et la statue porte bonheur. on se croirait presque √©tudiant !!
translated_text: super campus; free access; enter as you wish. in the center there are chairs to admire the buildings and the statue of good luck. it's almost like being a student!

title: Impec√°vel
text: Esta √© a faculdade dos sonhos e poder realizar um curso l√° foi muito bom. O lugar serve para estudos e passei pois √© um ponto de visita√ß√£o obrigat√≥rio. Excelente
translated_text: This is the college of my dreams and being able to do a course there was great. The place is good for studying and sightseeing because it's a must-see. Excellent

title: Hist√≥ria a p√©
text: Os jardins de Harvard unem uma variedade de edif√≠cios hist√≥ricos, de forte influ√™ncia arquitet√¥nica brit√¢nica. Embora tenha sido fundada em 1636, as edifica√ß√µes datam de per√≠odos posterioes. Em http://www.harvard.edu/visitors voc√™ pode acessar informa√ß√µes, inclusive um aplicativo para realizar um tour auto-guiado pelos jardins. N√£o deixe de conhecer a est√°tua em homenagem a John Harvard, o primeiro benem√©rito da universidade.
translated_text: Harvard's gardens unite a variety of historic buildings with a strong British architectural influence. Although it was founded in 1636, the buildings date from later periods. At http://www.harvard.edu/visitors you can access information, including an app for a self-guided tour of the gardens. Don't miss the statue in honor of John Harvard, the university's first benefactor.

title: Super agrad√°vel
text: Tinha muita vontade de conhecer... Deve ser muito agrad√°vel estudar num lugar como aquele (talvez quem estude l√° discorde... rsrsrsrsrsrs) Super bonito, organizado, com muitas informa√ß√µes... As salas de aulas que pude ver s√£o um espet√°culo!!!
translated_text: I really wanted to go there... It must be very nice to study in a place like that (maybe those who study there disagree... lol) Super beautiful, organized, with lots of information... The classrooms I saw were spectacular!!!

title: Sch√∂ner Campus
text: Der Campus ist etwas aufgeteilt, aber sehr sch√∂n und alles ist leicht zu Fu√ü zu erreichen. Die Historie der Universit√§t wird einem auf Anhieb bewusst und zwischen den alten Backsteingeb√§uden l√§sst es sich gerade im Sommer herrlich flanieren.
translated_text: The campus is somewhat spread out, but very beautiful and everything is within easy walking distance. The history of the university is immediately apparent and it is wonderful to stroll between the old brick buildings, especially in summer.

title: bellissima universit√†
text: proprio bella come struttura, un posto da visitare se si va a Boston. Universit√† piena di storia e fascino. io consiglio di andarci al mattino per le 9 perch√© dopo e' veramente pieno di gente. ps baciate il piede mi raccomando :D
translated_text: just beautiful as a facility, a place to visit if you go to Boston. University full of history and charm. i recommend to go there in the morning by 9 because after that it's really crowded. ps kiss your foot i recommend :D

title: Entretenido
text:
Pasear por el lugar, ver las construcciones (dormitorios, salas de clases, capillas, plazas, etc.) y los universitarios circulando vale la pena.
Me imagino que en primera o verano debe ser doblemente entretenido.
translated_text:
Walking around the place, seeing the buildings (dormitories, classrooms, chapels, squares, etc.) and the university students walking around is worthwhile.
I imagine that in first or summer it must be doubly entertaining.

title: Bellissimo...
text:
Se siete a Boston come potete non fare una capatina ad Harvard?
Questo campus lascia senza parole ... cos√¨ pieno di studenti,ma allo stesso tempo cos√¨ silenzioso,√® piacevole passeggiare all'interno del campus,immersi nel verde e osservare la bellezza architettonica di questa universit√†. A noi √® piaciuta l'aria che si respira in questo posto...tutto cos√¨ pulito,organizzato,preciso,ma anche tanto verde,tanti studenti,ma anche tanto silenzio...un posto incantevole.
translated_text:
If you are in Boston, how can you not make a detour to Harvard?
This campus leaves you speechless ... so full of students,but at the same time so quiet,it is pleasant to walk around the campus,surrounded by greenery and observe the architectural beauty of this university. We liked the air in this place...everything so clean,organized,precise,but also so much green,so many students,but also so much silence...a lovely place.

title: Harvard University -  A mais famosa! A mais antiga!
text: Tive o privil√©gio de fazer um curso de Ingl√™s na Universidade de Harvard, EM 2002. Localizada em Cambridge, logo ap√≥s cruzar a ponte sob o Rio Charles que a separa de Boston/MA, dispensa qualquer coment√°rio. A Est√°tua de John Harvard √© uma atra√ß√£o √† parte; tem at√© a pintura do p√© desbotada de tanto que os alunos colocam a m√£o para tirar foto. Eu tirei a minha! Pelo menos 8 presidentes americanos se formaram l√°, entre eles Roosevelt e Obama. Em 2002 quando engatinh√°vamos no com√©rcio de laptops, fui a uma sala de estudo da Harvard que j√° tinha no m√≠nimo uns 80 laptops, prontinhos pra gente usar. Pra muita gente, conhecer Harvard University √© um sonho. Eu n√£o sonhei...mas fiz meu cursinho de Ingl√™s de uns 2 meses l√°. E tive a oportunidade de conviver com estudantes do Jap√£o, Korea, Equador, Pakistan...
translated_text: I had the privilege of studying English at Harvard University in 2002. Located in Cambridge, just across the bridge over the Charles River that separates it from Boston/MA, it needs no comment. The Statue of John Harvard is an attraction in its own right; the paint on its foot is even faded from students putting their hands on it to take a photo. I took mine! At least 8 American presidents graduated from Harvard, including Roosevelt and Obama. In 2002, when we were just starting out in the laptop business, I went to a Harvard study room that already had at least 80 laptops, ready for us to use. For many people, going to Harvard University is a dream. I didn't dream it... but I did study English there for about two months. And I had the opportunity to meet students from Japan, Korea, Ecuador, Pakistan...

title: Visitando o campus da Universidade
text: Os pr√©dios da Universidade seguem um padr√£o de constru√ß√£o que caracteriza as depend√™ncias da Universidade; Tudo muito limpo, muito organizado e a sensa√ß√£o que se t√™m √© de estar no cen√°rio de um filme americano...rsrsr
translated_text: The University's buildings follow a pattern of construction that characterizes the University's premises; everything is very clean, very organized and you feel like you're on the set of an American film... lol

title: Curso de Lideran√ßa Executiva na Primeira Inf√¢ncia, em Harvard
text: Visitei o campus de Harvard em Cambridge, especialmente a Public Health Faculty e conheci as depend√™ncias dessa conceituada escola, o q muito me orgulho. As aulas foram no predio da escola de Educa√ß√£o, j√° que o curso teve uma abordagem intersetorial importante. Tivemos um jantar de gala com a dire√ß√£o do Center Childhood Development e o reitor de Harvard.
translated_text: I visited the Harvard campus in Cambridge, especially the Public Health Faculty, and got to know the facilities of this renowned school, which I am very proud of. Classes were held in the School of Education building, as the course had an important intersectoral approach. We had a gala dinner with the directors of the Center for Childhood Development and the Dean of Harvard.

title: FANTASTICA
text: Non ho alcun appunto da fare , forse per vistarla al meglio ci vorrebbe un' indicazione su quale percorso segure per una corretta visita , una sorta di percorso guidato .
translated_text: I don't have any notes to make , maybe to see it at its best we would need an 'indication on which route to follow for a proper visit , a kind of guided tour .

title: Hermosos jardines
text:
Es un lugar ideal para ir en verano y pasar todo el d√≠a recorriendo no s√≥lo los edificios principales de la universidad sino para estar en los jardines comiendo algo o leyendo un libro. 
Se puede pagar por un gu√≠a que te lleva a un recorrido o con un mapa cada uno lo arma como quiere.
Desde Boston se llega en un subte.
translated_text:
It is an ideal place to go in summer and spend the whole day touring not only the main buildings of the university but to be in the gardens eating something or reading a book.
You can pay for a guide to take you on a tour or with a map you can put it together as you wish.
From Boston you can take a subway.

title: Excelente passeio
text: Um leve passeio pelo Harvard Yard √© obrigat√≥rio para quem vai a Boston. √â poss√≠vel conhecer um pouco da arquitetura e do ambiente da universidade
translated_text: A stroll through Harvard Yard is a must for anyone visiting Boston. You can see a little of the university's architecture and atmosphere

title: emozionante
text:
camminare nei giardini del campus √® stato emozionante! non √® difficile da trovare,  nel pieno centro!
merita una visit√†.
translated_text:
walking in the campus gardens was exciting! not hard to find, right in the center!
well worth a visit.

title: Tem que visitar
text: Ir para Boston e n√£o dar um pulo em Harvard √© deixar uma bela visita de lado. Al√©m de ser muito bem cuidado, o lugar √© cheio de hist√≥ria. V√°rios tours dispon√≠veis.
translated_text: To go to Boston and not visit Harvard is to miss out on a great visit. As well as being very well looked after, the place is full of history. Several tours are available.

title: Ottimo
text: Vale la pena dare un occhiata ad Harvard ,che dire ,per un italiano che ha visto nelle universit√† italiane cose inenarrabili e' un po' frustrante ,comunque parliamo del top del top ,una bella passeggiata scambiando 4 chiacchiere con chi ci vive dentro e' stato veramente piacevole.
translated_text: It's worth taking a look at Harvard,what can I say,for an Italian who has seen unspeakable things in Italian universities it's a bit frustrating,however we're talking about the top of the top,a nice walk exchanging 4 chats with the people who live in it was really enjoyable.

title: N√£o custa sonhar
text: Nunca √© demais sonhar com a possibilidade de estudar ou ter seus filhos estudando em Harvard. Ent√£o, pra dar sorte, a gente vai e cumpre o "ritual" de passar a m√£o no pezinho j√° dourado de John Harvard.
translated_text: You can never dream too much about the possibility of studying or having your children study at Harvard. So, for good luck, we go and perform the "ritual" of touching John Harvard's already golden feet.

title: A busca do conhecimento.
text: Visitamos a estrutura f√≠sica da Universidade, seus monumentos e pudemos sentir fortemente a tradi√ß√£o presente um todos os locais. Visitamos a livraria e pudemos adquirir alguns livros de interesse. Interessante essa visita.
translated_text: We visited the physical structure of the University, its monuments and we could strongly feel the tradition present everywhere. We visited the bookshop and were able to buy some interesting books. An interesting visit.

title: ÂÜ≤ÁùÄÂìà‰ΩõËøô‰∏§‰∏™Â≠óÂ∞±ÂÄº‰∫Ü
text: Âà∞Âìà‰ΩõÂ§ßÁ∫¶ÊòØÊØè‰∏™‰∫∫ÁöÑÂêëÂæÄÂêß„ÄÇÂõõÂπ¥ÂâçÊÄÄÊä±‰∏ÄËÖîÁÉ≠ÊÉÖÊú™ËÉΩÊàêË°åÔºåËøôÊ¨°Áªà‰∫éËÉΩÂ¶ÇÊÑøÁúãÁúãÁªôÊàëÊçÆ‰ø°ÁöÑÂú∞Êñπ‰∫Ü„ÄÇÊ≥¢Â£´È°øÊòØÂ∞ëÊúâÁöÑÂè™ÈúÄÊ≠•Ë°åÂíåÂÖ¨ÂÖ±‰∫§ÈÄöÂ∞±ËÉΩËµ∞ÈÅçÁöÑÂüéÂ∏Ç„ÄÇÂà∞Âìà‰ΩõÂπøÂú∫Á´ô‰∏ãÔºåHarvard YardÂ∞±Âú®Ë°óÂØπÈù¢„ÄÇÊ∏Ö‰∏ÄËâ≤ÁöÑÁ∫¢Á†ñÂª∫Á≠ëÔºå‰∏çËµ∑ÁúºÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÁèçË¥µÁöÑÂ∞±ÊòØËøôÁßçÊú¥Á¥†ÂÆâÈùôÁöÑÊ∞îÊ∞õ„ÄÇÂà∞‰∫ÜËëóÂêçÁöÑÂìà‰ΩõÂÖàÁîüÈìúÂÉèÂâçÔºåÊë∏‰∫Ü‰ªñÁöÑÂ∑¶ËÑöÔºå‰ΩÜÊÑøËÉΩÂèòËÅ™ÊòéÔºÅ

title: Campus sensacional
text: Harvard fica localizado em Cambridge, uma cidadezinha pr√≥xima a Boston, e a visita ao campus √© um passeio imperd√≠vel. Todos os locais do campus s√£o muito bonitos e bem cuidados, tanto os pr√©dios quanto os jardins. Uma boa sugest√£o √© fazer uma visita guiada, que alguns departamentos da universidade oferecem.
translated_text: Harvard is located in Cambridge, a small town near Boston, and a visit to the campus is a must. Every part of the campus is beautiful and well-kept, both the buildings and the gardens. A good suggestion is to take a guided tour, which some university departments offer.

title: ‰∏ñÁïåÈ°∂Á∫ßÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑÈ£éËåÉ
text: Ê≤°Âà∞ËøáÂìà‰ΩõÂ∞±‰∏çÁÆóÂà∞ËøáÊ≥¢Â£´È°øÔºåÁªèËøáÂ§ßÂ≠¶Ê≠£Èó®Êó∂ÊÑüÊÖ®ËøôÁ´üÁÑ∂ÊòØ‰∏ñÁïå‰∏ÄÊµÅÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑÊ†°Èó®„ÄÇ‰ΩÜÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁöÑÂÆûÂäõÊõ¥Âú®‰∫éÂ•πÁöÑËΩØ‰ª∂ÔºåÊòØ‰∏ÄÊµÅÁöÑÊïôÊéàÔºå‰∏ÄÊµÅÁöÑÂ≠¶ÁîüÈÄ†Â∞±‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÊµÅÁöÑÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÄÇÊàëÂà∞ÁöÑÈÇ£Â§©Ê≠£Â•ΩÊòØÂë®Êú´ÔºåÂà∞Â§ÑÈÉΩÊòØÊÖïÂêçÊù•ÂèÇËßÇÁöÑÊ∏∏ÂÆ¢ÔºåÂèÇËßÇ‰πã‰ΩôÂà´Âøò‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÂÆöË¶ÅÊë∏‰∏Ä‰∏ãÂìà‰ΩõÂÖàÁîüÁöÑÂ∑¶ËÑö„ÄÇ

title: wow!
text:
Ci sono voluta andare... e non me ne sarei mai voluta andare.
Harvard ha quel fascino di sapienza e austerit√† ma anche di giovane respiro che ogni citt√† universitaria dovrebbe avere.
Se solo un minimo amate l'idea di cultura e vi piace passeggiare in posti intrisi di conoscenza questo √® il posto che fa per voi!
translated_text:
I wanted to go there-and I never wanted to leave.
Harvard has that charm of wisdom and austerity but also of young breath that every university town should have.
If you just a little bit love the idea of culture and enjoy walking around places steeped in knowledge this is the place for you!

title: Todos queremos ir a Harvard
text: No importa cu√°nto tiempo haya pasado desde que saliste de la escuela, cuando vas a Harvard quieres volver a ser estudiante. El lugar es hermoso, jardines amplios y edificios espectaculares. Vale la pena tomar un tour para conocer los detalles de sus espacios, como que los estudiantes consideran de mala suerte entrar por la puerta principal, o la historia de la familia que don√≥ la biblioteca. Lo obligado es sobar el pi√© de John Harvard para tener buena suerte en tu carrera.
translated_text: No matter how long it's been since you left school, when you go to Harvard you want to be a student again. The place is beautiful, spacious gardens and spectacular buildings. It is worth taking a tour to learn the details of its spaces, such as that students consider it bad luck to enter through the front door, or the history of the family that donated the library. The obligatory thing to do is to rub John Harvard's foot for good luck in your career.

title: Vale a pena!
text: Apesar de nao poder entrar na maioria dos pr√©dios, visitar a universidade mais conceituada no mundo tem o seu valor! O campus √© muito bonito, com diversos pr√©dios com uma arquitetura inglesa cl√°ssica e muito bem conservados! Vale a pena pegar uma tarde para dar uma caminhada por l√°!
translated_text: Although you can't enter most of the buildings, visiting the world's most prestigious university is worth it! The campus is very beautiful, with several buildings with classic English architecture and very well preserved! It's worth taking an afternoon to walk around!

title: Visitar Harvard √© imperd√≠vel!!!
text: Visitar Harvard √© um passeio imperd√≠vel para quem est√° em Boston. O lugar √© lindo, cheio de hist√≥ria. Lembra Hogwarts. V√°rios tours est√£o dispon√≠veis, eu contratei um com os pr√≥prios alunos de Harvard e fiquei satisfeito.
translated_text: Visiting Harvard is a must for anyone in Boston. The place is beautiful and full of history. Several tours are available, I hired one with the Harvard students themselves and I was pleased.

title: Excelsa
text: Es la Universidad por excelencia. El sue√±o inalcanzable de muchos, tanto por su nivel de exigencia como por sus costos. Amplios jardines, con muchos lugares para sentarse a leer y tomar un caf√©. Me pareci√≥ el ambiente muy circunspecto, silencioso,  a diferencia de otras universidades donde el clima era de juventud. Aqu√≠ parece que se respira sabidur√≠a.Por supuesto que tocamos el pie izquierdo de la estatua de John Harvard
translated_text: It is the University par excellence. The unattainable dream of many, both for its level of demand and its costs. Large gardens, with many places to sit and read and have a coffee. I found the atmosphere very circumspect, quiet, unlike other universities where the atmosphere was youthful. Of course we touched the left foot of John Harvard's statue.

title: Tr√®s beaux b√¢timents!
text: J'√©tais contente de voir le campus de l'Universit√© Harvard. C'est aussi beau que dans les films. Tous ces b√¢timents de briques rouges! Les couleurs de l'automne rendaient le site des plus enchanteurs.
translated_text: I was happy to see the Harvard University campus. It's just as beautiful as in the movies. All those red brick buildings! The fall colors made the site even more enchanting.

title: Universit√† da telefilm....
text: Harvard... appena varcati i cancelli sembra di stare in uno di quei telefilm che da adolescenti guardavi con occhi sognanti, un'emozione respirare l'aria del campus, questi studenti tutti con le felpe dell'universit√†, la sala mensa che sembra quella di harry Potter √® una cosa incantevole, per chi passa da boston √® una tappa obbligatoria!
translated_text: Harvard. as soon as you walk through the gates it feels like you're in one of those TV shows that you watched with dreamy eyes as a teenager, a thrill to breathe the air of the campus, these students all wearing university sweatshirts, the mess hall that looks like harry potter's is enchanting stuff, for those passing through boston it's a must see!

title: –ó–∞–º–µ—á–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–µ –º–µ—Å—Ç–æ!!!
translated_text: It is a wonderful place! The whole complex of buildings related to the university (not only academic buildings, but also stores, restaurants, cafes), and the streets themselves - everything breathes youth, health and energy. In the evenings cafes are filled with young people with books and notebooks, who are reading or writing something over a cup of coffee. A lot of kids with whom their parents-students walk:), a lot of squirrels, which these kids feed with cookies right from their hands:). In small parks between the knowledge are arranged multicolored chairs, which looked very beautiful against the background of trees with yellowing leaves.... Amazing atmosphere...

title: Um lugar que remete a excel√™ncia
text: Andar pelos jardins de Harvard nos remete de imediato ao ambiente de excel√™ncia dessa universidade americana.
translated_text: Walking through Harvard's gardens immediately brings to mind the atmosphere of excellence at this American university.

title: Bellissima universit√†!
text:
Bellissima universit√† con giardini e struttura molto curati e pieno di studenti che tramite tour spiegano le origini dell'universit√† e tutto ci√≤ che rappresentano i vari edifici, non √® possibile visitarlo all'interno.
Il tour lo si prenota in un ufficio davanti, √® ad orari stabiliti e molto richiesto, cercate o di prenotarlo prima o di essere l√¨ abbastanza presto mettendo in conto di doverlo fare in un orario successivo se nn ci sono posti..
Infatti noi nn abbiamo potuto farlo poich√® pieno, e quindi armati di mappa lo abbiamo fatto da soli:√® tutto molto curato, gli studenti che se lo possono permettere e che lo frequentano vengono da ogni parte del mondo e hanno un futuro diciamo gi√† assicurato.
Lo consiglio vivamente anche visitandolo da soli, √® molto pi√π caratteristico del "fratello" blasonato  MIT.
translated_text:
Beautiful university with very manicured gardens and facility and full of students who through tours explain the origins of the university and all that the various buildings represent, you cannot visit inside.
You book the tour at an office in front, it is at set times and very much in demand, try either to book it before or be there early enough anticipating having to do it at a later time if there are no seats..
In fact we couldn't do it as it was full, so armed with a map we did it ourselves:everything is very well taken care of, the students who can afford it and who attend it come from all over the world and have a future let's say already assured.
I highly recommend it even visiting it alone, it is much more distinctive than its emblazoned "brother" MIT.

title: Campus muito bonito
text: Um lugar a se visitar devido ao grande nome que tem. Muito bonito, todo arborizado, conhecer a est√°tua de Jonh Harvard, a Biblioteca, enfim passear pelo campus da Universidade. Adorei conhecer!
translated_text: A place to visit because of its great name. Very beautiful, all wooded, you can see the statue of Jonh Harvard, the Library, and walk around the University campus. I loved it!

title: Hist√≥rica
text: Es el sue√±o de un estudiante, ir a sus jardines y patios, pero m√°s que nada por su excelencia e hist√≥ria, ojo que es super exigente, es decir no es para cualquier estudiante universitario, adem√°s su costo es muy elevado. Fundada por los colonos langlicanos ingleses , su parque ya lo hemos visto en varias pel√≠culas entre ellas recuerdo "Una mente brillante". Obviamente fuimos a tocar el zapato de la estatua de su fundador Jhon Harvard.
translated_text: It is a student's dream to go to its gardens and courtyards, but mostly for its excellence and history, beware that it is super demanding, that is not for any college student, plus its cost is very high. Founded by the English Langlican settlers, its park has already been seen in several movies, among them I remember "A brilliant mind". Obviously we went to touch the shoe of the statue of its founder John Harvard.

title: Passeio que vale √† pena!
text: Fiz um passeio muito interessante e instrutivo com Harvard hitorical walking tour. Vale muito √† pena conhecer, saber mais da hist√≥ria, ver ospr√©dios mais antigos e conhecer a redondeza. O tour durou aproximadamente 1h30, com tempo para fotografar os belos lugares! Me senti emuma m√°quina do tempo!
translated_text: I went on a very interesting and instructive tour with the Harvard Historical Walking Tour. It's well worth seeing, learning more about the history, seeing the oldest buildings and getting to know the surroundings. The tour lasted about 1.5 hours, with time to take pictures of the beautiful places! I felt like I was in a time machine!

title: Se√±orial
text: Es como si entraras al mundo de Harry Potter, por la edificacion. La diversidad cultural es increible. Me encanto.
translated_text: It's as if you were entering the world of Harry Potter, because of the buildings. The cultural diversity is incredible. I loved it.

title: Harvard
text: Imposs√≠vel n√£o se impressionar com Harvard. O lugar √© lindo e enorme. Cen√°rio de filme. Cheio de esquilos. O campus √© enorme. Reza a lenda que para ir bem nas provas deve-se tocar o p√© esquerdo da est√°tua de John Harvard.
translated_text: It's impossible not to be impressed by Harvard. The place is beautiful and huge. A movie set. Full of squirrels. The campus is huge. Legend has it that to do well in your exams you have to touch the left foot of the statue of John Harvard.

title: Belo conjunto arquitet√¥nico
text: Gostei muito de Harvard, transmite o espa√ßo serenidade e agu√ßa nossos sentidos para conhecer a hist√≥ria desta famosa Universidade, visite-a, vale a pena.
translated_text: I really liked Harvard, it conveys serenity and sharpens our senses to learn about the history of this famous University, visit it, it's worth it.

title: Lindos jardines
text: Debes pasear por los jardines de Harvard. Nosotros entramos a la escuela de ciencias y arte y los jardines son hermosos. Hay una estatua del fundador Harvard, una iglesia dentro del campus, y la bibilioteca enorme.
translated_text: You must walk through the gardens at Harvard. We went into the school of science and art and the gardens are beautiful. There is a statue of the founder Harvard, a church inside the campus, and the huge library.

title: Harvard complex, Cambridge, Massachustts, USA
text:
Appena fuori Boston, si trovano due delle pi√π importanti universit√† degli USA e del mondo intero, MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology) e Harvard. Ho visitato la seconda, mentre mi sono solo fermato per una foto ricordo al MIT.

Fortunatamente era una domenica, ed ho comunque avuto grossi problemi a trovare un parcheggio: non oso immaginare durante la settimana.

Harvard √® sicuramente uno tra i "campus" pi√π famosi al momdo e vale una visita, se non altro per una foto ricordo alla Business School of Economics.

L'area universitaria √® molto ampia, quindi ci vuole una buona mezza giornata per visitarla senza dover correre.

Sicuramente un luogo consigliato, per immergersi in un luogo che sforna di continuo persdone destinate ad avere influenza, sia in campo politico che economico, sul mondo intero.
translated_text:
Just outside Boston are two of the most important universities in the U.S. and the world, MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology) and Harvard. I visited the latter, while just stopping for a souvenir photo at MIT.

Fortunately, it was a Sunday, and I still had big problems finding a parking space-I dare not imagine during the week.

Harvard is definitely one of the most famous "campuses" in the momdo and worth a visit, if only for a souvenir photo at the Business School of Economics.

The university area is very large, so it takes a good half day to visit without having to rush.

Definitely a recommended place, to immerse yourself in a place that continually churns out persdone people destined to have influence, both in politics and economics, on the entire world.

title: tour
text: La nostra guida, pur essendoci molti stranieri, parlava velocissimo e con un accento incomprensibile... comunque gita da fare se si va a Boston
translated_text: Our guide, even though there were many foreigners, spoke very fast and with an unintelligible accent... anyway trip to do if you go to Boston

title: Tiempo de Universidades
text: Harvard es un sue√±o! Si bien en verano van muchos turistas de todo el mundo, si o s√≠ hay que ir para sentirse un estudiante m√°s en ese inmenso campus universitario! Muero por ir a Harvard :)
translated_text: Harvard is a dream! Even though in summer many tourists from all over the world go there, you have to go there to feel like one more student in that huge university campus! I can't wait to go to Harvard :)

title: Imperdible.
text: Un lugar increible por su historia. Sentarse en alguna aula de Harvard es una experiencia fuerte, seas o no universitario. Sin dudas que vale la pena visitar el lugar.
translated_text: An incredible place for its history. Sitting in a Harvard classroom is a powerful experience, whether you are a college student or not. It is definitely worth a visit.

title: Universidad
text: Muy cuidada universidad con bellos jardines y calles donde pasear. Si se va en domingo resulta un paseo muy tranquilo. Vida universitaria.
translated_text: Very well kept university with beautiful gardens and streets to stroll through. If you go on Sunday it is a very quiet walk. University life.

title: Clima europeu nos EUA
text: Uma universidade muito bonita, com os alojamentos dos alunos em um clima bastante europeu. Os arredores da universidade s√£o muito bonitos, em um clima calmo e bastante acolhedor.

title: Historiens vingesus
text: Harvard Yard er fuld af historiske bygninger og interessante historie. Man m√¶rker de mange √•rhundreders viden symboliseret med John Harvardstatuen (husk at ber√∏re hans fod,) og samtidig kan man m√¶rke nutidens unge og deres lyst og gl√¶de ved at v√¶re en del af historien. En. Dejlig g√•tur.
translated_text: Harvard Yard is full of historic buildings and interesting history. You can feel the centuries of knowledge symbolized by the John Harvard statue (remember to touch his foot) and at the same time you can feel the youth of today and their desire and joy to be a part of history. One. Lovely walk.

title: Vale a visita!
text: Muito legal como se concentram os pr√©dios de Harvard, sua arquitetura, a distribui√ß√£o da sala de aula, as √°reas de estudo (inclusive, com as cadeiras coloridas e ao ar livre).

title: Encantador
text: Adorei conhecer a Universidade. Nostalgia e encantamento. A biblioteca √© enorme. Espero poder retornar.
translated_text: I loved visiting the University. Nostalgia and enchantment. The library is huge. I hope to return.

title: Obrigat√≥rio
text: Passear pelos campus,  ver as constru√ß√µes, tem guias que montam grupos no port√£o principal e levam para conhecer os principais locais, √© enorme , para passar uma tarde  vale a pena.
translated_text: Walk around the campus, see the buildings, there are guides who set up groups at the main gate and take you to see the main sites, it's huge, it's worth spending an afternoon.

title: Gran campus
text: Es una de las mejores universidades a nivel mundial y el campus es un gran lugar para descansar con sus sillas y bancos portatiles que puedes mover por todo el cesped mientras tomas un refresco

title: Historia
text: N√£o conhecia mas fiquei maravilhada com esta universidade, com seus 350 anos de historia mostra sua magnitude no cen√°rio mundial.
translated_text: I didn't know it but I was amazed by this university, with its 350 years of history it shows its magnitude on the world stage.

title: Una meraviglia!
text: Non mi sono sentita davvero in America fino a quando non ho varcato i cancelli di Harvard! un'atmosfera surreale e pacata allo stesso tempo.... un'autentica emozione ritrovarsi a visitare l'universit√† forse pi√π importante del mondo!!!!

title: Tem que ser excelente
text: Afinal √© a Universidade da excel√™ncia .A melhor em tudo, pr√™mios nobeis aos mont√µes .Visitar este local √© um "estado de espirito".
translated_text: After all, it's the University of Excellence, the best in everything, with tons of Nobel prizes. Visiting this place is a "state of mind".

title: Imperdible
text: Si, estan de visita por Boston no dejen de visitar Cambridge. Ahi se encuentran con la mitica Universidad Harvard... realmente dan ganas de perderse en el campus y volver a estudiar, jeje. Realmente te da la sensacion que estas en una pelicula. No le pierdan por nada.
translated_text: If you are visiting Boston, be sure to visit Cambridge. There you will find the mythical Harvard University.... It really makes you want to get lost on campus and go back to study, hehe. It really gives you the feeling that you are in a movie. Don't miss it for anything.

title: De tirar o f√¥lego!
text: Lugar maravilhoso. Caminhar por entre os pr√©dios da Universidade de Harvard √© de tirar o f√¥lego. Tive a oportunidade de visitar a capela, que √© imperd√≠vel. Recomendo.
translated_text: Wonderful place. Walking through the buildings of Harvard University is breathtaking. I had the opportunity to visit the chapel, which is not to be missed. I recommend it.

title: Interessante
text: Bella sensazione quella di stare in un campus universitario come quello di Harvard. Ottima l'idea di mettere delle sedie colorate ovunque nel prato.
translated_text: Nice feeling to be on a university campus like Harvard's. Great idea to put colorful chairs everywhere on the lawn.

translated_text:
It is located right in front of Harvard square station.
I went there in the summer and there were more tourists than students.
The lush green lawn was beautiful and there were many people lounging around.
It seems that the public is allowed to enter the art museum and the museum. However, the museum was currently under renovation.
Other than that, there is not much to see.... That is my personal opinion.
If you have time, it might be interesting to visit there.

title: Se respira excelencia
text:
Llegamos a visitar Harvard por nuestra cuenta justo el Harvard Freshman, el d√≠a que llegan a la universidad los nuevos alumnos, y son recibidos por los alumnos m√°s antiguos. Fue muy emocionante ver a los padres despidiendo a sus hijos, que a su vez mostraban esas caras de susto por estar ingresando a una de las mejores universidades del mundo, desde donde tienen al egresar pr√°cticamente asegurado su futuro econ√≥mico y profesional.
Se puede recorrer los patios sin problemas.
translated_text:
We came to visit Harvard on our own on Harvard Freshman Day, the day when the new students arrive at the university and are welcomed by the older students. It was very exciting to see the parents saying goodbye to their children, who at the same time were showing their frightened faces because they were entering one of the best universities in the world, where their economic and professional future is practically assured upon graduation.
You can walk through the courtyards without any problems.

title: Imprescindible
text: Imprescindible, no tanto por lo bonito, que no es feo, todo lo contrario, sino por lo que significa. Reconforta ver c√≥mo se pueden dedicar dinero y esfuerzo para satisfacer el deseo de conocimiento. Adem√°s al lado est√° el MIT, que tambi√©n vale la pena visitar y el propio pueblo, Cambridge, que vale un buen paseo.
translated_text: Essential, not so much for its beauty, which is not ugly, on the contrary, but for what it means. It is comforting to see how money and effort can be devoted to satisfy the desire for knowledge. In addition, next door is MIT, which is also worth a visit, and the town itself, Cambridge, which is worth a good walk.

title: Visita obligada para quienes viajan a Cambridge y Boston
text: Harvard Yard es ideal para caminar y recorrer los jardines y zonas exteriores que rodean los edificios y salones de Harvard University. En medio de mucha vegetaci√≥n, grandes y frondosos √°rboles, y lugares adecuados para descansar, disfrutar√°n de un delicioso paseo.
translated_text: Harvard Yard is ideal for walking and strolling through the gardens and outdoor areas surrounding Harvard University's buildings and classrooms. Amidst lush greenery, large, leafy trees, and places to rest, you will enjoy a delightful stroll.

title: Exatamente como nos filmes
text: Para n√≥s era priorit√°rio passar em Harvard numa visita a Boston. Adoramos o clima de cidade universit√°ria e pudemos andar naquela pra√ßa principal onde fica a est√°tua das 3 mentiras. Tudo muito tranquilo e organizado. Da pr√≥xima vez vou procurar um barco que v√° de l√° at√© o MIT.
translated_text: For us, it was a priority to stop off at Harvard on a visit to Boston. We loved the university town atmosphere and were able to walk around the main square where the statue of the 3 Lies stands. Everything was very peaceful and organized. Next time I'll look for a boat that goes from there to MIT.

title: american university
text:
Prendendo la metro da Boston, ci si arriva in 15 minuti...c'e' proprio lo stop harvard university.Prima di visitare Harvard ho fatto un piacevole giro per la cittadina di Cambrige deliziosa, piena di caffe' e ristorantini molto carini.consiglio una passeggiata a tutti coloro che vogliono visitare l'universita'.
L'universita' e' in stile ereo con i mattoncini,spettacolari zone verdi piene di pace,ho toccato il piede del padron di Harvard sperando che porti fortuna!!!!!!!!!!Dopo ovviamente e' d'obbligo andare all'harvard shop per prendere la maglietta!!!!!!!!!
translated_text:
Taking the subway from Boston,you can get there in 15 minutes...there is just the stop harvard university.Before visiting Harvard I had a pleasant walk around the small town of Cambrige delightful,full of cafes and very nice little restaurants.I recommend a walk to everyone who wants to visit the university.
The university is ereo style with bricks,spectacular green areas full of peace,I touched the foot of the Harvard master hoping it will bring good luck!!!!!!!!!!Afterwards of course it is a must to go to the harvard shop to get the t-shirt!!!!!!!!!

title: ambiente incr√≠vel
text: Passear por Harvard, mesmo sabendo que voc√™ n√£o estudar√° l√°, √© uma experi√™ncia muito boa. Os pr√©dios, os jardins, a biblioteca... Nota-se que tudo funciona. Aos redor do campus, v√°rios caf√©s cheios de estudantes e charme. Fui num dia de muito frio (-20C de sensa√ß√£o t√©rmica) e mesmo assim adorei andar por l√°. A cidade tamb√©m √© muito charmosa. Vale o passeio!
translated_text: Walking around Harvard, even if you know you won't be studying there, is a great experience. The buildings, the gardens, the library... You can see that everything works. Around the campus, there are many caf√©s full of students and charm. I went on a very cold day (-20C) and I still loved walking around. The city is also very charming. Well worth the walk!

title: Exemplo de campus universit√°rio
text: Apesar de um pouco mais distante do centro de Boston, vale √† pena uma visita para um passeio despreocupado por seu campus, incluindo uma parada na Harvard Bookstore para a compra de, pelo menos, um livro.
translated_text: Although a little further away from the center of Boston, it's worth a visit for a leisurely stroll around the campus, including a stop at the Harvard Bookstore to buy at least one book.

title: Experi√™ncia √∫nica
text: A universidade √© maravilhosa. √â uma experi√™ncia √∫nica fazer um curso em Harvard. Os professores s√£o muito bons. O espa√ßo √© lindo. Uma pena que n√£o pode entraria biblioteca para fotografar.
translated_text: The university is wonderful. It's a unique experience to do a course at Harvard. The teachers are very good. The space is beautiful. It's a shame you can't go into the library to take pictures.

title: imperdibile
text: La struttura √® semplice, mi aspettavo edifici pi√π imponenti e decorati. Tuttavia pensare che qui si sono laureati molti personaggi di fama mondiale (anche attori) √® veramente impressionante. Chi si iscrive paga 35000 dollari l'anno e 70000 per la facolt√† di medicina, si viene accettati solo se si appartiene ad un ceto elevato. Se siete a Boston non perdetevi questa gita a Cambridge.
translated_text: The structure is simple; I expected more impressive and ornate buildings. However, to think that many world famous people (even actors) have graduated here is really impressive. Those who enroll pay $35000 a year and 70000 for medical school, you are accepted only if you belong to a high class. If you are in Boston don't miss this trip to Cambridge.

title: ciencia e tecnologia
text: Uma linda estrutura, um pr√©dio bonito, com um belo jardim, que soh inspira conhecimento. Vale passear pelo jardim e sentir e aspirar toda a tecnologia que paira no ar.
translated_text: A beautiful structure, a beautiful building with a beautiful garden that inspires knowledge. It's worth strolling through the garden and feeling and inhaling all the technology that hangs in the air.

title: Un campus que invita a estudiar
text:
El Campus principal de la Universidad de Harvard conserva gran parte de los edificios y espacios que le han ido dando su renombre a esta gran universidad.
Caminar por sus senderos y parques, rodeado de universitarios mientras se vista alguna al√∫as de clase hacen de esta visita una gran experiencia.
translated_text:
The main campus of Harvard University retains much of the buildings and spaces that have been giving its reputation to this great university.
Walking through its paths and parks, surrounded by university students while you see some of the classrooms, makes this visit a great experience.

title: Diversidade Cultural
text: A universidade √© incr√≠vel, os pr√©dios e salas de aula s√£o lindos e √© tudo gigantesco. Organiza√ß√£o impec√°vel! Em julho a cidade fica lotada de estudantes do mundo todo. Vale muito a pena fazer os cursos de ver√£o!
translated_text: The university is incredible, the buildings and classrooms are beautiful and everything is huge. Impeccable organization! In July the city is packed with students from all over the world. It's really worth taking the summer courses!

title: Muito linda a universidade
text: √â tudo muito bonito e organizado .Muitas arvores no campos todo, uma enormidade ,tem que andar bastante, vale a pena conhecer,aquela estrutura.
translated_text: It's all very beautiful and organized. Lots of trees all over the fields, an enormity, you have to walk a lot, it's worth seeing, that structure.

title: Harvard
text: √â poss√≠vel visitar o campus da faculdade com tranquilidade e seguran√ßa. Conta com uma est√°tua de um dos membros da faculdade.
translated_text: You can visit the college campus in peace and safety. It has a statue of one of the faculty members.

title: Me gusto mucho
text: Es tal y como aprece en las pel√≠culas, lo que mas me impresiono fue lo sencilla que es, lo que quiere decir que lo importante ahi no es el lujo sino el conocimiento.  Fue muy emocionante ver el lugar donde se hacen las graduaciones y conocer todas las historias, anecdotas y cuentos de la universidad y sus fundadores.  Es bueno hacer la visita en un tour para conocer todas estas historias.  Yo lo hice con Don Quijote Tours en espa√±ol y fue excelente.  El tour duro 3 horas y nos llevaron a todos los lugares de interes de Boston incluyendo Harvard en Cambridge.
translated_text: It is just as it looks in the movies, what impressed me the most was how simple it is, which means that what is important there is not luxury but knowledge.  It was very exciting to see the place where the graduations take place and to know all the stories, anecdotes and tales of the university and its founders.  It is good to visit on a tour to learn all these stories.  I did it with Don Quijote Tours in Spanish and it was excellent.  The tour lasted 3 hours and they took us to all the places of interest in Boston including Harvard in Cambridge.

title: igual nos filmes
text: muito legal conhecer a Universidade de Havard, me senti vendo os filmes em que ela √© mencionada, a universidade fica dentro de um muro que circunda os principais pr√©dios, ambiente universit√°rio com muitos jovens transitando no local
translated_text: It was very nice to see Havard University, I felt like I was watching the movies in which it is mentioned, the university is inside a wall that surrounds the main buildings, a university atmosphere with lots of young people walking around the place.

title: Templo de forma√ß√£o de talentos!
text: Uma vez em Boston, √© interessante conhecer a Universidade de Harvard. Visitei no dia 30/06/13.  A sensa√ß√£o positiva para um professor √© maior ainda. √â como se adentr√°ssemos um templo de valoriza√ß√£o de talentos e conhecimento. √â uma institui√ß√£o fundada em 1636, muito tradicional  e prestigiada. Chama-se Harvard em homenagem a John Harvard, um de seus mecenas. Em 1780 passou a ser universidade. Precisa-se de um per√≠odo, no m√≠nimo, para conhecer as instala√ß√µes, como o jardim de Harvard. H√° muito que conhecer como, por exemplo, o campus de Harvard Business School.
translated_text: Once in Boston, it's interesting to visit Harvard University. I visited on June 30, 2013.  The positive feeling for a teacher is even greater. It's like entering a temple of talent and knowledge. It was founded in 1636 and is a very traditional and prestigious institution. It was named Harvard after John Harvard, one of its patrons. It became a university in 1780. You need at least a week to visit the facilities, such as the Harvard Garden. There is a lot to see, such as the Harvard Business School campus.

title: Vale a pena!
text: Vale muito a pena conhecer o campus principal da Universidade de Harvard, e depois passear nos arredores, onde h√° diversas lojas de souvenirs.
translated_text: The main campus of Harvard University is well worth a visit, followed by a stroll around the grounds, where there are many souvenir stores.

title: geweldig
