translated_text: To sample the atmosphere of this centuries-old institution in Cambridge. Beautiful buildings and gardens. Highly recommended if you are visiting Boston and Cambridge!

title: Tudo muito lindo!!!
text: O local √© fant√°stico!!! Tudo muito limpo, organizado. Arquitetura linda!!! Encontrar esquilos pelos jardins faz a diferen√ßa!!!
translated_text: The place is fantastic! Everything very clean, organized. Beautiful architecture!!! Finding squirrels in the gardens makes all the difference!!!

title: Linda experiencia!!
text:
En principio nos acercamos a un puesto para atenci√≥n a los visitantes en Harvard Square  donde nos orientaron muy bien como realizar una recorrida  auto guiada por los principales edificios.
Tambien tienen la opci√≥n de contratar algunos de los tous guiados que se ofrecen, nosotros por una cuesti√≥n de tiempo decidimos hacerlo por nuestra cuenta.
Con mapa en mano recorrimos en un par de horas los principales edificios de Hardvard.  El paseo es muy interesante se pueden apreciar las elegantes instalaciones, creo  con solo dos horas nos quedamos un poco cortos.
En resumen fue  incre√≠ble recorrer esta prestigiosa universidad, vale la pena.
translated_text:
At first we approached a booth for visitors in Harvard Square where we were very well oriented how to make a self-guided tour of the main buildings.
You also have the option of hiring some of the guided tours that are offered, but we decided to do it on our own due to time constraints.
With map in hand we toured the main buildings of Harvard in a couple of hours.  The tour is very interesting and you can appreciate the elegant facilities, I think with only two hours we were a little short.
In summary it was incredible to tour this prestigious university, it is worth it.

title: Â§ßÂ≠¶„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„Çà„ÇäË¶≥ÂÖâÂú∞Ôºü
text: Êó•Êú¨„Åß„ÇÇÊúâÂêç„Å™„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÄÇ„Ç≠„É£„É≥„Éë„ÇπÂÜÖ„ÅØË¶≥ÂÖâÂÆ¢„Åß„ÅÑ„Å£„Å±„ÅÑ„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÅåË¶≥ÂÖâÂú∞Âåñ„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÄÅ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„ÅÆÂÉè„Å´„ÅØÂ∏∏„Å´ÂÜôÁúüÊíÆÂΩ±„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã‰∫∫„Åå„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Éú„Çπ„Éà„É≥„Åã„Çâ„Åß„ÇÇÂú∞‰∏ãÈâÑÂà©Áî®„ÅßË°å„Åè„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„ÄÅÂ§ßÂ≠¶„Ç∞„ÉÉ„Ç∫„Å™„Å©„ÅÆ„Ç≥„Éº„Éó„ÅÆ„ÅäÂ∫ó„ÇÇÊ•Ω„Åó„ÇÅ„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅËøë„Åè„ÅÆMIT„Å®„Å®„ÇÇ„Å´ÂçäÊó•„ÅßÂêçÈñÄÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÇÅ„Åê„Çä„ÇíÊ•Ω„Åó„Åø„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ
translated_text: Harvard University is famous in Japan. The campus was full of tourists. The university has become a tourist attraction, and there were always people taking pictures of the statue of Harvard. I enjoyed a half-day tour of the prestigious university along with nearby MIT, as it is accessible by subway even from Boston, and you can also enjoy the Co-Op stores selling university goods and other items.

title: Impressionante
text: Vale a pena a visita ao lugar. Possui um ar todo especial. Sem contar o Museu de Hist√≥ria Natural e Antropologia! Precisa ser visitado.
translated_text: The place is well worth a visit. It has a special atmosphere. Not to mention the Museum of Natural History and Anthropology! It must be visited.

title: D√† proprio l'impressione di essere la n¬∞  1 al mondo
text:
Siamo stati alcuni anni fa a Boston, citt√† dove nel 1776 dal balcone della Old State House fu
letta per la prima volta la dichiarazione dell'indipendenza, piazzetta , casa, e balconcino esistono
tutt'ora.
In questa meravigliosa citt√† che in alcuni luoghi assomiglia a Londra siamo andati a visitare
la famosa  universit√† di John Harvard , fondata dall'omonimo prete nel 1630 .
Gi√† l'entrata principale √® piuttosto pomposa , e con tanto di stemma, poi proseguendo
all'interno si notano edifici d'epoca fatti con mattoni d'argilla rossa, molto belli a dire il vero,
e poi quelli pi√π nuovi non altrettanto belli , quello che mi ha colpito era lo spazio verde che
c'era, molti prati verdi, zone ricreative, e moltissimi giovani di tutte le parti del mondo che se la godevano giocando tra di loro, veramente un bel vedere.
Il refettorio √® ricavato da una bella vecchia grande chiesa, in mattoni rossi naturalmente, siamo entrati e c'era abbastanza baccano, centinaia di studenti erano intenti chi a mangiare, chi a chiacchierare chi a  cantare, ci venne subito incontro l'addetto alla sicurezza il quale con molto
garbo disse a me e mia moglie che non potevamo rimanere dentro la chiesa/refettorio.
Continuammo il nostro giro ed entrando da una porta aperta salimmo le scale belle pulite 
bianche silenziosissime, e ci trovammo al secondo piano nientepopodimeno che in direzione ,
anche li trovammo 2 segretarie le quali molto gentilmente ci dissero che non potevamo stare .
Ce da dire che noi impersonavamo perfettamente i turisti sulla cinquantina con tanto di macchina fotografica ciondoloni venuti da molto lontano, per ammirare quel pop√≤ di universit√†.
Ci dirigemmo verso il self service , molto grande , e con diversi punti di vendita come pizzeria,
cafeteria, ecc. ecc.  il nome della pizzeria era errato,  " Bella  Boca " noi lo facemmo presente
e ci dissero che l'avrebbero corretto, in un'altra struttura visitammo le aule , le quali  segnalazioni 
erano alfanumeriche, non molto grandi a dire il vero, max 150 persone, li nessuno ci disse nulla,
entrammo tranquillamente nelle aule e guardammo .
Dopo aver molto gentilmente ed educatamente rotto un po' le scatole a tutti attraversammo il
parco verso il monumento al prete  John Harvard il quale ha il piede sinistro completamente
levigato per il fatto che tutti appoggiano le mani su quel piede per farsi la foto, me compreso.
Ha un certo fascino la galleria  dei "famosi " , le quali targhe all'interno portano incisi nomi
e cognomi di personaggi che hanno fatto la storia degli Stati Uniti, caratteristiche le fontanelle di legno dove abbeverarsi.
buon viaggio       LuigiB
translated_text:
We were a few years ago in Boston, the city where in 1776 from the balcony of the Old State House was
first read the Declaration of Independence, little square, house, and balcony still exist
to this day.
In this wonderful city that in some places resembles London we went to visit
the famous John Harvard University , founded by the priest of the same name in 1630 .
Already the main entrance is rather pompous , and complete with coat of arms, then continuing
inside you notice period buildings made of red clay bricks, very beautiful actually ,
and then the newer ones not as beautiful , what struck me was the green space that
there was, lots of green lawns, recreational areas, and lots of young people from all parts of the world enjoying it playing with each other, really a beautiful sight.
The refectory is made out of a beautiful big old church, red brick of course, we entered and there was quite a hubbub, hundreds of students were intent on some eating, some chatting some singing, we were immediately met by the security officer who very
politely told my wife and I that we could not stay inside the church/refectory.
We continued our tour and entering through an open door went up the beautifully clean stairs
white very quiet, and we found ourselves on the second floor no less than in the direction ,
even there we found 2 secretaries who very kindly told us that we could not stay .
It must be said that we were perfectly impersonating the tourists in their fifties, complete with dangling cameras who had come from far and wide to admire that populace of a university.
We headed for the self-service , very large , and with several outlets such as pizzeria,
cafeteria, etc. etc. the name of the pizzeria was wrong, " Bella Boca " we pointed it out
and they told us they would correct it, in another facility we visited the classrooms , which reports
were alphanumeric, not very big actually, max 150 people, there nobody said anything to us,
we quietly entered the classrooms and looked .
After very kindly and politely breaking everyone's balls a little bit we crossed the
park toward the monument to Priest John Harvard who has his left foot completely
polished due to the fact that everyone rests their hands on that foot to take their picture, including me.
It has a certain fascination with the gallery of the "famous " , whose plaques inside bear engraved names
and surnames of people who have made U.S. history, features wooden drinking fountains where you can drink.
have a good trip LuigiB

title: Ein Blick muss sein
text: Also, was gibt es zu sagen? Es ist Harvard University! Wenn man schon einmal in der Gegend ist sollte man sich den Flair dieser Universit√§t durchaus einmal einverleiben. Ein Rundgang √ºber den Campus...die amerikanische "oh my god" F√ºhrung braucht man daf√ºr nicht, wird einem einen kleinen Eindruck vermitteln dar√ºber, was diese Universit√§t mit ihrem hervorragenden Lehrern und Studenten der Menschheit gebracht.
translated_text: So, what is there to say? It's Harvard University! If you're ever in the area, you should definitely take in the flair of this university. A tour of the campus...you don't need the American "oh my god" tour for that, will give you a small impression of what this university with its outstanding teachers and students has brought to mankind.

title: Passeggiata universitaria
text: Ero a Boston e non potevo fare a meno di una visita nelle famosissima Universit√†, dove si laureano i famosi..i ricchi...i potenti.. La passeggiata √® piacevole, io sono partita da Back Bay e avevo gia visitato per strada il MIT). Bella anche la libreria universit√† di Harvard... passeggiata culturale americana..
translated_text: I was in Boston and I couldn't help but pay a visit to the very famous University, where the famous...the rich...the powerful...graduate. The walk is pleasant, I started from Back Bay and had already visited MIT on the way). Also nice is the Harvard University bookstore.... American cultural walk...

title: FANT√ÅSTICO E EXTREMAMENTE BONITO.
text: Estivemos agora em Mar√ßo de 2013 em Harvard University , na realidade √© tudo √© mais algumas coisa no que se diz respeito a este lugar , pois tivemos a oportunidade de ir e visitar algumas das mais remadas universidades do mundo e suas salas de aulas e alguns cursos , foi um dia magico , pois podemos viver um pouco do que vivem os seu alunos , pois al√©m disso tudo sua arquitetura √© uma coisa magnifica com pr√©dios centen√°rios e com uma estrutura fant√°stica , ao redor da universidade , voc√™ tamb√©m poder√° visitar seu museu , suas lojas e tamb√©m os Pubs ondes nos fins de tarde a uma verdadeira festa dos alunos que frequentam a Harvard .enfim acho que realmente √© um passeio extremamente bom para que gosta de ver arquiteturas e hist√≥ria ao mesmo tempo .tamb√©m n√£o deixe de colocar as m√£o nos p√©s da estatua de John Harvard pois se voc√™ ainda faz faculdade dizem a lenda que quem colocar a m√£o no sapato dele tem a certeza de passar de ano no curso que esta fazendo .. rsrsrs..
translated_text: We were at Harvard University in March 2013, in fact it is everything and more when it comes to this place, because we had the opportunity to go and visit some of the most famous universities in the world and their classrooms and some courses, it was a magical day, because we could live a little of what their students live, Its architecture is magnificent, with centuries-old buildings and a fantastic structure. Around the university, you can also visit its museum, its stores and also the pubs where, at the end of the day, there is a real party for the students who attend Harvard.Finally, I think it's an extremely good tour for those who like to see architecture and history at the same time. Also, don't forget to put your hand on the feet of the statue of John Harvard, because if you're still at university, legend has it that if you put your hand on his shoe, you're sure to pass the course you're taking... lol....

title: ÊÑüÂèóÊñáÂåñ
text: Âú®Ê†°Âõ≠ÈáåÈó≤ÈÄõÔºåÈô§‰∫ÜÊòéÊòæÁöÑÊñáÂ≠óÊ†áËØÜÂíåÂìàÁ¶èÈìúÂÉèÂ§ñÔºå‰ºº‰πéÊÑèËØÜ‰∏çÂà∞ËøôÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™‰∏ñÁïåÁ∫ßÁöÑÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÄÇÊ†°Âõ≠ÁéØÂ¢ÉÂæàÂ•ΩÔºåÊó∂‰∏çÊó∂ÊúâÁ©øÊ¢≠Êù•ÂæÄÁöÑÂ≠¶ÁîüÔºåÊïôÂ†ÇÈáåÊúâ‰πêÈòüÂú®ÊéíÁªÉÔºåËçâÂú∞‰∏äÊúâÊùæÈº†ÂíåËßÖÈ£üÁöÑÂ∞èÈ∏üÔºåÊï¥‰ΩìÊÑüËßâÂæàÂíåË∞ê„ÄÇ

title: Qui si laureano i ricchi e potenti
text:
Interessante visitare il campus che si estende su 10 ettari, nei cui edifici non si pu√≤ entrare. La biblioteca che si vede esternamente √® la pi√π grande biblioteca universitaria del mondo. La statua che si pu√≤ vedere √® anche chiamata "delle tre bugie" perch√© l'iscrizione contiene 3 errori.
Da Harvard, universit√† di alta √©lite, molto costosa, sono usciti 8 presidenti USA e 75 premi Nobel. 
Chi viene accettato (per censo e motivazione) e pu√≤ permettersi di pagare quanto richiesto, far√† sicuramente parte del club dei potenti del mondo.
translated_text:
Interesting to visit the 10-hectare campus, into whose buildings you cannot enter. The library that can be seen on the outside is the largest university library in the world. The statue that can be seen is also called "of the three lies" because the inscription contains 3 errors.
Eight U.S. presidents and 75 Nobel Prize winners have come out of Harvard, a highly elite, very expensive university.
Those who are accepted (by census and motivation) and can afford to pay what is required will surely be part of the club of the world's powerful.

title: una experiencia unica
text: Recorri la universidad, asist√≠ a una clase de oyente sin ninguna objeci√≥n. soy medica pediatra y justo daban prevalencia de enfermedades cr√≥nicas no transmisibles como obesidad, hipertension arterial , etc. un lujo. todos los alumnos escuchando , con auriculres y sus notebooks.silencio y respeto,la profesora motivando constantemente.experiencia unica.las casitas alrededor del campus de cuento. ojala mis hijos pudieran acceder a universidades de ese nivel. alejandra
translated_text: i went through the university, i attended a class as a listener without any objection. i am a pediatrician and they were just teaching the prevalence of chronic non-communicable diseases such as obesity, arterial hypertension, etc. a luxury. all the students listening, with headphones and their notebooks. silence and respect, the professor constantly motivating. unique experience. the little houses around the campus are a story. i wish my children could access universities of that level. alejandra

title: harika bir √ºniversite
text:
MIT'ye g√∂re daha b√ºy√ºleyici, 3-4 katlƒ± ta≈ü saraylardan olu≈üan kamp√ºsleri var, √ßok ≈üirin bir rekt√∂rl√ºk binasƒ± var, bah√ßesinde dilediƒüiniz gibi dola≈üabilirsiniz, biz bah√ßesinde pizza bile yemi≈ütik, ≈üanslƒ±ysanƒ±z bah√ßenin ortasƒ±nda harvardlƒ± √∂ƒürencilerin, harvardla alakalƒ± objelerin satƒ±ldƒ±ƒüƒ± kermeslere denk gelebilirsiniz, yani biz geldik

harvard heykelinin sol ayaƒüana elinizi s√ºr√ºp burada okuyacaƒüƒ±nƒ±zƒ± umabilirsiniz :D aynƒ± zamanda heykel '3 yalan' heykeli olarak bilinir 1-heykel Harvardƒ±n deƒüildir, harvardlƒ± bir √∂ƒürencinindir 2-yapƒ±m yƒ±lƒ± yanlƒ±≈ütƒ±r 3√º unuttum
translated_text:
They have a more charming campus than MIT, consisting of 3-4 storey stone palaces, there is a very cute rectorate building, you can walk around the garden as you wish, we even ate pizza in the garden, if you are lucky you can come across bazaars in the middle of the garden where Harvard students sell Harvard-related objects, so we did

you can put your hand on the left foot of the harvard statue and hope that you will read it here :D it is also known as the '3 lies' statue 1- the statue is not Harvard's, it belongs to a harvard student 2- the year of construction is wrong I forgot 3

title: Imperd√≠vel
text: A cidade de Harvard  √© uma gra√ßa. Tem que andar pelas ruas e pelos pr√©dios, respirando o ar jovial da universidade.
translated_text: Harvard is a beautiful city. You have to walk through the streets and buildings, breathing in the university's youthful air.

title: Beeindruckend!
text:
Das nenne ich mal einen Campus! Selbst ohne F√ºhrung lohnt ein Spaziergang √ºber das Gel√§nde, um die Atmosph√§re auf sich wirken zu lassen.
Ausserdem gibt es in in unmittelbarer N√§he drei sch√∂ne Kunstmuseen!
translated_text:
Now that's what I call a campus! Even without a guided tour, it's worth taking a walk around the grounds to soak up the atmosphere.
There are also three beautiful art museums in the immediate vicinity!

title: Endroit incontournable
text:
Juste se promener dans le parc, s'assoir et regarder la vie qui passe.
Il n'y a pas de toilettes publiques ni d'endroits o√π se restaurer, pr√©voir le faire avant d'entrer sur le campus.
translated_text:
Just stroll through the park, sit back and watch life go by.
There are no public toilets or places to eat, so plan to do so before entering the campus.

title: Harvard University
text: Interessantes Ini-Gel√§nde mit sehr alten und interessanten Geb√§uden, die schon in vielen Filmen/Serien als Kulisse genutzt wurden.
translated_text: Interesting Ini site with very old and interesting buildings that have been used as a backdrop in many films/series.

title: „Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶
text:
„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶„Å´ÈÄö„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„ÅüÂèã‰∫∫„Å´ÊßãÂÜÖ„ÇíÊ°àÂÜÖ„Åó„Å¶„ÇÇ„Çâ„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÂ§ïÊñπÈÅé„Åé„Å†„Å£„Åü„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅÊõ¥„Å´‰ºëÊöá‰∏≠„Å†„Å£„Åü„ÅÆ„Åß„Ç≠„É£„É≥„Éë„ÇπÂÜÖ„ÅÆ‰∫∫„ÅØ„Åæ„Å∞„Çâ„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÂØÆ„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„ÄÅ„Éó„Éº„É´ÔºÜ„Ç∏„É†„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„ÄÅÂõ≥Êõ∏È§®„ÄÅÊïô‰ºö„ÄÅ„Ç´„Éï„Çß„ÉÜ„É™„Ç¢‚Ä¶„Å™„Çì„Åß„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„Çπ„ÇØ„Ç®„Ç¢ÈßÖÂë®Ëæ∫„Å´„ÅØÂ∫ó„ÅåÈõÜ„Åæ„Å£„Å¶„Åä„Çä„ÄÅÈßÖÂâç„ÅÆcoopÔºàÁîüÂçîÔºâ„Åß„ÅØ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶„Ç∞„ÉÉ„Ç∫„ÅåË≥ºÂÖ•„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Ç¢„Éá„Ç£„ÉÄ„Çπ„ÇÑ„Éù„É≠„ÄÅ„ÉÅ„É£„É≥„Éî„Ç™„É≥„Å™„Å©„ÅÆ‰∏ÄÊµÅ„Çπ„Éù„Éº„ÉÑ„É°„Éº„Ç´„Éº„Å®„Ç≥„É©„Éú„Åó„Åü„Çπ„Éù„Éº„ÉÑ„Ç¶„Çß„Ç¢„Å™„Å©„ÇÇÂ£≤„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶ÁõÆÂΩì„Å¶„Åß„ÅØ„Å™„Åè„Å¶„ÇÇ„ÄÅÂë®Ëæ∫„Å´„ÅØ„ÅäÊ¥íËêΩ„Å™ÈõëË≤®Â±ã„ÇÑÂ∏ΩÂ≠êÂ±ã„ÄÅ„Ç´„Éï„Çß„Å™„Å©„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Ç∑„Éß„ÉÉ„Éî„É≥„Ç∞„Å´„ÇÇ„Åä„Åô„Åô„ÇÅ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
translated_text:
A friend of mine who had attended Harvard University gave me a tour of the campus. It was late in the evening and even more so during vacation, so the campus was sparsely populated. There are dormitories, swimming pool & gym, library, church, cafeteria...you name it.
There are many stores around Harvard Square station, and you can buy Harvard University goods at the coop (co-op) in front of the station. There were also sportswear collaborated with top sports manufacturers such as Adidas, Polo, Champion, and so on. Even if you are not visiting for Harvard University, there are fashionable general stores, hat shops, and cafes in the area, making it a great place for shopping.

title: Imperdible paseo
text:
ES incre√≠ble estar en esta famosa facultad, ver su patio donde se filmo legalmente rubia y tantas otras pel√≠culas.
Hay varias formas de llegar hasta esta facultad. Hay que tener en cuenta que el sistema de transporte en esta ciudad es muy bueno y seguro.
Nosotros tomamos un Tour en espa√±ol de la empresa Don Quijote sacamos los datos de una revista del Hotel. 
Paso la pagina por si les interesa http://www.tourboston.com/
Este Tour nos llevo entre varios sitios a la Universidad.
El Guia nos acompa√±o para ver desde afuera una clase , fue interesante la experiencia, ver a los estudiantes en clase,  Caminamos por el barrio que la rodea, que es donde viven los estudiantes vimos sus casas y los comercios de la zona, tanto las casas como la onda de los bares no es como uno se lo imaginaria , es mas bien precario, casual no muy elegante y se puede ver las casitas un tanto desordenadas des prolijas,
Ademas de bares tambi√©n hay las t√≠picas tiendas de recuerdo.
Los estudiantes te pasan por al lado como si no vieran al turismo deben estar acostumbrados a que la gente los visite como peces. Uno los puede ver apresurados y en su mundo.
A diferencia de la UCLA aqui los estudiantes se ven mas arreglados, serios y menos distra√≠dos
Tambi√©n se puede observar la casa donde vivieron presidentes en su √©poca de estudiantes y hasta un Bill Gates. Fue muy √∫til la explicaci√≥n en espa√±ol del gu√≠a del Tour.
Aprendimos tambien que tienen su propia policia y su propio banco. Muy Intersante todo. Vale la pena ir.
translated_text:
It is amazing to be in this famous college, to see its courtyard where legally blonde and so many other movies were filmed.
There are several ways to get to this school. Keep in mind that the transportation system in this city is very good and safe.
We took a tour in Spanish from the company Don Quijote, we got the information from a magazine of the Hotel.
I am passing the page in case you are interested http://www.tourboston.com/
This tour took us to the University.
The guide accompanied us to see a class from the outside, it was an interesting experience, to see the students in class, we walked around the surrounding neighborhood, which is where the students live, we saw their houses and stores in the area, both the houses and the vibe of the bars is not as one would imagine, it is rather precarious, casual, not very elegant and you can see the little houses a bit messy and untidy,
Besides the bars there are also the typical souvenir stores.
The students pass you by as if they don't see the tourists, they must be used to people visiting them like fish. One can see them in a hurry and in their own world.
Unlike at UCLA here the students look more groomed, serious and less distracted.
You can also see the house where presidents lived when they were students and even a Bill Gates. The tour guide's explanation in Spanish was very helpful.
We also learned that they have their own police and their own bank. Very interesting. It is worth going.

text:

title: Muito alto n√≠vel!!
text: Se voc√™ n√£o vai estudar l√°, voc√™ deve ao menos ir conhecer para saber como √© a famosa harvard! Tudo muito lindo e organizado, estrutura fenomenal! Vale a pena conhecer!
translated_text: If you're not going to study there, you should at least go and see what the famous Harvard is like! Everything is so beautiful and organized, the structure is phenomenal! It's worth a visit!

title: Visita di curiosit√†!
text: E' comunque una bella emozione varcare la soglia della Harvard University, specie per chi vive in questi ambienti in Italia, oltre ad ammirare la statua del primo benefattore  √® bello respirare l'aria del campus, vedere gli edifici e gli estesi giardini dove gli studenti anche studiano e fanno sport. Peccato che non si possa visitare qualcosa all'interno come invece accade in molti college inglesi.
translated_text: Still, it is quite a thrill to cross the threshold of Harvard University, especially for those who live in these environments in Italy; besides admiring the statue of the first benefactor, it is nice to breathe the air of the campus, see the buildings and the extensive gardens where students also study and play sports. It's too bad you can't visit something inside as you can in many English colleges.

title: Visita obligada
text:
Para un europeo creo que debe ser visita obligada si se viaja a Boston. Cruzar el r√≠o, venirse a Cambridge y visitar la Harvard es muy recomendable. Tiene un paseo que merece la pena, bastante historia y te haces una idea de por qu√© es una de las Universidades m√°s prestigiosas del planeta. 
Despu√©s de visitarla, baja hacia Harvard Square y toma una cerveza local (Sam Adams o Harpoon) en alguno de los muchos locales que hay y habr√°s echado un rato muy bueno.
translated_text:
For a European I think it should be a must visit if you travel to Boston. Crossing the river, coming to Cambridge and visiting Harvard is highly recommended. It has a worthwhile walk, a lot of history and you get an idea of why it is one of the most prestigious universities on the planet.
After visiting it, go down to Harvard Square and have a local beer (Sam Adams or Harpoon) in one of the many local breweries and you will have had a great time.

title: Quartier √† visiter
text: J'y suis all√©e un samedi entre 11h et 14h, il y avait pas mal de monde. Mais cela n'emp√™che pas de visiter et d'appr√©cier. Il y a des nombreux "Harvard Shop" au centre du campus et c'est l√† que sont les touristes donc je vous conseille de circuler dans les rue du campus, autour du centre. √áa donne envie d'y faire ses √©tudes ! (ou de les reprendre)
translated_text: I went there on a Saturday between 11am and 2pm, and it was quite crowded. But that doesn't stop you from visiting and enjoying it. There are lots of "Harvard Shops" in the center of campus, and that's where the tourists are, so I'd advise you to wander the campus streets around the center. It makes you want to study there! (or go back to school)

title: Suggestiva
text: consiglio davvero la visita, non si pu√≤ entrare nei vari edifici.. ma girare per il campus e vedere i studenti che fanno lezione all'aperto √® davvero unico!
translated_text: I really recommend the visit, you can't go into the various buildings... but walking around the campus and seeing the students lecturing outside is really unique!

title: IMPERDIBLE
text: La Universidad de Harvard merece un d√≠a de visita. Puedes fracionarlo en d√≠as diferentes pero conocerla realmente lleva su tiempo. Nosotros solo pudimos recorrerla en una ma√±ana completa. Conocimos solo el √©rea central m√°s popular. Animate e ingresa a los edificios de las distintas facultades.
translated_text: Harvard University is worth a day visit. You can split it into different days but it really takes time. We were only able to tour it in a full morning. We only visited the most popular central area. Go ahead and enter the buildings of the different faculties.

title: Peque√±a decepci√≥n
text: Me esperaba algo mas parecido a Cambridge con un ambiente parecido pero el campus esta en mitad de la ciudad rodeado de coches. Bien es cierto que tal vez la visita guiada pod√≠a haber ayudado pero no la hice. Otra vez sera
translated_text: I was expecting something more like Cambridge with a similar atmosphere but the campus is in the middle of the city surrounded by cars. It is true that maybe the guided tour could have helped but I didn't do it. Another time

title: La parte antigua de la universidad m√°s famosa de los EUA
text:
Es el centro del campus de la Universidad de Harvard, aqu√≠ se encuentran la mayor√≠a de los dormitorios para los novatos, as√≠ como unas librer√≠as y algunos salones de clases.

Los jardines son muy bonitos, sobre todo porque estas rodeado de los cl√°sicos edificios de Harvard que ves en las pel√≠culas. Adem√°s encontrar√°s uno de los 2 edificios educativos m√°s antiguos de los EUA.

Muy recomendado para relajarse un poco y descansar del caos de la ciudad.
translated_text:
The center of the Harvard University campus, this is where most of the dormitories for freshmen are located, as well as some bookstores and a few classrooms.

The gardens are very nice, especially because you are surrounded by the classic Harvard buildings you see in the movies. You will also find one of the 2 oldest educational buildings in the USA.

Highly recommended to relax a little and take a break from the chaos of the city.

title: Welch ein Campus!
text: Cambridge ist Harvard. Rund um den Harvard Square sind hier die Unigeb√§ude, der Campus selbst ist traumhaft. Eingebettet in alten Baumbestand sthen hier die altehrw√ºrdigen Geb√§ude dieser Ivy League Universit√§t. Sehr beeindruckend und ein Muss. F√ºhrung durch Studenten besonders empfohlen.
translated_text: Cambridge is Harvard. The university buildings are located around Harvard Square, and the campus itself is fantastic. The time-honored buildings of this Ivy League university are embedded in old trees. Very impressive and a must-see. Guided tours by students are highly recommended.

title: Vale la pena
text: Es muy f√°cil llegar desde Boston, ya que el subterr√°neo tiene estaci√≥n en Harvard Square, a metros de la entrada. Si se dispone aunque sea de medio d√≠a no hay que perderse recorrer el campus, ver alumnos entrecruzarae con libros bajo el brazo y admirar las diferentes construcciones que forman parte de la universidad.
translated_text: It is very easy to get there from Boston, since the subway has a station in Harvard Square, meters away from the entrance. If you have even half a day, you should not miss to walk around the campus, see students with books under their arms and admire the different buildings that are part of the university.

title: A VOIR
text: On peut se promener dans le parc de l'universit√© mais malheureusement pas entrer dans les b√¢timents; incontournable de toute fa√ßon !!!
translated_text: You can take a walk in the university park, but unfortunately you can't go inside the buildings; a must-see anyway!!!!

title: Increible
text: El campus de harvard es para todo el publico ahi puedes caminar tranquilo por el campus hay visitas de estudiantes . En el campus est√°n los edificios para estudiar derecho, ciencias pol√≠ticas , medicina.  te puedes SENTAR en los banquillos de harvard y sentir el  fresco y respirar el aire de conocimientos del ambiente. El sonido del silencio es genial, todo fluye de una manera casi perfecta, es el ambiente ideal para estudiar, luego al salir de all√≠, puedes caminas hac√≠as Harvard square y completar tu paseo
translated_text: The harvard campus is open to the public and you can walk around the campus at your leisure, there are student tours. On the campus are the buildings to study law, political science, medicine. you can sit on the benches of Harvard and feel the fresh air and breathe the air of knowledge of the environment. The sound of silence is great, everything flows in an almost perfect way, it is the ideal environment to study, then when you leave the campus, you can walk to Harvard square and complete your walk.

title: ÊßãÂÜÖ„ÇíÊï£Ê≠©„Åô„Çã„Å†„Åë„ÅßÊ∞óÊåÅ„Å°„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÑÊôÇÈñì„ÇíÈÅé„Åî„Åô„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô
text: ‰∏ñÁïåÂ§ßÂ≠¶„É©„É≥„Ç≠„É≥„Ç∞Ôºë‰Ωç„ÅÆ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„ÉâÂ§ßÂ≠¶„Åß„Åô„ÄÇÊ£Æ„ÅÆ‰∏≠„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Åü„Åè„Åï„Çì„ÅÆÊ®π„Åå„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇMIT„Å®ÊØî„Åπ„ÄÅÂ∞ë„ÅóË¶≥ÂÖâÂú∞„ÅÆÊÑü„Åò„Åå„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Åü„Åè„Åï„Çì„ÅÆË¶≥ÂÖâÂÆ¢„ÅåË®™„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÊßãÂÜÖ„ÇíÊï£Ê≠©„Åô„Çã„Å†„Åë„ÅßÊ∞óÊåÅ„Å°„ÅÆ„Çà„ÅÑÊôÇÈñì„ÇíÈÅé„Åî„Åô„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ
translated_text: This is Harvard University, ranked No.1 university in the world. There are many trees like in a forest. compared to MIT, it seemed a bit touristy. A lot of tourists visit here. You can spend a pleasant time just strolling around the campus.

title: IL SANTUARIO DELLA CULTURA
text: Sbaglia chi si aspetta da una visita ad Harvard chiss√† quali brividi: non √® n√® un circo equestre n√® una via della moda. Altrettanto sbaglia chi restasse deluso perch√® non pu√≤ visitare nessun edificio: assicuro che le aule di Harvard, le sue biblioteche, i laboratori, i dormitori sono esattamente come quelli di quasi tutte le circa 3.300 universit√† degli Stati Uniti, anzi, alcune ne hanno di migliori. Di diverso, Harvard ha la storia e il valore: a testimonianza dell'importanza attribuita all'educazione, Harvard √® stata fondata dai Padri Pellegrini nel 1636, solo 15 anni dopo il loro sbarco sulle coste del Massachusetts. Il suo nome ricorda un oscuro pastore protestante morto a poco pi√π di 30 anni, che lasci√≤ a una scuola gi√† esistente il patrimonio dei suoi 2.000 libri. Grazie all'impegno e alla dedizione profusi negli ultimi 300 anni dal personale docente e non docente, Harvard √® diventata la prima Universit√† al mondo o comunque una delle prime due al mondo. Il modello didattico prevede l'elevatissima qualit√† dell'insegnamento (molti professori sono premi Nobel), l'applicazione di criteri di valutazione meritocratici, rigore, ordine e severit√†. I risultati? Da Harvard sono usciti i Presidenti americani Theodore Roosevelt, John Fitzgerald Kennedy, Barack Obama, il VIce Presidente Al Gore, un numero impressionante di presidenti canadesi e latino americani, il Premier israeliano Netanyahu e poi BIll Gates, l'Aga Khan e pure un tal Kaszinsky, meglio noto come "Unabomber" (forse una difettosit√† nei criteri di selezione all'ingresso?). Non tutti i laureati ad Harvard si sono buttati in politica o negli affari: Jack Lemmon, Matt Damon, Tommy Lee Jones, Natalie Portman a altri hanno fatto del cinema, Mark Zuckerberg ha inventato Facebook e Jeremy Lin √® una stella dei New York Knickerborkers di basket. Sorvolo sulla ventina di istituti di ricerca, sui PhD, sui Master: quelli potete guardarveli nel sito dell'Universit√†. Se si sa cosa √® Harvard, aggirarsi tra gli edifici del campus o guardare la statua di John Harvard regala la stessa emozione che si pu√≤ provare entrando in un santuario. Questo ovviamente √® un santuario laico, tutto dedicato alla cultura.
translated_text: Those who expect who knows what thrills from a visit to Harvard are wrong: it is neither an equestrian circus nor a fashion street. Equally wrong are those who would be disappointed because they cannot visit any of the buildings: I assure you that Harvard's lecture halls, its libraries, laboratories, and dormitories are exactly like those of almost all of the approximately 3,300 universities in the United States, indeed, some have better ones. What is different, Harvard has history and value: reflecting the importance placed on education, Harvard was founded by the Pilgrim Fathers in 1636, only 15 years after they landed on the shores of Massachusetts. Its name recalls an obscure Protestant pastor who died at the age of just over 30, leaving an existing school the legacy of his 2,000 books. Thanks to the hard work and dedication of faculty and non-teaching staff over the past 300 years, Harvard has become the world's premier university, or at least one of the top two in the world. The educational model includes the very high quality of teaching (many professors are Nobel laureates), the application of meritocratic evaluation criteria, rigor, order and severity. The results? Out of Harvard have come American Presidents Theodore Roosevelt, John Fitzgerald Kennedy, Barack Obama, VIce President Al Gore, an impressive number of Canadian and Latin American presidents, Israeli PM Netanyahu and then BIll Gates, the Aga Khan and even one such Kaszinsky, better known as the "Unabomber" (perhaps a flaw in the selection criteria at entry?). Not all Harvard graduates have jumped into politics or business: Jack Lemmon, Matt Damon, Tommy Lee Jones, Natalie Portman a others have made movies, Mark Zuckerberg invented Facebook and Jeremy Lin is a star of the New York Knickerborkers basketball team. I'll gloss over the 20 or so research institutes, PhDs, Master's degrees: you can look those up on the University's website. If you know what Harvard is, wandering around the campus buildings or looking at the statue of John Harvard gives you the same thrill as entering a shrine. This of course is a secular shrine, all about culture.

title: Non ne vale la pena
text: Non si pu√≤ vedere l'interno di nulla, si pu√≤ solo girare per il campus. Non ne vale proprio la pena. Deludente.
translated_text: You can't see the inside of anything, you can only walk around the campus. It's just not worth it. Disappointing.

title: Molto suggestiva
text:
Anche qui, come al mit, vale la pena andarci per l contesto, la storia, il fascino e l'edificio (nei paraggi c'e anche un palazzo di le Corbusier)
Per il resto, non c'e molto altro da vedere...
translated_text:
Again, as at mit, it is worth going for the context, history, charm, and building (there is also a le Corbusier building nearby)
Otherwise, there is not much else to see....

title: Belle visite ...
text: prenez le tour guid√© avec les √©tudiants, √ßa co√ªte 10$ par personne ou 20$ pour une famille ... ils ont plein d'anecdotes √† compter ... √ßa vaut le d√©tour !
translated_text: take the guided tour with the students, it costs $10 per person or $20 for a family ... they have lots of anecdotes to tell ... it's worth the detour!

title: D√©tente
text: Prenez le temps de vous assoir sur les chaises laiss√©es dans le yard de l'universit√© et de vous impr√©gnez des lieux.
translated_text: Take the time to sit on the chairs left in the university yard and soak up the atmosphere.

title: Tr√®s bien
text: Impressionnant de se retrouver dans la plus connu des universit√©. Dommage que l'on ne puisse pas se balader dans les locaux ou visiter la biblioth√®que.
translated_text: It's impressive to find yourself in the world's most famous university. Too bad you can't walk around the premises or visit the library.

text: Ê†°Âõ≠‰∏çÂ§ß„ÄÇÁõ∏Êú∫ÈöèÊâã‰∏ÄÊãçÂ∞±Êò∞‰∏ÄÂº†Âêç‰ø°Áâá„ÄÇÂæàÁæé„ÄÇÂíåÊúãÂèãÔºå‰∏§‰∏™‰∫∫ÊÑüËßâÂÉèÂÜúÊ∞ëËøõÂüé‰∏ÄÊ†∑„ÄÇÊúâ‰∏™ÂÉèÂ±ïËßàÈ¶Ü‰∏ÄÊ†∑ÁöÑÂª∫Á≠ë„ÄÇÈáåÈù¢ÁÆÄÁõ¥Â§™Áæé‰∫Ü„ÄÇ

title: atmosfera emozionante
text: Non si pu√≤ visitare Harvard senza rimanere emozionati e guardare quei luoghi e i giovani che li percorrono con un pizzico quasi di riverenza: √® uno dei luoghi pi√π famosi nella cultura e nella storia di questo grande Paese!
translated_text: One cannot visit Harvard without being moved and looking at those places and the young people who walk through them with a hint almost of reverence: it is one of the most famous places in the culture and history of this great country!

title: di fascino
text: si attraversa l' universit√†, con i suoi parchi. Palazzi di mattoni rossi -tipico stile "bostoniano" in ampi spazi verdi ove passano studenti e visitatori da tutto il mondo
translated_text: one passes through the university, with its parks. Red brick buildings -typical "Bostonian" style in wide green spaces where students and visitors from all over the world pass by

title: Lohnt einen Ausflug
text: Wer in Boston ist sollte einen Ausflug nach Cambridge machen und dabei √ºber den Campus von Harvard bummeln (wenn man in Cambridge ist sowieso). Die Geb√§ude sind beeindruckend, es gibt sch√∂ne Parks und (je nach Jahreszeit) kann das studentische Treiben beobachtet werden.
translated_text: If you are in Boston, you should take a trip to Cambridge and stroll around the Harvard campus (if you are in Cambridge anyway). The buildings are impressive, there are beautiful parks and (depending on the time of year) you can watch the hustle and bustle of the students.

title: Monumental
text: Passeio imperd√≠vel em Boston. V√° de metr√¥. Reserve pelo menos uma tarde (ou manh√£) para curtir.
translated_text: A must-see in Boston. Take the subway. Set aside at least an afternoon (or morning) to enjoy it.

title: G√ºzel
text:
Benim bababamƒ±n kuzeninin kƒ±zƒ± Harvord √úniversitesin'de yazƒ± okuluna gidecekti bizi de annemle o sƒ±rada Amerika'daydƒ±k ve biz de onlarla gittik.Hepimizin bildiƒüi gibi orasƒ± √ßok iyi bir okul ve oraya girmek de zor √ßok √ßalƒ±≈üman lazƒ±m ve i√ßeriye herkezi almƒ±yorlar.Harvord'ƒ±n en k√∂t√º
yanƒ± binalar √ßok eski.Babamƒ±n kuzeninin kƒ±zƒ±nƒ±n kaldƒ±ƒüƒ± odanƒ±n camƒ± kƒ±rƒ±ktƒ± ve onu kaƒüƒ±tla kaplamƒ±≈ülardƒ± ve bu okulda 4 yƒ±l kalmak i√ßin y√ºzlerce bin dolar veriyorsun.
translated_text:
My dad's cousin's daughter was going to Harvord University for summer school and my mom and I were in the States at the time and we went with them.As we all know, it's a very good school and it's hard to get in, you have to work hard and they don't let everyone in.Harvord's worst
The room where my father's cousin's daughter stayed had a broken window and they covered it with paper and you pay hundreds of thousands of dollars to stay in this school for 4 years.

text: Âú∞‰∏ãÈâÑ„É¨„ÉÉ„Éâ„É©„Ç§„É≥Harvard SquareÈßÖ„Åß‰∏ãËªä„Åô„Çã„Å®Â≠¶Áîü‰ª•Â§ñ„Å´„ÇÇÊòé„Çâ„Åã„Å´Áâ©Ë¶ãÈÅäÂ±±„ÅÆË¶≥ÂÖâÂÆ¢„Å®ÂàÜ„Åã„Çã‰∫∫„ÄÖ„ÅßÊ∫¢„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÊàë„ÄÖÊó•Êú¨‰∫∫„ÅåÊÉ≥ÂÉè„Åô„ÇãÂÖ∏ÂûãÁöÑ„Å™Ê¨ßÁ±≥„ÅÆÂ§ßÂ≠¶„Ç≠„É£„É≥„Éë„Çπ„ÅåÂ∫É„Åå„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÔºëÔºñÔºìÔºñÂπ¥„Å´Ë®≠ÁΩÆ„Åï„Çå„Å¶ÔºíÔºêÔºëÔºëÂπ¥„ÅßÂâµÁ´ãÔºìÔºóÔºïÂë®Âπ¥„ÇíËøé„Åà„Åü„Çà„ÅÜ„Åß„ÄÅ„Ç≠„É£„É≥„Éë„ÇπÂÜÖËá≥„ÇãÊâÄ„Å´„ÄåÔºìÔºóÔºï„Äç„ÅÆ„Éï„É©„ÉÉ„Ç∞„ÅåÊé≤„Åí„Çâ„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„ÅäÂúüÁî£Êé¢„Åó„Å™„ÇâThe CoopÔºàÁîüÂçîÔºâ„Å´Ë°å„Åè„Å®„Çà„ÅÑ„Åß„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÇ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„Çπ„ÇØ„Ç®„Ç¢„Å´‰ΩïÂ∫óËàó„Åã„ÅÇ„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÁßÅ„ÅØÔºìÔºóÔºïÂë®Âπ¥Ë®òÂøµ„Éû„Ç∞„Ç´„ÉÉ„ÉóÔºà7.98„Éâ„É´Ôºâ„Å®„Çπ„Éà„É©„ÉÉ„ÉóÔºà3.98„Éâ„É´ÔΩûÔºâÊï∞ÁÇπ„ÇíË≥ºÂÖ•„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÅåÁµêÊßãÊ∞ó„Å´ÂÖ•„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„Å∏„ÅÆÊó•Êú¨‰∫∫ÁïôÂ≠¶Áîü„ÅØÊ∏õÂ∞ë„ÅÆ‰∏ÄÈÄî„ÇíËæø„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„Å®Ë®Ä„Çè„Çå„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„Åå„ÄÅÁîüÂçî„Åß„ÅØÊó•Êú¨Ë™û„ÅåËÅû„Åì„Åà„Å¶„Åç„Åü„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅÊó•Êú¨‰∫∫„ÅÆ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ‰ø°‰ª∞„ÅØÁõ∏Â§â„Çè„Çâ„ÅöÈ´ò„ÅÑ„Å®„ÅÑ„Åà„Çã„Åß„Åó„Çá„ÅÜ„ÄÇ
translated_text: When I got off at the Harvard Square subway station on the Red Line, I was met with a crowd of people, not only students, but also tourists, obviously on a sightseeing tour. The campus was established in 1636 and celebrated its 375th anniversary in 2011, with "375" flags displayed all over the campus. If you are looking for souvenirs, you can go to The Coop (Co-op). There are several stores in Harvard Square. I bought a 375th anniversary mug ($7.98) and several straps (from $3.98) and I like them a lot. It is said that the number of Japanese students at Harvard is on the decline, but I could hear Japanese at the Co-op, so I can say that Japanese people's faith in Harvard is as high as ever.

title: Man sollte mal dort gewesen sein...
text: Durch die vielen prominenten die auf der Harvard University waren hat diese Einrichtung nat√ºrlich etwas an Glanz bekommen. Wenn man in Boston ist, sollte man auf jedenfall einen Besuch der Harvard University einplanen. Sie ist ganz leicht mit der Bahn zu erreichen und bei sch√∂nem Wetter lonhnt ein Sparziergang durch den Park um dort das rege treiben der Studenten zu beobachten. Ein Foto an der Harvard Statue sowie einiger sch√∂ner Geb√§ude ist immer ein sch√∂nes Andenken. Wir waren auch in einem der Geb√§uden und haben uns einen Saal angeschaut. Wie gesagt, es hat uns nicht vom Hocker gehauen, aber wir waren mal dort......
translated_text: Due to the many celebrities who have attended Harvard University, this institution has naturally acquired a certain glamor. If you are in Boston, you should definitely plan a visit to Harvard University. It's easy to reach by train and, if the weather is nice, it's worth taking a stroll through the park to watch the hustle and bustle of students. A photo at the Harvard statue and some of the beautiful buildings is always a nice souvenir. We also visited one of the buildings and had a look at a hall. As I said, it didn't blow us away, but we were there once......

title: mal anschauen
text:
Ja, man sollte es mal gesehen haben, das Gel√§nde DER amerikanischen Eliteschmiede. Die Studienbedingungen scheinen optimal. Tolle Parkanlage, beste lage mitten in der Stadt.
Es bleibt jedoch die laienhafte Frage: War das alles? Es sieht eher aus wie ein Feriencamp als eine Uni. Und es sind recht wenige GEb√§ude. Vielleicht bin ich selbst aber auch durch die Eindr√ºcke deutscher Universit√§ten einfach v√∂llig anderes gewohnt...
translated_text:
Yes, you should have seen it once, the site of THE American elite school. The study conditions seem ideal. Great park, best location in the middle of the city.
But the layman's question remains: Is that all there is to it? It looks more like a vacation camp than a university. And there are very few buildings. But maybe I'm just used to completely different things because of my impressions of German universities...

title: No se puede dejar de recorrela
text: Ir a Boston y no recorrer Havard es una picard√≠a. F√°cil para llegar por medio del metro y ni bien se sale de la estaci√≥n Harvard Square se tiene un centro de informaci√≥n muy completo
translated_text: To go to Boston and not go through Havard is a pity. Easy to get to via the subway and as soon as you get out of Harvard Square station there is a very complete information center.

title: Sexy
text: Ich finde einen Besuch auf dem Campus immer wieder nett: zum einen ist es ja f√ºr amerikanische Verh√§ltnisse ein steinalter Ort, und die alten Backsteinh√§user verstr√∂men durchaus ein w√ºrdiges Flair. Man spaziert √ºber den Rasen und wird von dicken Eichh√∂rnchen verfolgt, und kann die "Statue od the three lies" betrachten, die Statue von John Harvard. Diese tr√§gt ihren Namen, da sie 1) nicht John Harvard zeigt 2), er nicht Harvards Gr√ºnder war und 3) die Jahrezahl auch nicht stimmt. Diese Infos gab es auf einer Tour, die von Studenten geleitet wird und es durchaus verstehen, die Begeisterung f√ºr Ihre Hochschule zu √ºbertragen. Hier erf√§hrt man nicht nur viel Geschichtliches, sondern auch einiges √ºber die Struktur der Uni, und wie "die Denke" funktioniert. Sehr interessant, und: Wissen macht sexy!
translated_text: I always enjoy a visit to the campus: for one thing, it's a stony place by American standards, and the old brick buildings certainly exude a dignified flair. You can walk across the lawn and be chased by fat squirrels, and you can look at the "Statue of the Three Lies", the statue of John Harvard. The statue bears its name because 1) it does not show John Harvard, 2) he was not Harvard's founder and 3) the number of years is also incorrect. This information was provided on a tour led by students who really know how to convey their enthusiasm for their university. Here you not only learn a lot of history, but also a lot about the structure of the university and how "the mindset" works. Very interesting, and: Knowledge is sexy!

title: √Ä voir!
text: Tr√®s belle universit√© un incontournable pour Boston. Nous avons pris le metro pour nous y rendre, tr√®s facile et la station Harvard nous d√©barque vraiment au coin du campus. Nous avons acheter au cout de 2$ un d√©pliant nous montrant le trajet et une description de tout le campus la visite a √©t√© int√©ressante. Toutefois pour ceux qui sont tr√®s bon en anglais on nous a sugg√©r√© la visite non-officiel des √©tudiants de Harvard. Par contre tr√®s peu de b√¢timents sont accessible au visiteur, mais il vous faut visiter l'√©glise sur le campus, elle est vraiment splendide!
translated_text: Beautiful university, a must for Boston. We took the metro to get there, very easy and the Harvard station really lands us at the corner of the campus. We bought a pamphlet for 2$ showing us the route and a description of the whole campus, so the visit was interesting. However, for those who are very good in English, the unofficial Harvard student tour was suggested. On the other hand, very few buildings are accessible to visitors, but you have to visit the church on campus - it's really splendid!

title: Fantastico posto!
text: Tutti i giorni, due volte al giorno, l'Universit√† organizza un tour per mostrare il campus agli studenti che vengono da tutte le parti degli Stati Uniti. Lo consiglio vivamente, se si parla un discreto inglese. Ci si immerge nell'atmosfera del Campus, si parte con l'incontro con un paio di studenti che spiegano le opportunit√† di studio, le agevolazioni e raccontano le loro esperienze. Si parte poi per un giro di Harvard (ovviamente non si vedono i dormitori n√® le strutture sportive) ma ad es. la ns. guida, uno studente di chimica, ci ha portato dentro il suo dormitorio facendoci vedere la sala comune. Poi alla fine del tour che dura circa due ore, ci siamo riposati nei giardini del Campus. Fantastico ambiente e fantastica universit√†.
translated_text: Every day, twice a day, the University organizes a tour to show the campus to students who come from all parts of the United States. I highly recommend it if you speak decent English. You get immersed in the atmosphere of the campus, start by meeting with a couple of students who explain study opportunities, facilities and tell about their experiences. We then go on a tour of Harvard (of course you don't see the dorms nor the sports facilities) but e.g. our guide, a chemistry student, took us inside his dormitory showing us the common room. Then at the end of the tour that lasts about two hours, we rested in the campus gardens. Fantastic environment and fantastic university.

title: Como en las peliculas
text: Excelente para una buena caminata. Se reviven escenas de decenas de peliculas norteamericanas. Interesante, de muy buena arquitectura y con el encanto que caracteriza a Boston.
translated_text: Excellent for a good walk. You can relive scenes from dozens of American movies. Interesting, with very good architecture and the charm that characterizes Boston.

title: Á¥†Êô¥„Çâ„Åó„ÅÑ„Ç≠„É£„É≥„Éë„Çπ
text:
„É°„Ç§„É≥„Ç≠„É£„É≥„Éë„Çπ„ÅØ„Ç±„É≥„Éñ„É™„ÉÉ„Ç∏„Å´Â∫É„Åå„Çã„Åå„ÄÅ„Çπ„Çø„Ç∏„Ç¢„É†„ÇÑ„Éì„Ç∏„Éç„Çπ„Çπ„ÇØ„Éº„É´Á≠â„ÅÑ„Åè„Å§„Åã„ÅÆÂ≠¶ÈÉ®„ÅØ„ÄÅ„ÉÅ„É£„Éº„É´„Ç∫ÂÅ¥„Çí„ÅØ„Åï„Çì„ÅßÂØæÂ≤∏„Å´Êï£„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã„ÄÇÁ´Ø„Åã„Çâ„ÅØ„Åò„Åæ„ÅßË¶ã„Çã„Å´„ÅØ„Åã„Å™„Çä„ÅÆÊôÇÈñì„ÇíË¶Å„Åô„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅÔº¥„Åß„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„Çπ„ÇØ„Ç®„Ç¢„Åæ„ÅßË°å„Åç„ÄÅ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„É§„Éº„Éâ„Çí‰∏≠ÂøÉ„Å´Ë¶ãÂ≠¶„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„Çí„ÅäÂãß„ÇÅ„Åô„Çã„ÄÇËààÂë≥„Åå„ÅÇ„Çå„Å∞„ÄÅ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„Ç∞„ÉÉ„Ç∫„ÅØCoop
(ÁîüÂçî)„ÅßÊâã„Å´ÂÖ•„Çã„ÄÇ
translated_text:
The main campus is spread out in Cambridge, but the stadium, business school, and several other departments are scattered across the Charles side of the river. It would take quite some time to see the entire campus from one end to the other, so we recommend taking the T to Harvard Square and focusing on Harvard Yard. If you are interested, Harvard goods are available at Coop
(Co-op) if you are interested.

title: boston
text:
Harvard √® molto particolare. Sembra di entrare nel mondo del "sapere", viene voglia di respirare a  pieni polmoni al fine di incamerare tutto il "sapere" del posto.
Nel cortile c'e' la statua dello studente che tutti (soprattutto gli studenti) toccano perche' porta fortuna.
Paritcalri i colori delle strutture, tutte in mattoni rossi.
Anche la cittadina e negozietti attorno sono molto carini e ben curati.
translated_text:
Harvard is very special. It feels like entering the world of "knowledge," one feels like breathing heavily in order to encapsulate all the "knowledge" of the place.
In the courtyard is the statue of the student that everyone (especially students) touches because it brings good luck.
Paritcalri the colors of the structures, all red brick.
The small town and little stores around are also very nice and well-kept.

title: Tradicion y Elegancia
text: Paseo por las elegantes instalaciones de la prestigiosa universidad. Mucho parecido a construciones inglesas. Buen Paseo
translated_text: Walk through the elegant facilities of the prestigious university. Very similar to English constructions. Nice Walk

title: Il college pi√π prestigioso al mondo
text:
In concomitanza con il mio soggiorno a Boston ho visitato il campus del pi√π famoso college al mondo,Harvard.
In una giornata di freddo e neve,dal centro di Boston siamo arrivati direttamente al campus con la MBTA.
Il campus √® in pieno di stile inglese tardo ottocentesco.con moltissimi edifici cosparsi nel campus,collegati tra di loro con delle vie interne.
Si entra con facilit√† e mischiarsi con gli studenti √® abbastanza facile,anche se l'ingresso negli edifici √® proibito a chiunque non sia in possesso nel tesserino di riconoscimento.
La sensazione pi√π frequente durante la mia visita √® stata rendersi conto che chi frequenta Harvard non √® poi cos√¨ diverso noi!
L'atmosfera √® poi molto frizzante e rilassata,e questa vivacit√† si respira anche nel quartiere antistante l'Universit√†.
Visita consigliata!
translated_text:
In conjunction with my stay in Boston I visited the campus of the most famous college in the world,Harvard.
On a cold and snowy day,from downtown Boston we arrived directly to the campus by MBTA.
The campus is in full late 19th century English style.with lots of buildings sprinkled across the campus,connected by internal streets.
It is easy to get in and mingling with students is quite easy,although entry into the buildings is forbidden to anyone who does not have in their student ID.
The most frequent feeling during my visit was realizing that those who attend Harvard are not so different from us!
The atmosphere is then very bubbly and relaxed,and this liveliness can also be felt in the neighborhood in front of the University.
Recommended visit!

title: Soddisfare la sete del sapere
text: Hce in italia cose cos√¨ proprio non esistono nemmeno di similari. Passeggiate tra cortili, dormitori edifici di ogni genere e tipo. lasciatevi condurre dagli studenti all'interno del campus, ammiratelo e immaginatevi studenti, qui. Gi√† l'ambiente sembra rendere il cervello pi√π reattivo e accresce la voglia di leggere, studiare, di sapere!  Se vi muovete in maniera accorta e trovate una giusta mappa, dovreste riuscire anche a fare un piccolo architour, in senso strettamente architettonico!!! Enjoy!!!
translated_text: Hce in italy such things just do not even exist of similar. Walk through courtyards, dorm buildings of all kinds and types. let the students lead you around the campus, admire it and imagine yourself as a student here. Already the environment seems to make the brain more responsive and increases the desire to read, to study, to know!  If you move shrewdly and find a right map, you should also be able to do a little architour, in a strictly architectural sense!!! Enjoy!!!

title: Uno scorcio di America da assaporare
text: Proprio come lo si vede nei film, forse ancora pi√π speciale di come ci si aspetta che questa Ivy League University sia nella realt√†. Struttura "purtroppo" molto oltre gli standard di casa nostra, biblioteca strafornita, ma visitabile solo se si √® uno studente americano o si accompagna qualcuno immatricolato ad Harvard. Lo Yard √® grande, verde e carico di quei significati che trasformano anche una sola visita in occasione di apprendimento. Un giro per il campus e poi per la deliziosa cittadina di Cambridge giustifica un'intera giornata rubata a Boston. Un consiglio, se il cielo √® terso ed √® ancora giorno, costeggiate il fiume e passeggiate fino a Boston. Il panorama √® unico e la skyline da non perdere, come del resto il tramonto
translated_text: Just as you see it in the movies, perhaps even more special than you would expect this Ivy League University to be in reality. Structure "unfortunately" far beyond our house standards, library overflowing, but visitable only if you are an American student or accompany someone matriculated at Harvard. The Yard is large, green and loaded with those meanings that turn even a single visit into a learning opportunity. A tour of the campus and then the delightful town of Cambridge justifies a whole day stolen from Boston. A word of advice, if the skies are clear and it is still daylight, skirt the river and walk to Boston. The views are unique and the skyline not to be missed, as is the sunset

title: √§lteste Universit√§t der USA
text: Die Harvard University ist die √§lteste Unviersit√§t der USA, vor kurzem feierte sie ihr 375-j√§hriges Bestehen. Zu den Absolventen z√§hlen u.a. auch zahlreiche amerikanische Pr√§sidenten, Nobelpreistr√§ger unterschiedlicher Disziplinen, bekannte Schriftsteller und Philosophen. Dieser Ort ist damit also sehr geschichtstr√§chtig. Viele Teile der Universit√§t sind mittlerweile ausgelagert, aber der alte Hauptcampus am Harvard Square in Cambridge besteht aus charmanten neuenglischen roten Backsteinbauten. Als Besucher kann man √ºber den park√§hnlichen Campus mit altem Baumbestand bummeln, auf B√§nken oder Stufen verweilen und dem akademischen Leben zusehen. In einem der nahe gelegenen Coop-Laden kann man Souvenirs mit dem Motto der Universit√§t kaufen.
translated_text: Harvard University is the oldest university in the USA and recently celebrated its 375th anniversary. Its alumni include numerous American presidents, Nobel Prize winners in various disciplines, famous writers and philosophers. This place is therefore steeped in history. Many parts of the university have now been relocated, but the old main campus on Harvard Square in Cambridge consists of charming New England red brick buildings. Visitors can stroll around the park-like campus with its mature trees, linger on benches or steps and watch academic life unfold. Souvenirs with the university's motto can be bought in one of the nearby Coop stores.

title: Magique
text: Vous arrivez dans un endroit merveilleux qui appelle au r√™ve. Vous vous rendez en ce lieux qui a vu la reconnaissance de tant de prix Nobel, ce lieux qui a √©t√© le berceau culturel de plusieur pr√©sident, un lieu ou l'on a compris qu'√©tudier pouvait se faire dans un cadre agr√©able et mythique. Un d√©tour √† faire absolument pour toucher du doigt un campus √† l'ancienne.
translated_text: You've arrived in a wonderful place that beckons you to dream. You're on your way to a place that has seen the recognition of so many Nobel Prize winners, a place that has been the cultural cradle of several presidents, a place where it was understood that studying could be done in a pleasant and mythical setting. A must-see detour to get a feel for an old-fashioned campus.

title: Campus molto bello
text: Stimola la voglia di tornare all'universit√†! Noi ci siamo stati all'inizio dell'anno accademico, quindi con un fermento particolare di attivit√†. Gli edifici sono di stile inglese, circondati da molto verde in cui corrono scoiattoli. Gli sutdenti sono quanto di pi√π eterogeneo si possa pensare, tutte le razze sono rappresentate e si ha quindi un'atmosfera cosmopolita molto piacevole. Facile da girare anche senza cartina.
translated_text: It stimulates the desire to go back to college! We were there at the beginning of the academic year, so with a particular buzz of activity. The buildings are English-style, surrounded by lots of greenery in which squirrels run around. The sutdents are as diverse as you can think of, all races are represented, so you have a very pleasant cosmopolitan atmosphere. Easy to get around even without a map.

title: Curioso ed interessante!
text:
Dopo aver mangiato un hamburger seduti sui tavolini nel giardino principale,abbiamo seguito il Tour gratuito organizzato dagli studenti, davvero utilissimo!
Un ragazzo ci ha portato in giro per il campus per un'oretta, raccontando divertenti aneddoti e leggende oppure spiegando come si svolge in pratica la vita all'interno di una delle facolt√† pi√π blasonate del mondo. Nessuna spiegazione noiosa, n√© digressioni storiche, ma una bella chiacchierata con qualcuno che il college lo conosce molto bene, dato che ci vive!
Alla fine della visita ci siamo ancora avventurati nei corridoi degli edifici, cercando di curiosare un po'...davvero un bel pomeriggio!
translated_text:
After eating a hamburger sitting on the small tables in the main garden,we followed the free Tour organized by the students, which was really very useful!
A guy took us around the campus for an hour or so, telling amusing anecdotes and legends or explaining what life is like in practice inside one of the most emblazoned faculties in the world. No boring explanations or historical digressions, but a nice chat with someone who knows the college very well, since he lives there!
At the end of the visit we still ventured into the corridors of the buildings, trying to poke around a bit...really a nice afternoon!

title: Merece la pena un paseo
text: Agradable y precioso. Merece la pena un paseo por una de las universidades de la Ivy League.
translated_text: Nice and beautiful. Worth a walk through one of the Ivy League universities.

title: Entt√§uschend
text:
Wer nach Boston f√§hrt nimmt meist auch den Umweg nach Cambridge auf sich um die wohl bekannteste Hochschule Amerikas, Harvard University zu besichtigen. 
Gut besucht ist der Harvard eine Gr√ºnfl√§che zwischen den teilweise ehrw√ºrdigen Unigeb√§uden allerdings nicht besonders sch√∂n. Jedermann kann sich auf den Gr√ºnfl√§chen aufhalten. Ohne den ehrw√ºrdigen, historischen Beigeschmack der Universit√§t Harvard w√§re dies absolut nichts besonderes so also das Urteil: Mangelhaft. 
Meiner Meinung nach ist Harvard University den Umweg nach Cambridge aus Boston kommend nicht wert.
translated_text:
Those who travel to Boston usually take the detour to Cambridge to visit the most famous university in America, Harvard University.
Harvard is a green space between the sometimes venerable university buildings, but it is not particularly beautiful. Anyone can spend time on the green spaces. Without the venerable, historical flavor of Harvard University, this would be absolutely nothing special, so the verdict: Poor.
In my opinion, Harvard University is not worth the detour to Cambridge from Boston.

title: Il college pi√π conosciuto del mondo
text:
Alloggiavo a Boston per turismo e non ho potuto fare a meno di prendere la metro e arrivare a Cambridge per vedere il College. Harvard √® una vera e propria istituzione, a forza di guardare telefilm, fin da piccola ero cresciuta con l'idea che questa fosse l'universit√† dei numeri 1 (chiaramente non l'unica).
Quando ho visitato il campus, era fine marzo 2011. C'era la neve...
Consiglio a tutti di entrare e farvi un giro.
translated_text:
I was staying in Boston for tourism and couldn't help but take the subway and get to Cambridge to see the College. Harvard is a real institution, by dint of watching TV shows, since childhood I had grown up with the idea that this was the No. 1 university (clearly not the only one).
When I visited the campus, it was late March 2011. There was snow...
I recommend that everyone go in and take a tour.

title: sch√∂ner Campus mit Geschichte!
text:
Harvard ist die √§lteste Uni der USA und das sieht man auch. Die Geb√§ude sind alt und eher niedrig, die Wiesen gro√üz√ºgig und man findet ehrw√ºrdige Statuen. Der Campus ist riesig, aber man bekommt dennoch einen ganz guten √úberblick. Wenn man an einem Sonnigen Tag da ist kann man sich sehr sch√∂n auf die Stufen der Bibliothek setzen und etwas lesen und die Leute beobachten. Man kann auch eine Tour machen (habe viele gesehen) und das mache ich vielleicht auch noch - was man so im vorbeigehen geh√∂rt hat klang super spannend. Ein kleiner Tip: haltet Ausschau nach einem Baum, der um unteren Teil nahe der Wurzel eine kleine T√ºr hat. Hier drin wohnt Puh der B√§r - also eine Stofftier! Das haben Studenten wohl einmal eingerichtet. 
Am sch√∂nsten ist es, bei gutem Wetter zu kommen. Etwas schade fand ich, dass man die Geb√§ude nicht von innen sehen konnte (soweit ich wei√ü). Man kann sehr gut auf dem Campus das Museum of Natural History besuchen!
translated_text:
Harvard is the oldest university in the USA and it shows. The buildings are old and rather low, the lawns are spacious and there are venerable statues. The campus is huge, but you still get a good overview. If you are there on a sunny day, you can sit on the steps of the library and read something and watch the people. You can also take a tour (I've seen many) and I might do that too - what I heard as I walked past sounded super exciting. A little tip: look out for a tree that has a small door in the lower part near the root. Pooh the bear lives in here - a stuffed animal! Students must have set this up once.
It's best to come in good weather. I thought it was a bit of a shame that you couldn't see the buildings from the inside (as far as I know). The Museum of Natural History is a great place to visit on campus!

title: Netter Spaziergang, auch wenn es nicht viel zu sehen gibt
text: Der Campus der Harvard University befindet sich √∂stlich des Harvard Square und ist sehr weitl√§ufig -  die klassichen Postkartenmotive, d.h. efeubewachsene, altehrw√ºrdige Geb√§ude befinden sich allerdings in unmittelbarer N√§he des Harvard Square, auf dem Harvard Yard. Bei einem Spaziergang √ºber den Campus gibt es allerdings nicht wirklich viel zu sehen, inbesondere wenn man, wie ich, Ende Mai kommt, der Studienbetrieb schon zu Ende ist und die meisten Studenten offenbar schon in die Semesterferien aufgebrochen sind. Schon wegen der netten, typischen New-England Architektur lohnt sich der Spaziergang aber. Dar√ºberhinaus f√ºhlt sich die Gegen um den Harvard Square sehr jung und studentisch an, mit hippen L√§den wie z.B. Urban Outfitters und Boutiquen sowie jungen Restaurants, au√üerdem gibt es den Harvard Coop, den inoffiziellen Buchladen der Harvard University, der eine beeindruckende Auswahl sowohl Fachb√ºcher als auch Belletristik f√ºhrte (sowie Harvard Merchandise, wenn man denn unbedingt ein Harvard T-Shirt erstehen m√∂chte). Boston als Stadt kann sehr gesetzt und snobbish wirken - die Harvard Gegend bildet dazu einen erfrischenden studentischen Kontrast.
translated_text: The Harvard University campus is located to the east of Harvard Square and is very spacious - the classic postcard motifs, i.e. ivy-covered, time-honored buildings, are located in the immediate vicinity of Harvard Square, on Harvard Yard. However, there's not really much to see on a walk around the campus, especially if, like me, you arrive at the end of May, when classes are already over and most students seem to have left for the semester break. But it's worth the walk just for the nice, typical New England architecture. In addition, the area around Harvard Square feels very young and student-like, with hip stores such as Urban Outfitters and boutiques as well as young restaurants, and there is also the Harvard Coop, the unofficial bookstore of Harvard University, which has an impressive selection of both specialist books and fiction (as well as Harvard merchandise, if you really want to buy a Harvard T-shirt). Boston as a city can seem very sedate and snobbish - the Harvard area is a refreshing student contrast.

title: Wundersch√∂ne Universit√§t in der N√§he von Boston
text: Sofern es sich einrichten l√§sste sollten G√§ste, die sich in der N√§he der Harvard University befinden einen Abstecher zu dieser Bildungseinrichtung machen und dort nach M√∂glichkeit auch an einer der dort angebotenen F√ºhrungen teilzunehmen. Im Rahmen dieser F√ºhrungen, die von Studenten der Universit√§t durchgef√ºhrt werden, erfahren die G√§ste ¬¥ne Menge aus dem Alltag des studentischen Leben und sehr interessante Informationen, die die Universit√§t betreffen. Der Campus der Harvard Universit√§t ist wundersch√∂n gestaltet, so dass die Studenten und G√§ste bzw. Besucher der Universit√§t dort zumindest bei sch√∂nem Wetter verweilen, sich erholen und die sch√∂ne Umgebung genie√üen k√∂nnen.
translated_text: If it is possible, guests who are in the vicinity of Harvard University should make a detour to this educational institution and, if possible, take part in one of the guided tours offered there. During these tours, which are conducted by students of the university, guests learn a lot about everyday student life and very interesting information about the university. The campus of Harvard University is beautifully designed, so that students and guests or visitors to the university can linger there, relax and enjoy the beautiful surroundings, at least when the weather is nice.

text: ‰ªéÁ∫ΩÁ∫¶Áªè4Â∞èÊó∂ÊäµËææÊ≥¢Â£´È°øÔºåÂÖ•‰ΩèÂêéÁöÑÁ¨¨‰∏ÄÁ´ôÊàë‰ª¨ÈÄâÊã©‰∫ÜHarvard University„ÄÇ‰ªéBerkeley StÂÅöÊñπ‰æøÁöÑÂüéÂ∏ÇÂÖ¨‰∫§‰∏ÄË∑ØÁªèËøá‰ºØÂÖãÂà©Ëâ∫ÊúØÂ≠¶Èô¢Ôºå‰ªécombridgrÊ°•‰∏äÁöÑË∑®ËøáÂú∞Âõæ‰∏äÁúãÊù•ËõÆÂÆΩÁöÑÊü•Â∞îÊñØÊ≤≥ÔºåÊäµËææÂâëÊ°•Â∏ÇÔºåÁª≠ËÄåÊ®™Á©øMITÈ∫ªÁúÅÁêÜÂ∑•ÔºåÂú®Ë∑ùÁ¶ªHarvard SquareÊúâ‰∏ÄÊÆµË∑ùÁ¶ªÁöÑÂú∞Êñπ‰∏ãËΩ¶ÔºåËµ∞ËøõËøô‰∏™Á¨¨‰∏ÄÂ≠¶Â∫úÔºå ÊµìÈÉÅÁöÑÂ≠¶ÊúØÊ†ñÊÅØËîìÂª∂.Âìà‰Ωõ‰∏éÈ∫ªÁúÅÁêÜÂ∑•ÊòØÊ≤°ÊúâÁïåÈôêÁöÑÔºåÂ∞±Âú®Âìà‰ΩõÔºåÂ∑≤ÁªèËµ∞Âú®Âìà‰ΩõÁöÑÊ†°Âõ≠‰∫ÜÔºå‰ΩÜÊòØÊ≤°ÊúâÁúãÂà∞ÂÉèÊòØÂõΩÂÜÖÂ§ßÂ≠¶Â®Å‰∏•ÂÆè‰ºüÁöÑÊ≠£Èó®Ôºå‰∫éÊòØÂÉèÂ≠¶ÁîüÊâìÂê¨Â•πÁöÑMain gateÔºåË¢´ÂëäÁü•ËøôÈáåÊ≤°ÊúâÊ≠£Èó®ÔºåÂ∞±ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊïôÂ≠¶Ê•ºÁæ§ËêΩÔºåÂêÑ‰∏™Â≠¶Èô¢ÁöÑ  Âú®Ê†ëÂΩ±ÊñëÈ©≥ÁöÑÁªøÂú∞‰∏äÊúâÂ≠¶Áîü‰ª¨ËØª‰π¶‰ºëÈó≤ÁöÑË∫´ÂΩ±ÔºåË¶Å‰∏çÊòØÂú∞Âõæ‰∏äÁöÑÊ†áÊ≥®ÔºåÊàë‰ª¨Â∞±Âú®Ê≥ïÂ≠¶Èô¢ÁöÑÊ•º‰∏ãËßÜËÄå‰∏çËßÅÁöÑÂ∞ÜÂ•πpassÊéâ‰∫Ü„ÄÇÂéöÈáçÁöÑÁü≥Êü±ËøòÊúâÊöóÁ∫¢Ëâ≤ÁöÑÊ•º‰ΩìÔºå‰∏ÄÁÇπ‰πü‰∏çÂº†Êâ¨ÂíåÂçé‰∏ΩÔºåÂ∞±ÈöêÂú®Âè§Ê†ëÁéØÁªï‰∏≠„ÄÇ

title: Ganz gem√ºtlich √ºber den Campus schlendern
text: Wenn man in Boston ist, sollte man auf jeden Fall mal die kurze Fahrt nach Cambridge machen. Sicher nicht ganz einfach da einen Parkplatz zu finden, aber wenn man den hat kann man den Spirit von dieser altehrw√ºrdigen University richtig sp√ºren. Allein schon das schlendern √ºber den Campus ist sehr sch√∂n. Die Blicke fallen recht schnell auf die pr√§chtigen roten Bauten mit den Treppen wo die Abschl√ºsse der Studenten gefeiert, oder wie in unserem Fall besungen werden. Das sollte man sich nicht entgehen lassen.
translated_text: If you're in Boston, you should definitely make the short drive to Cambridge. It's certainly not easy to find a parking space, but once you do you can really feel the spirit of this venerable university. Just strolling around the campus is very beautiful. The magnificent red buildings with the staircases where the students' graduations are celebrated or, as in our case, sung about, quickly catch the eye. You shouldn't miss out on that.

title: beeindruckender Campus - alles first class
text: habe eine Tour durch √ºber 10 Campusse der besten Universit√§ten in den USA gemacht und es gibt nur zwei, die mich wirklich beeindruckt haben: Stanford und Harvard, wobei Harvard klar die Nummer 1 ist. Alles ist super gepflegt, eine first class Kantine, top Ausstattung und dazu ein Ambiente, das zum Nachdenken und Studieren anregt. Sehr inspirierend. Habe mich dort einen ganzen Tag umgeschaut und mir ist nicht langweilig geworden. Wenn man in Boston ist, dann unbedingt anschauen.
translated_text: I took a tour of over 10 campuses of the best universities in the US and there are only two that really impressed me: Stanford and Harvard, with Harvard clearly being number 1. Everything is super well maintained, a first class canteen, top facilities and an atmosphere that encourages you to think and study. Very inspiring. I spent a whole day there looking around and never got bored. If you are in Boston, you should definitely visit.

title: amerikanischer campus fuer touristen
text:
wenn man in boston ist hat manmeistens zeit auch noch nach cambridge zu fahren (ubahn) und ist auf einmal am harvard campus! wenn man als tourist durchschweifen kann hat dies enorm viel charme und versteht man die elite! ich wa rmit einem studenten unterwegs, der dies mit anderen augen sieht!

auf jeden fall muss man das einmal gesehen haben um sich selbst ein bild zu machen! tip: im herbst hinfahren!
translated_text:
when you are in boston you usually have time to go to cambridge (subway) and you are suddenly at the harvard campus! if you can wander around as a tourist this has a lot of charm and you understand the elite! i was traveling with a student who sees this with different eyes!

in any case, you have to see it once to get your own impression! tip: go there in the fall!

title: Weniger als erwartet
text:
Von der F√ºhrung der Harvard University erhofften wir uns einen Einblick in das Studentenleben und interessante Infos √ºber die ber√ºhmte Universit√§t. Es werden zwei unterschiedliche F√ºhrungen angeboten, eine offizielle und die inoffizielle "Hahvahd" Tour, welche beide von Studenten der Uni gemacht werden. Wir entschieden uns f√ºr die kostenlose offizielle, bei der Hahvahd Tour, die als humoristischer beschrieben wird,  bittet man um eine Spende. Leider war die F√ºhrung sehr stark besucht, ca. 40-50 Leute und unser F√ºhrer war relativ schwer zu verstehen (trotz relativ guten Englischkenntnissen), da er sehr schnell und undeutlich gesprochen hat. Zudem konnten alle Geb√§ude nur von au√üen betrachtet werden und waren wenig aussagekr√§ftig √ºber die eigentliche Universit√§t. 
Insgesamt ist ein Besuch der Uni zu empfehlen, einfach weil es die Ber√ºhmteste der Welt ist, von der offiziellen F√ºhrung ist mit Schulenglisch eher abzuraten.
translated_text:
We hoped that the Harvard University tour would give us an insight into student life and interesting information about the famous university. There are two different tours on offer, an official and an unofficial "Hahvahd" tour, both of which are run by students at the university. We opted for the free official tour, the Hahvahd tour, which is described as more humorous, asks for a donation. Unfortunately, the tour was very busy, about 40-50 people and our guide was relatively difficult to understand (despite a relatively good command of English) as he spoke very quickly and indistinctly. In addition, all the buildings could only be viewed from the outside and were not very informative about the actual university.
Overall, a visit to the university is recommended, simply because it is the most famous in the world; the official tour is not recommended if you speak English at school.

title: bellissima universit√†
text: da vedere questa citt√†, studio sede di una delle + blasonate universit√† mondiali. Da fare la visita tramite un tour organizzato dagli studenti.
translated_text: to see this city, study home to one of the world's + emblazoned universities. Worth visiting via a student-organized tour.

title: Tolle Universit√§t, definitiv einen Abstecher wert
text:
Hallo,
ich habe ein Jahr an der Harvard Law School studiert und kenne mich daher in Boston gut aus. Ich kann jedem, der sich in der Gegend aufh√§lt nur dringend empfehlen, wenigstens eine STunde am Campus der Harvard University vorbeizuschauen (einfach T neben bis "Harvard Square"). Besonders sehenswert ist die Law SChool, aber auch die Business School, wobei letztere etwas weiter weg liegt (nach S√ºden). 
Anschauen v.a: Harvard Statue; Weidner Library; Law School Library (Langdell).
Viel Spass!
translated_text:
Hello,
I studied at Harvard Law School for a year and therefore know my way around Boston. I can strongly recommend anyone who is in the area to stop by the Harvard University campus for at least an hour (just T next to "Harvard Square"). The Law School is particularly worth a visit, as is the Business School, although the latter is a little further away (to the south).
Take a look at the Harvard Statue; Weidner Library; Law School Library (Langdell).
Have fun!

title: ‰∏ÄÂ∫¶„ÅØË°å„Åè„Åπ„Åç
text: „Å®„Å¶„ÇÇÊ≠¥Âè≤„ÅÆ„ÅÇ„ÇãÁ¥†Êïµ„Å™Âª∫Áâ©„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„Çπ„ÇØ„Ç®„Ç¢„Éº„ÅÆÈßÖ„ÅÆËøë„Åè„Åã„ÇâÁÑ°Êñô„ÅÆ„ÉÑ„Ç¢„ÉºÔºàËã±Ë™ûÔºâ„Çí„Éè„Éº„Éê„Éº„Éâ„ÅÆÂ≠¶Áîü„ÅåË°å„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÅÆ„Çµ„Ç§„Éà„ÅßÊôÇÈñì„Å™„Å©„ÅØ„ÉÅ„Çß„ÉÉ„ÇØ„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÂª∫Áâ©„ÇÑÊ≠¥Âè≤„Å´„Åæ„Å§„Çè„ÇãË©±„ÇíËÅû„Åè„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„ÄÅ‰Ωï„Çà„ÇäÂΩº„ÇâËá™Ë∫´„ÅÆÂ≠¶Ê†°ÁîüÊ¥ª„ÅÆË©±„ÇíËÅû„Åè„Åì„Å®„Åå„Åß„Åç„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÂ§ßÂ≠¶„ÅÆÂõû„Çä„ÇÇÂ≠¶Áîü„ÅÆË°ó„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜÈõ∞Âõ≤Ê∞ó„ÅåÊºÇ„ÅÜ„ÅÑ„ÅÑÂ†¥ÊâÄ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ
translated_text: It is a lovely building with a very long history. Free tours (in English) are offered by Harvard students from near the Harvard Square train station. You can check the times and other information on the university's website. You can listen to their stories about the building, its history, and most importantly, their own school life. The area around the university is also a nice place with a student town atmosphere.
